description.en:
<html>It was opened by a Korean cleric and became the house of protestant worship since recognized by South Korea in 2000, is eye-catching with its simple architecture.

There is no information about the history of the construction of the Protestant Church, which is known to have been used as an embassy and bank during the French period. The building, which was closed for many years, was opened to worship by South Korean cleric PastÃ¶r in June 2000. At the entrance door of the church there is a plaque written in Turkish, English and Korean. The church was recognized by the Kwong Lim Methodist Church in South Korea in the same year.

The classic French-style work is a rectangular structure that opens on to the side. The front of the ledge also has three windows that are rectangular. There's a cross at the top of the church. As soon as you enter the church, there are stairs and after the stairs, the inside of the church can be switched. In addition, inside the church there are late-circuit church items and ikonos, which are important for Christians.
</html>

description.en:
The historical tower, which is popularly called 'Armory' because it was used as an ammunition depot during the Russian occupation of Trabzon, has been in various rumors since the 1300s.

It is also known as Fatih Tower or Irena Tower, which is one of the most remarkable and most controversial structures in Trabzon! It is written in some sources that it was built in the 1340s to be a meeting place for the Archaeocracy of Trabzon by The Empress Irena, which is not exactly known since the inscription has not reached to this day. 

Another information about the tower is the inscription from 1887 on the tower gate, including Abdulhamit the IIâ€™s Tugra (Sultanâ€™s signature). In this inscription, it is written that this structure was built in place of a structure that was left behind by the time of Fatih Sultan Mehmet Khan.

There are two sections as a condo in the interior of the tower, which is about 40 meters in diameter and 25 meters high. The interior section is four and the outer part is three storeys. The interior and exterior structures have three windows with oval arches. On the western part, the historic building with a police station has a high protective wall. The Armory used as ammunition depots during the 1916-1918 Russian occupation; 
Unfortunately, on July 9, 1919, had an explosion. 

The restoration of the historic tower, which is called the 'Armory' among the people, was started in 2006 with permission from the Ministry of Tourism. The restoration of the historic tower was completed in four years and turned into a tourism business in 2010.

Es ist eine Tatsache, dass die Waffenkammer, eine der bemerkenswertesten und umstrittensten Strukturen in Trabzon-Strukturen, auch als Fatih-Turm oder Irena-Turm bekannt ist! In einigen Quellen steht, dass der Bau der Aristokratie von Trabzon 1340 von Kaiserin Irena erbaut wurde, Ã¼ber deren Struktur das genaue Datum des Baus unbekannt war, da die Inschrift bis heute nicht erreicht wurde.

Eine weitere Information Ã¼ber den Turm befindet sich an der TurmtÃ¼r. Es ist eine Inschrift von 1887, die auch des II. Abdulhamits Monogramm enthÃ¤lt. In dieser Inschrift steht, dass es anstelle eines GebÃ¤udes aus der  Fatih Sultan Mehmet Khan-Zeit gebaut wurde.

Der Turm mit einem Durchmesser von ungefÃ¤hr 40 Metern und einer HÃ¶he von 25 Metern hat zwei miteinander verflochtene kreisfÃ¶rmige Abschnitte im Inneren des Turms. Der innere Teil hat vier Stockwerke und der Ã¤uÃŸere Teil hat drei Stockwerke. Es gibt drei ovale Bogenfenster in den Innen- und AuÃŸenstrukturen. Das historische GebÃ¤ude, das im westlichen Teil eine Station hat, hat eine hohe Schutzmauer. Waffenkammer, die wÃ¤hrend der russischen Besetzung von 1916-1918 als Munitionsdepot genutzt wurde; Leider war er am 9. Juli 1919 einer Explosion ausgesetzt.

Die Restaurierung des historischen Turms, der unter den Menschen als â€Waffenkammerâ€œ bezeichnet wird, begann 2006 mit Genehmigung des Tourismusministeriums. Die Restaurierung des historischen Turms wurde in vier Jahren abgeschlossen und 2010 in ein Tourismusunternehmen umgewandelt.

description.en:
BeypazarÄ± Bazaar is one of the oldest and most interesting markets in Anatolia with a history of more than 600 years. Every day it welcomes its guests from the immediate vicinity as well as curious visitors from all over Turkey. Shopping in the recently restored bazaar, to be familiar with the construction of Traditional Arts is a great pleasure and a different experience.

Copper, silver, tin, iron, leather, jewelry, weaving, tailoring, carpenter's work and saddling can be seen and purchased in the historical BeypazarÄ± Bazaar with its streets surrounded by stone buildings and mansions. What about local delicacies?

BeypazarÄ± Bazaar's 80-storey baklava, BeypazarÄ± Kurusu, carrot juice, olive oil leaf wrap, tarhana(soup with dried yoghurt), dry grass, delight, cezerye, all kinds of confectionery is famous. In addition to shopping in the market, which attracts its friendly atmosphere, shopkeepers and sympathetic people, many treats are also made. You may encounter friendly residents of BeypazarÄ± who walk around with a variety of desserts to be served to you at any time.

The bazaar, where once departed people will want to come again, is among the ideal sightseeing and shopping locations for those who want to spend a good day.

description.en:
Azmak River, which is located in MuÄŸla Akyaka, is in the foreground among the natural beauties of the city. This important river, which is located exactly in GÃ¶kova region, receives full notes from local and foreign tourists. This place is named as a freshwater river. The reeds and ducks, located right next to the river, add a different color and beauty to the region. The Azmak River, which is usually visited by vacationers in Akyaka, offers a very pleasant view. The river has a peaceful atmosphere with this structure. Just watching the beauty of the river to one side, you can also be involved in a lot of activities here.


Apart from the postcard bays, Azmak River with its abundant oxygen air is ideal for those who want to spend time in a quiet place. There is a distance of around 30 kilometers between the river and Marmaris which is located in Ula district. It is also located at the eastern end of the Azmak River, GÃ¶kova Bay. MuÄŸla Dalaman Airport is approximately one hour away from Azmak River.


The most obvious feature of the river is that its water is quite cold. Besides taking walks around the river, you can explore new beauties with your camera. Between october and april, boat tours are also organized here regularly. To any extent you can join these tours with your loved ones.


The area also includes businesses where you can rent canoes. Thanks to the recent popularization of the Azmak River, numerous restaurants have been opened on the river's edge areas. You can watch the sunset while eating with your loved ones against the river. Wind surfing in the Azmak River has gained considerable popularity recently. The physical conditions around the river are quite suitable for doing this sport. The presence of perch within the river is remarkable. In this context fishing boats around the river create a pleasant image.

description.en:
<html>The FasÄ±llar Cemetery, which includes tombs belonging to Turks who came to Anatolian lands at the beginning of the 11th century, also reflects hundreds of years of history.

The Turks first come to BeyÅŸehir and its surroundings together with the Anatolian Seljuk State. Seljuks, who have moved from nomadic life to a settled life and want to spread, buried their dead, while an art monument planted the beautiful tombstones at the head of the burial. Handcrafted relief and figure-making techniques are used in these stones. The works created from one piece of cutting stone thus reach the present day.

A total of 28 tombstones are found in archaeological surveys covering the 19th and 20th centuries. These tombstones in The FasÄ±llar Village of BeyÅŸehir are a history page that has survived from the past to the present. In the 1960s, as a result of the researches carried out by Ibrahim Hakki KonyalÄ±, many of the tombstones were found to be composed of those who died on the same year and on the same day. Historians assume that there are people who died of the same date as a result of a big fight, and nine people died in just one day.
</html>

description.en:
MuÄŸla's Datca district, which offers numerous destinations worth setting out to, is home to HayÄ±tbÃ¼kÃ¼ Beach, one of the favorite destinations for sea and sun enthusiasts.


Reaching HayÄ±tbÃ¼kÃ¼ Beach, which is reached by a road that is 20 kilometers away from Datca, means witnessing stunning views. The sophisticated beach, which completes the winding road, is also adjacent to many beaches such as OvabÃ¼kÃ¼.


The beach in Mesudiye District offers many different features at the same point. It lies primarily along a small bay. It is also extremely closed to the wind due to the elevations surrounding it in the shape of a bowl. In hot weather, it is protected from burning breezes. It has an interesting texture and air; the occasional coolness provides a unique beach comfort in the region during the summer months. However, it is also often preferred by families with children as its sea slowly deepens and is not very undulating.


There is also a tea garden and restaurants near the beach. There are also usually small accommodation facilities. Sun loungers and umbrellas are available free of charge at the beach. However, the beach is also visited by hiking enthusiasts, and from time to time there are yoga activities or fishing activities.


HayÄ±tbÃ¼kÃ¼ Beach, which is also in demand in autumn, is among the ideal spots for relaxing in the shade of the mulberry trees adjacent to the beach, enjoying the view, and enjoying a quiet sea experience with the sun.

description.en:
Erzurum is one of the cities at the easternmost end of Anatolia, where the first zoning process for the city that exists today dates back 1,500 years. At the same time, the main reasons for such an important position to become a field of competition between the state throughout history... Another importance of the city is its location on trading points. In general, it is possible to examine the historical origin of being one of the most developed cities in the east of Turkey with these headings. 

On the other hand, the ongoing life in Erzurum has been seen to have a special place in the baths, which have a civilian architectural structure in the city since ancient times. It is seen that the baths built from ancient times were another place in Erzurum, especially during the Ottoman Empire.

The culture of baths, which is the focus of the healing feature of the spa waters in ancient times, was mainly discussed in the Ottoman Empire for cleaning purposes. The importance given to hygiene and cleanliness is almost incarnated in special structures shaped like hammams. In this context, one of the prominent historical baths in Erzurum is undoubtedly The Mistress Bath.

The bath stands out with its spacious indoor and powerful lighting elements. The dressing room, the bathing section, the umbilical stone are fully serviced with its parts. In The Mistress Bath, which also attracts attention with its atmosphere in Erzurum, only women are served, as the name suggests.
description.de:
Erzurum, wo der erste Bebauungsprozess der Stadt, der heute existiert, vor 500.000 Jahren begann, ist eine der Ã¶stlichsten StÃ¤dte Anatoliens. Eine solch wichtige Position zu haben, ist auch einer der HauptgrÃ¼nde, warum es im Laufe der Geschichte zu einem Konkurrenzbereich zwischen den Staaten geworden ist ... Eine weitere Bedeutung der Stadt ist ihre Position in Bezug auf Handelsorte. Man kann im Allgemeinen die historischen StÃ¤mme der TÃ¼rkei im Osten der Stadt zu einem der fortgeschrittenen StÃ¤dte unter diesen Ãœberschriften nachforschen.

Auf der anderen Seite wird das fortdauernde Leben in Erzurum und in den BÃ¤dern, die seit der Antike eine zivilbauliche Struktur in der Stadt haben, als ein besonderer Ort angesehen. Es ist zu sehen, dass der seit der Antike errichtete Ort der BÃ¤der besonders fÃ¼r Erzurum war, insbesondere wÃ¤hrend der Zeit des Osmanischen Reiches.

Die Badekultur, die in der Antike von den heilenden Eigenschaften des Thermalwassers profitierte, wurde im Osmanischen Reich hauptsÃ¤chlich zu Reinigungszwecken gehandhabt. Die Bedeutung, die der Hygiene und Sauberkeit beigemessen wird, zeigt sich fast in privaten Strukturen in Form eines Bades. In diesem Zusammenhang ist eines der bedeutendsten historischen BÃ¤der in Erzurum unumstritten das HanÄ±m-Wasserbad.

description.en:
The SarÄ±kadÄ± mosque is a characteristic and interesting Ottoman structure located in the HamamÃ¶nÃ¼ District of Altindag, one of the famous districts of Ankara with its historical past, under the entourage of an outdoor museum. The mudbrick-walled mosque, which has survived with traces of its architectural identity, stands out with its tile-covered wooden roof supported by four columns decorated with geometric shapes that defy centuries.

The minaret of the SarÄ±kadÄ± Mosque, which is very valuable in its decorations throughout the mosque, including its pulpit made of carved wood where the imam read the sermon, does not exist. When entering the interior of the mosque, the word-I Tawhid (Islamic confession of faith) inscription on the upper parts of the Windows is visible. There is a small cemetery in the eastern part of the SarÄ±kadÄ± Mosque, which can be visited and worshipped. The fine workmanship of the tombstonesâ€™ quilted turbans here astounds the beholders when taken into consideration the period they were made .

Sarikadi Mosque, one of the oldest mosques in Ankara with its rich historical texture around it, invites its visitors by waiting and serving with all its simplicity.

description.en:
<html>Penbe (BalkapanÄ±) Inn was ordered to build by BeyazÄ±t II, Ottoman Sultan, in 1481 and took 31 years to complete. The completion of the inn, which still bears traces of Ottoman architecture, continued until 1512.

Kastamonu is also famous for its inns... In this geography of centuries-defying inns, Penbe (Balkapani) Inn is located next to the western adjoining of KurÅŸunlu Inn. The inn, which was once recognized as the center of honey trade, is also known as the 'Balkapan'. In the following period, it became the center of the cotton tradeâ€™s heart. This is how it begins to get famous because the cotton is called 'Penbe' in Persian. 

Penbe (BalkapanÄ±) Inn, who was left in ruins for many years, was left to himself because of the fire disaster years ago. Penbe (BalkapanÄ±) Inn, who only survives the north gate after centuries, is finally restored... The inn, which was renovated by the Regional Directorate of Foundations in 2006, is now used as a restaurant and bazaar.
</html>
description.de:
<html>Die Fertigstellung von Penbe (BalkapanÄ±) Khan, das 1481 vom osmanischen Sultan 2. BeyazÄ±t gebaut werden sollte, dauerte 31 Jahre. Die Fertigstellung des Gasthauses, das noch immer die Spuren der osmanischen Architektur aufweist, wurde bis 1512 fortgesetzt.

Kastamonu ist auch eine Stadt, die fÃ¼r ihre GasthÃ¤user bekannt ist. In dieser geografischen Region, in der es GasthÃ¤user gibt, die Jahrhunderte herausfordern, befindet sich das Penbe (BalkapanÄ±) Khan neben dem KurÅŸunlu Khan. Das Gasthaus, das eine Zeit lang als Zentrum des Honighandels bekannt war, ist auch als "Balkapan" bekannt. In der folgenden Zeit wurde es zum Zentrum des Baumwollhandels. Da Baumwolle auf Persisch "Penbe" genannt wird, wird sie auf diese Weise berÃ¼hmt.

Penbe (BalkapanÄ±) Khan, der viele Jahre in TrÃ¼mmern lag, wurde aufgrund der Brandkatastrophe vor vielen Jahren verlassen. Das Gasthaus Penbe (BalkapanÄ±), dessen einziges Nordtor nach den letzten Jahrhunderten erhalten blieb, wurde endgÃ¼ltig restauriert ... Das Gasthaus, das 2006 von der Regionaldirektion fÃ¼r Stiftungen repariert wurde, wird heute als Restaurant und Bazaar genutzt.

</html>

description.en:
<html>The center, which is a large complex structure serving under the name of Vedat Tek, the pioneer of Turkish National Architectural Movement in Kastamonu, is among the cultural and artistic activities of the historical city and its attractions. 

The culture and art center, which opened in 2008, has many sections located among the global examples in their fields with the breadth of collections they have, such as the Lace and Hat Museum, Baby House. 
Architect Vedat Tek Culture and Arts Center has a painting gallery and exhibition hall, where the city's residents are interested in the museum sections in question, most of which are the first in their area. 

Ataturk Exhibition Hall hosts prominent painting and art events in the city. There is also a House of Republic within the scope of the building. Valuable objects and various artifacts about the founding years of the Republic of Turkey can be examined here. 

Founded to keep the famous architect's name alive, Mimar Vedat Tek Culture and Arts Center can be visited every day of the week at no cost. Visiting hours start at 08:00 in two periods, summer and winter, and continue until the evening hours. 
</html>
description.de:
<html>Das Zentrum mit seiner breiten, komplexen Struktur, die dem Namen Vedat Tek, dem Pionier der tÃ¼rkischen nationalen Architekturbewegung in Kastamonu, dient, gehÃ¶rt zu den kulturellen und kÃ¼nstlerischen AktivitÃ¤ten der historischen Stadt und ihrer markanten Orte.

In dem Kultur- und Kunstzentrum, das 2008 erÃ¶ffnet wurde, gibt es viele Bereiche, die zu den globalen Beispielen auf ihrem Gebiet und in der Breite ihrer Sammlungen gehÃ¶ren, wie das Spitzen- und Hutmuseum oder Babyhaus.

Neben den genannten Museumsabschnitten, von denen die meisten die ersten auf ihrem Gebiet sind, verfÃ¼gt der Architekt Vedat Tek Ã¼ber eine Kunstgalerie und eine Ausstellungshalle, an denen die Bewohner interessiert sind.

In der AtatÃ¼rk-Ausstellungshalle finden die wichtigsten Mal- und Kunstveranstaltungen der Stadt statt. Es gibt auch ein Republikhaus innerhalb des GebÃ¤udes. Hier kÃ¶nnen Sie wertvolle GegenstÃ¤nde und verschiedene Werke aus den GrÃ¼ndungsjahren der Republik TÃ¼rkei sehen.

Das Kultur- und Kunstzentrum des Architekten Vedat Tek, das gegrÃ¼ndet wurde, um den Namen des berÃ¼hmten Architekten im Gedanken zu halten, kann jeden Tag der Woche kostenlos besucht werden. Die Besuchszeiten beginnen in den beiden Jahreszeiten Sommer und Winter um 08:00 Uhr und bleibt bis in die Abendstunden offen.
</html>

description.en:
Iznik Green Mosque is located in Iznik District of Bursa. The historic mosque, located near Lefke Gate, was uncovered by the architect Haji Musa. He built the mosque in the name of Hayrettin Pasha of Ã‡andarlÄ±. The construction date of the mosque is recorded as 1391. The reason the construction process lasted approximately 13 years is that the architect lost his life while the mosque was in progress. Ali Pasha, who became his son after Haji Musa died, completes the remaining part of the mosque. Iznik Green Mosque is considered as part of the early Ottoman architecture. The mosque is single domed and stands in a special place between the central mosques.


Iznik Green Mosque is square-planned as a structure. Just in front of the last parish site, there are two marble columns. These columns are connected to the walls by means of round arches. They are connected to each other by means of cut stone arches. The double column system is reminiscent of Byzantine architecture. This is also true for jambs, of course. The upper sections of the portico structures are cross vaulted. Domes resting on top of octagonal shaped pulleys cover the space. The top of the side sections is also closed by means of mirror vaults. Iznik Green Mosque has an Arabic inscription on top. In this inscription, there is information that the person who built the mosque was Haji Musa. Visitors to the mosque can directly testify to this original inscription. To be included in the place of worship, the pitch is passed through. The pitch is rectangular and a three-step staircase leads to it. Various columns and arches divide this space within itself.


A dome is located in the middle section of the space. This dome has eight slices in total. Extremely interesting oyster figures stand above the niche of the mihrab. Also in the middle section, there is a medallion made up of stars. The upper side of the mihrab is divided into two parts thanks to a flat panel.
description.de:
Die GrÃ¼ne Moschee von Iznik befindet sich im Stadtteil Iznik in Bursa. Die historische Moschee in der NÃ¤he des Lefke-Tors wurde vom Architekten Haci Musa ausgegraben. Er machte die Moschee im Auftrag von Ã‡andarlÄ± Hayrettin Pasha. Das Errichtungsdatum der Moschee wird als 1391 aufgezeichnet. Der Grund dafÃ¼r, dass der Bauprozess ungefÃ¤hr 13 Jahre dauerte, ist, dass der Architekt wÃ¤hrend der Moschee sein Leben verlor. Ali Pascha, der sein Sohn war, nachdem Haci Musa verstorben war, vervollstÃ¤ndigt den Rest der Moschee. Die Iznik-GrÃ¼ne Moschee wird hauptsÃ¤chlich im Rahmen der frÃ¼hen osmanischen Architektur bewertet. Die Moschee hat eine einzige Kuppel und steht an einer besonderen Stelle unter den zentralen Moscheen.

Die GrÃ¼ne Moschee von Iznik hat einen quadratischen Grundriss als GebÃ¤ude. Vor dem letzten Versammlungsort stehen zwei MarmorsÃ¤ulen. Diese SÃ¤ulen sind mit RundbÃ¶gen an den WÃ¤nden befestigt. Sie sind durch geschnittene SteinbÃ¶gen miteinander verbunden. Das DoppelsÃ¤ulensystem erinnert an die byzantinische Architektur. Dies gilt natÃ¼rlich auch fÃ¼r Pfosten. Die oberen Teile der PortikusgebÃ¤ude sind mit KreuzgewÃ¶lben versehen. Die Kuppeln, die auf den achteckigen Riemenscheiben basieren, bedecken den Raum. Die Oberseite der Seitenteile ist von SpiegelgewÃ¶lben bedeckt. Auf der Iznik-GrÃ¼nen Moschee befindet sich eine arabische Inschrift. In dieser Inschrift ist bekannt, dass die Person, die die Moschee baute, Haci Musa war. Besucher der Moschee kÃ¶nnen direkt Zeuge von dieser Originalinschrift sein. Durch den Palast gehen, um sich der KultstÃ¤tte anzuschlieÃŸen. Die Plattform hat einen rechteckigen Grundriss und kann Ã¼ber eine dreistufige Treppe erreicht werden. Verschiedene SÃ¤ulen und BÃ¶gen teilen diesen Bereich in sich.

Im mittleren Teil des Raumes befindet sich eine Kuppel. Diese Kuppel hat insgesamt acht Scheiben. Ãœber der Nische des Mihrab stechen Ã¤uÃŸerst interessante Austernfiguren hervor. Im mittleren Teil befindet sich ein Medaillon aus Sternen. Die Oberseite des Altars ist durch ein flaches Brett in zwei Teile geteilt.

description.en:
Bozukkale, located in MuÄŸla, serves as a stop for Blue tours, especially because it is sheltered against the wind. Boats that want to go to Bodrum via Marmaris often stop here. If you want to reach the area by road you can come by car from SÃ¶ÄŸÃ¼t to TaÅŸlÄ±ca, but you may have to walk the rest of the way. This area is also seen throughout history as an important location due to its strategic location. It is known that the Athenian navy stayed in this area in 412 BC.


Nowadays, there are some small restaurants serving Blue tour boats in the Bay. The ruins of the ancient city of Loryma, located in Bozukkale, are mostly at the entrance of the Bay. The peak sees the Bay in its entirety. The most precious relic that can be reached from the ancient city is of course the castle. The length of the castle measures about 120 meters. This castle, in time, especially the entrance point of the bay acts as a shield. Against the intervening time, it can be said that the castle is in very stable condition. Climbing the castle in the northern part of the Bay is not as easy as thought.


'Loryma' comes from Karyia languages with Luwi. For this reason, there is no semantic equivalent in the Hellenic language. At the same time, information about the founding period of the ancient city is insufficient. In the texts of Strabon, it is mentioned as â€˜a rugged coastline in Cariaâ€™. In the written sources of earlier periods, the city was expressed asâ€™ the Land of the opposite collar'.


Loryme does not succeed in being an important city during its active existence. There was no comprehensive field study of the ancient city. Although inscriptions carved on the rocks indicate Zeus Atabyrios, there is no definite information about his temple. Apart from the ancient city, those who come to Bozukkale have the chance to explore other important points such as Marmaris Castle, Turgut waterfall, chimney cave.

description.en:
The historical Ã‡ukur Khan in Bursa is also referred as â€˜KÃ¼tahya Khanâ€™ in some sources. Located on TuzpazarÄ± Street, the historic khan is known that it was built during the reign of II.Murat. The signature of Bukhara Emir Effendi is seen in the construction of the khan. He is also the son-in-law of Yildirim Bayezid.


The khan draws attention immediately with its structure of smooth cut stones. The khan is evaluated in the category of two-storey and courtyard khan in Bursa. It consists of high porches and rooms visible behind them. Some of the original parts of the khan do not survive to the present day. Only three of the ground floor cells in the southern section and the door arch stairs in the western section are counted among the parts that can reach today. Even these limited spaces are enough to reflect the grandeur of the khan.


Ã‡ukur Khan, or, in other words, KÃ¼tahya Khan, was created in 1396. The Bursa series registers are used because the construction date of the building does not have any inscriptions. Built on a total area of 720 square meters, Ã‡ukur Khan is a first-degree historical monument. It also passes as a monumental structure in written sources.


There are 19 rooms on the second floor of the khan. These rooms have an average size of 12-15 square meters. On the ground floor, there are 18 large rooms. The volume of these rooms is 20-25 square meters. One section of Ã‡ukur Khan faces TuzpazarÄ± Street and the other section faces KÃ¼tahya Han Street. Both sections of the khan have an entrance gate. Today, it is seen that there are masters who keep Turkish-Islamic crafts alive in Ã‡ukur Khan. These arts include painting, rosary, illumination, tile, calligrapher and marbling. Although khan suffered very serious damage in the Jalali riots, it underwent repair in the same process.

Es gibt 19 Zimmer im zweiten Stock des Gasthauses. Diese Zimmer haben eine durchschnittliche GrÃ¶ÃŸe von 12-15 Quadratmetern. Es gibt 18 groÃŸe Zimmer im Erdgeschoss. Das Volumen dieser RÃ¤ume betrÃ¤gt 20-25 Quadratmeter. Ein Teil von Ã‡ukur Khan Ã¼berblickt TuzpazarÄ± Strasse und der andere Teil Ã¼berblickt die KÃ¼tahya Khan StraÃŸe. In beiden Teilen des Gasthauses befindet sich eine EingangstÃ¼r. Heute sieht man, dass in Ã‡ukur Khan Meister des tÃ¼rkisch-islamischen Handwerks leben. Unter diesen KÃ¼nsten kÃ¶nnen Malerei, Tesbih, Ornamente, Fliesen, Kalligraph und Ebru-Kunst aufgefÃ¼hrt werden. Obwohl Khan wÃ¤hrend dem Celali Aufstand schwer beschÃ¤digt wurde, wurde er im gleichen Zeitraum repariert.

description.en:
AtatÃ¼rk's second visit on January 20-24, 1923, and after that, he is known to have stayed in this elegant mansion. After 1938, the pavilion continued to be used for various public purposes, and was transferred to the General Directorate of Museums in 1968 and opened to visitors as a museum about five years later. The AtatÃ¼rk House and Museum, which was inaugurated on 29 October 1973, the 50th anniversary of the founding of the Republic, has been continuously attracting visitors for almost 50 years.

The first floor of the pavilion, which is prominent with its woodwork and dates back to the 19th century, has an admission hall, rest and dining rooms. On the second floor, the study room and the bedroom can be observed. In addition, the basement of this historical pavilion has been prepared for kitchen and other services.

In the AtatÃ¼rk House and Museum, which also has a pleasant garden, a large number of AtatÃ¼rk's personal belongings can be examined closely together with a spiritual atmosphere.

description.en:
Izmir Fair area, which has a very important place in the history of Izmir, is generally referred as â€œKÃ¼ltÃ¼rparkâ€. The Fair, which was opened on the first day of the year 1936, soon becomes a place being demolition job in all of Turkey. The main goal of the opening of the fair is to strengthen the economic ties between Turkey and other states. Today, the Kulturpark has the largest green field in Izmir city center. When you fly over the city, you can understand the physical dominance of the region much more clearly. Built on an area of 420 thousand square meters, KÃ¼ltÃ¼rpark offers a suitable activity for people of all ages and tastes.

The Izmir fairground normally traditionally stays open for an average of one week in September. In the past, the fair was officially open for two weeks. This period, which is looked forward to an entire year, has many activities and activities. At the same time, the fair has a great commercial volume and companies for geting a chance to introduce themselves through the stands here. Although the official opening of the Fair covers a short period, this place is active throughout the year. The Fair, whose doors are open to visitors throughout the year; Ismet InÃ¶nÃ¼ Art Center, Amusement Park, Youth Theater, parachute Tower, AtatÃ¼rk Outdoor Theater, Celal Atik Sports Hall, painting and Sculpture Museum are among many interesting sections.

There are around 8 thousand trees in Izmir Fair area. This number is considered as an extremely serious level for such a metropolis. The Fair also hosts more than 200 plant species. Many of the trees here are insured. After the famous Izmir fire, some Armenian neighborhoods within the Fair area and structures such as St. Stepanos Church were seriously damaged. The Fair has five separate entrance gates. Normally, admission to the Fair is free, but you must use your transportation cards to enter the Fair during the official opening periods.

description.en:
<html>The ancient city of Myra, located in the center of the Demre district of Antalya, is one of the most touristy ancient cities in Turkey, and is an ancient settlement built on the plain of the same name as its own.

Myra, one of the six major cities of Lycia, is referred as â€˜Myrrhâ€™ in the Lycian language. The Demre stream (Myros), which runs through the ancient city of Myra dating back to the 5th century BC, has contributed to the development of maritime trade throughout history.

The ancient city of Myra, which showed incredible development since the 2nd century BC, was the metropolis of the Lycian Union at the time. In the ancient city of Myra you can see many structures, especially the portico and theatre, which Licinius LanGus of Oinoanda built with 10 thousand dinars. In addition, you will encounter city walls dating from the Roman period, wall remains from the Hellenistic period and more.

In the ancient city of Myra, whose reputation is spread all over the world with its rock tombs, these tombs are gathered in two separate places, on the Acropolis of the river on the eastern slope and on the theatre. You should also see the Church of St. Nicholas in Myra, built in the 6th century on the death of St. Nicholas, and the historic wooden houses built by the Lycians.

Entrance to the ancient city of Myra, whose name means â€˜place of the Great Mother Goddessâ€™, is paid, but museum card holders can make their visits free of charge. April and October, the ancient city of Myra is open to visitors from 08:00 in the morning to 19:00 in the evening. In the period between November and March the visiting hours are 08: 00-17:00.
</html>
description.de:
Die antike Stadt Myra, die sich im Stadtteil Demre in Antalya befindet und zu den touristischen antiken StÃ¤dten der TÃ¼rkei gehÃ¶rt, ist eine antike Siedlung in der gleichnamigen Ebene.

Myra, eine der sechs groÃŸen StÃ¤dte Lykiens, wird in der lykischen Sprache als "Myrrhe" bezeichnet. Der Demre Bach (Myros), der durch die antike Stadt Myra flieÃŸt, die bis ins 5. Jahrhundert vor Christus zurÃ¼ckreicht, hat im Laufe der Geschichte zur Entwicklung des Seehandels beigetragen.


Myra Antikstadt, die seit dem 2. Jahrhundert v. Chr. eine unglaubliche Entwicklung zeigte, war zu dieser Zeit die Metropole der Lykischen Union. Es ist mÃ¶glich, viele GebÃ¤ude in der antiken Stadt Myra zu sehen, insbesondere den Portikus und das Theater, die von Oinoanda Licinius Langus mit 10 000 Dinar erbaut wurden. DarÃ¼ber hinaus finden Sie Stadtmauern aus der RÃ¶merzeit, Mauerreste aus der hellenistischen Zeit und vieles mehr.


In der antiken Stadt Myra, deren FelsengrÃ¤ber und Ruhm auf der ganzen Welt verbreitet sind, sind diese GrÃ¤ber an zwei Orten gesammelt, am Osthang, an der Flussakropolis und am Theater. Sie sollten auf jeden Fall die Nikolauskirche sehen, die nach dem Tod des Nikolaus in Myra im 6. Jahrhundert erbaut wurde, und die historischen HolzhÃ¤user, die von den Lykern gebaut wurden.


Obwohl der Eintritt in die antike Stadt Myra, was als Wort "Ort der hÃ¶chsten MuttergÃ¶ttin" bedeutet, bezahlt ist, kÃ¶nnen Inhaber von Museumskarten kostenlos besuchen. Die antike Stadt Myra ist zwischen April und Oktober zwischen 08:00 und 19:00 Uhr morgens fÃ¼r Besucher geÃ¶ffnet. In der Zeit zwischen November und MÃ¤rz sind die Ã–ffnungszeiten zwischen 08:00 und 17:00 Uhr.

PalamutbÃ¼kÃ¼ Beach on the coast of Cennet, located near the westernmost tip of MuÄŸla, in the borders of Datca district, is one of the attraction centers of the city for the trio of sea, sand and sun.


The beach of PalamutbÃ¼kÃ¼, which is famous for its sea resembling a tropical aquarium, is adjacent to the cleanest and clear waters you can see. The experience as soon as you set your foot, is a kind of meeting of joy and happiness. However, a brief footnote; in recent years, although less common at sea, contamination from ship waste can be seen at some times.


PalamutbÃ¼kÃ¼ Beach has a long coastline. That means a large area, even during busy months. On the other hand, it is home to many businesses. Sun loungers are available for hire. There are also restaurants serving a variety of delicacies on the beach, where there are pleasant tea gardens. The beach, which has a large number of accommodation facilities nearby, is also ideal for long holidays.

description.en:
Underground cities such as Fairy Chimneys in NevÅŸehir are among the highlights. Underground living spaces, each woven with sophisticated stories, are basically aimed at security against foreign incursions. 

A place it finds itself among the strategies to protect human life in wars, interesting escape routes, passages, the gates which are closed with giant stones. One of the ancient cities at this point is the MazÄ± Underground City. MazÄ± Underground City is surrounded by churches and cemeteries with its history dating back 2,000 years. The church of the underground city is visually rich. You can also come across the sections used for body cleaning.

The living area stands out in terms of engineering in general. It's eight floors and four doors. There are giant sliding rocks at every door. Considering the finds and clues, close to 6,000 people are thought to have lived in this city. 

Entrance to The Underground City of MazÄ±, 11 miles from Urgup, is paid. The museum card is valid passes the card. There are places to eat and drink in the surrounding village. Especially food with potato is famous.

Die Kirche der unterirdischen Stadt ist visuell reich. Es gab auch Teile zur KÃ¶rperreinigung.

description.en:
The Fortification Walls of Iznik were built in the 4th century BC. This period is mentioned in written sources as â€˜Bithynia periodâ€™. The fortifications were later expanded thanks to new additions in both the Roman and Byzantine periods. It takes its form during this period, which has reached the present day. The historic ramparts resembling a five-edged polygon plan are approximately 5 thousand meters long. In this sense, it has a rather imposing image.


Some of the ramparts are round and some are square. There are 114 bastions in total in Fortification Walls of Iznik. The highest fortification is around 13 metres. When you look at the intersection of two busy streets in the city, you can easily see the four main gates of the city walls. The gates of Fortification Walls of Iznik are listed as Istanbul Gate, Lefke Gate, GÃ¶l Gate and Yenisehir Gate.


The Istanbul gate facing the northern part of the city of Bursa has three separate gates in itself. Between these doors, there is an oval courtyard. At the same time, the cylinder-shaped door towers have survived intact to the present day. The large arch located just above the jambs sits atop the corner walls. Lefke Gate faces east of Bursa. The structure is quite similar to the Istanbul Gate. These reasons are estimated that both doors were built on similar dates. However, there is no definite date for the periods in which these gates were built.


The GÃ¶l Gate faces the west direction of the town. Unfortunately, not much remains of this door nowadays. Only a section of the tower in the right section remained standing. Only the foundation of the remaining tower in the left section is evident. Yenisehir Gate is one of the most interesting gates. It consists of three parts in itself. This is also the gateway to the city from the outside. To reach the inner door, it is necessary to pass through the square-shaped courtyard.
description.de:
Iznik-Mauern wurden im 4. Jahrhundert vor Christus errichtet. Diese Periode wird in schriftlichen Quellen als "Bithynia-Periode" bezeichnet. Die Mauern wurden dann dank neuer ErgÃ¤nzungen sowohl in rÃ¶mischer als auch in byzantinischer Zeit erweitert. In dieser Zeit nimmt es auch seine heutige Form an. Historische Mauern, die einem fÃ¼nfseitigen Polygonplan Ã¤hneln, haben eine LÃ¤nge von ungefÃ¤hr 5.000 Metern. In diesem Sinne wirkt es sehr imposant.

Einige der Mauern sind rund und andere quadratisch. Es gibt 114 Bastionen an den Iznik Mauern. Die hÃ¶chste Mauer ist rund 13 Meter. Wenn man sich den Bereich ansieht, in dem sich zwei belebte StraÃŸen in der Stadt kreuzen, sind alle vier Haupttore der Stadtmauer leicht zu erkennen. Die Tore der Iznik-Mauern sind als Istanbul Tor, Lefke Tor, GÃ¶l Tor und YeniÅŸehir Tor aufgefÃ¼hrt.

Das Istanbuler Tor, das den nÃ¶rdlichen Teil der Stadt Bursa Ã¼berblickt, hat drei weitere Tore in sich. Zwischen diesen TÃ¼ren befindet sich ein ovaler Innenhof. Gleichzeitig sind zylindrische TÃ¼rme bis heute erhalten. Der groÃŸe Bogen direkt Ã¼ber den Pfosten sitzt an den EckwÃ¤nden. Das Lefke-Tor liegt Ã¶stlich von Bursa. Es ist dem Istanbuler Tor in seiner Struktur sehr Ã¤hnlich. Diese GrÃ¼nde werden geschÃ¤tzt, dass beide TÃ¼ren zu Ã¤hnlichen Daten gebaut wurden. Trotzdem gibt es kein genaues Datum fÃ¼r die ZeitrÃ¤ume, in denen diese TÃ¼ren hergestellt wurden.

description.en:
<html>One of the oldest mosques in Antalya, Murat Pasha Mosque, was built between 1570-1571 by Murat Pasha, who served as a Karaman Beylerbeyi(Governor) during the Ottoman Empire.

Among the prominent features of the mosque, there are the arched openings in which colored stones are used, the last communion place consisting of three parts in the front, and its spacious and bright windows in two rows. It has a marble mihrab and plain pulpit, as well as windows on the sides of its door. It is known for its pen-work decorations, which attracted interest from herbal motifs. However, in general, it can be stated that it has a simple interior design. Quite large trees in the garden of the mosque, where cut stones were used in its construction, also attract attention.

It is also known that the historical mosque has elements that have not survived to the present day. These include the section called imaret, which is used to help the poor, the madrasa, where secondary and higher education is carried out, which was incorporated after the construction of the mosque, and a nearby inn, which is said to be located.

In addition, the minaret of the mosque is among the sections that have not survived to the present day. In its place is a minaret of cut stone, completed in 1914, with a lead sarcophagus and two minarets. The historical mosque is known to have undergone extensive renovations in 1960, staying true to its original status... This historical mosque in the MuratpaÅŸa district of Antalya will impress you with its mystical atmosphere and the wisdom of the centuries.
</html>

GewÃ¶lbte Ã–ffnungen mit farbigen Steinen an der Fassade, der letzte aus drei Teilen bestehende Versammlungsort an der Vorderseite und seine zweireihigen Fenster sowie seine GerÃ¤umigkeit und Helligkeit gehÃ¶ren zu den herausragenden Merkmalen der Moschee. Neben dem Marmoraltar und der einfachen Kanzel hat es Fenster an den Seiten seiner TÃ¼r. Es ist bekannt fÃ¼r seine handgezeichneten Ornamente, die Blumenmotive anziehen. Es kann jedoch festgestellt werden, dass es im Allgemeinen eine einfache Innenausstattung hat. AuffÃ¤llig sind auch groÃŸe BÃ¤ume im Garten der Moschee, fÃ¼r deren Bau geschnittene Steine â€‹â€‹verwendet wurden.


Es ist auch bekannt, dass die historische Moschee Elemente aufweist, die bis heute nicht erreicht wurden. Diese kÃ¶nnen als der Abschnitt namens Imaret gezÃ¤hlt werden, der den Armen hilft, die Medresse, in der nach dem Bau der Moschee Sekundar- und Hochschulbildung errichtet wurde, und ein Gasthaus, das sich angeblich in unmittelbarer NÃ¤he befindet.


DarÃ¼ber hinaus gehÃ¶rt das Minarett der Moschee zu den Teilen, die heute nicht mehr zu erreichen sind. Sein Minarett, das 1914 fertiggestellt wurde und aus geschnittenem Stein besteht; Es hat Bleisarkophag und zwei UmgÃ¤nge. Es ist bekannt, dass die historische Moschee 1960 einer umfassenden Renovierung unterzogen wurde, indem sie ihrem Original treu blieb. Diese historische Moschee im Stadtteil MuratpaÅŸa in Antalya wird Sie auch mit ihrer mystischen AtmosphÃ¤re und Weisheit beeindrucken, die durch Jahrhunderte gebracht wurde.

description.en:
<html>Ã‡elebi Sultan Mehmet Mosque, one of the most important cultural and historical values of Antalya, was founded in 1414 by Sultan I.Mehmet's leadership. The mosque, located in the district of SÃ¶ÄŸÃ¼t, bears traces of Ottoman architecture.

In some sources, the Ã‡elebi Sultan Mehmet mosque was built by Orhan Bey, the second Sultan of the Ottoman Empire, but there is no clear judgment. The construction of the house of worship was started in 1414 and after six years of feverish work, the mosque was completed. This historic Ottoman mosque, notable for its magnificent structure, is among the first domed examples.

The first serious repair of the mosque, which has 12 domes resembling rectangles, was made during the reign of II.Abdulhamid. With this repair, the capacity of the mosque was expanded and some of the glitches were fixed. The main major repair process of the mosque corresponds to the year 1876. The architect Ãœsep journeyman undertook the major repair in 1876. Apart from the base of the minaret, radical changes were also made in the mosque at that time. The Ã‡elebi Sultan Mehmet Mosque, which has been in service since 1420, still offers some reflections from its original image today.

12 small domes of the mosque are supported by six columns. The large dome, on the other hand, is supported by four pillars. A special technique called as pendentive was used in the elegant arch structures in the interior area. At the same time, a large light lamp is placed in this section.

The Ã‡elebi Sultan Mehmet Mosque, which has a large and spacious structure in general, attracts attention especially with the richness of its interior decorations. Cut stone and brick were used in the construction of the mosque and there are three separate gates to enter. Only the sentence door located in the northern part is fixed, but the other two doors are left open at all times. The minaret, which has been preserved to date, has an octagonal cross section.

</html>
description.de:
Die Ã‡elebi Sultan Mehmet Moschee wurde 1414 unter der Leitung von Sultan Mehmet I. als einer der wichtigsten kulturellen und historischen Werte von Antalya erbaut. Die Moschee im Bezirk SÃ¶ÄŸÃ¼t weist Spuren osmanischer Architektur auf.


In einigen Quellen der Ã‡elebi Sultan Mehmet Moschee gibt es Informationen, die Orhan Bey, der zweite Sultan des Osmanischen Staates, gebaut hatte, aber es gibt kein klares Urteil. Der Bau der KultstÃ¤tte begann 1414 und die Moschee wurde nach sechs Jahren intensiver Arbeit fertiggestellt. Diese historische osmanische Moschee, die mit ihrer prÃ¤chtigen Struktur Aufmerksamkeit erregt, gehÃ¶rt zu den ersten Kuppelbeispielen.


Die erste ernsthafte Restaurierung der Moschee mit 12 Kuppeln, die einem Rechteck Ã¤hneln, ist, findet wÃ¤hrend der Regierungszeit von Abdulhamit II. statt. Mit dieser Reparatur wurde die KapazitÃ¤t der Moschee erweitert und einige Probleme wurden beseitigt. Der Hauptreparaturprozess der Moschee entspricht 1876. Der Architekt Usep Kalfa unternahm 1876 die Hauptreparatur. Neben der Basis des Minaretts wurden zu dieser Zeit auch radikale VerÃ¤nderungen in der Moschee vorgenommen. Die Celebi Sultan Mehmet Moschee, die seit 1420 dient, bietet noch einige Reflexionen von ihrem ursprÃ¼nglichen Erscheinungsbild.


Die 12 kleinen Kuppeln der Moschee werden von sechs SÃ¤ulen getragen. Andererseits wird die groÃŸe Kuppel von vier SÃ¤ulen getragen. Eine spezielle Technik, die als AnhÃ¤nger bezeichnet wird, wird in den eleganten Bogenstrukturen im Innenbereich verwendet. Gleichzeitig befindet sich in diesem Bereich ein groÃŸer Leuchtturm.


Die Ã‡elebi Sultan Mehmet Moschee, die im Allgemeinen eine breite und gerÃ¤umige Struktur aufweist, fÃ¤llt besonders durch ihre reichhaltige Innenausstattung auf. description.en:
<html>The decals of football seasons in Europe and Turkey are colorful as they can be in Antalya. Antalya, famous for its warm climate, facilities and modern urban texture, was among the first choices of many local and foreign football clubs for camping, but the renovation of the historic stadium in the city was necessary. In addition, Antalyaspor needed a modern stadium to host league matches, in this context, the Antalya Stadium, which was completed between 2013 and 2015, is one of the symbol points of the city today.

The stadium, with a capacity of 33 thousand 32 people, has an arena-like, round design with reference to the ancient theatres in the Mediterranean. With its bleachers and reinforced concrete stadium body made of precast elements in order to be lighter, the steel construction roof stands out with its aesthetic appearance. The Antalya Stadium is an example, especially with the solar panels used as a first in Turkey on its roof. These panels generate 7200 kilowatts of energy per day and not only meet the entire stadium's electricity requirement, but also meet the needs of more than 500 homes in the city.

On the other hand, the roof of the eco-friendly stadium, which has a high sun permeability, contributes to the grass being more vibrant. The total construction area of the stadium, which has a project cost of 103 million TL, is 200 thousand square meters. The stadium ,which has 44 lodges, is defined by â€˜3â€™, which means â€˜intermediateâ€™ level in the UEFA stadium classification. Besiktas and Antalyaspor played the opening match at the Antalya Stadium in 2015-16 season.
</html>

Andererseits trÃ¤gt das Dach des umweltfreundlichen Stadions, das eine hohe SonnendurchlÃ¤ssigkeit aufweist, dazu bei, das Gras lebendiger zu machen. description.en:
The Acem Reis mosque is located in the eastern part of Demirtas mosque. The historical mosque, which is situated on the GÃ¼zel KÄ±z Street, is also known as the â€˜Arab Dede Mosqueâ€™ among the people.


It is known that the historical mosque was built by Bedreddin Mehmet Acem. He was one of the teachers of Fatih Sultan Mehmet, the most famous Sultan of the Ottoman Empire at that time. At the entrance of the Acem Reis Mosque, which has an internal dimension of about 7 meters,there is the last place of communion. Three rows of bricks were used on the walls of the mosque, whose main place of worship was covered by a large and ostentatious dome. The eye in the middle section is under the Bursa-type pointed arches. This section is also covered with mirrored vaults.


Hazire(a forbidden area surrounded by fences) part of the Acem Reis mosque being the middle of the two roads has become smaller. As of today, only a few graves remain in this area. According to the information provided, the mosque was built in 1516. Bedreddin Mahmut, who built the mosque, was a merchant of Tabriz origin who was well known in Bursa at that time. When he died in 1517, he was buried next to this mosque. He made the mosque built, but at the same time, a school was also built here by him, but the place where this school is today is lost.


Jalali riots began in the century in which the mosque was built. In 1608, several gangs in the city damaged the Acem Reis mosque. On the other hand, in 1855, the historic mosque faced a major earthquake disaster. As a result of this earthquake, part of the minaret is destroyed. For a very long time the mosque remains without minarets due to financial impossibilities. Bursa Antiquities lovers institution, after the Republic, even if they want to repair the mosque can not get the support they desire. This situation continues until 1957. The Foundation Administration also step in the situation in 1958 and, with the help of some philanthropists, completed the restoration.
description.de:
Die Acem Reis Moschee befindet sich im Ã¶stlichen Teil der DemirtaÅŸ Moschee. Die historische Moschee, die sich genau an der GÃ¼zel KÄ±z StraÃŸe befindet, ist auch als "Arap Dede Moschee" bekannt.

Es ist bekannt, dass die historische Moschee von Bedreddin Mehmet Acem erbaut wurde. Er war einer der Lehrer des berÃ¼hmtesten Sultans des Osmanischen Reiches, Fatih Sultan Mehmeti. Am Eingang der Acem-Reis-Moschee, deren InnenmaÃŸ etwa 7 Meter betrÃ¤gt, befindet sich der letzte Versammlungsort. An den WÃ¤nden der Moschee, deren HauptanbetungsstÃ¤tte mit einer groÃŸen und auffÃ¤lligen Kuppel bedeckt war, wurden drei Ziegelreihen verwendet. Der Abschnitt im mittleren Teil befindet sich unter den SpitzbÃ¶gen mit einer Bursa Art. Dieser Abschnitt ist auch mit gespiegelten GewÃ¶lben abgedeckt.

Der Grabteil der Acem-Reis-Moschee, der zwischen den beiden StraÃŸen liegt, ist kleiner geworden. Bis heute sind nur noch wenige GrÃ¤ber in diesem Gebiet erhalten. Nach den Ã¼bermittelten Informationen wurde die Moschee 1516 erbaut. Bedreddin Mahmut, der die Moschee baute, war zu dieser Zeit ein bekannter Tabriz-HÃ¤ndler in Bursa. Als er 1517 starb, wurde er neben dieser Moschee begraben. Als er die Moschee baute, baute er hier auch eine Schule, aber der Ort, an dem diese Schule ist, ist heute verloren gegangen.

Celali-AufstÃ¤nde begannen im Laufe des Jahrhunderts, als die Moschee gebaut wurde. Verschiedene Partisangruppen in der Stadt beschÃ¤digten 1608 die Acem-Reis-Moschee. Andererseits steht die historische Moschee 1855 vor einer schweren Erdbebenkatastrophe. Infolge dieses Erdbebens wird der Minarettteil zerstÃ¶rt. Die Moschee bleibt aufgrund finanzieller UnmÃ¶glichkeiten sehr lange ohne Minarett. Obwohl die Bursa Antiksachen Enthusiastengemeinschaft die Moschee nach der Republik reparieren wollte, konnten sie nicht die UnterstÃ¼tzung bekommen, die sie sich wÃ¼nschen. Diese Situation hÃ¤lt bis 1957 an. Die Stiftungsverwaltung ergriff 1958 die Situation und schloss die Restaurierung mit Hilfe einiger WohltÃ¤tigen ab.

description.en:
Of course, if you are not going to ski to travel in Erzurum, the best season is when the nature begins to green. Because although the winter is quite cold, spring and summer months add beauty to the beauty and peace of mind to peace in this city.

Narman Fivelakes, a natural wonder, is in a position where you can reach it in a short time by the car, even though it is 121 kilometers away from Erzurum. When you come to Narman, Fivelakes welcomes you with a visual feast and welcomes with its natural beauty its guests who come in the best way. This area, where five large and small lakes create a spectacular view, now stands as a virgin area. There are also plateaus close to where many points are needed to be explored. Considering that the nearest plateau is 2 kilometers away, this trip is not finished without taking a magnificent photo of this area from the plateau!

A large number of local tourists come to the region during spring periods, especially to camp or trekking. But the width of the region is large enough to prevent from forming a crowded environment. It is easier to reach by road through Erzurum Hasankale.

Ein Naturwunder Narman BeÅŸgÃ¶ller ist an einem Ort, den Sie mit dem Auto in kurzer Zeit erreichen kÃ¶nnen, obwohl es 121 Kilometer von Erzurum entfernt ist. Falls Sie nach Narman kommen, begrÃ¼ÃŸt Sie BeÅŸgÃ¶ller mit einer wundervollen Landschaft und empfÃ¤ngt seine GÃ¤ste mit seiner natÃ¼rlichen SchÃ¶nheit auf die beste Weise. Dieses Gebiet, in dem fÃ¼nf groÃŸe und kleine Seen eine herrliche Aussicht bilden, ist bis heute eine unberÃ¼hrte Region. Es gibt auch Hochebenen in der NÃ¤he, wo es viele Orte zu entdecken gibt. Wenn man denkt, dass die nÃ¤chstgelegene Ebene 2 Kilometer entfernt ist, darf dieser Ausflug nicht beendet werden, ohne ein groÃŸartiges Foto vom Plateau zu machen!

In der Region kommen viele einheimische und auslÃ¤ndische Touristen, um im FrÃ¼hjahr ein Camp oder Trekking zu veranstalten. Die Breite der Region ist jedoch groÃŸ genug, um eine Ã¼berfÃ¼llte Umgebung zu verhindern. Die Anreise Ã¼ber Erzurum Hasankale ist einfacher.

description.en:
KarabaÅŸ-Ä± Veli Dervish Lodge, one of the characteristic Ottoman structures in the Osmangazi District of Bursa, was founded by Yakup Ã‡elebi in the 16th century. The source of his name is the same person's book called Tecvid-i KarabaÅŸ.

The historical dervish lodge is also active today; there are usually sema shows in the evenings dedicated to Mevlevi culture and free drinks are offered. It's almost like visitors are given an authentic atmosphere of centuries ago.

A variety of events related to traditional culture, such as poetry night and Ney concert, are also organized as part of the monthly programmes. Training programs are also being carried out. The programs are prepared in cooperation with the Mevlana Culture Promotion and survival Association and the General Directorate of Property Foundations. The rectangular plan of KarabaÅŸ-Ä± Veli Dervish Lodge, whose restoration work was completed in 2005, is famous for its dome, which attracts attention with its fine woodwork. Based on a total area of 720 square meters, lodgeâ€™s garden area of 380 square meters, 110 square meters constitute the joint building. The exterior features have two smaller sections totaling 230 square meters.

KarabaÅŸ-Ä± Veli Dervish Lodge, located on a hill close to Bursa Ulu Mosque, has the characteristic of a high historical route of spirituality.
description.de:
KarabaÅŸ-Ä± Veli Derwischloge, eines der charakteristischen osmanischen GebÃ¤ude im Stadtteil Osmangazi in Bursa, wurde im 16. Jahrhundert von Yakup Ã‡elebi gegrÃ¼ndet. Die Quelle seines Namens ist das Buch derselben Person namens Tecvid-i KarabaÅŸ.

Die historische Route ist noch heute aktiv; Am Abend, der der Mevlevi-Kultur gewidmet ist, finden hÃ¤ufig Sema AuffÃ¼hrungen statt und GetrÃ¤nke werden kostenlos angeboten. Dieser Ort gibt seinen Besuchern eine authentische AtmosphÃ¤re von vor Jahrhunderten.

Im Rahmen von monatlichen Programmen werden auch verschiedene AktivitÃ¤ten im Zusammenhang mit traditioneller Kultur wie Poesienacht und Ney AuffÃ¼hrungen organisiert. ZusÃ¤tzlich werden Schulungsprogramme durchgefÃ¼hrt. Die Programme werden in Zusammenarbeit mit der Mevlana Kultur Bekanntmachung und Bewahrung und der Generaldirektion der Eigentumsstiftung vorbereitet. Die Kuppel von KarabaÅŸ-Ä± Veli Derwischloge, deren Restaurierungsarbeiten 2005 abgeschlossen wurden, fÃ¤llt durch ihre feine Holzverarbeitung auf. Die GesamtflÃ¤che der Route wurde auf einer GesamtflÃ¤che von 720 Quadratmetern erbaut und besteht aus 380 Quadratmetern Garten und 110 Quadratmetern Tekke-GebÃ¤ude. Auf der AuÃŸenseite gibt es zwei kleine Abschnitte von 230 Quadratmetern.

KarabaÅŸ-Ä± Veli Derwischloge liegt auf einem HÃ¼gel in der NÃ¤he der GroÃŸen Moschee von Bursa und hat eine spirituelle historische Route.

description.en:
Built in the 19th century as a winter mansion, the Chamber of Industry and Commerce Building stands out among russian architectural examples. Designed with cut basalt stone and single-storey, work is among the Examples of Baltic architecture.

Today, the exterior of the mansion, which is used as the Building of the Chamber of Industry and Commerce, stands out with its border decorations. Especially recently, with external lighting, it impresses people with its majesty who pass in front of it in the evening. 

The building has been used as kars Chamber of Industry and Commerce Building since the announcement of the Republic. Today, the building used for the same purpose increases its importance with the visit of Gazi Mustafa Kemal Ataturk. It is among the buildings AtatÃ¼rk visited during his visit to Kars province on October 6, 1924.
description.de:

Das Ã„uÃŸere des Hauses, das heute als Industrie- und Handelskammer genutzt wird, fÃ¤llt durch seine Randverzierungen auf. Vor allem bei der Beleuchtung von auÃŸen beeindruckt es die abends vorbeikommenden Menschen.

Das GebÃ¤ude, das heute fÃ¼r denselben Zweck genutzt wird, gewinnt mit dem Besuch von Gazi Mustafa Kemal AtatÃ¼rk an Bedeutung. Es ist eines der GebÃ¤ude, die AtatÃ¼rk wÃ¤hrend seines Besuchs in Kars am 6. Oktober 1924 besuchte.

description.en:
<html>In the National Liberation War initiated by the State of Turkey in the name of the struggle for independence, the western front has an important place. 

The building, which is used as a museum today, was built by the mayor of the period between 1904 and 1905. The building, which operates as a Town Hall and opened to the public, is allocated to the Western Front Command, which moved to AkÅŸehir on November  18th 1921. The commandership is available for a year in the building where preparations for the Great Offensive are being hold.

When the history pages showed 1964, the building was transferred to the Ministry of Culture and Tourism and underwent restoration work in accordance with original. After five years of repair and maintenance, it opens to visitors under the name of AtatÃ¼rk and Ethnography Museum. The collection of  the museum, which was repaired again in 1981, is developed and is reopened to the public service as today's Western Front Headquarters Museum.

The museum collection consists of equipments and firearms, which are generally thought to have been used in the War of Independence, as well as photographs of Ataturk and Ismet Inonu in Konya and the rifle gifted to Haci Bekir Sumer. The purpose of using the building rather than its collection is important, and explorers are guided accordingly. In the room, Ataturk and his comrades made the decision of the Great Raid, the  visitors can feel the spirit of that day.
</html>

Das GebÃ¤ude diente ein Jahr lang dem Kommandant, in dem der GroÃŸe Angriff vorbereitet wurde.

AÅŸs die Geschichtsseiten das Jahr 1964 zeigten, wurde das dem Ministerium fÃ¼r Kultur und Tourismus Ã¼bertragene GebÃ¤ude restauriert, indem es seinem Original treu blieb. Nach fÃ¼nf Jahren Reparatur- und Wartungsarbeiten wird es unter dem Namen AtatÃ¼rk and Ethnographisches Museum fÃ¼r Besucher geÃ¶ffnet. Die 1981 rekonstruierte Sammlung des Museums wird als heutiges Museum vom Hauptquartier an der Westfassade entwickelt und der Ã–ffentlichkeit prÃ¤sentiert.

Die Museumssammlung besteht im Allgemeinen aus Schusswaffen, von denen angenommen wird, dass sie im UnabhÃ¤ngigkeitskrieg verwendet wurden, sowie Fotos von AtatÃ¼rk und Ä°smet Ä°nÃ¶nÃ¼ in Konya und Gewehren, die dem HacÄ± Bekir SÃ¼mer geschenkt wurden. Anstelle der Sammlung ist der Zweck des GebÃ¤udes wichtig und die Entdecker werden entsprechend gefÃ¼hrt. In dem Raum, in dem AtatÃ¼rk und seine Mitsoldaten den GroÃŸen Angriff beschlossen haben, kÃ¶nnen Besucher den Geist dieses Tages einfangen.</html>

description.en:
Faroz, famous for its lighthouse, which guides sailor guests of the Black Sea, notorious for its vicious waves, has a particularly historical significance.

The word 'faroz' means lighthouse in Greek. The city of Trabzon in the Black Sea region, which is known for its vast natural beauties, also draws attention with its lighthouse, which guides its guests from the sea. Faroz, whose native still holds on to all Anatolian culture, has enormous grandeur with its hospitality and fishing boats, especially one of the favorite places for those who dream of a seaside town.

Faroz is like a dream... So much so that it is the incarnation of the dream of a seaside town of almost everyone living in the big city. Every morning, with the dawn, countless takas (small sailing boats) begins its fishing journey, grappling with raging waves. Before noon, fresh crate of fish arrives and from in the town where accented Turkish speakers, seagulls and the scent of real Black Sea tea on guests.

Faroz, where each square meter allows a separate beautiful scenery, takes those who see it on a journey towards the realm of dreams, so to speak, especially with its magnificent view at sunset.

Faroz ist berÃ¼hmt fÃ¼r seinen Leuchtturm, der die Seefahrer des Schwarzen Meeres fÃ¼hrt und fÃ¼r seine heftigen Wellen bekannt ist, ist von besonderer Bedeutung.

Das Wort "Faroz" bedeutet im Griechischen Leuchtturm. Die Stadt Trabzon am Schwarzen Meer, die fÃ¼r ihre immensen NaturschÃ¶nheiten bekannt ist, macht mit ihrem Leuchtturm auf sich aufmerksam, der ihre GÃ¤ste vom Meer aus fÃ¼hrt. Faroz, wo die Einheimischen noch immer die gesamte anatolische Kultur verkÃ¶rpern und mit seiner Gastfreundschaft und ihren Fischerbooten eine enorme Pracht haben, ist einer der beliebtesten Orte fÃ¼r diejenigen, die von einer KÃ¼stenstadt trÃ¤umen.

Faroz ist wie ein Traumâ€¦ So sehr, dass die KÃ¼stenstadt, die der Traum fast aller in der GroÃŸstadt lebenden Menschen ist, die VerkÃ¶rperung des Traums ist. Jeden Morgen beginnt er sein Angelabenteuer, indem er mit den Wellen der unzÃ¤hligen Tees mit der SonnendÃ¤mmerung kÃ¤mpft. In dem Dorf, in dem vor Mittag frischer Fisch kommt, sprechen die MÃ¶wen einen dialetisches TÃ¼rkisch und der echte Schwarzmeertee, der aufgekocht wird, nimmt ihre GÃ¤ste mit sich ein.

Faroz, wo jeder Quadratmeter Fotos von unterschiedlicher SchÃ¶nheit erlaubt, unternimmt eine Reise in die Traumwelt, besonders wenn Sie den herrlichen Blick auf den Sonnenuntergang sehen.

description.en:
Nuri Mehmet Pasha Mosque stands at an important place among the historical mosques of Gaziantep. The mosque, located on the suburban street, was built by Nuri Mehmet Pasha himself. This information is transferred through the court records of ecclesiastical. There are two separate inscriptions in both the minaret and the mihrab section of the mosque. The information contained in the inscriptions confirms the information about when and by whom the mosque was built. The second inscription belongs to the year 1834. It is presumed that this was written as a repair inscription.

Nuri Mehmet Pasha Mosque, which reflects the Ottoman architectural style, has been repaired many times over time. This causes the mosque to lose a modicum of authenticity. The mosque suffered serious damage, especially due to the French occupation. After the defence of Antep, this mosque was used as a military depot for some time. By the 1960s, the mosque had been converted into a museum. The Ministry of Education plays an active role in this process. This condition continues for about 10 years. By 1968, it was finally undergoing a major renovation and restored to its mosque form. Just as in the past, it begins to serve as a mosque again. In the eastern part of the courtyard, there is the Tomb of Nuri Mehmet Pasha.

The last renovation of the mosque takes place in 2007. A year later, the mosque opens for worship. The Nuri Mehmet Pasha mosque is still open for worship today. Smooth cut stones are used in the construction process of the historic mosque, which is also located close to the pit quarter. The fact that these stones are in black and white color adds a nice air to the mosque from an aesthetic point of view. Today it is a mosque that is often preferred not only for worship but also for tourist visits.

description.en:
<html>Abdullah Bey Mansion, which has lived in all its stories in Savur district of Mardin, has been operating for 170 years as both a hotel and as a museum.

One of the most beautiful buildings in the city, this magnificent mansion amazes those who see it with its long history and architecture.The shadow of Mardin casttle  virtually  takes the people who reached the site by leaving the green  poplars at full lenght,behind,a long  the road ,under its wings.
Abdullah Bey Mansion is a visual feast monument with its magnificent view of light  earth-colored hills.

Abdullah Bey Mansion, the oldest mansion in the city, bears the name of its former owner, Haji Abdullah Bey. Built in the 1850s, this building also gives its visitors a spaciousness with the width of its interior. The venue, which makes guests feel that it is a Mansion of Bey with its symmetrical and flamboyant decorations, takes its explorers on a time journey, so to speak.

Abdullah Bey Mansion, which is also a museum, contains many works from the kitchen utensils that mardin people used from the past to the present ,to the clothes they wear.
</html>
description.de:
<html>Das Haus vom Herrn Abdullah belebt alle Geschichten im Stadtteil Savur in Mardin und ist seit 170 Jahren ein Hotel und Museum.

Dieses prÃ¤chtige Herrenhaus ist eines der schÃ¶nsten GebÃ¤ude der Stadt und fasziniert seine Besucher, mit seiner tief verwurzelten Geschichte und Pracht in seiner Architektur. Es befindet sich im Schatten der Burg Mardin, den man durch langen grÃ¼nen Pappeln erreichen kann. Das Haus vom Herrn Abdullah ist ein visuelles Fest mit einer herrlichen Aussicht, die aus HÃ¼geln von heller Erdfarbe besteht.

Das Haus vom Herrn Abdullah, das Ã¤lteste Herrenhaus der Stadt, trÃ¤gt den Namen seines ehemaligen Besitzers Herr HacÄ± Abdullah. Dieses GebÃ¤ude, das in den 1850er Jahren erbaut wurde, bietet seinen Besuchern ein gerÃ¤umiges Interieur. Der Ort, der seinen GÃ¤sten das GefÃ¼hl gibt, ein Herrenhaus mit seinen symmetrischen und extravaganten Dekorationen zu sein, nimmt seine Entdecker mit auf eine Zeitreise.

Das Haus vom Herrn Abdullah, das auch ein Museum ist, enthÃ¤lt viele Werke von den KÃ¼chenutensilien, die die Menschen in Mardin verwenden, bis zu den Kleidern, die sie tragen.

description.en:
It is not wrong to say that the temple of fairy tale fairy chimneys for NevÅŸehir, one of the cities in central  of Turkey. This is a unique historic city that welcomes visitors from around the world from the United States to China. There's no doubt it's also famous for itâ€™s major valleys, which raise the visiual feast to different levels. One of them is The Red Pit Valley.

Why would it be wrong to say 'Lord of the Landscape' for The Red Pit Valley, which promises a must-taste visual feast, especially in sunset views? 

The valley on the Urgup road is famous for its panoramic views and is ideal for trekking. It is difficult to understand how the time passes in the KizilÃ§ukur Valley, which offers the opportunity to take long walks in nature. You will find not only nature and bird chirps, but also a few historical churches. 

The vvalley, which is one eof the bests destinaion not only in Turkey but also in the world fort he sunset iew is among the sightseeing activities that should not be skipped if you are to cross your way to Cappadocia. 
By the way, a very important reminding is  to go at least an hour before the sun's set time to stand in places with better views, especially in the Red Pit Valley, which has received a lot of attention in the summer months. Have a good time...

description.en:
Mosques undoubtedly have a very special and important place in Trabzon, where Muslim and Christian communities create an important cultural richness by sharing the same atmosphere side by side. The increase of the Muslim population living in the region with the Ottoman period also makes the motifs used in the mosques built quite different according to others.

Although there are mosques in different forms in other cities, the Ceiling Mosque is also among the typical rooftop mosques, in fact. This mosque was built by the Nemlizade family, who has been known for many years as a very wealthy and high brow family of Trabzon. The Nemlizade Family; undertook the construction of many works such as the historic mansion next to The Ceiling Mosque DeÄŸirmendere Bridge, Trabzon High School and Karasu Bridge and even brought Zulmara Water to Trabzon.

The rectangular structure consists of the last congregational area and harim section. The mosque thick stone walls with careful craftsmanship and a large graveyards. There is a screened and elevated wooden loge over the entrance part of the harim. The lighting of the mosque is provided by windows. The minbar is kept simple. Harim's wooden ceiling is also in the middle with dome.
description.de:
Moscheen haben zweifellos einen ganz besonderen und wichtigen Platz in Trabzon, wo muslimische und christliche Gemeinschaften eine AtmosphÃ¤re der Kultur teilen, indem sie dieselbe AtmosphÃ¤re nebeneinander teilen. Die Zunahme der muslimischen BevÃ¶lkerung in der Region wÃ¤hrend der osmanischen Zeit macht die in den Moscheen verwendeten Motive von anderen getrennt.

Obwohl es in anderen StÃ¤dten Moscheen in unterschiedlichen Formen gibt, gehÃ¶rt die TabanlÄ±-Moschee auch zu den typischen Ã¼berdachten Moscheen. Diese Moschee wurde von der Familie Nemlizade erbaut, die seit vielen Jahren als multikulturelle Familie von Trabzon bekannt ist. Die Familie Nemlizade Ã¼bernahm den Bau vieler Werke wie das historische Herrenhaus neben der TavanlÄ±-Moschee , die DeÄŸirmendere-BrÃ¼cke, die Trabzon-Oberschule und die Karasu-BrÃ¼cke und brachte sogar das Zulmara-Wasser nach Trabzon.

Das GebÃ¤ude, das einen rechteckigen Grundriss hat, besteht aus dem letzten Gemeindebereich und dem Harim-Abschnitt. Die Moschee, die dicke Steinmauern mit akribischer Handwerkskunst hat, hat eine groÃŸe Kammer. Am Eingang des Harims befindet sich ein Holzschaft. Die Beleuchtung der Moschee ist mit Fenstern versehen. Die Kanzel ist schlicht. Die Holzdecke des Harim hat in der Mitte eine Ausbauchung.

description.en:
<html>To reach the ancient city of Arykanda, it is necessary to follow the path of Finike and ElmalÄ± to the side of the Taurus Mountains and then continue for another six kilometers from Ã‡atals. The road that is followed to reach the ancient city is largely covered with pine trees, making it feel like it is going towards peace.

It is estimated that the active settlements in the ancient city of Arykanda, located near the village of Arif, coincided with the 2000s BC. Unfortunately, there are no remains of these periods. The oldest surviving pieces from the ancient city of Arykanda are coins, pots and pottery. These belong to the 5th century BC.

The ancient city of Arykanda began to be influenced by Christianity after the 4th century. Throughout history, many earthquakes have caused serious damage to the city. Especially after 240 BC, the earthquake caused serious damage to the city. As these earthquakes continued, the population migrated to the vicinity of Ã‡atalar village. In later centuries, they dispersed to more remote locations to protect themselves from Arab attacks.

The ancient city of Arykanda was discovered by an Englishman by chance in 1838. Regular excavations have been carried out in the area since 1971. Professor Cevdet BayburtluoÄŸlu is the leading figure in these studies. A bath meets you at the entrance of the ancient city, which has managed to survive considerably despite the earthquakes it has experienced. The walls and windows of this bathhouse are still standing. In the opposite section it is possible to see traces from a high basilica.

A necropolis is located just to the right of the city. The reliefs here are of interest. The remains standing at the foot of the cliffs in the left section are outnumbered. The Agora of the city is also located in this area. The odeon in the rear section is still standing.
</html>

description.en:
Girls' Monastery is among the highlights in Trabzon, which welcomes its visitors with its rich atmosphere of history on every corner. After many years, the building was restored and brought to tourism, and is located on the borders of Boztepe District, which also draws attention to the panoramic view of itâ€™s balcony that offers bird's eye view in Ortahisar District in the south of the city. 

According to written sources, the Girls' Monastery, built in the 14th century, is also known as Theotokos Theoskepastos Monastery and Panaghia Theotocos Monastery. 

Built in a dominating cliff, the monastery was built in a method called masonry construction. Cut stones were mainly used in the construction. The Girls' Monastery, which does not contain much aesthetic detail in its exterior, gives a feeling of a basic rectangular building . On the other hand, it contains different elements in the interior. These include chambers identified as monk cells, two courtyards, churches, gathering places, library, dining room and bell tower. There is also a chapel at the end of one of the courtyards thought to be a small place of worship. 

In the  Girlsâ€™ Monastery entered through the iron gate between the small columns, the Byzantine Emperor of the period, was the portraits of  Byzantine emperor of the period 3. Alexios' wife and mother, frescoes stand out. There are also new frescoes unearthed during restoration work. Therefore, it can be noted that this process is completed with important results for tourism. The roof of the building has not reached the present day, but has generally become an important attraction, the Girls' Monastery is among the striking historical values of Trabzon.
description.de:
Das MÃ¤dchenkloster ist einer der herausragenden Werte in Trabzon, der seine Besucher mit seiner reichen AtmosphÃ¤re der Geschichte begrÃ¼ÃŸt. Das GebÃ¤ude, das nach vielen Jahren des Wartens restauriert und dem Tourismus zugÃ¤nglich gemacht wurde, befindet sich innerhalb der Grenzen des Bezirks Boztepe, der mit seinem Panoramabalkon, der im Stadtteil Ortahisar im SÃ¼den der Stadt eine Vogelperspektive bietet, Aufmerksamkeit erregt.

Laut schriftlichen Quellen ist das im 14. Jahrhundert erbaute MÃ¤dchenkloster auch als Theotokos Theoskepastos-Kloster bekannt. Es ist auch bekannt, Panaghia Theotocos Kloster genannt zu werden.

Das Kloster wurde in einem dominanten Felsen erbaut und nach einer Methode namens Mauerwerksbau errichtet. Bei der Konstruktion wurden hauptsÃ¤chlich geschnittene Steine â€‹â€‹verwendet. Das MÃ¤dchenkloster, das in seiner Ã¤uÃŸeren Erscheinung nicht viele Ã¤sthetische Details enthÃ¤lt, vermittelt einen im Grunde rechteckigen GebÃ¤udeeindruck. Auf der anderen Seite enthÃ¤lt es verschiedene Elemente im Inneren. Unter diesen stechen als MÃ¶nchszellen definierte Kammern, zwei InnenhÃ¶fe, Kirchen, Treffpunkte, Bibliothek, Speisesaal und Glockenturm hervor. Es gibt auch eine Kapelle am Ende eines der InnenhÃ¶fe, die als kleine KultstÃ¤tte gilt.

Die Bilder und Fresken der Frau und Mutter des byzantinischen Kaisers Alexios dem 3., die sich auch nach Jahrhunderten im MÃ¤dchenkloster, die durch das Eisentor zwischen den kleinen SÃ¤ulen betreten wurden, in einem relativ guten Zustand befanden, ziehen die Aufmerksamkeit auf sich. WÃ¤hrend der Restaurierungsarbeiten wurden auch neue Fresken entdeckt. Aus diesem Grund kann festgestellt werden, dass dieser Prozess mit wichtigen Ergebnissen im Hinblick auf den Tourismus abgeschlossen ist. Das Dach des GebÃ¤udes ist bis heute nicht erreicht worden, aber das MÃ¤dchenkloster, das allgemein zu einer wichtigen Attraktion geworden ist, gehÃ¶rt zu den bemerkenswerten historischen Werten von Trabzon.

description.en:
The Sarica Church on a dominant hill, one of the standout historical structures of NevÅŸehir, is one of the first examples of Byzantine architecture in the heart of Anatolia.

It is not clear, but it is thought to have been built in the 9th century. Today, it can be seen in the focus of cultural tourism, it is not active. Due to the mainly yellow color of the church, it is referred to as the Church of Sarica. With its various size decorations and colorful frescoes in the interior, it gives guests a visual feast. 

The church, which planned a closed Greek Cross, is also inspired by a three-leaf chip type. In Sarica Church, which is described as an original architectural fusion, the paintings made with ochre on the walls stand out. 

Sarica Church, which has been better covered with restorations, it has seen on various dates as one of the historical values of interest in the region, is one of the landmark of Cappadocia.
description.de:
Die SarÄ±ca-Kirche auf einem dominanten HÃ¼gel, die zu den bedeutenden historischen GebÃ¤uden von NevÅŸehir gehÃ¶rt, gehÃ¶rt zu den ersten Beispielen byzantinischer Architektur im Herzen Anatoliens.

Es wird angenommen, dass es im 9. Jahrhundert erbaut wurde, obwohl es nicht sicher ist. Heute ist es im Fokus des Kulturtourismus zu sehen, es ist nicht aktiv. Aufgrund der gelben Farbe der Kirche ist sie als SarÄ±ca-Kirche bekannt. Es bietet seinen GÃ¤sten ein visuelles Fest mit verschiedenen DekorationsgrÃ¶ÃŸen und farbenfrohen Fresken.

Es ist auch zu sehen, dass die Kirche mit einem geschlossenen Plan des griechischen Kreuzes vom Dreiblatt-Kleeblatt-Typ inspiriert wurde. In der SarÄ±ca-Kirche, die als originelle architektonische Verschmelzung beschrieben wird, fallen die mit Ocker an den WÃ¤nden gemalten GemÃ¤lde auf.

Die SarÄ±ca-Kirche, die durch die Restaurierungen, die sie an verschiedenen Daten als einen der historischen Werte der Region angesehen hat, verbessert wurde, ist eine der KultstÃ¤tten Kappadokiens.
