description.en:
<html>Karatay Madrasah, one of the Seljuk-era madrasas in Konya, which bears traces of Anatolia's cultural symbols all over it, was repaired in 1955 and turned into a tile museum. The museum, one of the city's touristic leading routes, is worth treasure for those who are curious about Anatolian tile art.

Within the scope of the museum, seljuk era wall tiles, Seljuk Mansion tiles, tile pots, Kubad-abad Palace tiles and Principality and Ottoman tiles can be seen. Among the Seljuk wall tiles in the museum, which promises a unique visual elegance, the tiles belonging to Nizamiye Madrasah in Konya stand out.

Seljuk Mansion tiles include unique gold gilded, glazed works discovered in Konya in 1941 with archaeological studies. 

Kitchen utensils such as tile plates, jugs, housewares, plates and bowls can be seen. 

The most valuable works in the museum are undoubtedly the tiles of The Kubad-abad Palace. The numerous tiles found with archaeological works are on display at Karatay Madrasah Museum in Kubad-abad, the general name of the palaces built near BeyÅŸehir Lake, influenced by the views by Seljuk Sultan Alaeddin Keykubat I. These tiles are among the most valuable examples of Turkish art, especially in terms of the richness of their figures.

Finally, tiles that have survived ottoman times invite you on a journey that cannot be easily avoided by the influence of museum displays. In addition to all this tile feast, the mosaic tiles of Karatay Madrasah also undertake the function of an element that complements the visual experience. 
</html>
description.de:
<html>Karatay Museum, eine der seldschukischen Medresen in Konya, die Spuren der kulturellen Symbole Anatoliens trÃ¤gt, wurde 1955 repariert und in ein Fliesenmuseum umgewandelt. Das Museum ist eine der touristisch bedeutendsten Routen der Stadt und ein Schatz fÃ¼r alle, die sich fÃ¼r anatolische Fliesenkunst interessieren.

Im Rahmen des Museums sind die Fliesen der seldschukischen Zeit, die Fliesen des seldschukischen Pavillons, die gefliesten TÃ¶pfe, die Fliesen des Kubad-abad-Palastes, die FÃ¼rstentÃ¼mer und die osmanischen Fliesen zu sehen. Unter den seldschukischen Wandfliesen im Museum, die eine einzigartige visuelle Eleganz bieten, stechen die Fliesen von Nizamiye Medresse in Konya hervor.

Die Fliesen des seldschukischen Pavillons hingegen enthalten einzigartige Werke mit Goldvergoldung und Glasurmustern, die 1941 bei archÃ¤ologischen Studien in Konya entdeckt wurden.

Zu sehen sind KÃ¼chenutensilien wie Teller, KrÃ¼ge, TÃ¶pfe, Geschirr, Schalen aus Porzellan.

Die wertvollsten Werke im Museum sind zweifellos die Fliesen des Kubad-abad-Palastes. Im Karatay Museum sind zahlreiche Kacheln ausgestellt, die in archÃ¤ologischen Werken in Kubad-abad gefunden wurden. Dies ist der allgemeine Name der vom seldschukischen Sultan Alaeddin Keykubat I in der NÃ¤he des BeyÅŸehir-Sees erbauten PalÃ¤ste. Diese Fliesen gehÃ¶ren zu den wertvollsten Beispielen tÃ¼rkischer Kunst, insbesondere im Hinblick auf den Reichtum ihrer Figuren.

SchlieÃŸlich laden die Kacheln, die aus osmanischer Zeit erhalten sind, zu einer Reise ein, die sich in Museumsvitrinen nicht leicht von ihrem Einfluss entfernen lÃ¤sst. Neben all diesem Fliesenfest dienen die Mosaikfliesen von Karatay Museum auch als ErgÃ¤nzung zum visuellen Erlebnis.
</html>

description.en:
PiÅŸirici Kasteli, known for its widespread use hundreds of years ago and almost never succumbed to time until today, is one of the landmarks of Gaziantep.

Hundreds of years ago, authentic buildings were built in Gaziantep to meet the people's water needs. In these buildings called Kastel, people come together to do laundry free of charge with the flow of clean water. This type of structure, which is essentially a very important public service, is found only in Gaziantep in Turkey. One of these structures is PiÅŸirici Kasteli, the most well-known and visited one.

The roof part of the kastel being the opposite side of the Agha Mosque, one of the prominent historical values of the city, is at the level of the road and the washing areas are reached by stairs. Although the date of the construction of the Kastel is not known clearly, sources record that it is predominantly a 13th-century structure. Apart from the entrance, where the pool, bathroom and toilets are located, the carved stone ceiling is also noted. The pool that is active in the middle of the present day can be shown among other details.

PiÅŸirici Kasteli, one of the six kastels that have survived in Gaziantep, is an important cultural stop visited by hundreds of people every day. The venue, which becomes quite cool especially in the summer months, is also considered to be one of the stand-out destinations for catching a breath in the city.Decommissioning of kastel is also used by some residents in order to meet their water needs by continuing to serve kastel's original purpose.

There is also a masjid located under the structure. This religious place of worship, which was restored in the past years, is open today.

description.en:
<html>Yellow Selim Mosque, one of the landmarks of Hatay, is located in the Payas district of the city. There are seven arcades in the section called the last congregation allotd on the outside of the mosque. However, today's arcades were originally made in accordance with the original. 

The courtyard of The Yellow Selim Mosque, which has a reverse T plan seen in the early Ottoman mosques, has a closed structure consisting of 18 rooms, each with a window. These rooms are thought to be used for educational purposes. The only minaret that has never seen any destruction and lived its historical atmosphere even centuries later, and the centuries-old olive tree in the courtyard can also be considered intriguing. 
The mosque has a pleasant landscaping and decorations features and strong lighting in the spacious interior. Yellow Selim Mosque, which is open to religious worship, has been damaged many times throughout history, but has been repaired in each time as a result of its importance in the region. Among the other highlights is that the mosque, which has been standing for centuries, has never been closed. 

You can visit this historic mosque in Hatay and perform religious worship under a spiritually powerful atmosphere.
</html>

Diese RÃ¤ume sollen zu Bildungszwecken genutzt worden sein. Interessante Elemente sind das einzige Minarett, das Jahrhunderte nach ohne eine ZerstÃ¶rung Ã¼berlebt hat, und der jahrhundertealte Olivenbaum im Innenhof, der auch Jahrhunderte spÃ¤ter seine historische AtmosphÃ¤re bewahrt hat.

Die Moschee, die eine angenehme Landschaftsgestaltung hat, hat Verzierungen und starke Beleuchtungsmerkmale in ihrem gerÃ¤umigen Inneren. description.en:
It is one of the world's highest-altitude botanical gardens and reveals the city's natural beauty.

Ata Park, the botanical garden with the highest altitude in Turkey, fascinates those who see it with its more than 150 species of plant. The Ata Park Botanical Garden, which has an enormous beauty with various endemic plants and different types of flowers in different families, takes place in the head of the list of the most magnificent places in the city.

The garden, which gives you the impression that it is heading towards a land of peace with its magnificent scenery, opens the doors of a mysterious and fairytale universe with its 'Alice of Wonderland' view...

The Ata Park Botanical Garden, which combines almost every color of nature, is one of the most important places to increase the nature tourism of Erzurum with its stone roads and unique scenery. As a project of Professor Dr. Hasan Yilmaz on an area of 350 thousand square meters, 100 thousand square meters of the park, which was completed in 2006, constitutes a special interest of the public with landscaping.

The Ata Park Botanical Garden, one of the most magnificent places famous for its natural beauty in Erzurum, is one of the most popular haunts for photography enthusiasts and peace seekers.

description.en:
Latife HanÄ±m Mansion Memory House, as its name suggests, belongs to the family of Latife HanÄ±m, who is the wife of the great leader Mustafa Kemal AtatÃ¼rk. ZÃ¼beyde HanÄ±m, who is also the mother of our ancestor, spends her last days in this mansion. Latife HanÄ±m KÃ¶ÅŸkÃ¼ ANI Evi, located in the Karsiyaka District of Izmir, was extensively restored in 2008. The restoration process remains largely true to the original structure. Both ZÃ¼beyde HanÄ±m and Latife HanÄ±m's wax sculptures stand out in Latife HanÄ±m's Mansion memory House. ZÃ¼beyde HanÄ±m's loss of life in this house increases the spiritual value of this place a little bit.

Latife HanÄ±m mansion Memory House is created by the joint initiatives of both Karsiyaka Municipality and Izmir Governorate. Special items and daily materials from that time are exhibited here. Most of the items are brought to the place by donation or purchase method. The wax sculptures in Latife HanÄ±m Mansion Memory House are made by YÄ±lmaz BÃ¼yÃ¼kerÅŸen, who was the mayor of Eskisehir at the time. AtatÃ¼rk sent his aide, Salih Bozok, to Izmir to find a suitable home after his mother's illness. He asks that the house he will find should not belong to the Greeks in particular. At that time, ZÃ¼beyde HanÄ±m's doctors also said that Izmir weather would be good for her. Salih Bozok finds this house in KarÅŸÄ±yaka for ZÃ¼beyde HanÄ±m. At that time, ZÃ¼beyde HanÄ±m was paralyzed. For this reason, all the thresholds in the house are removed and ZÃ¼beyde HanÄ±m is allowed to walk around with a wheelchair more easily.

Before the mansion was expropriated by the Karsiyaka municipality, it was used as a courthouse and then as a lecture hall. In 2018, technological facilities are used and augmented reality implementation is included. Latife HanÄ±m Mansion Memory House, which has two floors in total, is listed as a â€œspecial museumâ€ by the Ministry of Culture.

description.en:
<html>The Mevlevihane Museum Complex, consisting of many structures including Nigar Hatun Tomb, Zincirkiran Mehmet Bey Tomb, Hammam and Mevlevihane, is located within the boundaries of Antalya city center, KaleiÃ§i region. The museum is easy to reach by public transport moving from the city centre.

Antalya Mevlevihane, shown among the most notable structures of the museum complex and built on a high terrace, has a rectangular form. This Mevlevihane, which is thought to date back to the Seljuk period, has served as an Ottoman Mevlevihane since the beginning of the 16th century, according to sources, although its construction date is not known for certain.

Mevlevihane Hammam, another important building in Mevlevihane Museum and built around Yivli Minaret mosque, was built in the history of Seljuk Sultan and It dates back to the period of I.Alaeddin Keykubat. This bath, which has an inscription on the lower level and a water tank at the rear, served as a â€˜Palace Bathâ€™ in the 13th century.

The Tomb of Nigar Hatun, which is in the Mevlevihane Museum Complex, was built between 1450 and 1503. It is a mausoleum built in memory of Nigar Hatun, mother of Beyazid's son Åehzade(sultanâ€™s son) Korkud. This historical shrine, where the pieces of marble from devshirmeh are immediately visible, is on a hexagonal plan but has a prism body. Built with cut and rubble stones, Nigar Hatun tomb and Zincirkiran Mehmet Bey tomb, which you can visit after Mevlevihane, dates back to the year 1377.

Mevlevihane Museum is open to visit the period of Sunday and Monday 08:30-17:30 and other days 08:30-22:00, such activities as Islamic thought lessons, Mesnevi and Divan readings, Sema Ayin-I Sharifi and Sufi music can also be participated by visitors.
</html>
description.de:

Sonntags und montags von 08:30 bis 17:30 Uhr; An anderen Tagen kÃ¶nnen Sie auch an AktivitÃ¤ten wie islamischen Gedankenstunden, Lesungen von Mesnevi und Divan, Sema Ayin-i Åerifi und Sufi Music teilnehmen, die im Mevlevihane Museum stattfinden, das zwischen 08:30 und 22:00 Uhr fÃ¼r Besucher geÃ¶ffnet ist.

description.en:
<html>Dragonfly Hill Inscriptions are located on the summit of YusufÃ§uktepe. This place can also be considered as the immediate edge of the road, which has the function of connecting the Anafarta plain to Little Anafarta. The region is known as â€™Dragonfly Hillâ€˜ and is named by foreigners as â€™Scimitar Hill'. This can also be translated into Turkish as â€˜Pala Hillâ€™. The yellow stones located on the hill are the main reason why it is named this way. The height in the form of a scythe resembles a traditional Turkish machete. The monument consists of three separate stone veneer inscriptions at the basic level.

During the Battle of Anafartalar, the enemy soldiers heading towards the harbor advance up this hill. Colonel Mustafa Kemal successfully served as commander of the Anafartalar Group at that time. As a result of the communication, the enemy forces are pushed towards limestone. In the 2.Battle of the Anafarta, the strength of the enemy forces is weakened. As a result, 8 thousand 155 soldiers were killed by the Turkish army, while the enemy forces suffered a loss of 20 thousand.

A wide-ranging repair work has recently been started for some inscriptions located within the Gallipoli peninsula. The number of these inscriptions is 15 in total. Besides the Dragonfly Tepe Inscriptions, places such as Ariburnu, ConkbayÄ±rÄ±, KireÃ§tepe Gendarmerie Monument are also repaired within this scope. Gallipoli historical site presidency of the Gallipoli Wars takes the lead in all these studies. These studies cover a total period of 250 days. The Dragonfly Hill Inscriptions are reopened after repair. Cracks in stone coatings or deterioration in planting are removed. The exposed or rusting irons are repaired in the same way and the Department of Conservation Central Laboratory officially explains all restoration work. The Dragonfly Hill Inscriptions, in their renewed form, await visitors to the area throughout the year. The Turkish texts on Dragonfly Tepe Inscriptions can be read very clearly.
</html>
description.de:

Anafartalar-Krieg wird die StÃ¤rke der feindlichen StreitkrÃ¤fte weiter geschwÃ¤cht. WÃ¤hrend 8.155 Soldaten auf tÃ¼rkischer Seite gemartert wurden, kam es zu einem Verlust von 20 000 durch die feindlichen StreitkrÃ¤fte.

Vor kurzem wurden umfassende Reparaturarbeiten fÃ¼r einige Inschriften auf der Gelibolu-Halbinsel begonnen. Die Anzahl dieser Inschriften betrÃ¤gt insgesamt 15. Neben den YusufÃ§uk Tepe-Inschriften werden in diesem Bereich auch Orte wie ArÄ±burnu, ConkbayÄ±rÄ± und das KireÃ§tepe Gendarmerie-Denkmal repariert. Die PrÃ¤sidentschaft der Ã‡anakkale Kriege Gelibolu historischen StÃ¤tte war all dieser BemÃ¼hungen. Diese Studien erstrecken sich Ã¼ber einen Zeitraum von insgesamt 250 Tagen. YusufÃ§uk Tepe Inschriften werden nach der Restaurierung wieder geÃ¶ffnet. Risse in Steinbeschichtungen oder eine Verschlechterung der Vegetation werden beseitigt. Freiliegendes oder verrostetes Eisen wird auf die gleiche Weise repariert, und die Direktion des Konservierung Zentral Labor gibt offiziell alle durchgefÃ¼hrten Restaurierungsarbeiten bekannt. Die YusufÃ§uk Tepe Inschriften erwarten die Besucher der Region das ganze Jahr Ã¼ber in ihrer erneuerten Form. Die tÃ¼rkischen Texte auf den YusufÃ§uk Tepe Inschriften sind sehr deutlich zu lesen.

description.en:
There are many monuments in the squares of Ankara that make the victories of recent Turkish history immortal. These monuments are also shown among the symbols of the city.

The monument, located in Ulus Square in Ankara, is one of them. The Ulus Republic Monument, is also known as the â€™Victory Monument'. It is created with the contributions of the Turkish people and the leadership of YenigÃ¼n newspaper. Especially on behalf of the newspaper, Yunus Nadi has great efforts. At that time a great competition was held for this monument. This competition gains a universal identity. The winner of the competition is Austrian H. Krippel. He is a very talented artist who completed his education at the Vienna Academy of Fine Arts. Krippel began work on sculpture in 1925. United Mining Enterprises, located in his home country, goes down in history as the place where the statue was cast. As a result of the work, it was erected in a magnificent ceremony in 1927. Later, due to the expansion of the square, the location of the statue is changed and taken to its present location.

It is possible to see AtatÃ¼rk on the main pedestal deployed between the figures. AtatÃ¼rk is on his horse known as â€œSakaryaâ€ with his soldier clothes. This impressive animation adds a much more special feel to the sculpture. When the reliefs are examined, some figures about the arrival of the great leader to Ankara and the origins of the Turkish nation are aesthetically reflected. A total of four figures are found on top of the stone plinth, each of which is also made of bronze. Two of these figures represent the suffering mother who was known as â€˜Black Fatmaâ€™ and carried bullets to the army at that time. The other two figures are made in memory of MehmetÃ§ik(robin). The structure is described in official records as a memorial sculpture.

It is possible to encounter someone who is always taking pictures in front of the Ulus Republic Monument, which has always attracted the attention of local visitors. Ulus Square was known as Hakimiyet-I Milliye during the first period when the statue was made.

description.en:
Although it is a square fountain on The Sarajevo Street, the hollow has a fountain. Hijri 1163-Miladi 1750, the fountain built by Ibrahim Pasha; In 1973, the side walls were repaired. In 1998, it was also replaced by Erzurum Yakutiye Municipality.

Ibrahim Pasha ordered the construction of this fountain to the Office during his Erzurum Governor Period. In fact, ibrahim Pasha mosque and madrasa together with the fountain builds. Ibrahim Pasha, who also built The Fountain of Four roses, which is a little below, has also devoted many real estate by spending a lot of money to build and maintain these works. The foundation organized by the pasha himself is also on display at Erzurum Archaeological Museum.

There is an Ottoman text for Ibrahim Pasha on the Yazicizade Fountain. The text also states:

1- In the name of Allah (c.c), (the most merciful and the mostgracious)
We made from water every living thing. Will they not then believe ? (30th verse of the enbia).

2- The great, generous, charitable (Ibrahim Pasha) has always made his property for charity.

3- His pure creation was again directed to the good charity. When you do this good deeds, great rewards will be earned from the stream of bounty.

4- This fountain used to be the charity, was in the name of his ancestors, but it was ruined by a long time passing through it.

5- Whoever drinks from here finds flavour

6- Allah always protect his pure body from commiting a sin, follow each other for good, and let him be incomparable.

7- When HÃ¼nerli Mahir Kalem , saw this fountain, dated the history like â€œ Drink from Ibrahim Pashaâ€™s Fountainâ€™s waterâ€ immaculate and silver like. 
Sene H.1163/M.1750

description.en:
Oinoanda, which is one of the many ancient cities within the borders of MuÄŸla, is first mentioned in Hittite texts. The remains that can reach to date mark the 2nd century BC.


The philosopher Diogones turned his thoughts about this region into an epitaph. He excavates these on the walls of the stoa, but after the collapse of the structure, the inscription is torn down. Since these parts are distributed, it is possible to meet in many parts of the city. The inscriptions of the Diogones play an important role in making the ancient city known. Today, a significant portion of the ruins in the city contain philosophical contents. Oinoanda is located in the immediate northern section of the Xanthos Valley. Therefore, it is among the ancient cities included in the Lycian region. The village of Incealiler is a 20-25 minute walk between the ancient city of Oinoanda and the village center, which is set on a hill. When you come to the village by car, you will usually come across footpaths.


When the Hittite cuneiform writings are examined, the name Oinoanda is found asâ€™ Winuwanda'. It is also understood that Oinoanda is a territory belonging to Lukka. There is no trace to prove that the ancient city was older than the Hellenistic period. The city experiences its golden age in the 2nd century. At that time ,Bubon would be involved in an important alliance with cities such as Balbura and Kibyra. Although the alliance continued for 84 years, it was terminated by the Roman commander Murena.


The walls of the ancient city of Oinoanda have fine workmanship. In addition, the pentagonal tower is among the important structures of this place. During the Roman period, a new temple was built in a position that could see the city as a whole. This Doric temple contains inscriptions dating from Augustos. The bath, one of the important structures of the ancient city of Oinoanda, finds its place as a complex. Only a small area of this bath is on the way up to the Agora. It is said that this bath complex was built thanks to donations collected during those years.

description.en:
<html>in Antalya. Adding significant value to the city's tourist services, the museum is frequently visited by domestic and foreign tourists throughout the year.

500 different species living in the seas in Turkey are exhibited in the Marine Biology Museum. The museum, which is a first in its field in this sense, is located in the Antalya Marina and has been serving enthusiasts since the beginning of 2014.

In the Museum of Marine Biology, especially Dr. Elif Ã–zgÃ¼r has a very important work. Her 15 years of marine biology studies have a serious role in the museum's collection. Artist Ayhan DoÄŸan stands out in the design and visual processes of the museum. The museum was designed in the form of a sunken pirate ship. For this reason, it is not only with its collections, but also with its exterior.

The museum, which aims to bring art together with science, manages to show the biodiversity and richness of Turkey's seas in a different way. The main purpose of the museum is to highlight species that are particularly endangered or relatively less recognized. At the same time, the museum has an important mission in order to further adopt and properly convey the culture of the sea. The Museum of marine biology is highly appreciated by visitors as it is a place that boasts the natural heritage of Turkey.

For groups of students who routinely visit the museum, the information provided here is very useful. The museum, which can be seen as a visual and catchy educational method, attracts the attention of educators in this sense. In certain parts of the museum, skeletons of large species such as sea mammals are shown. These skeletons are preserved for a long time without any deterioration thanks to fixative solutions. In the museum, you can find numerous species of sponges, corals, crabs, octopuses and Sharks.
</html>
description.de:

Doktor Elif Ã–zgÃ¼r hat wichtige Anstrengungen im Meeresbiologischen Museum unternommen. Seine 15 Jahre Meeresbiologischen Werke spielen eine wichtige Rolle in der Sammlung des Museums. Der KÃ¼nstler Ayhan DoÄŸan zeichnet sich durch das Design und die visuellen Prozesse des Museums aus. Das Museum ist in Form eines versunkenen Piratenschiffs gestaltet. description.en:
Åefik BursalÄ± Museum House is named after the person who was born in the city of Bursa in 1903 and had the chance to take lessons from the very important art teachers. He also had the opportunity to go to Europe in the following periods and found the opportunity to work in some art centers. When he returns to his homeland, he serves as a teacher at the high school level in different provinces. During this process, Mevlana's paintings provide a reputation.

Åefik BursalÄ±, who filled the eye with his talents, attracted the attention of AtatÃ¼rk in a short time with his studies. In fact, AtatÃ¼rk supports him in the name of exhibiting his paintings in some European cities. Åefik BursalÄ±, who has had numerous exhibitions throughout his art life, passed away in 1990. After he died, the house where the artist lived, shown among the most important painters in the history of the Republic, was converted into a museum. The Ministry of Culture and Tourism personally signs this transformation. Finally, as a result of a long work and arrangement, the house is opened to visit as Åefik BursalÄ± Museum.

During his life, Åefik BursalÄ± donated many of his works and the house he used as a workshop to the Ministry of Culture and Tourism. All these donated artifacts are carefully reserved for the museum. During the arrangement of the museum, special measures are taken in order to preserve these works and therefore certain parts of the house are re-laid. For the museum, you can use the public transport moving towards Ã‡ankaya District and get off at a stop near Ahmet Mithat Efendi Street.

Today, there are around 70 works in the Åefik BursalÄ± Museum House. Besides these paintings, many photographs and materials are also exhibited in this area. The museum, which is one of the most attractive museums in Ankara in terms of content, serves under the State Painting and Sculpture Museum of the General Directorate of Fine Arts. When you come to the museum, you may also encounter a half painting here that cannot be completed due to his death.

description.en:
<html>One of the highlights of the visual feasts in Sanliurfa, the city of modern museums, which has been the subject of thousands of years of historical heritage, is located in the center of the city. HaleplibahÃ§e Mosaic Museum, incarnate hidden treasures... 

The floor mosaics of a villa that was unearthed during the excavations for the park and date back to the Roman period form the main lines of the museum. The mosaic of the Amazons can be seen in the museum with the mosaic of the story of Akhilleus the hero of Greek mythology. 

It should be noted that the example is one of the world's rare mosaics that address the appearance of mythological Amazons, a mysterious race. The short-haired Amazonian woman, pictured on a horse in the mosaic, is seen with her exotic jewellery and with a spear, a war instrument in her hand. 

On the other hand, the Mosaic of Orpheus, which was finally brought back to our country in 2015, is another precious part of the HaleplibahÃ§e Mosaic Museum, following the process of returning from the United States to Turkey, which has been on the agenda for a long time. The Orpheus mosaic, dated in 194, is striking with artist signature and visual details on it. 

HaleplibahÃ§e Mosaic Museum, which is home to numerous mosaics reached by archaeological sites in the region, can be visited within certain hours every day except Mondays. 

</html>
description.de:
<html>Eines der visuellen Feste in ÅanlÄ±urfa, der Stadt der modernen Museen, die das Thema eines jahrtausendealten historischen Erbes sind, befindet sich im Zentrum der Stadt. Das HaleplibahÃ§e Mosaik Museum beinhaltet verborgene SchÃ¤tze.

Die Bodenmosaike einer Villa, die wÃ¤hrend der Ausgrabungen fÃ¼r Parkzwecke ausgegraben wurden und aus der RÃ¶merzeit stammen, bilden die Umrisse des Museums. Das Mosaik der Geschichte des griechischen Mythologie-Helden Akhilleus und das Mosaik des Amazonas sind im Museum zu sehen.

Es ist erwÃ¤hnenswert, dass das fragliche Beispiel eines der seltenen Mosaike der Welt ist, das sich mit der Ã¤uÃŸeren Erscheinung des mythologischen Amazonas, einer mysteriÃ¶sen Rasse, befasst. Die kurzhaarige Amazonasfrau, die auf dem im Mosaik laufenden Pferd abgebildet ist, ist mit ihrem exotischen Schmuck und einem Speer in der Hand zu sehen.

Andererseits ist das Orpheus-Mosaik, das 2015 endlich in die TÃ¼rkei zurÃ¼ckgebracht wurde, ein weiterer wertvoller Teil des HaleplibahÃ§e-Mosaikmuseums. Das Orpheus-Mosaik aus dem Jahr 194 besticht durch seine KÃ¼nstlersignatur und visuellen Details.

Das HaleplibahÃ§e-Mosaikmuseum, in dem viele Mosaike ausgestellt sind, die durch archÃ¤ologische Studien in der Region erreicht wurden, kann tÃ¤glich auÃŸer montags innerhalb bestimmter Stunden besichtigt werden.</html>

description.en:
One of the first places that comes to mind when it comes to summer tourism in Bodrum, YalÄ±kavak Marina is located in the YalÄ±kavak District of Bodrum. It is also a facility that responds to the needs of yachts and boats such as protection, shelter and repair. There is a lot of entertainment and leisure facilities on site. At the same time, numerous concerts and art galleries are performed during the summer months. On the other hand, there are recreational pools specifically for children.


There is always a boat or yacht anchored on the shore at YalÄ±kavak Marina, where the nightlife is very lively. The total boat and yacht capacity of the marina is around 600. Boat owners can get a 24-hour service from here. There are also babysitting rooms and parking.


With the beginning of the popularization of the YalÄ±kavak region, accommodation options along with cafes and nightclubs begin to increase. Those who want to come to the region via the Bodrum Bus Station must travel around 18 kilometers. Minibuses departing from the district can always reach the YalÄ±kavak region. Vans move more frequently, especially in the summer months, than in the winter months. Marina is today the symbol of the YalÄ±kavak district.


There is a distance of 100 nautical miles between YalÄ±kavak Marina and Ã‡eÅŸme and 55 nautical miles from KuÅŸadasÄ±. It is also very close to popular Greek islands such as Samos, Patmos and Symi. Even yachts exceeding 100 meters in length are serviced within the Marina. With recent changes, this place also offers a living life form for visitors and sailors. The area covered by the marina is around 10 thousand square meters in total. There is also a helipad in the area. Offering a beautiful view, YalÄ±kavak Marina is still popular today.

description.en:
One of the most prominent issues in the city of Ankara is 75.Year Republic Educational Museum. The 75.Year Republic Educational Museum being one of the city's museums of interest serves under the Ministry of Education. A former residence belonging to AtatÃ¼rk High School is used for the museum located in SÄ±hhiye as the location. It was inaugurated in 1998 by MoNE(Ministry of National Education). 75.Year Republic Educational Museum is a first in this sense. The museum building is one-story, set in a large garden. Although it is a relatively small museum, it is successful in terms of inventory numbers.

75.Year Republic Educational Museum brings together many materials, photographs, documents and items belonging to the educational world. Especially the one-to-one revival of the classroom layout of the MoNE-Affiliated schools over the past years is appreciated. The museum, where teachers and students are of great interest, hosts certain schools here in groups from semester to semester. It also has its own private library. Museum-related inspections are carried out regularly by the MoNE.

You can easily visit the museum on weekdays between 09:00 and 17:00. This place is also closed on religious and public holidays. The museum is located on Strasbourg Street and is accessible by public transport. 75. Year Republican Museum of Education is navigable free of charge. The Museum's Strategy Development Department prepares and publishes its business plans annually.

description.en:
<html>Darb-Ä± Sak Castle, which means a mountain-footed passage, is one of the most magnificent of Hatay's past works.

In Arabic, the name of the 'Darb-Ä± Sak' castle, which means road, passage, or 'Darb', which means mountain foot or 'Sak' which means the word 'Sak' in the sense of a mountain foot or a slope adjacent to the valley, means the road that passes through the foot of the mountain. The castle, which is referred to as the castle of mountaineers or shepherds during the Byzantine period, is also referred to as 'Deir Bessak' in some historical sources, which means 'High Clergy House'. For centuries, the castle, which is of strategic importance in order to ensure the safety of the Aleppo road, is one of the places frequented by those who came to see Hatay today.

It is also known as the place where Darius, king of Persian, used it as a headquarters against Alexander the Great in 333 BC. Then, the Darb-Ä± Sak Castle, which took its place among the Turkish castles after the Anatolian Seljuk State took over Antioch, then Armenians in 1771 and The Knights of Templiers took over it in 1188.
Darb-Ä± Sak Castle, which dates back to the late Hellenistic period, is one of the oldest buildings in the city, but also of great historical and architectural importance.
</html>
description.de:
<html>Die Burg Darb-Ä± Sak, die als Passage am FuÃŸe des Berges bedeutet, ist eines der prÃ¤chtigsten Werke der Vergangenheit von Hatay.

"Derb" oder "Darb" bedeutet StraÃŸe auf Arabisch und "Sak" bedeutet Bergkante oder Hang neben dem Tal. Der Name des 'Darb-Ä± Sak'-Schlosses, das sich aus diesen beiden WÃ¶rtern zusammensetzt, bedeutet die StraÃŸe, die durch den Bergrand fÃ¼hrt. Die Burg, die in der byzantinischen Zeit als Bergsteiger- oder Hirtenburg bekannt war, wird auch als â€Deyr Bessakâ€œ bezeichnet, was in einigen historischen Quellen â€Haus des hÃ¶heren Klerusâ€œ bedeutet. Die Burg, die eine strategische Bedeutung fÃ¼r die Sicherung der Halep-StraÃŸe hat, liegt seit Jahrhunderten auf der StraÃŸe von Gaziantep nach Antakya und ist einer der beliebtesten Orte, die von den Besuchern unbedingt besucht wird.

Es ist auch als der Ort bekannt, an dem der persische KÃ¶nig Darius 333 v. Chr. als Hauptquartier gegen Alexander den GroÃŸen diente. SpÃ¤ter, nachdem der anatolische seldschukische Staat Antakya Ã¼bernommen hatte, unterstand die Burg Darb-i Sak, die ihren Platz unter den tÃ¼rkischen Burgen einnahm, 1171 den Rittern der Armenier und 1188 den Templern.

Die Burg Darb-Ä± Sak, die zur spÃ¤thellenistischen Zeit gehÃ¶rt, ist eine der Ã¤ltesten Bauwerke der Stadt, hat nebenbei eine groÃŸe geschichtliche und architektonische Bedeutung.
</html>

description.en:
The Muradiye Complex, crowned by UNESCO, has an important influence in the commemoration of the city of Bursa as the â€˜city of shrinesâ€™. This scattered complex, in which there are many baths, mosques and madrasas, is the area of Bursa that attracts the most visitors. The district in the region gets its name directly from this complex. It is possible to encounter tombs of dynastic descendants in the areas of interest of the complex. The chests belonging to concubines, princes, prince and sultan wives and their children are located in this area. Although there are 12 tomb sites in total, the number of persons lying here increases to around 40 due to the excess number of crates.


In the section known as â€™Muradiye Tombs ' you may encounter MÃ¼krime Hatun Mausoleum. This is located in the garden part of the shrines, just to the south. MÃ¼krime Hatun Tomb is created in 1515. The square planned tomb draws attention to the stone and brick sequences. Octagonal pulleys allow access from the walls to the dome section. It can be observed that the entrance in the eastern part was designed in the form of an iwan. And the chancels are immediately on either side of it. A total of 12 windows from the body walls provide illumination of the tomb. These windows have pointed arch pediments and iron railings with stone jambs. It is possible to find colored pencil figures both on the wall and on the dome. Except for the verses, geometric patterns add a special air to these areas. Unfortunately, because certain parts of these walls were later painted, the figures disappear to a certain extent.


MÃ¼krime Hatun is known as the wife of Åehzade ÅehinÅŸah. She is also the mother of Åehzade Mehmed. There are no inscriptions in the building containing historical and other information. Despite this, it is suggested that the tomb was built in the 16th century. There are three different crates in total in the tomb. Except MÃ¼krime Hatun, it is not known who the two crates belong to.
description.de:
Der von der UNESCO gekrÃ¶nte Muradiye-Komplex spielt eine wichtige Rolle im Namen der Stadt Bursa als â€Stadt der GrÃ¤berâ€œ. Dieser unordentliche Komplex mit vielen BÃ¤dern, Moscheen und Medressen ist die attraktivste Gegend von Bursa. Der Bezirk in der Region hat seinen Namen auch direkt von diesem Komplex. In den interessanten Bereichen des Komplexes kÃ¶nnen GrÃ¤ber von Menschen aus der Dynastie angetroffen werden. In diesem Gebiet befinden sich die Sarkophage der Konkubinen, FÃ¼rsten, FÃ¼rsten und ihre Gattin mit den Kindern. Obwohl es in der Anlage 12 Mausoleen gibt, steigt die Zahl der hier liegenden Menschen auf rund 40.

Sie kÃ¶nnen das MÃ¼krime Hatun Grab in der als "Muradiye Grab" bekannten Sektion begegnen. Dieser Ort befindet sich im Gartenteil der GrÃ¤ber, sÃ¼dlich. Das MÃ¼krime Hatun Grab wurde 1515 gegrÃ¼ndet. Stein- und Ziegelserien machen im geplanten Grab des Platzes auf sich aufmerksam. Dank der achteckigen Riemenscheiben ist der Ãœbergang von den WÃ¤nden zum Kuppelabschnitt mÃ¶glich. Es ist zu beobachten, dass der Eingang im Ã¶stlichen Teil als Iwan konzipiert wurde. Der Altar befindet sich auf beiden Seiten dieses Iwan. Insgesamt 12 Fenster an den KÃ¶rperwÃ¤nden beleuchten das Grab. Diese Fenster haben Eisenstangen mit Spitzbogengiebeln und Steinrahmen. Es ist mÃ¶glich, Buntstiftfiguren sowohl an der Wand als auch an der Kuppel zu finden. Abgesehen von den Versen verleihen geometrische Muster diesen Bereichen eine besondere Note. Leider werden bestimmte Teile dieser WÃ¤nde spÃ¤ter gestrichen, so dass die Figuren teilweise verschwunden sind.

MÃ¼krime Hatun ist bekannt als die Frau von Åehzade ÅehinÅŸah. Er ist auch die Mutter vom Åehzade Mehmed. Es gibt keine Inschrift im GebÃ¤ude, die die Geschichte und andere Informationen enthÃ¤lt. Trotzdem wird vermutet, dass das Grab im 16. Jahrhundert erbaut wurde. Es gibt drei verschiedene Sarkophage im Grab. Es ist nicht bekannt, wer zu den beiden Sargen auÃŸerhalb von MÃ¼krime Hatun gehÃ¶rte.

description.en:
GelemiÃ§ cave is located in the Keles District of Bursa. Located directly within the boundaries of GelemiÃ§ village, near the Kacasu River, the cave is among the popular natural beauties of recent times.


The hard valley, including the river flowing through the GelemiÃ§ Village Cave, is known as Kayalidere Canyon. The area between the villages of KocakovacÄ±k and Gelemic has many surprises. Although the canyon normally has a very wild and spooky appearance, you can easily walk here. A great trekking area awaits you by following the river path. If you follow this route, you may encounter GelemiÃ§ Village Cave after a climb of about half an hour. Gelemic Village Cave is also known as Gavurini cave.


The cave contains numerous stalactites and stalagmites. There are three separate sections and a gallery formed by these structures. The stalactites and stalagmites, which appear to be quite magnificent, are a rare blessing for photography enthusiasts. The main entrance of the cave is closed by means of a wall during the Byzantine period. In the later period it is transformed into a residential area. It is stated that there was a cistern at that time in the same area.


A cave with the same name as this unique paradise land is also located in Antalya, and from time to time, these two caves are confused because of their similar name. For this reason, the cave located in the city of Bursa is often referred as GelemiÃ§ Village Cave. Located on a high plateau, the cave is approximately 300 meters above the valley floor. Although the slope is steep, it is quite pleasant to walk the way to the cave. As a result of burying the stream, it fossilizes by hanging. In the interior, bats live in colonies. MTA(General directorate of mineral research and exploration) conducted a comprehensive survey of the cave in 1997 and mapped it in detail. The report obtained as a result of these investigations is shared with the public.
description.de:
Die GelemiÃ§-HÃ¶hle befindet sich im Stadtteil Keles in Bursa. Die HÃ¶hle befindet sich direkt innerhalb der Grenzen des Dorfes GelemiÃ§ in der NÃ¤he des Flusses Kacasu und gehÃ¶rt zu den beliebtesten NaturschÃ¶nheiten der jetzigen Zeit.

Das harte Tal, zu dem der Fluss gehÃ¶rt, der in der Region flieÃŸt, in der sich die GelemiÃ§ DorfhÃ¶hle befindet, ist als KayalÄ±dere Canyon bekannt. Das Gebiet zwischen den DÃ¶rfern KocakovacÄ±k und GelemiÃ§ ist voller Ãœberraschungen. Obwohl der Canyon normalerweise sehr wild und gruselig ist, kÃ¶nnen Sie hier leicht spazieren gehen. Wenn Sie der FlussstraÃŸe folgen, erwartet Sie ein fantastisches Trekkinggebiet. Wenn Sie dieser Route folgen, kÃ¶nnen Sie nach ungefÃ¤hr einer halben Stunde Aufstieg auf die GelemiÃ§ DorfhÃ¶hle stoÃŸen. Die GelemiÃ§ DorfhÃ¶hle ist auch bekannt als Gavurini HÃ¶hle.

Es gibt viele Stalaktiten und Stalagmiten in der HÃ¶hle. Es gibt drei separate Abschnitte und eine Galerie, die aus diesen Strukturen besteht. Stalaktiten und Stalagmiten, die ziemlich groÃŸartig aussehen, sind ein einzigartiger Segen fÃ¼r Fotografie-Enthusiasten. Der Haupteingangsteil der HÃ¶hle ist wÃ¤hrend der byzantinischen Zeit durch eine Mauer geschlossen. In der nÃ¤chsten Zeit entwickelte es sich zu einem Wohngebiet. Es wird angegeben, dass es zu dieser Zeit eine Zisterne in der gleichen Gegend gab.

In Antalya befindet sich eine HÃ¶hle mit demselben Namen wie dieses einzigartige Paradiesland. Diese beiden HÃ¶hlen werden manchmal aufgrund der Ã„hnlichkeit des Namens verwechselt. Aus diesem Grund wird die HÃ¶hle in der Stadt Bursa oft als GelemiÃ§ DorfhÃ¶hle bezeichnet. Die HÃ¶hle befindet sich auf einem ziemlich hohen Plateau etwa 300 Meter Ã¼ber dem Talboden. Obwohl der Hang steil ist, ist es sehr angenehm, die StraÃŸe zur HÃ¶hle zu gehen. Durch das Begraben des Baches wird er durch AufhÃ¤ngen versteinert. Im Inneren der HÃ¶hle leben FledermÃ¤use in Kolonien. MTA fÃ¼hrt 1997 eine umfassende Forschung und Planung der HÃ¶hle durch. Der als Ergebnis dieser Studien erhaltene Bericht wird der Ã–ffentlichkeit zugÃ¤nglich gemacht.

description.en:
Damla Creek, which welcomes its guests with wonderful nature views, is located within the borders of MenteÅŸe district, 20 kilometers from MuÄŸla city center. It is located approximately 15 minutes from the YerleÅŸik town. The creek is also considered to be one of the city's hidden photographic attractions due to its beauty.


There are also businesses to meet the needs of the guests at Damla Creek, where no fee is paid at the entrance. These businesses, which host visitors with local breakfasts in the morning, also continue to offer local delicacies throughout the day. It should be noted that the local tastes of the businesses that have acquired mark, morning hours and summer months are shown intense interest.


The stream's edge, which has different colors in its green surroundings, also stands out as an incredible address for the great photos that can be put on your social media accounts, in relation to the location of the sun in the evening hours of the day. Damla Creek also promises different visual and auditory experiences with its small waterfalls, hundreds of years of stalactites and stalagmites found in the cave nearby.


Finally, it should be noted that Damla Creek, with its unique naÃ¯ve bays close to the route, is also very close to KerimoÄŸlu Folk Song House, a local cultural place.

description.en:
<html>Beyazid bridge over the Tunca River, which passes through the heart of Edirne and surrounds the city's many beauties, has been standing for centuries.In 1488, the historic bridge which was thought to be built by II.Bayezit, is quite remarkable with its 78-meter length. Its width is about 6 meters.

Although the date of construction of the bridge is not clear, it is known that it was built to provide transportation between the nearby social complex (kÃ¼lliye) and the city.It is known that the completion date of the mosque in the said complex is 1488. Since it is widely believed that the construction of the bridge was needed at the same time as the kÃ¼lliye in order for the people of the city to come to the mosque, the probability of the bridge completed at these dates is close to 100 percent.

The structure, which was used cut stone in its construction, is also referred to as The New Imaret Bridge.The structure, which has 6 large eyes, also has drain eyes.Beyazid Bridge, one of the historical symbols of Edirne, offers the appearance of a classic bridge with its short fears.

The bridge between 2. BeyazÄ±t Kulliyesi and SaraÃ§hane Setboyu Street is open for use today. On the other hand, the bridge is as scarce as henâ€™s teeth for the photography enthusiasts.As well as the reflections of the river waters of the bridge, which has a rich visual atmosphere in the city, the mosque and the visual feast in the background are also wonderful.

Surrounded entirely by the Turkish architectural tradition, the bridge has artistic value and is one of the buildings proposed to be seen especially for cultural tourism enthusiasts.
</html>
description.de:
Die BeyazÄ±d-BrÃ¼cke am Tunca-Fluss, die durch das Herz von Edirne fÃ¼hrt und viele SchÃ¶nheiten der Stadt umgibt, steht seit Jahrhunderten. Die historische BrÃ¼cke, die 1488 von Bayezit II. gebaut worden sein soll, ist mit ihrer LÃ¤nge von 78 Metern bemerkenswert. Seine Breite betrÃ¤gt etwa 6 Meter.

Obwohl das Baudatum der BrÃ¼cke nicht klar ist, ist bekannt, dass sie fÃ¼r den Transport zwischen dem Komplex und der Stadt gebaut wurde. Es ist bekannt, dass das Fertigstellungsdatum der Moschee im Komplex 1488 ist. Da allgemein angenommen wird, dass der Bau der BrÃ¼cke gleichzeitig mit dem Komplex erforderlich war, damit die Einwohner der Stadt zur Moschee gelangen kÃ¶nnen, liegt die Wahrscheinlichkeit, dass die BrÃ¼cke zu diesen Zeitpunkten fertiggestellt wurde, bei nahezu 100 Prozent.

Das aus geschnittenem Stein gefertigte GebÃ¤ude ist auch als Neue Imaret-BrÃ¼cke bekannt. Das GebÃ¤ude, das 6 groÃŸe Kammern hat, hat auch Entladekammern. Die BeyazÄ±d-BrÃ¼cke, eines der historischen Symbole von Edirne, bietet mit ihren kurzen BrÃ¼ckengelÃ¤nder ein klassisches BrÃ¼ckenbild.

Die BrÃ¼ck, die zwischen dem 2. BeyazÄ±t-Komplex und der SaraÃ§hane Setboyu-StraÃŸeliegt, ist heute geÃ¶ffnet. Auf der anderen Seite ist die BrÃ¼cke ein einzigartiger Pilgerort fÃ¼r Fotografie-Enthusiasten. Neben den Reflexionen der BrÃ¼cke, die eine reiche visuelle AtmosphÃ¤re in der Stadt und im Flusswasser hat, ist auch das visuelle Fest mit der Moschee im Hintergrund wunderbar.

description.en:
<html>The Kingdom of Urartu has a very long history... Ã‡avuÅŸtepe Castle, a wonderful historical monument left over from the Kingdom of Urartu, was built at the behest of Sarduri II. 

The works from this kingdom, which ruled mesopotamia for many years, still fascinate those who see it in their glory. In 764 BC. Ä°t was the order of Sarduri ii to build The Fort of Cavustepe, which consists of two separate structures. This castle, which took 30 years to build, is called Sardurihinili, which means 'the city belonging to Sardur'. After thousands of years, the castle is revealed in the excavations carried out by Professor Arif Erzen, a professor at Istanbul University Faculty of Literature. 

There are many important areas, including Haldi Temple, in Ã‡avuÅŸtepe Castle, which has two different structures: the upper castle and the lower castle. The castle complex, which has a height of 30 meters between the two castles, covers a fairly large area. The walls built in the extreme castle method on both sides are knitted with almost flawlessly cut limestone blocks. Cisterns carved into the bedrock where the castle is placed, warehouses and other important structures of the palace form the work. On the walls of the Haldi Temple in the castle, king of Urartu II. There is also a inscription with a nail written dedicated to God Irmusini from Sarduri.
</html>
description.de:
<html>Das KÃ¶nigreich Urartu hat eine sehr tief verwurzelte Geschichte. Die Burg Ã‡avuÅŸtepe, ein wunderbares historisches Denkmal aus dem KÃ¶nigreich Urartu, wurde im Auftrag vom Sarduri dem II. erbaut. 

Die Artefakte aus diesem KÃ¶nigreich, das viele Jahre in Mesopotamien regierte, faszinieren immer noch diejenigen, die es mit ihrer GrÃ¶ÃŸe sehen. In 764 vor Chr. mit dem Befehl von Sarduri wird der Bauauftrag fÃ¼r die Burg Ã‡avuÅŸtepe erteilt, die aus zwei getrennten GebÃ¤uden besteht. Diese Burg, die 30 Jahre dauerte, wird als sardurinisch bezeichnet und bedeutet "die Stadt, die zu Sardur gehÃ¶rt". Nach Tausenden von Jahren taucht Kale bei den Ausgrabungen von Professor Doktor Arif Erzen auf, einem FakultÃ¤tsmitglied der FakultÃ¤t fÃ¼r Literatur der UniversitÃ¤t Istanbul.

Die Burg Ã‡avuÅŸtepe, die sich in zwei verschiedenen Strukturen als obere und untere Burg befindet, hat viele wichtige Bereiche, einschlieÃŸlich des Haldi-Tempels. Der 30 Meter hohe Burgkomplex zwischen den beiden Burgen erstreckt sich Ã¼ber eine sehr groÃŸe FlÃ¤che. Die beidseitig nach der Endburgmethode errichteten Mauern bestehen aus nahezu perfekt geschnittenen KalksteinblÃ¶cken. Die in das Grundgestein geschnitzten Zisternen, auf denen sich die Burg befindet, die LagerhÃ¤user und der Palast bilden weitere wichtige Strukturen der Arbeit. An den WÃ¤nden des Haldi-Tempels in der Burg befindet sich auch eine keilfÃ¶rmige Inschrift, die dem Herrn Gottes vom Urartu-KÃ¶nig Sarduri dem II. gewidmet ist.

</html>

description.en:
<html>Built in 1861 on the church ruins of the 6th century in Sanliurfa, the Reji Church is also known as St. Peter and St. Paulus Church, as it was built in memory of the two apostles of Jesus Christ.

Although the church continues its activities actively until the syrian migration to Syria, it has been used for other purposes by 1924. After the tombstones extracted from the church were sent to urfa museum, the building was converted into a monopoly factory. The name was soon referred to as the Reji Church due to the meaning of the word 'Regie (Reji)', which is the equivalent of the word 'Monopoly' in French.

The building was restored in 1998, which was seen as a recent past, and began operating as governor Kemalettin GazezoÄŸlu Cultural Center on May 24, 2002. The centre in question is still used for a variety of social activities today.

The Reji Church is northeast of 58 Square. The square opens up to four different streets. Important works such as Kurtulus Primary School, Nimetullah Mosque, Sheikh Saffet Lodge, Tomb of Muhammed Muhiddin are found in the vicinity.

</html>
description.de:
<html>Die Reji-Kirche, die 1861 auf den Ruinen der Kirche aus dem 6. Jahrhundert in ÅanlÄ±urfa erbaut wurde, wurde vom Prophet Jesus erbaut. Es ist auch bekannt als die Kirche St. Peter und St. Paul, die im Gedanken an die beiden Apostel Jesu gemacht wurde.

Obwohl die Kirche ihre AktivitÃ¤ten aktiv fortsetzte, bis die Syrer von Urfa nach Syrien auswanderten, wurde sie ab 1924 fÃ¼r andere Zwecke genutzt. Das GebÃ¤ude wurde in eine Monopolfabrik umgewandelt, nachdem die Grabsteine, die zuerst aus der Kirche entfernt wurden, an das Urfa-Museum geschickt wurden. Aufgrund der Aussprache des Wortes "Regie (Reji)", das auf FranzÃ¶sisch dem Wort "Monopoly" entspricht, wurde der Name in kurzer Zeit als Kirche des Reji bekannt.

Das 1998 restaurierte GebÃ¤ude wurde am 24. Mai 2002 als Kulturzentrum des Gouverneurs Kemalettin GazezoÄŸlu in Betrieb genommen. Das betreffende Zentrum wird heute noch fÃ¼r verschiedene soziale AktivitÃ¤ten genutzt.

Die Reji-Kirche liegt nordÃ¶stlich des AchtundfÃ¼nfzig-Platzes. Der Platz Ã¶ffnet sich zu vier verschiedenen StraÃŸen. Es gibt wichtige Werke wie die KurtuluÅŸ-Grundschule, die Nimetullah-Moschee, Åeyh Saffet Tekke und das Grab von Muhammed Muhiddin.
</html>

description.en:
Based on historical findings, the recent period of chess sport, which has a history of over 4 thousand years, is found in the two-storey museum in Altindag District of Ankara. Most of the works exhibited in the museum are in the form of chess sets acquired from many countries of the world by the well-known collector AkÄ±n GÃ¶kyay, who also entered the Guinness Book of World Records.

The founders of the museum summarizes the aims of the museum as both young and old to appeal to everyone, â€˜wide adoption of chess, which has the basis of analytical and multi-faceted thinking, and its spread among young peopleâ€™ Time flows like water at the GÃ¶kyay Foundation Chess Museum, where more than 700 chess teams with their intriguing designs can be seen closely within a wide area of thousand 8 square meters. It is hard not to be surprised when examining the reflections of each country's unique cultural and artistic characteristics on chess teams.

Within the historical structure, you can enjoy the serenity while watching chess teams of different concepts, such as films and countries, which are listed in four main themes in an authentic atmosphere. The GÃ¶kyay Foundation Chess Museum, which has a different experience for chess enthusiasts and children, can be visited with a modest entrance fee.

description.en:
State Opera and Ballet refers to the General Directorate, established with the Law No. 1309, which brings together opera or ballet formations at the national level. The State Opera and Ballet are located in six different cities in Turkey. Other than Ankara, activities continue throughout the year in Izmir, Mersin, Samsun, Antalya and Istanbul. Its main objective is to bring the masses together by using the power of opera and ballet, to bring these special arts together with the public and to perform various festivals and concerts at the national level. After the revolution of the Republic, as in every field, there are very important and fundamental changes in the field of culture and art. As a result of these changes, AtatÃ¼rk supports the opening of many institutions.

The State Opera and Ballet in Ankara always stops in a much more special place. Compared to other directorates, this place has a history of success. Åevki Balmumcu signed Exhibition Building in 1948 was converted into an Opera house through P.Bonatz's efforts. Ankara State Opera and Ballet; audience section, entrance section and stage are divided into three. This building was built as a result of a competition organized in 1931. The website of the Ankara Directorate of State Opera and Ballet publishes the most current programmes throughout the year.

It is known that the Opera House was created entirely with native materials. Especially the stained glass windows in the foyer fill the eye with its original texture. On the other hand, the suspended ceiling in the audience is applied very successfully.

description.en:
<html>The ancient city of Alexandria Troas, which is thousands of years old, is visited by tourists from all over the world, is considered one of the most important cultural discovery points of the Ã‡anakkale. The ancient city, which had existed since the 4th century BC, attracted dense population from surrounding cities. The region, which was one of the most important residential areas of its period, has continuously expanded and reached its present form.

Alexandria Troas, one of the most extensive ancient cities in Turkey, is a striking value... The excavations carried out by a team from Germany for many years, were taken over by a team from Ankara University in 2011. The works uncovered include the Herodes Attikus Bath, the largest bath in Anatolia, the gymasium and the monumental arches.

The ancient city of Alexandria Troas, visited by a large number of European and U.S. tourists every year, welcomes guests from many countries around the world. The historical city, which is also an important tourist destination for local tourists, remains the center of attraction of Ã‡anakkale, which came to light after centuries.
</html>
description.de:

Herodes Attikus Bad, das grÃ¶ÃŸte Bad in Anatolien im Zusammenhang mit der Antike, Turnhalle und monumentale BÃ¶gen gehÃ¶ren zu den herausragenden Strukturen in den ausgegrabenen Werken.

Die antike Stadt Alexandria Troas, die jedes Jahr von vielen europÃ¤ischen und amerikanischen Touristen besucht wird, empfÃ¤ngt GÃ¤ste aus vielen LÃ¤ndern der Welt. Die historische Stadt, die fÃ¼r einheimische Touristen ein wichtiger Reiseort ist, bleibt das Zentrum der Anziehungskraft von Ã‡anakkale, das nach Jahrhunderten ans Licht kam.

description.en:
Oylat cave is located approximately 17 kilometers from InegÃ¶l District of Bursa. The cave consists mainly of two floors. The total length of Oylat cave is around 665 meters. This interesting cave, separated by two compartments, has a meander profile. The width of the first area of Oylat cave is between two and five meters. This width rises to over 20 meters in other sections. The ceiling height of the cave is no more than 15 meters. In some sections you can witness the height of the ceiling going down to three meters. The Hall section of the cave of votes consists of stalactites and stalagmites. It has a thick layer of gravel in its final parts. On the other hand, this is a vibrant habitat for many living communities. It is possible to encounter worm, butterfly and bat species here.


It is possible to feel the wind sharply at the crossing points. This is considered to be the third largest cave in Turkey. For this reason, many local and foreign visitors who visit InegÃ¶l come to see this place. The popularity of Oylat cave is increasing by the day. In the first part of the cave, as well as gravel stores, drop stone pools stand out. You can choose to navigate the steps in Oylat cave. Meanwhile, the cave's entrance area serves an interesting cafe.


Oylat cave is of great interest, especially on weekends. The cave is open to visitors all days of the week. Oylat Cave can be visited between 08:00 in the morning and 21:00 in the evening. The cave is today under the control of a private enterprise. About 35 years since the Build-Operate-Transfer model is brought to tourism. Entrance to the cave is charged. To provide transportation to Oylat cave, after passing Inegol district about 15 kilometers, you have to enter the Domanic crossing and follow this new road. Along the way, you may encounter the guiding signs for Oylat cave.

description.en:
Located in the town of PolatlÄ±, the Duatepe Monument is an important monument that affects the people who see it. The spiritual meaning of the work, which also has a symbol value for PolatlÄ±, is great. The fact that it was the first hill taken back from the enemies during the offensive in 1921 makes it very meaningful and special in the historical process. As a result of a study in 1999, around 20 thousand trees are planted here in total. The monument was placed a year later in the area where these trees were.

Duatepe today consists of five separate sections. These sections can be listed as monument, link road, walkway, car park and ceremonial area. The Duatepe Monument, which is included in the travel list of those who come to Ankara, is created by Metin Yurdanur, who stands out as a talented sculptor. He is a very successful state artist, and this marks his signature on many other works. The design and application of both the statues and the monument belong to him. It is possible to see names such as Halide Edip AdÄ±var, Ismet InÃ¶nÃ¼ and AtatÃ¼rk when the statues in this area are examined.

In our recent history, the Duatepe Monument stands in a very special place as a structure symbolizing the resolution and determination of the Turkish military. That famous retreat from Vienna ends here in a sense. The chase that begins here extends to the Aegean Sea. The taking of Duatepe makes an important contribution to the spirit of struggle. Because Sakarya Square is a turning point for the war of Independence. Apart from Duatepe, which forms the defense line, TÃ¼rbe Tepe and Gazi Tepe are also afforested within the scope of this project. The first works related to the monument came to the agenda in 1999. It was inaugurated with a grand ceremony on 12 September 2000.

When you carefully examine the Duatepe Monument, you may encounter very interesting details. For example, the names of the soldiers who were killed in the Duatepe region are written on the memorial wall in brass letters.

description.en:
The Old Teacher's House, one of the most beautiful buildings left in Turkey from the Baltic architectural examples of the Russians, challenges time despite the age of more than 100 years.

The war that carved its name into the pages of history as the Ottoman-Russian War took place between 1877 and 1878. Occupied by the Russian government at the time, the city of Kars has been shaped by Russian architecture for 40 years. Russia, which brought architects and engineers from the Netherlands to Kars, which was described as the right to adapt the Baltic, one of the most popular European architectural styles of that era to Kars, they puts the city in its present form.

Kars, which is shaped by structures such as theatre halls, teachers' house, physician's house, mansions built for 40 years; It is the only city in the world that holds Armenian, Russian and Ottoman traces together. Built towards the end of the 19th century, the Teachers House is one of the rare three-storey examples of Russian Baltic architectural style. Properly cut basalt Stone is used to built it, the Old Teacher's House also shapes the street with its entrance facing the north direction.

The Old Teacher's House, which was owned by the treasury with the declaration of the Republic in Turkey, has been used as the main building of Ziraat Bank for many years. A teacher's house reorganized in 1984 and built, the interior of the building undergoes a great restoration in accordance with its originality with this new construction. 

The building, which was evacuated in 2003 for the creation of a new teacher's house in Kars, was allocated to Caucasian University and protected today, and then allocated to the Science Propagation Society. Today, the Old Teacher's House Building, which has become a place where many courses from advanced robotic coding to software technologies, art courses to literary readings are given, is of great importance for the cultural development of Kars youth today.

description.en:
Elif mausoleum, which adds an important value to tourism in Gaziantep, reaches today from the 2nd century BC. These monumental tombs, where cut stones are used, have a square plan. The cross-vaulted roof stands out in the structure, which begins to rise above the podium. Both sides of the fuselage section are arched. The section between the podium and the trunk resembles tombs from the classical period. The fact that the area is surrounded by the heads of the Medusa makes the area more valuable. Medusa is known as a mythical mythological creature that turns what it sees into stone.

The Elif Mausoleums, which are included in the district of Araban, are three in total. These are located in the villages named HasanoÄŸlu, Elif and Hisar. These Roman funerary monuments are located quite close to the Euphrates and at a commercially important crossroads. At that time, the mausoleum was built for high-ranking soldiers. All three monumental tombs are extremely close to each other. The monumental tombs consist of sections such as a pedestal chamber, arched upper section and roof cover.

Hisar mausoleum has a height of approximately 10 meters. Located on a high plinth, the tomb has a pyramidal roof. A column heading stands out just above this section. In terms of ornamentation, it has a simpler structure compared to other tombs. There is no definitive information on  by whom it was built.

The ancient tomb of Elif is located in the village of Elif. This village also contains the ancient city of Sugga. It is also an intersection for Samsat and Zeugma roads. This place is made up of cut stones like other mausoleum and has a vaulted covering system. HasanoÄŸlu mausoleum is located in the village of the same name. The pedestal section is square-planned. It can be said that this place is a little more aesthetic than the other two tombs. Certain parts of the pedestal are unfortunately in ruins.

description.en:
<html>This is a great place where you can watch a magnificent city on the viewing terrace of a 3,000-year-old castle that has put city of Van under your feet... 

Due to its historical texture and presence in Mesopotamia, Van is referred to as a city of religions and castles ... Numerous historical monuments in this land, which have hosted many civilizations from Urartu to Abbasiles, Seljuks to Ottomans, also remain present today. The Maiden Castle, who defies the time in all its glory, is one of the works. This magnificent monument, inherited from Urartu since 3,000 years ago, lays the entire city under your feet from the viewing terrace.

The view of The Edremit Maiden (Castle Viewing) Terrace captivates each visitor separately. Each object seen in the landscape, which extends far as eye can reach, has a separate historical value. Especially the explorers who come to this castle at sunset, are taken on a journey of time, s oto speak, with the red sun sinking behind the skyline.

Lake Van, which extends as if it was a sea on the one hand, Seljuk and Urartu heritage on the one hand, on the other hand the unique beauty of the old Van... Providing an unforgettable experience to all visitors, Edremit Maiden (Castle Viewing) Terrace is the most frequent destination for travellers with 360 degree views.
</html>
description.de:
<html>Dies ist ein groÃŸartiger Ort, an dem Sie die Gelegenheit haben, eine prÃ¤chtige Stadt auf der Aussichtsterrasse eines dreitausend Jahre alten Schlosses zu beobachten, auf dem die Stadt Van unter Ihren FÃ¼ÃŸen liegt.

Aufgrund seiner historischen Struktur und seiner PrÃ¤senz in Mesopotamien ist es als Stadt der Religionen und Burgen bekannt. In diesen LÃ¤ndern, in denen viele Zivilisationen lebten, von Urartianern bis Abbasiden, von Seldschuken bis zu Osmanen, sind zahlreiche historische DenkmÃ¤ler erhalten. Die Jungfrauburg, das der Zeit in seiner ganzen Pracht trotzt, ist eines dieser Werke. Dieses prÃ¤chtige Denkmal, das seit dreitausend Jahren von Urartianern geerbt wurde, legt die ganze Stadt von der Aussichtsterrasse aus unter Ihre FÃ¼ÃŸe.
Der Blick auf die Edremit Jungfrauburg (Aussichtsterrasse)  fasziniert jeden Besucher einzeln. Jedes Objekt in der Landschaft, die sich sehr weit erstreckt, hat einen anderen historischen Wert. Besonders die Entdecker, die bei Sonnenuntergang zu dieser Burg kommen, begeben sich auf eine Zeitreise, bei der die rote Sonne hinter dem Horizont untergeht.

Der Van See erstreckt sich auf der einen Seite bis ans Meer, einerseits das Erbe der Seldschuken und Urartu und andererseits die einzigartige SchÃ¶nheit des alten Van.
</html>

description.en:
There are many inns in Izmir. However, there is one that is attracted by its splendor; one of the city's landmarks is the Maiden's Tree Inn. Besides being authentic and magnificent, it is the largest Inn in Izmir. It is described as monumental.

The KÄ±zlaraÄŸasÄ± Inn, which is prominent among the Ottoman Inns, is about 200 metres from the beach.

It is adjacent to Hali Agha Bazaar. It is also close to the Hisar mosque.
In general, it is located in the center of many historical buildings.

It is among the Inns with a bazaar and a courtyard. It has a total area of 4 thousand m2 and has 2 floors. It also has a large courtyard.

The upper floor has 73 rooms. The inn, which made a significant contribution to the commercial life of its period, houses many shops on its lower floor.
As a smaller one, it resembles the famous Grand Bazaar in Istanbul. Souvenirs can be purchased here as one of the city's eminent shopping locations.
Spice shops and antique shops are also famous.

Tired? Turkish coffee with Turkish Delight can also be sipped in small coffeehouses.

KÄ±zlaraÄŸasÄ± Inn, which promises an original sightseeing experience that enriches the mind and spirit, is among the places of joyous sightseeing and shopping in Izmir.

description.en:
For Zelve Valley, which holds the title of being the longest settlement of Cappadocia, legends say that Christianity was spread from here first.

It is located in the Zelve Valley, where you can witness the areas where old people live with rock houses and its charming atmosphere. There was a belief that this area, which will take you to a stunning atmosphere, is the land where Christianity first came out and spread. It is also known that most churches, monasteries and settlements are here.

In the Zelve Valley, which was used as a village until the 1950s, some evenings are now performing incredible concerts for a mass of audience. Especially this area, which we recommend you to leave in the evening, also has its own unique view. When you step in here, you'll be lost in the magic of the environment, you'll be able to experience the experiences of rock houses.

Millions of people visit Zelve Open Air Museum every year, which says that this is the most visited place after Goreme Open Air Museum in Cappadocia. Don't forget to visit the valley while you're enjoying the Open Air Museum! You can enjoy views from the tunnels in the Zelve Valley. Many parts of this valley, which is extremely interesting, are currently closed to visitors. But there are still sightings that will take you for a long time!

description.en:
<html>Sapadere Canyon, located within the borders of Alanya district of Antalya, has a total height of 400 meters and a length of 750 meters. You can take exquisite landscape photos on the later-built hiking path above the canyon, which is located right at the exit of Sapadere Creek, and enjoy a pleasant time in places such as the country casino and picnic area.

Sapadere Canyon, located 40 kilometers from Alanya district center and 175 kilometers from Antalya Airport, is one of the places frequented by local and foreign tourists overwhelmed by the scorching heat of Alanya. You have the chance to taste the most delicious trout you can eat in the canyon, which is shown not only in Antalya but also among the natural wonders of all Turkey. While you are up to the canyon, you should also see the silk weaving workshop and the watermill in Sapadere Village.

Sapadere Canyon is open to visitors every day between 08:00 and 19:00, offering the opportunity to spend time in the environment by sitting in the gazebo next to the ice â€“ cold running waters. It is possible to reach the Sapadere Canyon, which is the first place in the list of places to visit in Antalya, by entering the Demirtas turn from the Alanya â€“ GazipaÅŸa Highway. Walking along the 170-metre long hiking trail you can see all the shades of green together, then explore the mystery of the cave you will reach.

Entrance to Sapadere Canyon, where there are artificial ponds, eating places, children's playgrounds, gift shops and a picnic area, is charged. The hiking trail in the canyon, which is only 50 â€“ 55 minutes ' drive from Antalya city centre, is also of great interest. You can have a village breakfast at this resort where you will witness the magnificent views of nature, and you can swim as you wish in the natural pool where the waterfall falls.
</html>

description.en:
YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m Madrasa, located within the borders of Bursa, was built in 1399. The madrasa, built by Yildirim Bayezid, underwent a major repair in 1948. Yildirim Madrasa has a rectangular structure. Porches surround the inner courtyard. Cells are located in the immediate rear section of these porches. Just across this area, there is a large domed classroom area.


The classroom measures 8.5 x 8.5 meters. The front of this classroom area is completely open. The plan of Yildirim Madrasa is long compared to other madrasas located in the city. Stalactite niches are located in both areas of the structure. Through the door with a low arch, the porches are covered with domes. Along the porches, the rooms are lined up. The rooms in the northern section are relatively larger. All of these rooms are vaulted. In addition, the doors of all these rooms open directly to the porches. The rooms are enriched by two niches and a furnace. The lead coverings in the domes immediately stand out. This place is considered in the context of the building community, which is actually located in a complex. In addition to the madrasa, there are also sections such as mausoleum, mosque, imaret and guest house.


The madrasa area is built in the northern section of the mosque. Cut mildew stones and bricks are used as building materials. There are 20 student rooms in the madrasa. The fact that it was the first Ottoman madrasa having closed frontier makes this place much more privileged. The plan of the place is an example for many madrasas built after it. Yildirim Madrasa from the first time it was built allows many important scholars to grow up. Abdulkadir Åeyhi Effendi and Mullah GÃ¼rani are among the first to come to mind. Although the madrasa has been damaged many times over time due to earthquakes and similar reasons, it is repaired every time.
description.de:
YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m Medresse, innerhalb der Grenzen von Bursa gelegen, wurde 1399 erbaut. Die von YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m Bayezid erbaute Medresse wurde 1948 einer umfassenden Reparatur unterzogen. YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m Medresse hat eine rechteckige Struktur. Es ist zu sehen, dass die SÃ¤ulengÃ¤nge den Innenhof umgeben sind und die Zellen befinden sich auf der RÃ¼ckseite dieser Portiken. Das Klassenzimmer hat Abmessungen von 8,5 x 8,5 Metern. Die Vorderseite dieses Klassenzimmerbereichs ist vollstÃ¤ndig offen. Der Plan von YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m Medresse ist lang im Vergleich zu anderen Medresses in der Stadt. In beiden Bereichen des GebÃ¤udes befinden sich Nischen mit Stalaktitis. Der Portikus, der mit einer Kuppel bedeckt ist, wird von der TÃ¼r mit einem flachen Bogen gefÃ¼hrt. Die Zimmer sind entlang der Portiken aufgereiht. Die RÃ¤ume im nÃ¶rdlichen Teil sind relativ grÃ¶ÃŸer. Alle diese RÃ¤ume sind mit GewÃ¶lben bedeckt. DarÃ¼ber hinaus Ã¶ffnen sich die TÃ¼ren all dieser RÃ¤ume direkt zu den Portiken. Die Zimmer sind mit zwei Nischen und einem Herd angereichert. Die Bleibeschichtungen in den Kuppeln fallen sofort auf. Dieser Ort wird tatsÃ¤chlich im Kontext der Baugemeinschaft in einem Komplex bewertet. Neben der Medresse gibt es auch Abschnitte wie GrÃ¤ber, Moscheen, Imaret und GÃ¤stehÃ¤user.


Das Medresse-Gebiet befindet sich im nÃ¶rdlichen Teil der Moschee. Geschnittene Steine â€‹â€‹und Ziegel werden als Baumaterialien verwendet. Es gibt 20 SchÃ¼lerzimmer in der Medresse. Es ist viel privilegierter, die erste osmanische Medresse zu sein, die geschlossen wird. Der Plan des Ortes ist ein Beispiel fÃ¼r viele Medressen, die danach gebaut wurden. YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m Medresse ermÃ¶glicht die Ausbildung vieler wichtiger Gelehrter seit dem ersten Bau. AbdÃ¼lkadir Åeyhi Efendi und Molla GÃ¼rani kommen als erste in den Sinn. Obwohl die Medresse im Laufe der Zeit aufgrund von Erdbeben und Ã¤hnlichen GrÃ¼nden oft beschÃ¤digt wird, wird sie immer repariert.

description.en:
The Peterson Pavilion on Mustafa Kemal Avenue, which is known to be started construction in 1859, is one of the prominent tourist attractions of the city. It is a historic mansion in Bornova District of Izmir, famous for its lush garden.

The mansion where John Bortwick Paterson, the Scottish merchant who first found the Chrome Mine in Fethiye, stayed for many years, is known by every people living in Bornova.
It also attracts attention with its interesting story.

Paterson soon became one of the few rich people in Anatolia thanks to Ottoman concessions. Three separate sections, including a small tower and a chapel, are located in the pavilion, which was built on the large grounds. The buildings in question have traces of West-East architecture. The main structure, surrounded by stunning decorations with games, ballrooms, dining rooms and various rest rooms, also has everything from tiled shower boats to chandeliers to expensive furniture. There were 7 pianos in the pavilion, not 1 or 2.

In his garden, racehorses were raised and various animals were fed for food purposes. In addition, there is a high pergola shaded by trees in the garden. It is also recorded that there are 100 Iron seats with a total value of 20 thousand pounds.

This huge living space, which was created without any expense, was abandoned by the family after the Greek occupation of Izmir. The family returned to the city after the transition of Izmir to Turkish rule again and saw that no goods had been damaged. The pavilion, sold by Gerald Paterson in 1973, then began to see destruction. There have been burglaries. It suffered a fire in 1986. Today, it has been partially restored by public efforts and is open to the public to visit.

description.en:
<html>The Center, which is owned by Ã‡anakkale, one of the eminent cities in the west of Turkey, with the majority of its historical monuments reflecting our past and shining a light on the future, welcomes visitors with the most beautiful examples of Ottoman architecture. In this context, one of the buildings of spiritual importance that is located in the location that presents art and history together is YalÄ± Mosque.

YalÄ± Mosque, which has a square plan, stands out with its tile roof. Its bricks also point to the characteristic visualness of the historic structure. Only the repair inscription has survived from the mosque, whose only minaret is present. This inscription records that it was renewed in 1854 by the efforts of Miralay Halil Bey. The repair records indicate that the first mosque was destroyed by a fire and was built for the second time.

The YalÄ± Mosque has a plain and far from ostentatious appearance. It is in the form of a plain Ottoman Mosque with its windows, doors, roofs and walls. As with most Ottoman Mosques, there is a hazire (forbidden area surrounded with fences) next to it in its courtyard. Numerous tombstones are located here.
</html>

In diesem Zusammenhang ist die YalÄ±-Moschee eines der GebÃ¤ude mit spiritueller Bedeutung an einem Ort, der Kunst und Geschichte zusammen bietet.

Die quadratisch geplante YalÄ±-Moschee macht mit ihrem Ziegeldach auf sich aufmerksam. Die Ziegel weisen auch auf die charakteristische Optik des historischen GebÃ¤udes hin. Von der Moschee mit einem einzigen Minarett ist nur die Reparaturinschrift erhalten. In dieser Inschrift ist vermerkt, dass sie 1854 mit den BemÃ¼hungen von Miralay Halil Bey erneuert wurde. In den Aufzeichnungen der Reparatur steht, dass die erste Moschee zum zweiten Mal gebaut wurde, nachdem die Moschee verbrannte.

Die YalÄ±-Moschee wirkt schlicht und unprÃ¤tentiÃ¶s. Es hat die Form einer einfachen osmanischen Moschee mit Fenstern, TÃ¼ren, Dach und WÃ¤nden. Wie die meisten osmanischen Moscheen befindet sich nebenan eine GrabstÃ¤tte im Innenhof. Hier gibt es viele Grabsteine.
