description.en:
<html>AtatÃ¼rk Monument rises in Cumhuriyet Square, the central point of Antalya, famous for its warm sun and tourist facilities in summer. Built by Prof. Dr. HÃ¼seyin Gezer and opened in 1964, the monument is one of the city's icons with its statue of AtatÃ¼rk and its granite stone pedestal. The AtatÃ¼rk Monument, which used 12 tons of bronze in its construction, draws attention with its height of six meters.

The monument, which also attracts attention with its lighting elements, bears characteristic features. When rising from the ground, the figures in the extreme point of liberation, unity, togetherness and the modern Republic of Turkey, founded with the victories led by AtatÃ¼rk, are asked to be told.

Each of the dates found on its pedestal refers to specific days of great importance with various aspects from its inception. The chronological dates begin with 19 May 1919, when AtatÃ¼rk set foot in Samsun.

At the bottom of the monument, there are steps representing the determination of independence. The figures next to AtatÃ¼rk express confidence in the youth who are also the protector of the country. The AtatÃ¼rk Monument, which is recommended to be seen, is one of the significant works that make up the skyline of Antalya.

</html>
description.de:
Im Sommer im Zentrum von Antalya, das fÃ¼r seine sonnenwÃ¤rmende Sonne und seine touristischen MÃ¶glichkeiten bekannt ist erhebt sich das AtatÃ¼rk-Denkmal auf dem Cumhuriyet-Platz. Das vom Bildhauer Prof. Dr. HÃ¼seyin Gezer erbaute und 1964 erÃ¶ffnete Denkmal ist eines der Symbole der Stadt mit der AtatÃ¼rk-Statue und der Granitsteinbasis, auf der es sich befindet. Das AtatÃ¼rk-Denkmal, in dem 12 Tonnen Bronze verwendet wurden, macht mit seiner HÃ¶he von sechs Metern ebenfalls auf sich aufmerksam.


Das Denkmal, das auch mit seinen Beleuchtungselementen auffÃ¤llt, weist charakteristische Merkmale auf. WÃ¤hrend des Bauens mÃ¶chte man der modernen Republik TÃ¼rkei, die mit dem von AtatÃ¼rk angefÃ¼hrten Sieg gegrÃ¼ndet wurde, Befreiung, Einheit und ZusammengehÃ¶rigkeit mit den Figuren am Ã¤uÃŸersten Punkt mitteilen.


Jedes Datum auf seinem Sockel weist auf bestimmte Tage hin, die seit seiner GrÃ¼ndung von groÃŸer Bedeutung sind. Chronologisch fortschreitende Daten beginnen am 19. Mai 1919, als AtatÃ¼rk Samsun betrat.


Am unteren Rand des Denkmals befinden sich Stufen, die die Bestimmung der UnabhÃ¤ngigkeit darstellen. Die Figuren neben AtatÃ¼rk drÃ¼cken das Vertrauen in die Jugend aus, die auch die BeschÃ¼tzer des Landes sind. Das AtatÃ¼rk-Denkmal, dessen Besichtigung empfohlen wird, ist eines der bedeutungsvollen Werke, die die Silhouette von Antalya ausmachen.

description.en:
<html>In Anatolia, an important settlement throughout history centuries of Roman domination, is remarkable. This ancient empire, which built cities all over its side, has built Kastamonu and its surroundings as an important center. In this context, the ancient city of Pompeiopolis, which is about an hour's drive from today's city center at 64 BC, is of great importance.

This historic region, dubbed 'Pompeiopolis', which means 'City of Pompeius', referring to the city state founded by Roman leader Gnaeus Pompeius Magnus. In the 6th century, Christianity became an important region for religion. 

A significant part of the artifacts excavated in the ancient city are on display at the Kastamonu Archaeological Museum. Architectural parts can be seen in The District of TaÅŸkÃ¶prÃ¼. 

Other important Roman settlements in Anatolia include columns, mosaics, rock tombs and various depictions during the visit to the Ancient City of Pompeiopolis, which stands out for its resemblance to Ephesus and Zeugma. 

Meanwhile, archaeological excavations are reportedly continuing. Located in the northern part of Kastamonu, the ancient city lies on the slopes of KÃ¼re and Ilgaz Mountain. 
</html>
description.de:
<html>Bemerkenswert ist die jahrhundertealte rÃ¶mische Herrschaft in Anatolien, die im Laufe der Geschichte ein wichtiges Siedlungsgebiet war. Dieses alte Reich, das StÃ¤dte auf allen vier Seiten errichtete, strukturierte Kastamonu und seine Umgebung als wichtiges Zentrum. In diesem Zusammenhang ist die antike Stadt Pompeiopolis, die 64 n. Chr. etwa eine Stunde vom Stadtzentrum entfernt war, von groÃŸer Bedeutung.


Dieses historische Gebiet, genannt "Pompeiopolis", was "Stadt von Pompeius" bedeutet, basiert auf dem vom rÃ¶mischen StaatsfÃ¼hrer Gnaeus Pompeius Magnus gegrÃ¼ndeten Stadtstaat. Es wurde im 6. Jahrhundert eine wichtige Region fÃ¼r die christliche Religion.

Ein wichtiger Teil der in der antiken Stadt ausgegrabenen Werken sind, ist im ArchÃ¤ologischen Museum von Kastamonu ausgestellt worden. Im Stadtteil TaÅŸkÃ¶prÃ¼ sind architektonische StÃ¼cke zu sehen.

Der Besuch der antiken Stadt Pompeiopolis, die durch ihre Ã„hnlichkeit mit anderen wichtigen rÃ¶mischen Siedlungen in Ephesus und Zeugma auffÃ¤llt, umfasst SÃ¤ulen, Mosaike, FelsengrÃ¤ber und verschiedene Darstellungen.
Auf der anderen Seite sollen archÃ¤ologische Ausgrabungen fortgesetzt werden. Die antike Stadt liegt im nÃ¶rdlichen Teil von Kastamonu an den Klippen von KÃ¼re und Ilgaz.
</html>

description.en:
Altindag, a district of Ankara known for its historical structures, becomes one of the regions of the city that is developing rapidly after its declaration as the capital of the Republic of Turkey. In this context, the HamamÃ¶nÃ¼ region, one of the historical values of the district, is very attractive with its characteristic features that attract attention from a tourist point of view.

HamamÃ¶nÃ¼ is famous for its bath which also gives its name to the historical region. Also known for its historic houses dating from the 17th and 18th centuries, the historic houses in the region are notable for their architectural plans and simplicity. The summer and winter sections, the courtyard, the interior sofa plans of these houses increase the pleasure of looking at the high ambience of the houses, the sections encountered when entering in the past Ottoman life promises a short trip. The lower floor with the kitchens, the upper floors with the bedroom and the living room stand out with their interesting features.

In these houses, where the street is usually a courtyard, the rooms, also known as SelamlÄ±k() The portion of a house reserved for men, also extend outwards. Built of thick trees, wooden skeletons, brick and adobe, the historic Ankara Houses of HamamÃ¶nÃ¼ can be visited both for the pleasure of looking at the historical atmosphere and for the purpose of photography.

description.en:
YaÄŸcÄ±lar Khan, located in Mugla city, was built in 1493. The khan was known as the most important commercial center of the city at the time. Notable for its solid stone walls, the inn has a wooden carcass system. This region consists of rendering plant houses during the founding years. For this reason, the name is still referred to today as â€˜YaÄŸhaneler Khanâ€™. Since it was recently restored, it has been reopened to visit. The sycamore trees, especially in the courtyard section, use it as a pleasant resting area.


YaÄŸcÄ±lar Khan which is located exactly in EmirbeyazÄ±t district, was the most extensive repair in 1990. YaÄŸcÄ±lar Khan welcomes travelers from the region throughout history. Today, it is mostly used as a business center and leisure area. The khan is quite easy to reach as it is located in the centre of the city. This allows many tourists to visit the khan.


Architecturally, cut stones and bricks attract attention. It consists mostly of rooms lined up around the courtyard. Although some additions were made to the YaÄŸcÄ±lar Khan at certain times in history, this situation causes it to move away from its authenticity. As the Gulf of Gokova developed in the 1800s, commercial activities in the city suddenly changed direction. This naturally affects the Hhstorical khan negatively.


The western section of the khan has two lamb gates. The courtyard section opens directly to KurÅŸunlu Street. After the restoration, small and cute businesses, especially woven carpets sold, add color here. A budget of around 2 million Turkish lira is allocated for the restoration works of YaÄŸcÄ±lar Khan. The khan adds value to the cultural and economic aspect of the city with its revamped state. The location delivery for the khan takes place in September 2009. In the coming periods, this place will also host cinema screenings and music performances.

description.en:
This mausoleum, which lies with two Alperens, Halil and Tevfik, one of the most important symbols in the history of the Anatolian Seljuk State, is one of the most important points of Kars's religious tourism. The religious scholar who led the Turks in their entry into Anatolian territory, as well as those who were soldiers, is called Alperen. 

Two Alperens, Halil and Tevfik, who are the pioneers in their struggle for the entry of the Anatolian Seljuk State into Anatolia, die while fighting where the tomb is now located. After this event in the 11th century, Halil and Tevfik were the first Alperens seljuk martyred in Anatolia. 
King Alparslan, who prevailed in the siege of Kars in 1064, does not forget these two martyrs and builds the Tomb of the Alperens on their behalf. Located on the outskirts of Kars Castle, the Tomb of the Alperens creates the effect as if it were a guard of the castle. The tomb, which looks quite modest as if it were watching the whole city, also has an important place in terms of religious tourism of the city.

 The Tomb of Alperens, which reached the present day with a small but very naÃ¯ve stance among the green grass and shrubs, is the place where the first Alperen martyrs, especially those from Turki states, respect the first Alperen martyrs.
description.de:
Dieses Grabmal, in dem zwei Alperen, Halil und Tevfik, zu den wichtigsten Symbolen der Geschichte des anatolischen seldschukischen Staates gehÃ¶ren, gehÃ¶rt zu den wichtigsten Punkten des religiÃ¶sen Tourismus von Kars.

Alperen ist ein Religionswissenschaftler, der die TÃ¼rken bei der Einreise in anatolische LÃ¤nder und auch Soldaten anfÃ¼hrt. Vor allem die Apostel zwei Alperen namens Halil und Tevfik, die im Kampf des anatolischen Seldschukenstaates um ihren Einzug in Anatolien, sind am Ort des Grabs gestorben, wo sie gekÃ¤mpft haben.

Nach diesem Ereignis im 11. Jahrhundert sind Halil und Tevfik die ersten Alperen, die in Anatolien den MÃ¤rtyrertod der Seldschuken erlebt haben. Der Herrscher Alparslan, der 1064 bei der Belagerung von Kars gewann, vergisst diese beiden MÃ¤rtyrer nicht und baute fÃ¼r sie das Alperengrab.

Das Grabmal von den Alperen gibt den Besuchern am FuÃŸe des Schlosses in Kars das GefÃ¼hl, als ob sie noch die HÃ¼ter des Schlosses wÃ¤ren. Das Grab, das sehr bescheiden aussieht, als wÃ¼rde man die ganze Stadt beobachten, hat auch einen wichtigen Platz im Hinblick auf den religiÃ¶sen Tourismus in der Stadt.

Das Grabmal von den Alperen, das mit einer kleinen, aber naiven Haltung zwischen grÃ¼nem Gras und StrÃ¤uchern bis heute erhalten ist, ist der Ort, an dem die TÃ¼rken die ersten Alperen-MÃ¤rtyrer respektieren.

description.en:
Bursa Archaeological Museum is a modern museum where the historical values of Bursa city can be seen on an extremely large scale.


The museum in Ã‡ekirge District of Bursa was first opened in 1972 in a new building. 41 years later, when it is seen the need in line with a comprehensive arrangement, it takes its present form. Bursa Archaeological Museum, where more than 50 thousand works are exhibited which shed light on the thousands of years history of Bursa, which is located at the crossing point between the Anatolian geography and the Balkans, is striking with its wealth and diversity.


The museum was organized in 1972 as a structure consisting of four sections: prehistoric works and coins, stone works; ceramic, glass and metal works, art gallery, and it has a different order as of 2013. However, today the museum is divided into the Hall of the Miocene Period-Phrygian Kingdom, the Hall of Stone Artifacts, the Hall of the Archaic Period-Eastern Roman period and the Hall of the Three Pinar Tumulus Car Finds.


In the related halls, archaeological artifacts collected in the excavations carried out in Bursa and the surrounding area can be seen. Among these works, the prominent ones are Hittite, Urartian artifacts; pottery and idols. In addition, the Statue of Apollo, bust of Athena, coins, ornaments, architectural pieces, parts of the wheel dated to the 6th century BC, horse harnesses and chariot model can be examined.


In addition, there is a library with archival documents. The museum, which promises a unique adventure, is visited by thousands of cultural tourism enthusiasts and everyone from 7 to 70 who are interested in history in general.

Cami ile ilgili en ilginÃ§ notlardan bir tanesi de Rodos seferine Ã§Ä±ktÄ±ÄŸÄ± sÄ±rada Kanuni Sultan SÃ¼leymanâ€™Ä±n burada namaz kÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ olmasÄ±dÄ±r.

description.en:
One of the most important mosques in MuÄŸla, the Shabanagha mosque, in some sources it also referred as â€˜Tannhane mosqueâ€™ or â€˜Sulu mosqueâ€™ . In particular, Evliya Ã‡elebi mentions the mosque under these names in his travelogue. The reason this place is called Sulu mosque is because of the presence of spring water coming out from underground at that time.


The mosque is located in the western part of the village square and is also in the northern part of the historical Seljuk Bath. According to the inscription at the entrance of the mosque, this holy place was built in 1876. It is seen that the Shabanagha Mosque has been repaired many times over time. Despite this, it has managed to come up solidly so far.


The Shabanagha Mosque is still active today and is open for worship. Various engravings show that the mosque has a minaret with a single balcony with a dome on top. At the entrance facing the northern end of the mosque is a congregational neighborhood supported by columns. The ceiling of this section is wooden and Portico shaped. The general plan of the Shabanagha Mosque is in the form of a quadrangle. Each surface is calculated to be approximately 15 meters. Each wall has four windows.


The ancient city of Stratonikeia, located in the YataÄŸan district of Mugla, is also close to the area. In this sense, for those who want to visit both historical and cultural sites, the region offers an important opportunity. Another repair of the mosque was carried out by Mehmet Eskisar in 1912. One of the most interesting notes about the mosque is that Suleiman The Magnificent prayed here during his expedition to Rhodes.


The mosque was last restored by the MuÄŸla Governorate in 2018 and opened for worship again. With this restoration, the mosque was restored to its former imposing appearance. The presence of the mosque also positively influences visits to the ancient city of Stratonikeia. The restoration process of the Shabanagha mosque was completed in about 300 days.

description.en:
<html>Seljuk style architecture style in different periods over the years with additional constructions in the Grand Mosque, which reaches its present form, has two shrines, fountains, hash house and shops in its adjacent complex.

Although the date of construction of the mosque has not been reached definitively, the oldest known data is the date of 1271 in the inscription in the minaret. After 1849, which is known to belong to the period of Memluk Sultan Baybars I,the mosque Kebir and the adjacent summer mosque were repaired. The complex was last repaired by the General Directorate of Foundations in 2002. 

The interior of the Grand Mosque, the oldest and largest of Antakya mosques, is quite simply furnished. On the wall of the mosque, where the very precious carpets are located, the verses written in gold letters stand out. The courtyard is spacious, stone paved and has shaded fountain. The mosque has a rectangular plan, with cutting stone material in its vaulted and flat roofed structure. 
</html>
description.de:
<html>Mit ihrem seldschukischen Baustil hat die Ulu-Moschee, die im Laufe der Jahre durch zusÃ¤tzliche Konstruktionen zu verschiedenen Zeiten ihre heutige Form angenommen hat, GebÃ¤ude wie den Komplex, zwei GrÃ¤ber, Brunnen, Imaret und GeschÃ¤fte.

Obwohl dem Errichtungsdatum der Moschee noch nicht erreicht wurde, ist das Datum 1271 in der Inschrift im Minarett das Ã¤lteste bekannte Datum. Nach diesem Datum, von dem bekannt ist, dass es aus der Zeit von Mameluk Sultan Baybars dem I. stammt, wurden Cami-i Kebir und die angrenzende Sommermoschee 1849 repariert. Der Komplex wurde zuletzt im Jahr 2002 von der Generaldirektion fÃ¼r Stiftungen repariert.

Das Innere der Ulu-Moschee, die Ã¤lteste und grÃ¶ÃŸte der Antakya-Moscheen, ist recht einfach eingerichtet. An der Wand der Moschee, wo es sehr wertvolle Teppiche gibt, fallen die in goldenen Buchstaben geschriebenen Verse auf. Der Innenhof ist groÃŸ, mit Steinen versehrt und hat einen Springbrunnen. Die Moschee, die in ihrer gewÃ¶lbten und flach gedeckten Struktur aus geschnittenem Steinmaterial besteht, hat einen rechteckigen Grundriss.</html>

description.en:
<html>Canakkale Martyrs Monument and Martyrs Monument is the point of Gallipoli Peninsula that attracts the most visitors. In fact, it is at the top of the travel lists of groups coming from out of town. This monument, one of the symbolic places of Ã‡anakkale, is located in the Cape of Hisarlik.

This place is actually created as a result of a project competition. The foundations of the Martyrs Monument were laid in 1954. The opening of the visit coincides with the anniversary of the second Anafartalar victory. This special monument represents the great soldiers of the Gallipoli campaign. The main goal is to keep their struggle and memories alive. Dogan ErginbaÅŸ is the architect of the monument, which attracts visitors very intensively. He is the first person selected from 37 projects in the competition organized for this place. The monument represents the ascension of the martyrs. This is the expression of DoÄŸan ErginbaÅŸ, who is the architect of the project himself. A variety of reliefs that express the moments of war in the monument also fill the eye.

Every year, especially during the week of March 18, many visitors from all parts of Turkey flock to the region. Commemorations are traditionally organized in the area where the monument of martyrs is located. Canakkale martyrs and martyrs monument attracts the attention of foreign visitors as well as local visitors. The representative cemeteries located just behind the monument offer a fairly regular view. This area was opened to visitors in 2007. The names of 59 thousand martyrs whose names were identified in martyrdom are inscribed.

Just in front of this representative martyrdom, there is a separate relief of 45 meters. There is a large marble inscription with the words that AtatÃ¼rk had set up for the soldiers. The Ã‡anakkale Martyrs Monument and the Martyrs Monument are located next to Morto Bay at the end of the Strait. Ismet InÃ¶nÃ¼ has important initiatives as well as AtatÃ¼rk in the construction process of the Canakkale martyrdom and Martyrs Monument. It is known that the monument cost 4 million Turkish lira in that period.
</html>
description.de:
Der MÃ¤rtyrerfriedhof und das MÃ¤rtyrerdenkmal von Ã‡anakkale ist der meistbesuchte Ort auf der Halbinsel Gelibolu. TatsÃ¤chlich steht es ganz oben auf der Reiseliste von Gruppen, die von auÃŸerhalb der Stadt kommen. Dieses Denkmal, das im Hinblick auf unsere jÃ¼ngste Geschichte ein sehr wertvoller Ort ist und einer der symbolischen Orte von Ã‡anakkale ist, befindet sich am Kap HisarlÄ±k.

Dieser Ort ist eigentlich das Ergebnis eines Projektwettbewerbs. Der Grundstein fÃ¼r das MÃ¤rtyrerdenkmal wurde 1954 gelegt. Die ErÃ¶ffnung des Besuchs fÃ¤llt mit dem Jahrestag des zweiten Anafartalar-Sieges zusammen. Dieses besondere Denkmal reprÃ¤sentiert alle Soldaten im Ã‡anakkale-Krieg. Der Hauptzweck ist es, ihren Kampf und ihre Erinnerungen am Leben zu erhalten. Der Architekt des Denkmals, das viele Besucher anzieht, ist DoÄŸan ErginbaÅŸ. Er ist der Gewinner unter 37 Projekten des fÃ¼r diesen Ort organisierten Wettbewerbs. Das Denkmal stellt die MÃ¤rtyrer dar, die sich zum Himmel erheben. Dies ist der Ausdruck von DoÄŸan ErginbaÅŸ, der selbst der Architekt des Projekts war. Beeindruckend sind auch die verschiedenen Reliefs, die die Momente des Krieges ausdrÃ¼cken.

Jedes Jahr strÃ¶men in der Woche vom 18. MÃ¤rz besonders viele Besucher aus allen Ecken der TÃ¼rkei an. Gedenkzeremonien werden traditionell in der Gegend organisiert, in der sich das MÃ¤rtyrerdenkmal befindet. Das Martyrium und das Denkmal der MÃ¤rtyrer von Ã‡anakkale ziehen die Aufmerksamkeit sowohl auslÃ¤ndischer als auch einheimischer Besucher auf sich. Die reprÃ¤sentativen FriedhÃ¶fe direkt hinter dem Denkmal wirken sehr regelmÃ¤ÃŸig. Dieser Bereich wurde 2007 fÃ¼r Besucher geÃ¶ffnet. Die Namen der 59.000 MÃ¤rtyrer, deren Namen im Martyrium bestimmt wurden, sind geschrieben.

Direkt vor diesem reprÃ¤sentativen Martyrium befindet sich ein 45 Meter langes Relief. Wenn Sie diesen Ort passieren, gibt es eine groÃŸe Marmorinschrift mit den Worten, die AtatÃ¼rk fÃ¼r die Soldaten aufgestellt hatte. Der MÃ¤rtyrerfriedhof und das MÃ¤rtyrerdenkmal von Ã‡anakkale befinden sich direkt neben der Morto Bucht am Ende der Meerenge. WÃ¤hrend des Bauprozesses des Ã‡anakkale-MÃ¤rtyrerfriedhof und des MÃ¤rtyrerdenkmals unternahm Ä°smet Ä°nÃ¶nÃ¼ ebenso wichtige Versuche wie AtatÃ¼rk. description.en:
<html>"The territory of Turkey is an open-air museum in itself," historians say. The Anatolian lands, which are home to countless civilizations and their cultures, also come out with countless works to confirm this saying. It is a work of Hittites, one of the most well-known ancient civilizations of Anatolia, the EflatunpÄ±nar Hittite Water Monument. 

Hittites attached great importance to water both in their importance in addressing their vital needs and their religious beliefs. That's why they usually made artifacts near the water. The EflatunpÄ±nar Hittite Water Monument, one of the most beautiful works they make next to water, stands out as one of the rare works that have come almost intact to this day.

The EflatunpÄ±nar Hittite Water Monument, which dates back to the last quarter of the 13th century BC, it belongs to the period of The Great King Tuthalia IV. The structure, which is similar to an open-air temple alone with hand-embroidered reliefs and original stonework style, also retains its robustness as it is built on a natural rock. The monument, which features god and goddess models in hittite religion, is built on the edge of the pool created from the natural water source, so it also gives information about the water technology of that era.

The EflatunpÄ±nar Hittite Water Monument, which has increased more in every century with its prudence and beauty, brings together the greatness of Anatolian lands under one roof. 
</html>
description.de:
<html>â€Die TÃ¼rkei ist ein Land der Open-Air-Museum.â€œ sagen die Historiker. Anatolische LÃ¤nder, in denen zahlreiche Zivilisationen und ihre Kulturen leben, stoÃŸen auch die Entdecker auf unzÃ¤hlige Werke, als ob sie diesen Satz bestÃ¤tigen wÃ¼rden. Das hethitische Wasserdenkmal EflatunpÄ±nar ist ein Werk der Hethiter und einer der bekanntesten antiken Zivilisationen Anatoliens.

Die Hethiter legten groÃŸen Wert auf Wasser, sowohl aufgrund ihrer Bedeutung fÃ¼r die Befriedigung ihrer LebensbedÃ¼rfnisse als auch aufgrund ihrer religiÃ¶sen Glauben. So machten sie oft Werke in der NÃ¤he von Wasser. Das hethitische Wasserdenkmal EflatunpÄ±nar, eines der schÃ¶nsten Werke neben dem Wasser, ist eines der seltenen Werke, die fast unversehrt erhalten geblieben sind.

Das hethitische Wasserdenkmal EflatunpÄ±nar, das auf das letzte Viertel des 13. Jahrhunderts vor Christus datiert ist, gehÃ¶rt zur Zeit des groÃŸen KÃ¶nigs Tuthaliya dem IV.  Die Struktur, die mit ihren handgefertigten Reliefs und dem ursprÃ¼nglichen Mauerwerkstil wie ein Tempel unter freiem Himmel aussieht, behÃ¤lt auch ihre Robustheit bei, da sie auf natÃ¼rlichem Fels gebaut ist. Das Denkmal, auf dem sich die Vorbilder von Gott und GÃ¶ttin in der hethitischen Religion befinden, gibt Auskunft Ã¼ber die Wassertechnologie jener Zeit, da sie am Rand des aus der natÃ¼rlichen Wasserquelle geschaffenen Becken errichtet wurde.

Das hethitische Wasserdenkmal EflatunpÄ±nar, dessen Pracht und SchÃ¶nheit mit jedem Jahrhundert mehr und mehr zunahm, vereint die unermessliche Natur anatolischer Gebiete unter einem Dach.
</html>

description.en:
<html>Sittishah Sultan Mosque is one of the dozens of mosques that have been moved from history to the present day in Edirne. DulkadiroÄŸlu Suleyman Bey's daughter Sitti Hatun built SittiÅŸah Sultan Mosque is recorded as the person who built. Sitti Hatun is also the wife of Sultan Mehmet The Conqueror. This mosque is sometimes referred  as Sitti Sultan Mosque or Hatuniye Mosque. The construction of the mosque is determined as 1482 by reference from the information in the inscription. At that time the mosque was built in a certain part of the palace. The palace survives smoothly until 1743.

Sittishah Sultan Mosque was involved in the repair process in the 1980s and 1990s. The historical mosque, located in Edirne city center, has three separate foundations. These are dated 1520, 1530 and 1574. It is recorded that various villages were dedicated to the mosque at that time. Since it is the only artefact left after the destroyed palace, the public takes more ownership of the mosque.

The architectural features of Sittishah Mosque are admirable. The north facade is completely covered with smooth cut stones. Rubble stones and bricks are used on this facade. The mosque is situated in a fairly large courtyard. In the eastern and southern areas, there is a Hazire(burial area reserved for special people especially in mosques or sufi lodges) which is also used as a cemetery. Historians say that Sitti Sultan lay here; however, this information cannot be confirmed as his tombstone is missing. The dome part of the mosque and the minaret cone are completely covered with lead. In the northern part of the parish area, there is a fountain resembling a roller. The fountain is understood to be rebuilt on top of the old pedestal.

SittiÅŸah Sultan Mosque is located on Talat Pasha Street in Sevindik Fakih District. Those who want to visit the mosque have to walk up to the AtatÃ¼rk Primary School. It is also possible to witness many historical sites on the same street.
</html>

Die SittiÅŸah Sultan Moschee ist eine der zehn Moscheen in Edirne, die von der Geschichte in die Gegenwart versetzt wurden. Er ist als die Person bekannt, die die SittiÅŸah Sultan Moschee von Sitti Hatun, der Tochter von DulkadiroÄŸlu SÃ¼leyman Bey, errichten lieÃŸ. Sitti Hatun ist auch die Frau von Fatih Sultan Mehmet. Diese Moschee wird unter den Einheimischen manchmal als Sitti Sultan Moschee oder Hatuniye Moschee bezeichnet. Der Bau der Moschee wird anhand der Angaben in der Inschrift als 1482 festgelegt. Zu dieser Zeit wurde die Moschee in einem bestimmten Teil des Palastes gebaut. Der Palast Ã¼berlebt problemlos bis 1743.

Die SittiÅŸah Sultan Moschee wird in den 1980er und 1990er Jahren nacheinander in den Restaurierungsprozess einbezogen. Die historische Moschee im Stadtzentrum von Edirne verfÃ¼gt Ã¼ber drei separate Stiftungen. Diese sind mit 1520, 1530 und 1574 datiert. Es wird berichtet, dass zu dieser Zeit verschiedene DÃ¶rfer der Moschee gewidmet waren. Da es das einzige Werk ist, das nach dem zerstÃ¶rten Palast noch Ã¼brig ist, beanspruchen die Menschen die Moschee mehr als nur.

Die architektonischen Merkmale der Sittisah-Moschee sind bewundernswert. Die Nordfassade ist vollstÃ¤ndig mit geschnittenen Steinen bedeckt. An dieser Fassade werden Schutt und Ziegel verwendet. Die Moschee befindet sich in einem sehr groÃŸen Innenhof. Im Ã¶stlichen und sÃ¼dlichen Bereich gibt es eine GrabstÃ¤tte, die auch als Friedhof genutzt wird. Historiker sagen, dass Sitti Sultan hier ruht; Diese Informationen kÃ¶nnen jedoch nicht bestÃ¤tigt werden, da der Grabstein fehlt. Die Kuppel und der Kegel des Minaretts der Moschee sind vollstÃ¤ndig mit Blei bedeckt. Im nÃ¶rdlichen Teil des Gemeindegebiets befindet sich ein Brunnen, der einem Zylinder Ã¤hnelt. Es versteht sich, dass der Brunnen auf dem alten Sockel wieder aufgebaut wurde.

Die SittiÅŸah Sultan Moschee befindet sich in der Talat PaÅŸa StraÃŸe im Bezirk Sevindik Fakih. Wer die Moschee besuchen mÃ¶chte, muss zur AtatÃ¼rk-Grundschule gehen. Es ist auch mÃ¶glich, viele historische Orte in derselben StraÃŸe zu sehen.

description.en:
The Ethnographic Museum, opened in Ankara in 1930, is also one of the first museums in Turkey. Besides the rich art works of Anatolia, the museum has a large number of navigable halls where ethnographic (cultural) materials are exhibited.

The area called â€˜Hall of Honorâ€™, where AtatÃ¼rk's body was buried until 1953 before his transfer to AnÄ±tkabir, is located at the entrance of the museum. In the clothing Hall, there are products such as Turkish folk clothing and jewelry; in the processing hall there are items such as bedspreads, socks, bath sets. Different areas such as the weaving hall where fabrics from different regions are exhibited, the civil works where striking examples of Anatolian mineworking can be seen, the writing hall, the wooden works and The Lodge Goods Hall stand out.

The library and archive of the museum, which contains interesting historical items of different characteristics, such as the throne of Seljuq Sultan III. KeyhÃ¼srev, also houses valuable artifacts. The Ethnography Museum in Altindag District, where rare works of Anatolian geography are open to visit every day within certain hours, is one of the best cultural attractions in the capital.

description.en:
The biggest feature of the cable car in the city of Bursa is that it is the first and only cable car in Turkey in the year it was built.


Bursa cable car opened on October 29, 1963 and was merged with the Republic celebrations of that period. The cable car offers a passenger reception hall, shops, cafes and a large car park. KadÄ±yayla station of the cable car, which had two stations in the first period, reaches a height of about 1230 meters, while SarÄ±alan station reaches a height of 1635 meters.


Normally, this area is reached by turning around 300 bends on the road. However, thanks to the cable car moving through SarÄ±alan station, it takes only 12 minutes to reach that distance. Another station, the Second District Hotels station, reaches up to 1800 meters above sea level.


There are currently around 140 cabins within the cable car. Each cabin is ready in an average of 20 seconds. It has a capacity to carry 1500 passengers per 1 hour. Each cabin can accommodate a total of eight people. In the cabins, there is an aerodynamics that prevents concussions. At the same time hydraulic doors and central system reinforce the cable car's strong safety system. Technically, the system is suitable for operation in all seasons and in all climatic conditions. Transportation is carried out without interruption, including rain or snow. Bursa Cable Car, which served with its original technology until 2012, has undergone a radical change since then. After nearly two years of renovation work, the cable car is reunited with the people of Bursa.


This whole restoration process is carried out by an Italian company. One of the symbols of Bursa, the line is operated by Cable Car Holding A.P.. Bursa cable car today has the longest route in Turkey in terms of horizontal length with rope transportation. The cable car, which houses four stations in total, is coloured by shopping shops and entertainment areas. The cable car from TeferrÃ¼c station ends in the famous hotels area in Uludag.

Derzeit befinden sich rund 140 Kabinen in der Seilbahn. Jede Kabine ist in durchschnittlich 20 Sekunden fertig. Es hat die KapazitÃ¤t, 1500 Passagiere in 1 Stunde zu befÃ¶rdern. Jede Kabine bietet Platz fÃ¼r insgesamt acht Personen. In den Kabinen gibt es ein aerodynamisches System, das StÃ¶ÃŸe verhindert. Gleichzeitig verstÃ¤rken hydraulische TÃ¼ren und das zentrale System das starke Sicherheitssystem der Seilbahn. Technisch ist das System fÃ¼r den Betrieb zu jeder Jahreszeit und unter allen klimatischen Bedingungen geeignet. Der Transport erfolgt kontinuierlich, einschlieÃŸlich Regen oder Schnee. Die Bursa-Seilbahn, die bis 2012 mit ihrer ursprÃ¼nglichen Technologie betrieben wurde, verÃ¤ndert sich nach dieser Zeit radikal. Nach zweijÃ¤hriger Renovierung wird die Seilbahn wieder mit den Menschen in Bursa vereint.

description.en:
The religious building, built in 1331 during the reign of the second Ottoman Sultan Orhan Ghazi, stands out as being the first mosque in the city with a zawiyah plan scheme. This type of plan, which was first seen in Iznik in the early 1300s, is also named as â€˜T-planâ€™ due to its longitudinal middle space and having volumes on both sides.


Orhan Ghazi Bey Mosque, which is considered as one of the first examples of early Ottoman architecture, is among the classics with its two sections in its mihrab, its iwans, which are frequently seen in Ottoman architecture, and its last Congregational place. The mosque, which is of great importance in terms of art history, is particularly noted for its colorful decorations. Interior decorations, Rumi folds and various decorations are among the interesting details of the mosque. Orhan Ghazi Bey Mosque, which is a simple and small structure in general, is approximately 17 and a half meters in length and 16 and a half meters in width.


Two minarets are known to have been added to Orhan Ghazi Bey Mosque, whose original minaret is currently visible in ruins, in 1889. In the meantime, it was damaged in 1413 and repaired in 1417, with details such as the year of construction are among those mentioned in the inscription.


In addition to its eaves, the walls of the mosque have distinctive features called as rosettes, and the walls are covered with rubble and brick. In addition, it can be seen that columns taken from Byzantine structures were used in the inner arches.
description.de:
Das religiÃ¶se GebÃ¤ude, das 1331 wÃ¤hrend der Regierungszeit des zweiten osmanischen Sultans Orhan Gazi erbaut wurde, ist die erste Moschee der Stadt mit einem Plan. Dieser Plan-Typ, dessen erstes Beispiel in den frÃ¼hen 1300er Jahren in Iznik angetroffen wurde, wird auch als "T-geplant" bezeichnet, mit seinem mittleren LÃ¤ngsraum und den volumisierten Beidseiten.


Die Orhan Gazi Bey Moschee, die als eines der ersten Beispiele der frÃ¼hen osmanischen Architektur gilt, gehÃ¶rt mit ihren zwei Abschnitten in ihrem Mihrab zu den Klassikern, die in der osmanischen Architektur hÃ¤ufig anzutreffen sind, und dem letzten Versammlungsort. AuffÃ¤llig fÃ¼r die kunstgeschichtliche bunte Dekoration der Moschee. Die Innenausstattung, RumÃ¤nischen-Windungen und verschiedene Dekorationen gehÃ¶ren zu den interessanten Details der Moschee. Die Orhan Gazi Bey Moschee, die im Allgemeinen ein schlichtes und kleines GebÃ¤ude ist, ist ungefÃ¤hr 17,5 Meter hoch und 16,5 Meter breit.


Es ist bekannt, dass der Orhan Gazi Bey Moschee, die ursprÃ¼nglich das einzige Minarett war, das heute in TrÃ¼mmern zu sehen ist, zwei Minarette hinzugefÃ¼gt wurden. In der Zwischenzeit wurde unter anderem in der Inschrift erwÃ¤hnt, dass es 1413 beschÃ¤digt und 1417 repariert wurde, mit Details wie dem Baujahr.


Die WÃ¤nde der Moschee, die mit ihren Elementen, die neben der Traufe Rosetten genannt werden, einzigartige Merkmale aufweisen, sind aus Schutt und Ziegeln gebaut. DarÃ¼ber hinaus ist zu erkennen, dass die SÃ¤ulen aus den byzantinischen Strukturen in den InnenbÃ¶gen verwendet werden.

description.en:
The pavilion built in 1860 by UÅŸakizade Sadik Bey, one of the leading figures of Izmir's commercial life, to stay in the summer months is one of the leading historical values of the city. This is because it is the place where the founder and first president of the Republic of Turkey, Mustafa Kemal AtatÃ¼rk, stayed on various dates during the following years.

It also stands out for being the mansion where he met Latife HanÄ±m, whom she had joined in his life and whose nuptials were held in the Great Hall, on 29 January 1923.

The pavilion, which was established as a school by an educational institution for many years, now serves as a cultural center after the restoration completed in 2001. It is noted that the restoration took many years with an understanding based on the consolidation of the building and the arrangement of the interior.

The first floor of the UÅŸakizade Pavilion, which has three floors, is reached by stairs on either side. There are four rooms on the ground floor below the floor, which is reached by stairs. On the other floor, there are six rooms. The purple panicles on the front draw attention.

description.en:
The Jinn Tower, located in Payas, the town of Payas, which is also famous for its ottoman-era castle, has offered functions for the purpose of monitoring the port in front of it since 1577. The watchtower is located at the heart of the military-important location; When other building wholes around it, such as pier, shipyard, complex, are taken into consideration with the complementary quality of all these strategic works. This historic tower was kind of responsible for the security of many Ottoman structures for centuries. 

The Jinn Tower, which has been restored in its orijinnal form in recent years, is in good condition in general respect. It has a more comprehensive structure with walls that span over a wide area rather than a vertical tower. The stylish entrance door, which also has two short column details, bears simple traces of ottoman architectural tradition. 

There is a cafÃ© in the interior of the Jinn Tower, which is well maintained, including the surrounding area by landscaping. In this way, the Jinn Tower, where you can drink coffee and tea with a beautiful view with its location close to the port, is met with great interest by the residents of the region. Hatay is becoming one of the historical buildings that is also in demand in terms of domestic tourism, especially in the summer months.

description.en:
<html>Dubbed 'Turkey's most beautiful cat', van cat, let's see if the statue is that beautiful too.

These famous cats living in Van have both eyes in different colors. These cats, which are almost a symbol of innocence with their white fur, are loved by the public enough to be statued in the heart of the city. 

Van Cat Statue by Iranian sculptor Jafar Necibi is exactly five and a half meters high. The statue, located on the road to the center of the city, greets all visitors. The Statue of Van Cat, which was completed in two months, creates a smile on the faces of the people in the city. In the meantime, besides the statue regarding the Van cat, we would also like to point out that even a research and conservation center has been established in 1992 in the name of the protection of the species at Van 100th Year University.
</html>

description.en:
GÃ¼lruh Sultan, an important figure in Bursa, was known as the Ottoman Sultan II. Bayezid's wife. She is essentially a concubine, and therefore the knowledge of which nation she is from is not available in the records. However, GÃ¼lruh Sultan is also the mother of one of the most important figures in Turkish history, such as Åehzade AlemÅŸah.


She lives for many years in the palace where she was built within the borders of today's Muradiye. When Alemshah, his son, died when he was still young, Gulruh Sultan decided to settle in Bursa. Suleiman The Magnificent loses his life in the early stages. According to the information provided, GÃ¼lruh Sultan, who died at the age of 70, is buried in the mausoleum at Muradiye mosque. Besides himself, his daughter and grandchildren also lie in this tomb.


GÃ¼lruh Sultan tomb has a square plan architecture. The pulley on the shrine is covered by a large dome. This impressive dome is seen to be covered in lead. Cut stones and vertical bricks are preferred as building material in the wall sections. In the last sections of the walls the Hedgehog Eaves attract attention. Marble jambed windows are prominent in the facade areas of the building. The eaves located just above the iwan at the entrance appear to have been similarly lead-coated; however, this Eaves cannot reach the present day at a large extent. Only small traces can be found in the sections connected to the wall. There are small mihrabs in the side sections of the entrance iwan. Above the door, there is a flattened arch. Today the doors or windows in the shrine retain their authenticity. Trompes are used to move to domes in the interior section, and these trompes are stalactite.


Another striking detail in the GÃ¼lruh Sultan mausoleum is the colored pencil workmanship. When the body walls are examined carefully, it is possible to find traces of pen work. The Tomb of GÃ¼lruh Sultan, which offers important reflections from the woodwork, is located in the Osmangazi District of Bursa.
description.de:
GÃ¼lruh Sultan, eine wichtige Figur fÃ¼r Bursa, ist als Ehefrau des osmanischen Sultans Bayezid dem II. bekannt. Sie ist im Wesentlichen eine Konkubine und existiert daher nicht in den Aufzeichnungen seiner NationalitÃ¤t. GÃ¼lruh Sultan ist jedoch auch Mutter eines der wichtigsten Namen der tÃ¼rkischen Geschichte wie Åehzade AlemÅŸah.

Sie lebt viele Jahre in dem Palast, den sie an den Grenzen des heutigen Muradiye erbaut hat. Als ihr Sohn AlemÅŸah noch in jungen Jahren starb, beschloss GÃ¼lruh Sultan, sich in Bursa niederzulassen. Kanuni Sultan SÃ¼leyman kam in den ersten Perioden ums Leben. Nach den Ã¼bermittelten Informationen ist die im Alter von 70 Jahren verstorbene GÃ¼lruh Sultan im Mausoleum der Muradiye-Moschee begraben. In diesem Schrein liegen auch ihre Tochter und Enkelkinder.

Das GÃ¼lruh Sultan Grab hat eine quadratisch geplante Architektur. Die Riemenscheibe am Grab ist mit einer groÃŸen Kuppel bedeckt. Diese beeindruckende Kuppel scheint mit Blei bedeckt zu sein. Geschnittene Steine â€‹â€‹und vertikale Ziegel werden als Baumaterial in den Wandteilen bevorzugt. Spitzenstreifen machen in den letzten Abschnitten der WÃ¤nde auf sich aufmerksam. In den Fassadenbereichen des GebÃ¤udes fallen Fenster mit Marmorrahmen auf. Es versteht sich, dass die Traufe am Eingang des Iwan am Eingang ebenfalls bleibeschichtet waren; aber dieser Rand kann bis heute nicht in groÃŸem MaÃŸe reichen. Kleine Spuren finden sich nur in den an der Wand befestigten Teilen. Es gibt kleine AltÃ¤re an der Seite des Eingangs vom Iwan. Ãœber der TÃ¼r befindet sich ein flacher Bogen. Heutzutage sind die TÃ¼ren oder Fenster im Schrein authentisch geblieben. Tromps werden verwendet, um zu den Kuppeln im Inneren zu gelangen, und sie sind stalaktitisch.

Ein weiteres bemerkenswertes Detail im Grab von GÃ¼lruh Sultan ist die Buntstiftarbeit. Wenn die KÃ¶rperwÃ¤nde sorgfÃ¤ltig untersucht werden, kÃ¶nnen Spuren von Stiftverarbeitung festgestellt werden. Das GÃ¼lruh Sultan Mausoleum, das stellenweise auch wichtige Reflexionen von Holzarbeiten bietet, befindet sich im Stadtteil Osmangazi in Bursa.

description.en:
Rumkale, one of Gaziantep's tourist attractions, is among the most striking places not only in Turkey but also in the world with its natural beauty and cultural richness.

The whole structure, visited by many local and foreign people every year, consists of parts built on high rocks surrounded by water. Among these the Church, Monastery, water cisterns and ditches stand out. Located on a small peninsula, intertwined with nature and history, transportation to Rumkale is provided by boats. In terms of architecture, Rumkale bears the traces of the Middle Ages, has been referred as Åitamrat, Kal-a Rhomayta throughout history. It has served various civilizations for centuries.

In the beginning of the aspects known to Christians is that Prophet Jesus's One of disciples, Yohannes, came to there for a term. Rumkale, an influential point in the spread of religion in the surrounding regions, is also the subject of a rumor that it was hidden in one of the caves near the copy of the Bible, the Holy Book of Christianity, and then taken further south to Beirut.

What you can see on a trip is sometimes more valuable than what you can research and learn. Rumkale, which accompanies the dance of green and blue together, promises its guests an experience in this direction. In other words, the atmosphere of this place encloses the guests and the wisdom of hundreds of years of life imbibes all over the place.

You can take plenty of photos during your trip to Rumkale, which is about 1.5 hours away from Gaziantep centre and promises a pleasant ambience along the lake.

description.en:
In the 9th century of Van, we are on Ã‡arpanak Island, known as the peninsula, because the nose part is not yet flooded. We examine the Ã‡arpanak Church, which takes its name from the island and preserves all its glory today.

The Church of Ã‡arpanak, built for St. Hrispime, Holy Cross, St. Jean and St. Gragorie, called the 'Holy Four'; used as a monastery in the early periods. By 1462, it was largely renovated by Monk Etienne and Architect Gregoire. The work is carried out by staying true to the original. The church, which achieved its present form in 1712 with the touches of Mimar KoÃ§bar, sheds light on the architectural styles of Armenians living in Mesopotamia.

The Armenian monastic community living in Van has lived in a monastery of the same name on Adir Island for many years. By the 15th century, many years of wars occur in the region, and the murder of The Great Priest Nerses takes its place on the pages of history. After this event, the community leaves Adir Monastery and settles in The Ã‡arpanak Monastery and begins to live there.

When the Ã‡arpanak Church is evaluated architecturally, it is all white, brown and cream ashlar. The main interior of the church, which has a completely artistic architectural approach and used black tuff on the dome part, has a cross-plan. Although the interior lighting of the church is largely provided with eight small windows, the large window on the east wall provides the actual light.
description.de:

Nachdem die Kirche 1712 mit dem Einfluss des Architekten KoÃ§bar ihre heutige Form erreicht hat, beleuchtet sie die architektonischen Stile der in Mesopotamien lebenden Armenier.

Die in Van lebende armenische Klostergemeinschaft lebt seit vielen Jahren im gleichnamigen Kloster auf der Insel Adir. Im 15. Jahrhundert kommt es in der Region zu lang anhaltenden Kriegen, und die Ermordung des Hohepriesters Nerses nimmt ihren Platz auf den Seiten der Geschichte ein. Nach diesem Ereignis lÃ¤sst sich die Gruppe, die das AdÄ±r-Kloster verlÃ¤sst, im Ã‡arpanak-Kloster nieder und beginnt hier zu leben.

Wenn man die Ã‡arpanak-Kirche hinsichtlich ihrer Architektur bewertet, sieht man, dass sie aus weiÃŸem, braunem und cremefarbenem Stein besteht. Das Hauptinnere der Kirche, in dem schwarzer Tuff im Kuppelteil verwendet wird, indem das kÃ¼nstlerische architektonische VerstÃ¤ndnis vollstÃ¤ndig Ã¼bernommen wird, hat einen Kreuzplan. Obwohl die Innenbeleuchtung der Kirche grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils durch acht kleine Fenster gewÃ¤hrleistet ist, sorgt das groÃŸe Fenster an der Ostwand fÃ¼r die eigentliche Beleuchtung.

description.en:
Midyat Guest House is the capital of the soap operas, which has been populared and record-breaking in Europe, especially in the Arabian peninsula and Turki states... The place that amazes those who see it with its architectural grandeur and mystical atmosphere, consisting of embroidered stones such as lace, is also frequented by local and foreign tourists. 

Midyat Guest House, which is one of the most beautiful examples of the architectural integrity of Mardin consisting of yellow limestone, gives people a sense of freshness with its rooms and spacious courtyard, which are arranged in Anatolia in the form of 'L'. Built by carved into the rock at the bottom floor, this structure stands out for its robustness. This three-storey building, where all Midyat can be viewed from the roof section, is the most frequented place for both photography enthusiasts and Anatolian architectural hunters.

Midyat Guest House, which has been particularly influx of foreign tourists due to the soap operas be staged here recently, has an important place in Mardin's cultural tourism. The building, which greets the mesopotamia sun in the most beautiful way, is also in a very easy place in terms of transportation with its surrounding location with many historical sites.
description.de:
Das Midyat Gasthaus ist die berÃ¼hmte Stadt der Serien, die seit kurzem von vielen Menschen in der TÃ¼rkei, insbesondere auf der Arabischen Halbinsel und in Europa, geliebt werden. Der Ort, der die Menschen mit seiner architektonischen Pracht und mystischen AtmosphÃ¤re aus Spitzensteinen fasziniert, ist auch ein Ort, der von einheimischen und auslÃ¤ndischen Touristen besucht wird.

Das Midyat Gasthaus, eines der besten Beispiele fÃ¼r Mardins architektonische IntegritÃ¤t, bestehend aus gelbem Kalkstein, vermittelt ein GefÃ¼hl der Erleichterung. Die Zimmer sind in Form von 'L' Anatolia angeordnet und mit groÃŸem Innenhof. Dieses GebÃ¤ude, das durch Schnitzen des Felsens im Erdgeschoss errichtet wurde, macht durch seine SoliditÃ¤t auf sich aufmerksam. Dieses dreistÃ¶ckige GebÃ¤ude, in dem der gesamte Midyat vom Dach aus beobachtet werden kann, ist der meistbesuchte Ort sowohl fÃ¼r Fotografie-Enthusiasten als auch fÃ¼r anatolische ArchitekturjÃ¤ger.

Das Midyat Gasthaus, das vor allem aufgrund der hier gedrehten Serie von auslÃ¤ndischen Touristen intensiv besucht wurde, hat einen wichtigen Platz im Kulturtourismus von Mardin. Das GebÃ¤ude, das die Sonne in Mesopotamien am besten begrÃ¼ÃŸt, ist aufgrund seiner Lage, umgeben von vielen historischen StÃ¤tten, sehr leicht zu erreichen.

description.en:
The Forestry Museum in Bursa is known as the first museum opened in this area. This interesting museum has been transformed from a historic building known as theâ€™ SaatÃ§i KÃ¶ÅŸkÃ¼ (Clockmaker's Lodge)'.


The pavilion, where Bursa Forestry Museum is located, offers traces of 19th century civic architecture. Bursa Forestry Museum, located on Ã‡ekirge Street, attracts great attention from visitors with its fountain, trees and artifacts in its contents. The pavilion used for the museum is essentially considered as a home for quite some time. Used as â€˜Bursa Forest Schoolâ€™ in 1939. Bursa Regional Forestry Directorate holds the property rights of this place until 1983. The fact that the place continues on its path as Bursa Forestry Museum corresponds to 1989. The owner of the mansion is SaatÃ§Ä±(clockmaker) Ali Effendi, one of the leading figures of Bursa. The details about the decoration in the pavilion fill the eye, especially the decorations in the interior of the pergola is one of the admirable elements.


In the museum, a total of around 3 thousand works about forestry from the Ottoman Empire until today are exhibited. Photographs, historical maps, fossil collections or various materials used in forestry, especially those reflecting the lives of people working in forestry, are displayed in the museum. The 50-million-year-old larch and yellow pine fossils in the fossil collection are exciting. Fossils belonging to redwood and walnut trees in the same area add value to the collection. On the other hand, the works which have been mummified with the aim of introducing the various animals living in the woodlands are also included in the museum.


Tree sections are located in various parts of the museum. In this sense, you can feel yourself in a really dense woodland when you are visiting the museum. You can visit Bursa Forestry Museum to see fauna and flora fossils dating back millions of years. A second example of the Bursa Forestry Museum, which makes significant contributions to Bursa tourism, is not found in our country. The museum can be visited every weekday and is open between 08:00 and 17:00.
description.de:
Das Forstmuseum in Bursa ist als erstes Museum in dieser Gegend bekannt. Dieses interessante Museum wurde von einem historischen GebÃ¤ude namens "Saatci Haus" umgebaut.

Es ist zu sehen, dass das Herrenhaus, in dem sich das Bursa Forestmuseum befindet, Spuren der Zivilarchitektur des 19. Jahrhunderts aufweist. Das Bursa Forestmuseum befindet sich in der Ã‡ekirge StraÃŸe. Mit seinem Brunnen, seinen BÃ¤umen und Werken zieht es die Aufmerksamkeit der Besucher auf sich. Das fÃ¼r das Museum genutzte Haus gilt im Wesentlichen lange Zeit als Haus. Es wird 1939 als "Bursa Waldschule" genutzt. Die regionale Forstdirektion von Bursa besitzt die Eigentumsrechte an diesem Ort bis 1983. Der Veranstaltungsort ist weiterhin das Bursa Forstmuseum, das 1989 entspricht. Der Besitzer des Herrenhauses ist SaatÃ§i Ali Efendi, einer der fÃ¼hrenden Namen in Bursa. WÃ¤hrend die Details der Dekoration in der Villa auffÃ¤llig sind, sind die Dekorationen im Inneren des Hauses bewundernswert.

Im Museum werden im Forstgebiet vom Osmanischen Reich bis heute insgesamt rund 3.000 Kunstwerke ausgestellt. Im Museum werden Fotografien, historische Karten, Fossiliensammlungen oder verschiedene Materialien aus der Forstwirtschaft ausgestellt, die das Leben der in der Forstwirtschaft tÃ¤tigen Menschen widerspiegeln. Spannend sind die 50 Millionen Jahre alten Fossilien aus Schwarzkiefer und Waldkiefer in der Fossiliensammlung. In der gleichen Gegend wird die Sammlung von Fossilien von Mammudbaum- und WalnussbÃ¤umen aufgewertet. Andererseits sind auch Werke im Museum enthalten, deren Mumifizierungsmethoden angewendet wurden, um verschiedene in Waldgebieten lebende Tiere vorzustellen.

In verschiedenen Teilen des Museums gibt es Baumabschnitte. In diesem Sinne kÃ¶nnen Sie sich beim Besuch des Museums in einem sehr dichten Waldgebiet fÃ¼hlen. Besuchen Sie das Bursa Forstmuseum, um die Fossilien der Fauna und Flora mit einer millionenjÃ¤hrigen Geschichte zu sehen. Ein zweites Beispiel des Bursa Forstmuseum, das wichtige BeitrÃ¤ge zum Bursa-Tourismus leistet, gibt es in unserem Land nicht. Das Museum, das wochentags tÃ¤glich besichtigt werden kann, ist zwischen 08:00 und 17:00 Uhr geÃ¶ffnet.

description.en:
<html>Ã‡imenlik Castle in Ã‡anakkale contains some war remains belonging to the Entente states that came from the Aegean Sea and crossed the Sea of Marmara during World War 1 and thus wanted to take over the capital Istanbul.

Among them is the German submarine UB 46, which was thrown into the castle by a British ship on 18 March 1915 but was smashed by a mine by Cannonball left from an explosion in the fortification wall and its remains were removed from the coast. The submarine relic was previously on display at the Istanbul Naval Museum and was brought to Ã‡anakkale in 2008.

On the other hand, various cannons, cannon batteries, mines and other fighting vehicles are on display again on the exterior of the castle. The powder mill building, which was given function as a gallery, can also be seen within the castle. There are also two mosques in the castle: the Fatih Mosque and the Abdul Aziz Mosque.

When the history of the castle is examined, it is known that it was built by Sultan Mehmet The Conqueror and that it was modernized to defend the entrance of the Sea of Marmara during the last period of the Ottoman Empire. It consists of two lines, the outer and inner fortress. The outer wall, which houses nine bastions in total, has a height of 150 x 100 meters and an height of 11 meters.

The inner castle, which functions as a museum, stands out for its 25-metre height in addition to its 42x48-metre measures close to the square. Military materials on the first floor, Cinevision show about the Battle of Ã‡anakkale, the second floor of the layout and the last floor of the various oil paintings can be examined.

Ã‡imenlik Castle, which has been made of Landscape Studies on and around the Sea coast, attracts interest both with its spiritual atmosphere and its landscape.
</html>

Unter ihnen das deutsche U-Boot namens UB 46, das am 18. MÃ¤rz 1915 von einem britischen Schiff in die Burg geworfen wurde, aber von einer Kanonenkugel zerstÃ¶rt wurde, die nicht explodiert an der Wand war, und die Ãœberreste vom Ufer entfernt wurden. Die U-Boot-Ãœberreste wurden zuvor im Istanbul Meer Museum ausgestellt und 2008 nach Ã‡anakkale gebracht.

Auf der anderen Seite sind auf der AuÃŸenseite des Schlosses verschiedene Kanonen, Kanonenbatterien, Minen und andere Kampffahrzeuge ausgestellt. Das Baruthane-GebÃ¤ude, das als Galerie dient, ist auch im Schloss zu sehen. Es ist auch bemerkenswert, dass es in der Burg zwei Moscheen gibt: die Fatih-Moschee und die AbdÃ¼laziz-Moschee.

Wenn man die Geschichte der Burg untersucht, ist bekannt, dass sie von Fatih Sultan Mehmet erbaut und in der letzten Periode des Osmanischen Reiches modernisiert wurde, um den Eingang des Marmarameeres zu verteidigen. Es besteht aus zwei Linien, der Ã¤uÃŸeren und der inneren Burg. Die AuÃŸenwand, an der insgesamt neun Schilder angebracht sind, hat eine Breite / LÃ¤nge von 150 x 100 Metern und eine HÃ¶he von 11 Metern.

Das innere Schloss, das als Museum dient, macht mit seinen Abmessungen von 42 x 48 Metern, die einem Platz nahe kommen, und seiner HÃ¶he von 25 Metern auf sich aufmerksam. MilitÃ¤rische AusrÃ¼stung im ersten Stock, eine Cinevision-Show Ã¼ber die Schlacht von Ã‡anakkale; Sie kÃ¶nnen die Szenen im zweiten Stock und verschiedene Ã–lgemÃ¤lde im letzten Stock untersuchen.

Das an der KÃ¼ste und rund um das Meer angelegte Schloss Ã‡imenlik besticht durch seine spirituelle AtmosphÃ¤re und Landschaft.

description.en:
The Merinos Cultural Park, where Bursa people show great interest especially on weekends, is seen as the oxygen tank of the city. It is one of the two largest urban parks in Bursa. Merinos Green Cultural Park occupies a green area of 252 thousand square meters. In total, there are around 2,500 trees and 11 thousand plants in this huge area. It is possible to mention 81 different species in the trees special.


Besides the natural beauties, various artificial areas that were later incorporated also attract attention. In this sense, a large artificial pond and various ornamental pools can be mentioned. Merinos Cultural Park is also used for various activities throughout the year. There is a large covered car park with a total of one thousand cars in the park. On the other hand, many cafes and restaurants respond to many needs. Walking, jogging or cycling paths are included within the park. Especially during the summer months, people show intense interest in these three trails. On the other hand, there are creative children's play areas in almost every part of the Merinos Cultural Park.


Merinos Cultural Park, which is full of surprises at every point, is almost the heart of the city in terms of social aspect. Within the park, there are various facilities. AtatÃ¼rk Congress and Culture Center is built on the site of the historical Merinos Yarn Factory. This center also hosts many congresses throughout the year.


The intensive efforts of Bursa Metropolitan Municipality between 2006 and 2008 have been instrumental in the creation of Merinos Cultural Park. This place is presented to the public as part of some kind of urban renewal project. The reintroduction of the SÃ¼merbank Merinos Woollen Industrial Weaving Factory to the city on this occasion makes the project even more meaningful.
description.de:
Der Merinos Kulturpark, in dem die Einwohner von Bursa besonders an den Wochenenden groÃŸes Interesse zeigen, gilt als Sauerstoffreservoir der Stadt. Es ist einer der beiden grÃ¶ÃŸten Stadtparks in Bursa. Der Merinos Kulturpark erstreckt sich Ã¼ber eine GrÃ¼nflÃ¤che von 252.000 Quadratmetern. In diesem riesigen Gebiet gibt es rund 2.500 BÃ¤ume und 11.000 Pflanzen. Es ist mÃ¶glich, Ã¼ber 81 verschiedene Baumarten zu sprechen.

Neben den NaturschÃ¶nheiten fallen spÃ¤ter verschiedene kÃ¼nstliche Bereiche auf. In diesem Sinne kÃ¶nnen verschiedene kÃ¼nstliche Becken und groÃŸe kÃ¼nstliche Teiche erwÃ¤hnt werden. Der Merinos Kulturpark wird das ganze Jahr Ã¼ber fÃ¼r verschiedene AktivitÃ¤ten in Betracht gezogen. Es gibt eine groÃŸe Tiefgarage mit insgesamt tausend Autos im Park. Auf der anderen Seite erfÃ¼llen viele CafÃ©s und Restaurants viele BedÃ¼rfnisse. Wander-, Jogging- oder Radwege sind im Park inbegriffen. Besonders im Sommer zeigt sich, dass die Menschen groÃŸes Interesse an diesen drei Strecken zeigen. Auf der anderen Seite gibt es an fast jedem Punkt des Merinos Kulturparks kreative KinderspielplÃ¤tze.

Der Merinos Kulturpark, der voller Ãœberraschungen steckt, ist das soziale Herz der Stadt. Es gibt verschiedene Einrichtungen im Park, insbesondere das AtatÃ¼rk-Kongress- und Kulturzentrum. Das AtatÃ¼rk Kongress- und Kulturzentrum befindet sich in der Gegend, in der sich die historische Merinos Spinnerei befindet. In diesem Zentrum finden das ganze Jahr Ã¼ber viele Kongresse statt.

Die intensiven BemÃ¼hungen der GroÃŸstadtverwaltungBursa zwischen 2006 und 2008 haben zur Schaffung des Merinos-Kulturparks beigetragen. Dies wird der Ã–ffentlichkeit im Rahmen einer Art Stadtumbauprojekt angeboten. Die WiedereinfÃ¼hrung der Wollweberei SÃ¼merbank Merinos in die Stadt bei dieser Gelegenheit macht das Projekt noch bedeutungsvoller.

description.en:
Gaziantep, located in southeastern Turkey, is a city being famous for its natural beauty as well as its historical values. DÃ¼lÃ¼kbaba Natural Park is one of the prominent places in this context.

DÃ¼lÃ¼kbaba Natural Park is located in Åehitkamil district in the north of the city, in an area of 3,60 decares. The wide area, which was granted the status of Natural Park in 2011, includes historical parts such as the ancient city of DÃ¼lÃ¼kbaba, which is a cultural center of attraction as well as its natural landscape texture.

DÃ¼lÃ¼kbaba Natural Park is remarkable for its plant diversity. Calabrian pine, Jackal plum can reach up to 3-4 meters in length, species such as acorn extremely common. In the park, where plants such as thyme, sideritis, zahter (a blend of powdered thyme), kÃ¼skÃ¼t (cuscuta gronovii) stand out, zahter, which is a kind of spice beneficial to local and health, is also found in abundance. On the other hand, there is a relatively small variety of animals in the natural park. The presence of animals such as jackals, foxes and rabbits can be seen in the park, bird species such as sparrow, crow, partridge, hawk, doÄŸan also roam the skies.

The DÃ¼lÃ¼kbaba Natural Park, which can be entered at fairly modest fees, can be biked or hiking. In addition, picnicking and camping with tents are also common in the park, wildlife watching is also quite common activities.

description.en:
The castle, which bears the footprints of the Anatolian Seljuk State, was built in the 12th century by The Sultan of Saltuklu, Melik Ä°zzeddin, and became a symbol of the city.

The Saltuklus are an autonomous people of the Anatolian Seljuk State. The Seljuks, who carried out the 1064 Kars Conquest, one step before the Victory of Malazgirt, give the administration to the Saltuklus after taking the city. The castle, built by The Sultan of Saltuklu, Firuz Akay, at the behest of Melik Izzeddin, becomes the symbol of the city over time.

Kars Castle, one of the most important examples of 12th-century Turkish architecture, is destroyed and looted during the siege of Kars by The Mongolian Emperor Timur. The city, which was very valuable to the Ottoman empire due to its geopolitical position, was the Ottoman Sultan of the period. Murad III. sends Grand Vizier Lala Mustafa Pasha to make architectural arrangements. Pasha, who shaped and repaired the castle in accordance with its original architecture within 16th century, also rebuilt the ruined walls.

Kars Castle, which underwent many restoration works over time, was last destroyed by the Russians for 40 years when Kars was lost during the Ottoman-Russian War of 1877-1878. After the looting it lived for almost half a century, kars castle, which lost its original feature and use, has survived its glory.
description.de:
Die Burg, die auf den Spuren des anatolischen Seldschukenstaates steht, wurde im 12. Jahrhundert vom Sultan von Saltuk Melik Izzeddin erbaut und wurde zum Wahrzeichen der Stadt.

Die SaltukbevÃ¶lkerung ist ein autonomes Volk des anatolischen seldschukischen Staates. Die Seldschuken, die die 1064 Kars-Eroberung verwirklichten, die eine Phase vor dem Manzikert-Sieg lag, Ã¼bergaben die Verwaltung den Saltuk, nachdem sie die Stadt eingenommen hatten. Die Burg, die vom Saltukwesir Firuz Akay auf Befehl des Sultans von Saltuk Melik Izzeddin erbaut wurde, wird in der Zeit zum Wahrzeichen der Stadt.

Die Burg Kars, eines der wichtigsten Beispiele der tÃ¼rkischen Architektur des 12. Jahrhunderts, wird wÃ¤hrend der Belagerung des mongolischen Kaisers Timur in Kars zerstÃ¶rt und geplÃ¼ndert. Der osmanische Sultan Murad der III. der Ã„ra sandte den GroÃŸwesir Erzieher Mustafa Pasha, um architektonische Vorkehrungen fÃ¼r die Stadt zu treffen, die fÃ¼r die Osmanen aufgrund ihrer geopolitischen Lage sehr wertvoll war. Pascha gestaltete das Schloss mit seiner Architektur aus dem 16. Jahrhundert im Einklang mit dem Original um und baute auch die zerstÃ¶rten Mauern wieder auf.

Die Burg Kars, die im Laufe der Zeit viele Restaurierungsarbeiten erlebt hat, wurde von den Russen 40 Jahre lang zerstÃ¶rt, als Kars wÃ¤hrend des Osmanisch-Russischen Krieges von 1877-1878 verloren ging. Das Schloss Kars, das nach fast einem halben Jahrhundert Brandschatzung seine ursprÃ¼ngliche Funktion und Nutzung verloren hatte, hat sich mit seiner Pracht bis heute bewahrt und hat Ã¼berlebt.

description.en:
<html>We stand with Nasreddin Hodja, who tried to add yeast in the lake, claimed the kettle to have given birth and climbed on the donkey reversly. Nasreddin Hodja's stories, which has a separate philosophical thought in each of his ones, which can be described as a laugh, his tomb has a cheerful architecture like himself.

Although the tombs and graves lead their visitors to their thoughts, Nasreddin Hodja's cause a smile on faces. There are generations who can think while laughing because of his stories... He is the one who makes philosophy loved by Turkish youth. From a distance, the tomb, which looks like an Ottoman classical architectural example, is almost cheeres as you go near it. The green-colored cone-shaped roof section and the tomb, which encompasses every beam of light of the sun with its 10 separate openings, provide integrity with the lush trees around it. Nasrettin Hodja Tomb, which greets its visitors through walk furnished with screeful stone, makes people smile with both its architecture and the vividness of their colors. Another important feature of the work is the inscription in which the history of death is written reversly in order to describe Nasrettin Hodja's philosophical humor. Here, the year of death was 386, which was 683 (1284) using the Hijri Calendar.

As long as you leave joyful memories behind you, the tomb, stands as an indicator that death has no meaning, greets everyone with the grave of the most important name in the history of Turkish humor... 

</html>
description.de:
<html>Jetzt sind wir mit Nasreddin Hodja zusammen, der versucht, Joghurt aus dem See zu machen, der behauptet, dass ein Kessel ein anderes Kessel zur Welt bringt und den Esel verkehrt besteigt. Das Grab von Nasreddin Hodja, das in jeder seiner Geschichten einen anderen philosophischen Gedanken hat, der als Humor bezeichnet werden kann, hat eine frÃ¶hliche Architektur wie er selbst.

Obwohl die DenkmÃ¤ler und GrÃ¤ber ihre Besucher in Gedanken versetzen, sorgt Nasreddin Hodja sicherlich fÃ¼r ein LÃ¤cheln auf den Gesichtern. Es gibt Generationen, die denken konnten, wÃ¤hrend sie mit seinen Geschichten lachten, weilâ€¦ Er ist die Person, die Philosophie bei tÃ¼rkischen Jugendlichen populÃ¤r macht. Das Mausoleum, das aus der Ferne wie eine osmanische klassische Architektur aussieht, ist fast so lebendig, wie Sie es in der NÃ¤he sehen. Mit seinem grÃ¼nen kegelfÃ¶rmigen Dachabschnitt und 10 separaten Ã–ffnungen bietet das Mausoleum, das jeden Lichtstrahl enthÃ¤lt, IntegritÃ¤t mit den grÃ¼nen BÃ¤umen um es herum. Treffen Sie die Besucher auf dem gepflasterten Weg. Das Nasrettin Hodja-Grab bringt die Menschen mit seiner Architektur und der Lebendigkeit seiner Farben zum LÃ¤cheln. Ein weiteres wichtiges Merkmal der Arbeit ist die Inschrift, in der das Todesdatum umgekehrt geschrieben ist, um den philosophischen Humor von Nasrettin Hodja zu erklÃ¤ren. Hier wurden 683 (1284) des Todesjahres unter Verwendung des Hijri-Kalenders als 386 angegeben.

Das Mausoleum, das als Zeichen dafÃ¼r steht, dass der Tod keine Bedeutung hat, solange Sie freudige Erinnerungen hinterlassen, begrÃ¼ÃŸt alle mit dem Grab des wichtigsten Namens in der Geschichte des tÃ¼rkischen Humorsâ€¦
</html>

description.en:
Ortahisar AbdioÄŸlu Mosque is one of the Ottoman mosques in NevÅŸehir, the center of Turkey's geographical borders on the Asian continent the mosque is among the symbols of the region. Located in Ortahisar, one of the important cultural points about the recent history of the city famous for its thousands of years of history in Urgup. 

In addition to the fountain in the northside, courtyard and fairly large inscription on the flattened arched gate, the last congregation place on the south side of the courtyard draws attention. Ortahisar AbdioÄŸlu Mosque with its arches, columns and domes, is a simple exemplary entourage that reflects its period very well. Today it is in very good condition and is open to religious worship.

The rectangular planned Ortahisar AbdioÄŸlu Mosque, built with cutstones in 1842, has a 1973 dated minaret in addition to the original minaret, which is not used today. In this respect, the mosque balances the old and new. The historic mosque, which has spiritual and historical importance, is on an extremely easy road and awaits everyone to its  visit the young and old people who travel through the area.

Sie gehÃ¶rt zu den Symbolen der Region.

Neben der recht groÃŸen Inschrift auf dem Brunnen an der Nordseite, dem Innenhof und der flachen BogentÃ¼r fÃ¤llt der letzte Versammlungsort auf der SÃ¼dseite des Innenhofs auf. Die Ortahisar AbdioÄŸlu Moschee ist mit ihren BÃ¶gen, SÃ¤ulen und Kuppeln ein schlichtes Beispiel, die ihre Zeit sehr gut widerspiegelt. Es ist heute in einem sehr guten Zustand und offen fÃ¼r religiÃ¶se Verehrung.

Neben dem ursprÃ¼nglichen Minarett des heutigen unbenutzten Minaretts verfÃ¼gt die Ortahisar AbdioÄŸlu-Moschee, die 1842 aus geschnittenen Steinen erbaut wurde, Ã¼ber ein Minarett aus dem Jahr 1973. In dieser Hinsicht stellt die Moschee ein Ã¼berraschendes Gleichgewicht zwischen Alt und Neu her. Die historische Moschee, die eine spirituelle und historische Bedeutung hat, befindet sich auf einer Ã¤uÃŸerst einfachen Route und wartet darauf, dass jeder ob Jung oder Alt sie besucht, die die Region besuchen.

description.en:
AbacioÄŸlu Khan, which is considered as one of the historical Inns of Izmir, is a place that has been brought into tourism today. The famous inn was built in the 18th century by Haji Mustafa Agha. The repair of the inn takes place by Konak Municipality in 2007. The â€Respect for History and Local Conservation Awards " are awarded to this special inn in the same year. On the other hand, it is the recipient of the Philippe Rotthier European Architecture Award in 2011. These awards increase the popularity of the inn at once. Even those who live in Izmir who do not know the existence of the inn begin to discover it. AbacioÄŸlu Inn is located in the Konak district of Izmir, in the heart of the city. In this sense, it has a very advantageous position in terms of transportation.

The historical KemeraltÄ± Bazaar is the oldest and largest bazaar in Izmir. This bazaar contains many inns. Besides the AbacioÄŸlu Inn, important inns such as KÄ±zlaraÄŸasÄ± Inn and Demir Inn are also worth seeing. The successful restoration of the AbacioÄŸlu Inn and its authentic atmosphere make it a little more prominent. The authenticity of the inn is largely preserved during the restoration process. With a simple and understated texture, the inn has a rather sympathetic image. The cafes in the courtyard of the inn are of great interest. There are also many shops around the inn.

AbacioÄŸlu Inn has decimated itself among the crowd of KemeraltÄ± Bazaar, but it has captured its old popularity. Two-storey buildings stand out in the historic inn, which has a peaceful atmosphere. AbacioÄŸlu Inn, which is also close to the BaÅŸdurak Mosque, has a total of 18 shops in operation today. Mainly gift and jewelry shops are in the foreground.

description.en:
The importance of baths in the Ottoman Empire is explained by religious references. The special emphasis on cleanliness in the Koran makes the baths popular. You can turn your direction to Bursa for rare examples of Ottoman baths.


One of the historical baths that you can visit when you come to Bursa, which is a special city in terms of baths and spas, is ÅengÃ¼l Hammam. This hammam is very close to Ulu(Grand) Mosque. The bath was built by Sultan YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m BeyazÄ±t in the 1400s. The income from this period is intended to provide income to the Grand Mosque. The ÅengÃ¼l Hammam, which reflects the Ottoman bath architecture to a large extent, is included in the single bath class.


It is a small and simple structure in general. The place, which has been repaired many times over time, continues to function as a hammam until the beginning of the Republican period. Today, even if it manages to maintain its physical character, it serves a different purpose. When you arrive in the area where the hammam is today, the silversmiths' shops will welcome you. This small market is active between 10:00 and 17:00. Today, this place is now known as â€˜GÃ¼mÃ¼ÅŸÃ§Ã¼ler Bazaarâ€™.


Rubble stones are used in the walls of the ÅengÃ¼l Hammam, which is also close to bedesten(Ottoman Bazaar). The part of the standoff is covered by a small dome. In this area is the transition to the temperature field in my rectangular shape, which has two iwans. On the other hand, there are two different seclusions in the same area. The boiler is located in the western part of the bath. Written sources say that ÅengÃ¼l Hammam was rented in the first period for 25 akÃ§e (small silver coin). It is severely damaged by major fires and earthquakes over time. Some walls of the standoff area have collapsed. However, it is one of the domes that sits on the pulley and the temperature area reaches as it is today. You can choose public transportation to Osmangazi district to reach ÅengÃ¼l Hammam.

description.en:
Ankara Bagevi is a place to visit with your loved ones throughout the year. The architectural details, in particular, are quite admirable. Reflecting the civil architectural character of Ankara to a certain extent, Ankara Bagevi, on the other hand, contributes greatly to the maintenance of collective memory and its transmission to future generations. Ankara Vineyard House is located in KeÃ§iÃ¶ren district. The place, which is among the last vineyard houses of this region, is also referred as â€˜GedikoÄŸlu Vineyardâ€™ by the local people. The reason for its commemoration is due to Ali GedikoÄŸlu who built the place. He is close to famous business person Vehbi KoÃ§.

Ankara Vineyard House was built in the early 1900s according to the information provided. After a long time, Vehbi KoÃ§ buys this place. A thorough restoration process is undertaken to restore it to its original style. The Vineyard House is donated to Vehbi KoÃ§ Foundation in the name of this restoration. The restoration of Ankara Bagevi results in the signature of Ark Construction. Those involved in this repair are also previously employed at the Sadberk HanÄ±m Museum. Ankara Bagevi, is included in the scope of â€œ1. Cultural assets that need to be protectedâ€.

With a central sofa plan, the kitchen of this quirky and authentic space is located to the left of the ground floor. A section of the kitchen area can come so far intact. Another part is converted to a functional form for visitors. The sofas where the rooms are opened are also known as karnÄ±yarÄ±k(eggplants with minced meat) among the people. The place is interpreted as a transition between Ottoman architecture and Republican-era Vineyard house architecture. This dual architectural understanding can be understood much more clearly, especially upstairs. Both rooms and sofa areas are very large in Ankara Bagevi. Tall cedars in front of the windows add a special atmosphere to the place. The decks are used mostly in winter. Ankara Bagevi, which serves as a museum today, is still connected to VEKAM..

description.en:
<html>There is a stunning museum where the past meets the future in Kastamonu, the historic city in the west of the Black Sea. The City History Museum, which was first opened in Turkey in 2002, is exemplary on behalf of its segment. 

This disparate, ethnographic and artistic value stand out in terms of revealing the last 400 years of a city. 
From a town with no very population to modern structure, the city's advance to the city's historical museum is the outline. A 1904 piano, a giant Kastamonu carpet and other rare works can be seen as part of the museum in a historic building with a stylish garden. 

Objects, things, equipment related to production, tools related to farming, swords, rifles can be examined. Especially the historical photos of the city stand out. 

In the narrative of the process, the graphics are also used takes attention, in this respect, the entrances to the City Museum, which takes visual expression to a rich level, are located in a very central place in the city's Republic Square. The City Museum, the address of those who want to store the history in Kastamonu, is waiting for its visitors. 
</html>
description.de:
<html>In Kastamonu, der historischen Stadt im Westen des Schwarzen Meeres, gibt es ein beeindruckendes Museum, in dem Vergangenheit und Zukunft aufeinander treffen. Es wurde zum ersten Mal im Jahr 2002 in der TÃ¼rkei erÃ¶ffnet, ein Museum fÃ¼r Stadtgeschichte in der TÃ¼rkei und wird im Namen der Segmente als Beispiele genannt. Dieser ausgeprÃ¤gte ethnografische und kÃ¼nstlerische Wert zeichnet sich durch die EnthÃ¼llung der letzten 400 Jahre einer Stadt aus.

Der Zugang der Stadt zu der heutigen modernen Struktur von einer Stadt aus, in der nicht viel BevÃ¶lkerung lebt, bildet die Hauptlinie des Stadtgeschichtlichen Museums. Im Rahmen des Museums in einem historischen GebÃ¤ude mit einem stilvollen Garten sind das Klavier aus dem Jahr 1904, der riesige Kastamonu-Teppich von 1907 und andere seltene Werke zu sehen.

Es ist mÃ¶glich, Objekte, Waren, Produktionswerkzeuge, landwirtschaftliche Werkzeuge, Schwerter und Gewehre zu sehen, die die Besucher auf eine Zeitreise mitnimmt. Besonders die historischen Fotos der Stadt ziehen die Aufmerksamkeit auf sich.

Es entgeht nicht der Aufmerksamkeit, dass die Grafiken auch fÃ¼r die ErzÃ¤hlung des Prozesses verwendet werden. Die EintrÃ¤ge in das Stadtmuseum, das den visuellen Ausdruck auf ein reiches Niveau bringt, befinden sich an einer sehr zentralen Stelle auf dem Platz der Republik. Das Stadtmuseum ist ein Ort fÃ¼r diejenigen, die die Geschichte in Kastamonu aufbewahren mÃ¶chten und wartet auf seine Besucher.

</html>
