description.en:
The parts of Hatay close to the Mediterranean coast are quite lively, especially in summer. The area of attraction changes direction from inland to the coast during these warm eras. In this context, Burnaz beach in Erzin district of the city is quite special... Because it is one of the longest beaches in Turkey. And itâ€™s appreciated for itâ€™s thin, beautiful sand.

Burnaz Beach, which has a staggering length of as 6 km, offers the possibility to enter the sea and sunbathe in a wide area. Some parts of it is dangerous to enter the sea, but it is recommended that they use it carefully, especially those who can not swim, not to enter the sea. 

It is noted that the requirements such as walking paths, eating and drinking areas, excursion recreational facilities are also projected by the public administration. Various studies may have started in this context. 
Burnaz Beach, which is a well-maintained beach that provides  a good time for guests from Hatay and surrounding provinces, not just the city; among the highlights of the entire eastern Mediterranean.

Der Strandteil in der NÃ¤he der MittelmeerstrÃ¤nde in Hatay sind besonders in den Sommermonaten sehr aktiv. Das attraktive Gebiet der Region Ã¤ndert sich in diesen heiÃŸen Monaten von der Richtung des Landesinneren zu den StrÃ¤nden. In diesem Zusammenhang ist der Burnaz Strand im Stadtviertel von Erzin ein besonderer Ort ... Weil er lÃ¤ngster Strand der TÃ¼rkei ist. DarÃ¼ber hinaus wird es mit seinem feinen, schÃ¶nen Sand geschÃ¤tzt.

Der 6 km Ã¼berraschend lange Strand von Burnaz bietet die MÃ¶glichkeit, in einer weiten Umgebung zu schwimmen und sich zu sonnen. An einigen Stellen deuten Anzeichen darauf hin, dass das Schwimmen gefÃ¤hrlich ist. Es wird jedoch empfohlen, vorsichtig zu sein, insbesondere wenn Sie nicht schwimmen kÃ¶nnen.

Es wird aufgezeichnet, dass von der Ã¶ffentlichen Verwaltung nach BedÃ¼rfnissen Orte wie Gehwege, Speise- und GetrÃ¤nkebereiche und tÃ¤glichen Freizeiteinrichtungen entworfen wurden. In diesem Zusammenhang kÃ¶nnten verschiedene Arbeite begonnen haben.

Der fÃ¼r die Familie, die Bewohner der Region, Hatay und die GÃ¤ste aus den umliegenden Provinzen gut geplante Strand von Burnaz zÃ¤hlt zu den wichtigsten Ruhepunkten nicht nur der Stadt, sondern des gesamten Ã¶stlichen Mittelmeers.

Bu sistemler ezan saatlerine gÃ¶re otomatik olarak devreye girer. Ä°hsan DoÄŸramacÄ± 2010 senesinde vefat edince caminin arka bÃ¶lÃ¼mÃ¼nde bir anÄ±t mezar oluÅŸturulur. Ä°hsan DoÄŸramacÄ±, Hacettepe Ãœniversitesiâ€™nin de Kurucusuâ€™dur.
description.en:
The DoÄŸramacÄ±zade Ali Sami Pasha Mosque is one of the most respected mosques in Ankara. The mosque, located in Bilkent District of Ã‡ankaya district, attracts the attention of local visitors all the time. It is stated that this mosque was built by Ihsan DoÄŸramacÄ±. He preferred to build the mosque in the name of his father Ali Sami Pasha at that time. The Ali Sami Pasha Mosque is not open for worship today. The most important feature of this place is that it is the first technological mosque in Turkey. This feature gives the mosque a tourist identity. Erkut ÅahinbaÅŸ is one of the talented figures of his field. Today, this place hosts many concerts, picture galleries or seminars.

Serving as a kind of worship and cultural center, the seminary halls of this quirky mosque are converted to a church or synagogue form, depending on future demands. DoÄŸramacÄ±zade Ali Sami Pasha Mosque , which caters to three different heavenly religions, is built on a 50-acre land. The mosque, whose construction has been going on for two years, has no historical identity. The interior sections of the mosque are predominantly covered in wood. The venue, which is famous for its technological infrastructure, is inaugurated in 2008. The fact that its construction cost an astronomical figure of $ 15 million creates a lot of controversy at a time. Ihsan DoÄŸramacÄ± will attend the opening in person. When you arrive here in your private car, you can use the parking area of the mosque.

Intelligent building systems are applied in the architecture of the mosque. Especially the lighting, ventilation and heating systems, are admired. These systems are automatically activated according to the hours of the adhan. When Ihsan DoÄŸramacÄ± passed away in 2010, a mausoleum was created in the rear section of the mosque. Ihsan DoÄŸramacÄ± is the founder of Hacettepe University.

description.en:
Geyve Han, one of the symbol places of Bursa city, is also known as â€˜Guild Khanâ€™ among the people. The purpose of the khan built by Hajii Ivaz Pasha in the 1400s was to provide economic income to the Greenl Mosque, one of the important mosques of the city at that time.


The Geyve Khan, presented as a gift to Sultan Of The Ottoman Empire I.Mehmet, is located inside DemirkapÄ± Bazaar and has two gates in total. The gate in the western section corresponds with the Masjid. Like many inns in Bursa, this place has two floors. There are also 26 rooms on the ground floor of Geyve Khan. The number of rooms on the second floor is 30. The khan is generally built with rubble stones and brick materials. The name Geyve Khan corresponds to the 17th century.


Until today, the place has names such as IrmÃ¼Ã§iler Inn, PayÄ±gah Inn. Geyve Khan, where local and foreign tourists still show intense interest, is today filled with shops selling textile materials. Geyve Khan is located in the most active part of the YorgancÄ±lar(quilt maker) Bazaar. This situation is effective in keeping the inn alive for many years in commercial terms. It is known that a barn was located on the ground floor when the inn was first built. In time, this section will disappear. The porches and courtyard in front of the rooms in Geyve Khan, whose last repair process took place in 2007, have their original identity.


To reach Geyve Khan, one must follow Republic Street and turn towards Koza Khan. When you return here, you will see that Geyve Khan is just to your right. The inn is also close to Zafer Plaza and GÃ¶kÃ§en Plaza. Both the foot parts and arches of the inn are made of brick. The chamber parts of the khan, which have Hedgehog eaves, are covered with vaults.
description.de:
Geyve Khan, einer der Symbolorte der Stadt Bursa, ist unter den Menschen auch als "Lonca Khan" bekannt. Der Zweck des von HacÄ± Ä°vaz Pasha im 14. Jahrhundert erbauten GebÃ¤udes ist Bereitstellung des wirtschaftlichen Einkommens fÃ¼r die YeÅŸil-Moschee, eine der wichtigsten Moscheen der damaligen Stadt.

Geyve Khan, der dem osmanischen Sultan Mehmet I. geschenkt wurde, befindet sich im DemirkapÄ±-Bazaar und hat insgesamt zwei TÃ¼ren. Die TÃ¼r im westlichen Teil befindet sich gegenÃ¼ber der Masjid. Wie die vielen GasthÃ¤user in Bursa hat dieser Ort zwei Stockwerke. Geyve Khan hat auch 26 Zimmer im Erdgeschoss. Die Anzahl der Zimmer im zweiten Stock betrÃ¤gt 30. Es ist zu sehen, dass das Gasthaus im Allgemeinen aus Schutt und Ziegel gebaut wurde. Der Name Geyve Khan entspricht hier dem 17. Jahrhundert.

Bis heute hat der Ort auch Namen wie ÃœtÃ¼cÃ¼ler Khan, PayÄ±gah Khan. Geyve Khan, wo einheimische und auslÃ¤ndische Touristen immer noch groÃŸes Interesse zeigen, ist heute voller GeschÃ¤fte, die Textilmaterialien verkaufen. Es befindet sich im aktivsten Teil des Geyve Khan Steppdeckenhersteller Bazaars. Diese Situation ist wirksam, um das Gasthaus kommerziell lang zu halten. Es ist bekannt, dass es im Erdgeschoss eine Scheune gab, als das Gasthaus gebaut wurde. Mit der Zeit geht dieser Abschnitt verloren. Im Geyve Khan, dessen letzter Reparaturprozess 2007 stattfand, haben die Veranden und InnenhÃ¶fe vor den Zimmern ihre einzigartige IdentitÃ¤t.

Um Geyve Khan zu erreichen, muss man der Cumhuriyet Strasse folgen und zum Koza Khan abbiegen. Wenn Sie hierher abgebogen sind, werden Sie sehen, dass Geyve Khan auf Ihrer rechten Seite ist. Das Gasthaus liegt auch in der NÃ¤he der Zafer Plaza und der GÃ¶kÃ§en Plaza. Sowohl die unteren Teile als auch die BÃ¶gen des Gasthauses bestehen aus Ziegeln. Die Zimmerteile des Gasthauses mit SpitzrÃ¤ndern sind mit GewÃ¶lben bedeckt.

description.en:
<html>Located between Fethiye town of MuÄŸla and Kalkan town of Antalya and Patara ancient city, one of the most popular ancient cities in Turkey, is located within the borders of OvagelmiÅŸ village in the southwestern part of the famous Xanthos Valley.

The ancient city of Patara, which is one of the oldest cities in Lycia, has been excavating since 1988. It is possible to find artifacts from the Middle Bronze Age, Iron Age and many other periods in this ancient settlement, whose name is referred as â€˜Patarâ€™ in Hittite texts dated to the 13th century before Islam. The ancient city, whose name is known as Patara in the Lycian language, became the pioneer city of Lycia after it came under the rule of Ptolemaios in the 3rd century before Islam. After that, Patara, the capital of the Union of Lycia, experienced its golden age in this period.

The ancient city of Patara, which continued to flourish during the Byzantine period, becomes an important center for Christians in time. In fact, it is worth saying that Santa Claus, whose real name is Saint Nicholas, is also from Patara. However, the magnificent Roman triumphal arch first attracts attention at the entrance of the ancient city of Patara, which was an important city during the Middle Ages. KurÅŸunlu Tepe, located in the southern part of the city, and the theatre just below it are definitely worth seeing. The Parliament Building, which is also known to host timely meetings, and the hole belt, which is located to the north of Firnaz Pier, can also be seen.

Between April 15 and October 2 at 08:30-19:30, between October 3 and April 14 at 08:30-17:00, you can visit the ancient city of Patara, where you can get access with Patara dolmush from Kas and Kalkan.
</html>

description.en:
<html>There is no doubt that Antalya, the Pearl of the Mediterranean, is full of history... Numerous archaeological monuments, cities, ports and structures that have survived from the Roman period in the region, which has been the scene of civilizations for centuries due to factors such as climate and geographical location, retain their existence even today. One of them is the ancient city of Selge, which is 250 meters high, which takes 1.5 hours to turn off the Antalya-Alanya Highway.

The partially standing fortifications from the entrance of the ancient Roman settlement in the northern part of the Taurus Mountains bear traces of two temples dedicated to Zeus and Artemis.Among the ruins of the ancient city, there are the large bazaar place, cemetery and monumental fountain building and a church built in Byzantine times after centuries of Rome. With the other section as ruins, a long street with a colonnaded entrance in the southeastern part of the historic city, a bathhouse and the ruins of an agora fill the eye.

Again, some of the 9 thousand-person theater ruins, which are similar to Horseshoe, can be seen even today. The ruins of the stadium are also encountered near the theatre. Here, it is possible to see the traces of the living places.

With its traces from the depths of history, the ancient city of Selge is one of the most photographed places in Antalya, where cultural tourism enthusiasts often visit.

</html>
description.de:
Es besteht kein Zweifel, dass Antalya, die Perle des Mittelmeers, voller Geschichte ist ... Mit seinen Faktoren wie Klima und geografischer Lage haben unzÃ¤hlige archÃ¤ologische Artefakte, StÃ¤dte, HÃ¤fen und GebÃ¤ude, die von der RÃ¶merzeit bis heute erhalten geblieben sind, ihre Existenz bewahrt. Eine davon ist die 250 Meter hohe antike Stadt Selge, die nach einer Abweichung 1,5 Stunden von der Autobahn Antalya-Alanya entfernt ist.


Die Stadtmauern, die teilweise seit dem Eingang der antiken rÃ¶mischen Siedlung im nÃ¶rdlichen Teil des Taurusgebirges stehen, weisen Spuren von zwei Tempeln auf, die Zeus und Artemis gewidmet sind. Unter den Ruinen der antiken Stadt befinden sich insbesondere der groÃŸe Marktplatz, der Friedhof und das monumentale BrunnengebÃ¤ude Eine Kirche, die zu byzantinischen Zeiten nach Rom erbaut wurde, zieht die Aufmerksamkeit auf sich. Der andere Abschnitt in Form von Ruinen, die lange StraÃŸe mit einem Kolonnadeneingang im sÃ¼dÃ¶stlichen Teil der historischen Stadt, das Bad und die Ruinen einer Agora fallen auf.


Auch hier sind noch heute einige SitzplÃ¤tze der Theaterruine mit 9.000 SitzplÃ¤tzen zu sehen, die einem Hufeisen Ã¤hnelt. Reste des Stadions befinden sich ebenfalls in der NÃ¤he des Theaters. Hier sind auch die Spuren der Sitze zu sehenâ€¦


Die antike Stadt Selge gehÃ¶rt mit ihren Spuren aus den Tiefen der Geschichte zu den am meisten fotografierten Orten von Antalya, die hÃ¤ufig von Kulturtouristen besucht werden.

description.en:
<html>The enormous inn built by Syrian Musa Samas in Mardin, which has been home to Syrians for many years, has been challenging time since 1903.

Mardin, a bridge connecting Mesopotamia and Anatolian lands, is home to many civilizations in its thousands of years of history. The city, which has been the capital of Syrians for a long time, also bears great traces from the Syrians people and its culture. In 1903, Musa Samas, one of the Syrian citizens of Mardin, built an inn with its savings. The inn, which was used as a barn and slaughterhouse of the owner and the city's people during the early periods, was also a accommodation center for traders who came to Midyat. 

GelÃ¼ÅŸke Inn, which became the market for midyat people between 1950 and 1970, also abolished the public bazaar because the city's settlement plan changed in the 1980s. GelÃ¼ÅŸke Inn, desolate for a while, is later bought by an entrepreneur named Veli Gunes. After renovation and repair work, the inn becomes a restaurant and accommodation center. GelÃ¼ÅŸke Inn, who is described as the new pupil of the city, is one of the food and drink points that tourists visiting Mardin today do not return without stopping.

GelÃ¼ÅŸke Inn, it amazes all tourists with its handcrafted decorations and preserves its historical texture on its walls today, is one of the most popular spots in Mardin, though not the oldest.
</html>
description.de:
<html>Das prÃ¤chtige Gasthaus des assyrischen Musa Samas in Mardin, in dem seit vielen Jahren Syrer leben, steht seit 1903 fest.

Mardin, eine BrÃ¼cke zwischen Mesopotamien und anatolischen LÃ¤ndern, beherbergt in seiner jahrtausendealten Geschichte viele Zivilisationen. Die Stadt, die lange Zeit die Hauptstadt der Assyrer war, hat viele Spuren des syrischen Volkes und der syrischen Kultur. Musa Samas, einer der syrischen BÃ¼rger von Mardin, baute 1903 mit seiner Erfahrung ein Gasthaus. Das Gasthaus, das in den ersten Bauphasen als Stall und Schlachthof der StadtbevÃ¶lkerung mit seinem Besitzer genutzt wurde, war auch ein Unterkunftszentrum fÃ¼r die Kaufleute, die nach Midyat kamen.

GelÃ¼ÅŸke Khan, der zwischen 1950 und 1970 zum Markt fÃ¼r Midyat wurde, wurde, als sich der Grundrissplan der Stadt in den 1980er Jahren Ã¤nderte, entfernt,. GelÃ¼ÅŸke Khan, wo eine Weile nichts vorbeifuhr, wird spÃ¤ter vom Unternehmer namens Veli GÃ¼neÅŸ gekauft. Das Gasthaus wird nach Renovierungs- und Reparaturarbeiten zu einem Restaurant und Unterkunftszentrum. GelÃ¼ÅŸke Khan, der als neuer Wert der Stadt bezeichnet wird, ist eine Ess-und Trinkstelle, die von den Touristen oft besucht wird.

GelÃ¼ÅŸke Khan, das alle Touristen mit seinen handgefertigten Ornamenten an den WÃ¤nden bewundert und seine historische Struktur bewahrt, ist einer der beliebtesten Orte Mardins.
</html>

description.en:
<html>The Palace Bridge is built just above the Tunca River in SarayiÃ§i, one of the most important areas of Edirne. The bridge is also referred  as the Kanuni Bridge. The Palace Bridge is said to be built by Suleyman the magnificent in 1560. At that time, Kanuni commissioned Mimar Sinan to build Libra and Justice KasrÄ± in addition to this work. However, there is no certainty about this issue. The bridge is made up of chipped stone material and is around 80 metres in total. The Kanuni or Palace Bridge is closed to traffic as of today. Therefore, visitors can easily walk on it.

Immediately at the end of the Palace Bridge, there is the square place reserved for the famous â€˜KÄ±rkpÄ±nar Oil Wrestlingâ€™. The spectators, which occurred during the period of Wrestling, also show intense interest in the Palace Bridge. The Justice Council itself is very close to this area. The bridge will only take a year to build. Its total length is around 60 metres. The road width is measured as 4.5 meters. The eye parts of the bridge are located on both sides of the foot in the middle. The Palace Bridge is one of the four-eyed bridges. Bridge feet do not currently have draining eyes.

It is recorded that the Palace Bridge was severely damaged in the great flood of 1902. The last major repair to the bridge took place in 2006. The bridge serves as an important link between SarayiÃ§i and Tunca Island. This is exactly why the people call it â€˜Palace Bridgeâ€™ instead of â€˜Kanuni Bridgeâ€™. The Kanuni Bridge, which is one of the most beautiful bridges in Edirne, is also considered one of the masterpieces of Mimar Sinan. So it fills the eye with its place in the glory of simplicity.

As of today, the bridge is officially connected to the General Directorate of Highways. The structure, in which smooth cut stones are preferred in its construction, attracts attention with its pointed arches.
</html>

Die Saray-BrÃ¼cke befindet sich direkt Ã¼ber dem Fluss Tunca in SarayiÃ§i, einem der wichtigsten Gebiete von Edirne. Die BrÃ¼cke ist auch als Kanuni-BrÃ¼cke bekannt. Es wird gesagt, dass die PalastbrÃ¼cke 1560 von Suleiman dem PrÃ¤chtigen erbaut wurde. Zu dieser Zeit lieÃŸ Kanuni zusÃ¤tzlich zu dieser Arbeit den Waagen- und Justizpavillon von Mimar Sinan errichten. Es gibt jedoch keine bestimmte Stadt in Bezug auf dieses Problem. Die BrÃ¼cke besteht aus abgebrochenem Steinmaterial und ist insgesamt etwa 80 Meter lang. Die Kanuni- oder PalastbrÃ¼cke ist heute fÃ¼r die StraÃŸenverkehr gesperrt. Daher kÃ¶nnen Besucher leicht darauf laufen.

Am Ende der PalastbrÃ¼cke befindet sich der Platz, der dem berÃ¼hmten 'KÄ±rkpÄ±nar Oil Wrestling' vorbehalten ist. Die Zuschauer, die wÃ¤hrend der Wrestling-Zeit stattfinden, zeigen groÃŸes Interesse an der Palast BrÃ¼cke. Der Justizpavillon befindet sich ebenfalls ganz in der NÃ¤he dieses Gebiets. Der Bau der BrÃ¼cke dauert nur ein Jahr. Die GesamtlÃ¤nge betrÃ¤gt rund 60 Meter. Die StraÃŸenbreite wird mit 4,5 Metern gemessen. Die Augenteile der BrÃ¼cke befinden sich auf beiden Seiten des Mittelbeins. Die PalastbrÃ¼cke ist eine der vierÃ¤ugigen BrÃ¼cken. Derzeit befinden sich keine Ablauftaschen an den BrÃ¼ckenpfeilern.

Es wird berichtet, dass die PalastbrÃ¼cke bei der groÃŸen Flut im Jahr 1902 schwer beschÃ¤digt wurde. Die letzte grÃ¶ÃŸere Reparatur der BrÃ¼cke fand 2006 statt. Die BrÃ¼cke ist eine wichtige Verbindung zwischen SarayiÃ§i und der Insel Tunca. Dies ist genau der Grund, warum die Leute diesen Ort "PalastbrÃ¼cke" anstelle von "Kanuni-BrÃ¼cke" nennen. Die Kanuni-BrÃ¼cke, die zu den schÃ¶nsten BrÃ¼cken von Edirne gehÃ¶rt, gilt auch als eines der Meisterwerke von Mimar Sinan. Daher beeindruckt es mit seinem Platz in der Pracht der Einfachheit.

Heute ist die BrÃ¼cke offiziell der Generaldirektion Autobahnen angeschlossen. Die Struktur, in der glatt geschnittene Steine â€‹â€‹bevorzugt werden, macht mit ihren SpitzbÃ¶gen auf sich aufmerksam.

description.en:
The famous Muradiye Complex in Bursa houses building communities such as mosques, madrasahs, shrines and baths. The most important feature of this place is that it is recorded as the last complex created by the Ottoman sultans themselves. Ä±N Muradiye Complex, Sultan II. Murat's signature is visible. This place also gives its name to the neighborhood it is connected to. In the complex, especially the tombs are of great interest. These shrines are enlarged with various additions over time. New additions are made to the complex during the periods of Fatih Sultan Mehmet and Kanuni Sultan. Together with the recent additions, 12 shrines are open to visitors in the region known as Muradiye shrines.


It is possible to mention the graves of 40 people belonging to the dynasty due to the excess of the crates in it. This large complex, which also houses the shrines, is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage site in 2014. UNESCO has a particular interest in CumalÄ±kÄ±zÄ±k.


Bursa is referred asâ€™ City of shrines'. In this case, the share of this great complex is large. Only members of the Ottoman dynasty are allowed in Muradiye shrines. Shrines like GÃ¼lÅŸah Hatun Tomb, Concubines Tomb, Ebe Hatun Tomb, GÃ¼lruh Hatun Tomb, Åehzade Ahmet Tomb, HÃ¼ma Hatun tomb and Åehzade Mustafa Tomb are among the most visited in Muradiye Tombs.


The group of shrines in the Muradiye Complex is in the middle of the imaret and the bath. The area is somewhat more dispersed compared to other complexities. Only one Sultan's body is found in Muradiye shrines. In shrines, usually sultan wives, prince wives, concubines or tombs directly belonging to princes are encountered. The only sultan's tomb located here belongs to II.Murat. Two of the shrines are designed to be open. The average of two to six crates are found in each tomb. When you visit this place, you can find traces of not only the Ottoman but also the Seljuk cupola tradition.
description.de:
Es beherbergt Baugemeinschaften wie Moscheen, Medresen, GrÃ¤ber und tÃ¼rkische BÃ¤der im berÃ¼hmten Muradiye-Komplex in Bursa. Das wichtigste Merkmal dieses Ortes ist, dass er als letzter Komplex der osmanischen Sultane aufgezeichnet wurde. Die Unterzeichnung von Sultan Murat ist im Muradiye-Komplex zu sehen.Dieser Ort gibt auch dem Bezirk seinen Namen, mit dem er verbunden ist. Besonders der Grababschnitt stÃ¶ÃŸt auf groÃŸes Interesse an dem Komplex. Diese GrÃ¤ber werden im Laufe der Zeit durch verschiedene ErgÃ¤nzungen vergrÃ¶ÃŸert. WÃ¤hrend der Zeit von Fatih Sultan Mehmet und Kanuni Sultan wurde der Komplex neu erweitert. Mit den neuesten ErgÃ¤nzungen sind 12 GrÃ¤ber fÃ¼r Besucher in der als Muradiye-GrÃ¤ber bekannten Region geÃ¶ffnet.

Es ist mÃ¶glich, Ã¼ber die GrÃ¤ber von 40 Personen zu sprechen, die der Dynastie angehÃ¶ren, da die Sarkophage darin Ã¼bermÃ¤ÃŸig vorhanden sind. Dieser groÃŸe Komplex, in dem sich auch GrÃ¤ber befinden, wurde 2014 in die Liste des UNESCO-Weltkulturerbes aufgenommen. Die UNESCO widmet CumalÄ±kÄ±zÄ±k besondere Aufmerksamkeit.

Bursa ist als "Stadt der GrÃ¤ber" bekannt. In diesem Fall ist der Anteil dieses groÃŸen Komplexes groÃŸ. Nur Mitglieder der osmanischen Dynastie sind in den Muradiye-GrÃ¤bern enthalten. In den Muradiye-GrÃ¤bern gehÃ¶ren GrÃ¤ber wie das GÃ¼lÅŸah-Hatun-Grab, das Konkubinengrab (Cariyeler Grab), das Ebe-Hatun-Grab, das GÃ¼lruh-Hatun-Grab, das Åehzade-Ahmet-Grab, das HÃ¼ma-Hatun-Grab und das Åehzade-Mustafa-Grab zu den meistbesuchten.

Die Gruppe der GrÃ¤ber im Muradiye-Komplex befindet sich in der Mitte des Ortes, an dem sich das Badehaus befindet. Die Region ist im Vergleich zu anderen Komplexen etwas unordentlich. In Muradiye-GrÃ¤bern gibt es nur einen Sultan. SultangrÃ¤ber, FÃ¼rstenfrauen, Konkubinen oder GrÃ¤ber, die direkt den FÃ¼rsten gehÃ¶ren, sind in den GrÃ¤bern anzutreffen. Das einzige Sultan-Mausoleum gehÃ¶rt dem II. Murat. Zwei der GrÃ¤ber sind offen gestaltet. In jedem Grab gibt es zwischen zwei bis sechs Sarkophage. Wenn Sie hierher kommen, finden Sie Spuren nicht nur aus der osmanischen, sondern auch aus der seldschukischen Kuppeltradition.

description.en:
50. Year Park is located in Ã‡ankaya, Ankara. The opening of the park, which is located exactly in Cebeci district, takes place in 1970. On that date, the opening events will coincide with the 50th year of the Republic. Therefore, the opening takes place in a very crowded and enthusiastic manner. The 50.Year Park located at a peak point covers an area of 130 thousand square meters in total. The park has a very pleasant view as it is built on a high area. When you come to the park you can feel like almost the whole of Ankara is under your feet. The most important reason for the intense interest here is this view.

The 50. Year Park was almost rebuilt in 2009. The park, which is largely undergoing renovation, is reopened to service after a long wait. The park includes a large green field, an open-air theater, an ice rink, a football field, and a picnic area. One of the most interesting features is that it has the tallest flagpole in Europe. This pole is also second in the world. You're likely to encounter people who often take photos in front of the flagpole. 50. Year Park is a navigational terrace for the people of Ankara.

The pond within the park is spread over an area of 4,800 square meters. At the same time, 35 thousand flowers and around 3,300 trees turn this place into an oxygen tank. In 50.Year Park, one of the largest green areas in Ankara, activities and events are at a level that will appeal to people of all ages. Here you can play basketball or football or you can run if you want. At the same time, a good opportunity to gain experience in ice skating awaits you.Due to the presence of modern lighting systems in 50.Year Park, you can spend time with your loved ones here until late.

description.en:
Erzurum in the east of Turkey continues to contain hundreds of works it has carried to the present day, embracing many cultures and civilizations for centuries. This distinguished city, which can reflect thousands of years of history even with its relic works, takes an exemplary stance on world societies with its polyphony.

Dervis Aga Mosque, one of the religious structures that attracts attention with its elegant minaret and simplicity of Erzurum, is home to worship and visitors in Yakutiye district of Erzurum.

The mosque, which was first made over by Haji Dervis Ibrahim Aga in 1717 for the worship of the people, was repaired and opened to worship by MÃ¼derris Haji Mustak in 1845 after being damaged. Dervish Aga Mosque has since fascinated everyone who passes trough the road with its mystical and elegant face.

The mosque, which has a square plan, is located in the single-domed mosque class. It amazes those who see it with its columns, decorations and fine craftsmanship. The altar of the historic building with the inscription of repairs pointing to the date of 1845 on the entrance gate is made of stone and minberi a wood. The mosque, which is also home to the Tomb of Dervis Aga in its courtyard, is among structures must be seen in Erzurum.
description.de:
Erzurum im Osten der TÃ¼rkei, das seit Jahrhunderten viele Kulturen und Zivilisationen umfasst, enthÃ¤lt weiterhin Hunderte von Werken, die es heute noch trÃ¤gt.Diese angesehene Stadt, die auch mit ihren Ruinen Jahrtausende alte Geschichte widerspiegeln kann, zeigt mit ihrer Vielfalt eine vorbildliche Haltung fÃ¼r die Weltgesellschaften.
Die DerviÅŸ AÄŸa-Moschee, eines der religiÃ¶sen Bauwerke, das durch sein elegantes Minarett und seine Einfachheit auffÃ¤llt, ist die Heimat derer, die im Yakutiye-Viertel in der â€œMoscheenweltâ€ Erzurum beten und besuchen.

Die Moschee, die HacÄ± DerviÅŸ Ä°brahim AÄŸa 1717 der Verehrung des Volkes widmete, wurde restauriert und nach seiner BeschÃ¤digung 1845 fÃ¼r den Gottesdienst geÃ¶ffnet. Die DerviÅŸ AÄŸa Moschee fasziniert seit Jahren auf einer mystischen und eleganten Weise jeden, die vorbeigekommen.

Die Moschee, die einen quadratischen Grundriss hat, gehÃ¶rt zur Klasse einer einkuppeligen Moschee. Es beeindruckt diejenigen, die es sehen, mit seinen SÃ¤ulen, Ornamenten und seiner feinen Verarbeitung. Der Altar des historischen GebÃ¤udes, an dessen EingangstÃ¼r eine Reparaturinschrift mit der Aufschrift 1845 angebracht ist, besteht aus Stein, die Kanzel aus Holz. Die Moschee, in deren Innenhof sich auch das DerviÅŸ AÄŸa-Mausoleum befindet, gehÃ¶rt zu den Bauwerken, die in Erzurum zu sehen sind.

description.en:
When you come to the city of Bursa, you will see that there are many historical khans that welcome you here. One of them, the Salt Khan, has been home to travelers from nice throughout its history. Salt Khan, which has been used as an important accommodation and Recreation Area for many years, is built by Omur Bey. Omur Bey is known as the son of TimurtaÅŸ. Construction of the khan corresponds to the year 1454. The Salt Market in the same region is created with the idea of providing income to the mosque. In fact, it functions in this way for many years. As with other Ottoman Khans, a courtyard is located in the middle section. Around this courtyard, the rooms with porches in front draw attention. The last restoration at the salt market took place in 2007. It continues to serve actively again immediately after this restoration. The restoration process is continued entirely by Osmangazi Municipality. At that time, khan was included in the â€˜Cultural Road Revitalization Projectâ€™.


Today, cut stones and bricks are used in the walls of the historic site, which is side by side with the Salt Bazaar Mosque.Salt Khan, which has a rectangular plan, has 35 rooms at the top. 18 of these rooms are located on the lower side and 17 are located on the second and last floor. A stone foundation with some basic information about the khan is immediately visible in the front facade section. Information about when and by whom the khan was built can be obtained from here.


The street where the khan is located passes as TuzpazarÄ±(Saltbazaar) Street. When the khan was most active, especially the shops where salt and various spices were sold were in the foreground. That's why it's called The Salt Khan. The Salt Khan occupies an area of approximately 100 square meters in total. When you visit the khan today, you will find a variety of shops serving mainly in areas such as textiles or crafts.

Wenn Sie in die Stadt Bursa kommen, werden Sie feststellen, dass Sie hier von vielen historischen GasthÃ¤usern begrÃ¼ÃŸt werden. Einer von ihnen, Tuz Khan, hat im Laufe der Geschichte viele Passagiere aufgenommen. Tuz Khan, das seit vielen Jahren eine wichtige Unterkunft und RuhestÃ¤tte ist, wurde von Omur Bey gebaut. Omur Bey ist als Sohn von TimurtaÅŸ bekannt. Der Bau des Gasthauses entspricht 1454 Jahren. Es wurde mit dem Gedanken geschaffen, der Tuz PazarÄ± Moschee in derselben Region Einkommen zu verschaffen. In der Tat funktioniert es seit vielen Jahren in dieser Art. Wie in anderen osmanischen GasthÃ¤usern befindet sich im Mittelteil ein Innenhof. Rund um diesen Innenhof ziehen RÃ¤ume mit Portiken an der Vorderseite die Aufmerksamkeit auf sich. Die letzte Restaurierung auf dem Tuz (Salz) Markt findet 2007 statt. Es dient unmittelbar nach dieser Restaurierung wieder aktiv. Der Restaurierungsprozess wird vollstÃ¤ndig von der Gemeinde Osmangazi durchgefÃ¼hrt. Zu dieser Zeit war das Gasthaus ein Teil des 'Belebungsprojekts von der Kulturstreckeâ€.


Heute werden an den WÃ¤nden des historischen Ortes neben der Tuz PazarÄ± Moschee geschnittene Steineâ€‹â€‹und Ziegel verwendet. Das rechteckig geplante Tuz Khan verfÃ¼gt Ã¼ber insgesamt 35 Zimmer. 18 dieser Zimmer befinden sich im unteren und 17 im zweiten und letzten Stock. Ein Steinfundament mit einigen grundlegenden Informationen Ã¼ber die Fassade fÃ¤llt sofort auf. Informationen darÃ¼ber, wann und von wem das Gasthaus gebaut wurde, finden Sie hier.


Die StraÃŸe, in der sich das Gasthaus befindet, ist als TuzpazarÄ± StraÃŸe bekannt. In der Zeit, wo das Gasthaus am aktivsten ist, stehen vor allem die GeschÃ¤fte im Vordergrund, in denen Salz und verschiedene GewÃ¼rze verkauft werden. Deshalb heiÃŸt es hier Tuz Khan. Tuz Khan umfasst eine FlÃ¤che von insgesamt rund 1.100 Quadratmetern. Wenn Sie das Gasthaus heute besuchen, kÃ¶nnen Sie auf verschiedene GeschÃ¤fte stoÃŸen, die in Bereichen wie Textilien oder Kunsthandwerk tÃ¤tig sind.

description.en:
<html>The mansion, which the Founder of the Republic of Turkey and the first President Mustafa Kemal Ataturk visited in Konya, serves as a museum today. 

Ataturk House Museum, which can be visited free of charge, includes numerous photographs on the War of Independence. The museum Ataturk's personal belongings, some clothes, various notes, he took while he is in Konya newspaper clippings and documents can be seen and can be visited every day between 09:00-17:00. 
Ataturk Houses all over Turkey are gaining a spiritual function today on the basis of converting mansions to museums he used during his visits to the city. Ataturk House Museum in Konya is among them...

The building, dated 1912, was registered under the name of AtatÃ¼rk in 1928 with the phrase of It is a gift from people of Konya to Reis "Leader of Public, Veteran Mustafa Kemal Pasha." After 1940, after serving as a public building for 23 years, it was converted into a museum in 1964 and opened to visit. It is a remembrance of Ata. 

Ataturk House Museum, which is easily accessible with its central location, is shown among the highlights of the spiritual visiting points in Konya. The museum undergoes repairing first in 1981 and finally in 2003 and is visited extensively, especially by local tourists who come to the city. 
</html>
description.de:
<html>Das Haus, wo der GrÃ¼nder und der erste PrÃ¤sident der Republik TÃ¼rkei, Mustafa Kemal AtatÃ¼rk, bei seinem Besuch in Konya blieb, dient heute als Museum.

Das Museum von AtatÃ¼rks Haus, das kostenlos besichtigt werden kann, enthÃ¤lt viele Fotos vom UnabhÃ¤ngigkeitskrieg. Das Museum, in dem AtatÃ¼rks persÃ¶nliche GegenstÃ¤nde, einige KleidungsstÃ¼cke, verschiedene Notizen, die er in Konya aufbewahrt hat, Zeitungsausschnitte und Dokumente zu sehen sind, kann tÃ¤glich zwischen 09:00 und 17:00 Uhr besichtigt werden.

AtatÃ¼rks HÃ¤user Ã¼berall in der TÃ¼rkei, erhalten eine spirituelle Funktion, indem die HÃ¤user, die bei Besuchen in der Stadt angewendet wurden, in ein Museum umgewandelt wurden. Das Museum von AtatÃ¼rks Haus in Konya gehÃ¶rt dazuâ€¦

Das GebÃ¤ude aus dem Jahr 1912 wurde 1928 unter dem Titel "Das Geschenk des Volkes von Konya an den PrÃ¤sidenten Gazi Mustafa Kemal Pascha" mit dem Namen von AtatÃ¼rk eingetragen. Nachdem es nach 1940 23 Jahre lang als Ã¶ffentliches GebÃ¤ude gedient hatte, wurde es in ein Museum umgewandelt und 1964 fÃ¼r Besucher geÃ¶ffnet.

Das Museum von AtatÃ¼rks Haus, das aufgrund seiner zentralen Lage leicht zu erreichen ist, gehÃ¶rt zu den wichtigsten spirituellen SehenswÃ¼rdigkeiten in Konya. Das Museum, das 1981 und schlieÃŸlich 2003 repariert wurde, wird von einheimischen Touristen, insbesondere der Stadt, ausgiebig besucht.
</html>

description.en:
<html>Atik Plateau in Belen district of Hatay; promises peace, joy and rest to visitors. There are also picnic areas in the plateau, which attracts attention with its magnificent nature for those looking for a cool place.

Especially in the muggy heat of the summer months, the Atik Plateau, which Hatayâ€™s residents prefer to cool off, offers a beautiful view to its visitors with its location among the rising pine trees and clouds. The Plateau can be taken from Belen by approximately 15 minutes of drive. In the area that has been used as a plateau for centuries; pine, sycamore and orchards stand out. 

The air of the area where you can see the settlements when you reach the center of the plateau is also quite clean. Although not many, there are plenty of fruit trees in the Atik Plateau, there are not many special areas for facilities, accommodation and picnics. There are also country coffees and grocery stores in the plateau. Atik Plateau attracts more attention than other plateaus with its residential areas and proximity to the sea. 

If you want to breathe this beautiful air and enjoy nature, you must stop by Atik Plateau. </html>
description.de:
<html>Atik-Alm im Belen-Bezirk von Hatay verspricht seinen Besuchern Frieden, Freude und Ruhe. FÃ¼r diejenigen, die einen kÃ¼hlen Ort suchen, gibt es PicknickplÃ¤tze auf dem Plateau, die mit ihrer herrlichen Natur Aufmerksamkeit erregen.

Bei hoher Hitze der Sommermonate bietet die Atik-Alm, die von den Menschen in Hatay zum Erfrischen bevorzugt wird, mit seiner Lage zwischen aufsteigenden Kiefern und Wolken seinen Besuchern eine schÃ¶ne Aussicht. Das Plateau erreichen Sie von Belen aus nach einer 15-minÃ¼tigen Fahrt. In dem Gebiet, das seit Jahrhunderten als Hochebene genutzt wird, bietet auch einen Ort mit Kiefern, Platanen und ObstgÃ¤rten.

Wenn Sie die Mitte der Alm erreichen, kÃ¶nnen Sie auch die Siedlung sehen und die frische Luft der Region einatmen. Obwohl es nicht viele Unternehmen, Unterkunftsorte, spezielle Picknickbereiche auf der Atik-Alm gibt, gibt es viele ObstbÃ¤ume. Auf dem Plateau gibt es auch lÃ¤ndliche Kaffees und LebensmittelgeschÃ¤fte. Die Atik-Alm zieht mit seinen Siedlungen und seiner NÃ¤he zum Meer mehr Aufmerksamkeit auf sich als andere Plateaus.

description.en:
The MehmetÃ§ik Monument, located in Ankara, is also referred in some sources as the â€˜Stop Passenger Monumentâ€™. The MehmetÃ§ik Monument, which has a total height of 22 meters, is located in the District of PolatlÄ±. It is built in memory of the people who lost their lives as a result of the Battle of Sakarya Square. As it is known, this battle also forms a very important pillar of the Liberation War and the resistance process. The MehmetÃ§ik Monument, which is situated on Kartaltepe, is 6 km away from the district center. Next to the monument,there is the Sakarya Square War Panoramic Museum. The laying of the foundations of this museum coincides with the sculpture.

Kartaltepe, home to the MehmetÃ§ik Monument, as it is known, passed under the control of the enemy in 1921; however, the enemy is not allowed to advance any further here. Bayonet attacks prevent enemy soldiers. MehmetÃ§ik Monument which has a very impressive appearance is built by Assoc. Dr. Sait Rustem. It has a total height of 32 meters along with its pedestal section. The statue itself is around 22 meters. There are eight reliefs on top of the pedestal. From the bus station to take the buses to PolatlÄ± will be sufficient in terms of transportation.

The project related to the MehmetÃ§ik Monument is put forward by the General Staff. This project carries the purpose and motivation of transferring the Battle of Sakarya to new generations. A large Turkish flag was later placed at the site of the MehmetÃ§ik Monument on the E-90 highway. Many important names participate in the opening of this wonderful monument, which can be seen by those who come to Ankara on the road thanks to the railway. Mustafa KoÃ§, who undertook the construction of the monument to a large extent, is at the beginning of these names. Binali Yildirim, the Minister of Transport at the time, and YaÅŸar BÃ¼yÃ¼kanit, the Chief of the General Staff, also honor the opening.

description.en:
<html>We are in one of the most beautiful schools in architecture. The building, which was completed in 1907 and was used as a home for a while, has been teaching Turkish youths as Gazipasa Primary School since 1934. 

Mardin's Chief Architect Lole Serkiz Gizo wants to build a structure in accordance with the general architecture of the city. Gizo laid the foundations of today's Gazipasa Primary School in 1892, but cannot complete it. Construction in 1907, the Period of constitutional II. was ended by Cebbur, a member of the Ancient Congregation of Syrian.

The structure is used as a home for 27 years after construction is completed. In 1923, the Republic was declared and the year behind it, Headteacher Gazi Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, i. The Congress of the Union of Masters. Speaking at the congress, Ataturk said, "Teachers, the next generation will be your work. The value of the work will be appropriate for your skill and dedication." Soon after, schools in Turkey and the literacy rate began to increase gradually. Large structures that are in good condition are either donated or sold to municipalities as an educational institution. The family living in Gazipasa Primary School then also sells the structure to the Mardin DEPUTY Abdurrezzak Shatana. The congressman who resides here for a while, then sells it for a fee under what he bought, to the Special Administrative Directorate. After these trading events, the building, which was completely in the hands of the state, was examined and restored and started to operate as an educational institution in 1934.

Gazipasa Primary School, which fascinates those who see the grand structure which the favorite of childrenâ€™s in Mardine, is still an institution that educates Turkish youth as a school today.
</html>

description.en:
The ancient city of Pedasa, located in the Bodrum district of MuÄŸla in the southwest of Turkey, is one of the places of interest in the region. The origin of the ancient settlement, about 4.5 kilometers from the district center, dates back to the 1500s BC.


Archaeological excavations continue in the area, the remains of settlements, stone roads, some parts of the city walls, theater and a few columns can be seen in the city center. In general, surrounded by a wooded area, the traces of thousands of years ago are exciting for enthusiasts. The ancient city of Pedasa, which is proposed to be visited as part of cultural trips, is one of the hidden historical values in Bodrum.


The city's history is very important. It was founded by the Lelegs, who settled in present-day Mugla and its surroundings after the Trojan War. The ancient city of Pedasa is recorded to be the largest settlement in this scope.


The Lelegs were indigenous people before Greek rule in Anatolia and influenced the said civilization in many ways. For example, according to written sources, the Greeks learned from Lelegler to attach handles to their shields and carry them in this way. Before, they hung their shields around their necks in battles.


It is also known to have important influences in terms of architecture.

description.en:
<html>It's a nice detail for the host of ancient history, ÅanlÄ±urfa, to be called the 'City of Prophets'. The holy city where many prophets were born and lived, it was also the meeting point of different religions throughout the passing time. In countless mosques and complexes, clergy, dignitaries, scholars have grown and provided services. 

One of the prominent spiritual structures in this land, which hosts many cultural values, is the Tomb of Sheikh Bekir, located close to the entrance gate of the Sanliurfa Grand Mosque, which rises in a very central location. 

The Tomb of Sheikh Bekir, which was built in 1719, is one of the landmarks of ÅanlÄ±urfa. The Tomb of Sheikh Bekir, which offers spiritual atmosphere to its visitors, has easy access due to its location. 

The tomb, which has a conical form of a different design from its counterparts, is also a striking cultural value with fine stonework. It stands out with its door and wide window. There are verses on the walls and sanduka in it. 

</html>
description.de:
<html>Was fÃ¼r ein schÃ¶nes Detail fÃ¼r ÅanlÄ±urfa, dem Gastgeber mit ihrer alten Geschichte, die Stadt der Propheten genannt zu werden. Die heilige Stadt, in der viele Propheten geboren wurden und lebten, war im Laufe der Zeit auch der Treffpunkt verschiedener Religionen. In unzÃ¤hligen Moscheen und Komplexen wurden Geistliche, PersÃ¶nlichkeiten und Gelehrte ausgebildet und gedient.

In diesem Zusammenhang ist das Sheyh-Bekir-Mausoleum in der NÃ¤he des Eingangstors der ÅanlÄ±urfa-Ulu-Moschee, die sich an einer sehr zentralen Stelle erhebt, eine der herausragenden spirituellen Strukturen in diesen LÃ¤ndern, die viele kulturelle Werte beherbergen.

Das 1719 erbaute Sheyh Bekir Denkmal ist eine der Wahrzeichen von ÅanlÄ±urfa. Das Åeyh Bekir-Grab, das seinen Besuchern eine spirituelle AtmosphÃ¤re bietet, ist aufgrund seiner Lage leicht zu erreichen.

Das Grab, das eine konische Form mit einem anderen Design als seine GegenstÃ¼cke hat, ist mit seinem feinen Mauerwerk auch ein bemerkenswerter kultureller Wert. Es zeichnet sich durch eine TÃ¼r und ein breites Fenster aus. Es gibt Anzeichen im Sarkophag und an den WÃ¤nden.

</html>

description.en:
In Ankara, you can experience not only cultural and historical sites but also many natural beauties. Although it does not have a coastline like in the other two major cities, at least the lakes comprehend a bit of this deficiency. For this reason, especially in the summer months, the local people show a great interest in the lakes in Ankara. The Blue Lake, considered to be one of the city's popular sightseeing stops, is located approximately 13 kilometers from the center. BayÄ±ndÄ±r Dam, located in the area just above Samsun road, covers an area of 2,400 square meters. Within this area,it is surrounded by quite large trees.

The reason why it is called Blue Lake is that the water in BayÄ±ndÄ±r Dam has a bluish color. Blue Lake is located in the eastern part of the city as the location. Local people visit this place to have a family picnic, especially on weekends during the summer months. Until 2005, the lake and its environs were not used for this purpose; however, extensive regulatory work in the region that year created this result. Blue Lake is now considered as a great resting place. The lake is located in Mamak District boundaries and is close to the city center. You can easily use the public transport which will take you to Mamak District. Offering a natural lake atmosphere, the area is quite calm and peaceful.

Currently, except from two separate business buildings in and around Blue Lake, 15 security huts outside are located. It also operates six toilets. The green area deemed suitable for picnicking is 245 acres in total. Ready-made tables, gazebos and barbecue areas will provide you with great convenience when picnicking.

description.en:
MuÄŸla is an extremely rich city in mythological terms. It is possible to find the names of many mythological heroes in the city where the ancient cities are dense. One of these heroes, of course, is considered Heracles. Heracles is named after an ancient city here.


The ancient city of Heracleia was named Latmos in the 8th century BC. In turn, it falls under the control of the Persians, the Alexander Empire and the Seleucids. The city of Herakleia is disconnected from the sea after some time. This causes the city to lose its importance in an instant. The intersections, which take advantage of the difficulties in transportation, prefer to be stored here for a long time. The ancient city of Heracleia is based on a very rugged terrain. Also the hard rocky areas in the area are immediately prominent.


There is a fortification area of 6 kilometers around Herakleia. There are around 65 towers in these walls. The square stonework on the ramparts is notable. The wall parts of the fortification are estimated to have been built during the Hellenistic period. The Hippodamos city plan is considered as a reference in this sense. The Temple of Athena, which lies just behind the harbour area of the city, is the best preserved point of the ancient city of Herakleia. The temple has two columns and is transferred from the Hellenistic Age to the present day. The agora, located just east of this temple, has two floors in total. Today, only the first floor is intact. The Agora area is likewise understood to have been created during the Hellenistic period.


Herakleia is an exemplary city in terms of street plan. The perimeter walls to the north are still intact. The theatre of the city is located at the eastern end. Surveys in the ancient city of Herakleia are carried on steadily every year. These studies have been carried out by a German group since 1991. In particular, many rock paintings have been unearthed.

description.en:
<html>The Gallipoli Peninsula Historical National Park, which is a very important place for Canakkale, is possible to encounter intense crowds throughout the year. The area, which was granted national park status in 1973, is approximately 33,400 hectares.

The Gallipoli Peninsula Historical National Park, which borders the Eceabat district, contains eight separate villages. The park is also among the highest plant diversity in Ã‡anakkale. In order to get oxygen, local people visit here especially in the summer season. The Gallipoli Peninsula Historical National Park is also suitable for a large number of activities. Therefore, it has a structure that can attract people of all ages.
.
This large area encompassing the National Park also covers areas where a large number of enemy soldiers are buried. For this reason, the proud memories of the Gallipoli victory are always alive here. Within the boundaries of the Gallipoli Peninsula Historical National Park, there are 35 martyrs belonging to foreigners out of 56 domestic monuments. It is known that around 250 thousand Turkish soldiers took part in this martyrdom.

The Gallipoli Peninsula Historical National Park is very valuable in terms of providing the traces of the war and the lessons to be learned from it to future generations. While other national parks in Turkey stand out largely with their natural beauty, the Gallipoli Peninsula Historical National Park attracts more attention in this aspect. Visitors to the National Park have the chance to visit villages such as BehramlÄ±, KÃ¼Ã§Ã¼kanafarta, Bigali and Kilitbahir. The people who come to this particular region by Istanbul from the peninsula to which is connected can follow the TekirdaÄŸ and KeÅŸan Highway. After arriving at Gallipoli, they must make their way to the south end. Ferries may be preferred to go to Ecaabat. These ferries continue to serve without interruption. Unfortunately, the region is removed from the status of National park in 2014 in order to be opened to development. It is currently defined as a â€˜historic siteâ€™ rather than a national park in the official sense.
</html>

Aus diesem Grund sind hier immer stolze Erinnerungen an den Sieg von Ã‡anakkale lebendig. Diejenigen, die aus Istanbul in diese besondere Region kommen, die ihren Namen von der Halbinsel hat, mit der sie verbunden ist, kÃ¶nnen der Autobahn TekirdaÄŸ und KeÅŸan folgen. description.en:
Kargi Bay, which is about 3 kilometers away from MuÄŸla's DatÃ§a District, is shown among the heaven bays of the region. The Bay is surrounded by mountains in general. KargÄ± Bay is closed to the north winds which threaten fishermen in particular. In this sense, the sea is calm even in the most windy and harsh weather. At the same time, being a warm place positively affects the number of visitors to the Bay.


Transportation to Kargi Bay, which is also prominent with its natural beauties, is extremely easy. Even with only a half-hour walk, you can easily get here from the district. At the same time, you can also reach the bay with minibuses moving from the district center.


Kargi Bay has a quiet atmosphere unlike other tourist areas in MuÄŸla. Especially suitable for hiking makes this place more attractive. Even very early in the summer months, hiking in the region can be encountered. The Bay also has a beautiful view for those who want to watch the sun set. The most visited beach in the region is in Mandalya locality. Even in the strongest winds, sailors anchor their crafts or boats in this area. The Bay, which has shades of green and blue, is an ideal beach for those who do not know much swimming. The Bay, which is always attracted by local and foreign tourists, begins to be hot up with the month of May. Kargi Bay is also very close to popular places such as PalamutbÃ¼kÃ¼ Bencik Bay and the ancient city of Knidos.


The western part of Kargi Bay is generally more mobile. Businesses have mostly gathered in this department. There are free showers and changing cabins on the beach that everyone can use. The entrance to the beach features a section with eucalyptus trees. In general, people prefer to go into the sea from the area where these trees are located. Parking in the Bay is charged.

description.en:
AlaÃ§atÄ±, the holiday destination of Izmir, which has started to shine in a flash recently, is increasing its popularity. The holiday resort, which has a great intensity in the summer months, is now in the eye of the city. AlaÃ§atÄ±, which is in the district of Ã‡eÅŸme, has been overshadowed by Ã‡eÅŸme and other summer regions for many years. AlaÃ§atÄ±, which started to be discovered in a moment, shows a great development. The popular resort town of Ã‡eÅŸme, which is seven kms away from the center, is very close to IlÄ±ca. There are three separate villages within AlaÃ§atÄ±.

It has many features that make AlaÃ§atÄ± so popular. When AlaÃ§atÄ± is called, its houses and charming streets have their own unique architecture. On the other hand, the area is in the foreground with windsurfing. This place is considered to be one of the best known surf centers in the world. Many amateur and professional surfers are involved in the competitions here. There are also around ten surf schools in AlaÃ§atÄ±. Because of the presence of international tournaments, surfing provides a serious tourism income for AlaÃ§atÄ±. Eleven months of the year, the wind shows the presence of a level suitable for surfing. Reflecting the typical characteristics of the Mediterranean climate, AlaÃ§atÄ± houses the only gum tree garden in our country. The population difference in summer and winter months is around 40-50 thousand.

AlaÃ§atÄ±, whose stone houses are the subject of postcards, becomes the center of attention of photography enthusiasts. You must keep your camera close to you while you are wandering the streets of AlaÃ§atÄ±. Blue painted stone houses, boutique hotels, gift shops, windmills and wonderful beaches make AlaÃ§atÄ± privileged. It is known that the Greeks lived here for a long time. The Greeks, who rent the fertile land here, ensure the development of viticulture. The Greeks called it "Alatzada" in those years. After the Balkan War, a significant majority had to emigrate.

description.en:
Located approximately 17 kilometers away from the city center of Artvin, the Sahara Plateau stands out as one of the favorite places of tourism. This place is also within the Sahara KaragÃ¶l National Park. It stands out as a very ideal place for both camping and caravan tourism. The Sahara Plateau, which is located exactly between ÅavÅŸat and Ardahan, is famous for its extensive grasslands. At the same time, the cold waters of the plateau is another feature that makes this place special. Every year in July, the PancarcÄ± Festival is held in the Sahara Plateau.


The Sahara Plateau, which is getting more attention by tourists every year, is located just above the pine mountains. The upland section is divided due to the deep valleys of the section. The slope value of the plateau in general is higher compared to other plateaus. The flat area has an altitude of around 800 metres. Numerous fir trees are found in the Sahara Plateau. These create a very special visual. On the other hand, spruce trees are also found in places. As you go to the lower areas, the yellow pine trees begin to found generally. Although the area is suitable for many activities, it is often preferred in summer especially for caravan and camping tourism.


KaragÃ¶l Sahara National Park, which includes the Sahara Plateau and confers great beauty, has been serving as a national park since 1994. The region is in a very good state in terms of biodiversity. It is also home to some species of wild animals. PancarcÄ± Festival, held in the Sahara Plateau, always attracts the attention of local and foreign tourists. It takes place with intense participation, especially from close districts. People ascend to the highlands in bulk and collect beets that mature during this period. At the same time some special demonstrations and events are organized by the municipality during this period.
description.de:
Das Sahara-Plateau liegt etwa 17 Kilometer vom Stadtzentrum von Artvin entfernt und ist einer der beliebtesten Orte des Tourismus. Dieser Ort befindet sich auch im Sahara KaragÃ¶l Nationalpark. Es ist ein idealer Ort sowohl fÃ¼r Camping- als auch fÃ¼r Caravan-Tourismus. Das Sahara-Plateau, das sich zwischen ÅavÅŸat und Ardahan befindet, ist berÃ¼hmt fÃ¼r seine weiten Weiden. Gleichzeitig ist das kalte Wasser des Plateaus ein weiteres Merkmal, das diesen Ort zu etwas Besonderem macht. Jedes Jahr im Juli findet auf dem Sahara-Plateau das RÃ¼ben-Festival statt.

description.en:
When you think of the adventurous state of travelling and seeing and spending time in sight, few places can pour water into the hands of the EÄŸriova Plateau in the BeypazarÄ± District of Ankara. Transportation to the EÄŸriova Plateau, surrounded by the SarÄ±Ã§am forests, can be achieved either by the BeypazarÄ±-KaraÅŸar-EÄŸriova road from the city center of Ankara or by the stabilized road from the KaraÅŸar District.

The plateau, which is famous for its waterfalls and ponds as well as the forests of SarÄ±Ã§am, has a kind of lung characteristic of Ankara. There are also areas of health and thermal tourism in the region. The area, which can be visited for both nature tourism and nature photography, also has camping facilities.

The EÄŸriova Plateau, whose tents and camps on the edge of the pond are popular at certain times of the year, is also valued for its wildlife. According to the latest data, there are 77 different vertebrate species living on the plateau, 9 of which are reptiles, 11 of which are mammals and 53 of which are birds. There are also some small houses within the Highland boundaries close to areas where cows and horses graze.

In the morning and evening, the sun reflects at different angles and the spring months are another in the EÄŸriova Plateau, where you can dive into the sights that do not search for movie scenes. The fog, which can be seen especially in the morning, promises a unique sight, with the pine trees in the background.

Accommodation on the EÄŸriova Plateau can be in several different ways. Come by caravan, park, set up tents or stay in business accommodation. Besides barbecued tables, there is also a restaurant and buffet on the plateau. A small fee is charged for entering the plateau by person or vehicle. On-site accommodation charges are quite modest.

A few recommendations; there may be mosquitoes at night, spray is recommended; there is also a risk of falling while driving along their path, caution is required. A variety of activities such as cycling, archery, wildlife watching, photography can be carried out on the plateau where fishing can be done and canoeing in its pond.

description.en:
KurÅŸunlu Mosque is located in Altindag District of Ankara and is located on Anafartalar Street. The mosque is architecturally square planned. At the same time the structure is situated between single-domed mosques and is built on a hillside. Sequential rubble stones are preferred on the wall facades. The last congregational section is placed in the north of the mosque. The roof of the last parish, both parts of which are closed, is Wooden at first. However, this area is also changed when it is enlarged by the Association which belongs to KurÅŸunlu Mosque. Today the subdivision of the last communion place is considered as ablution area.

This section, renovated as reinforced concrete, creates a sadly incompatible appearance with the mosque. The main entrance of the mosque is in the eastern part of this section. The other facades in KurÅŸunlu Mosque are largely similar to each other. The windows located inside the pointed arched niches provide a harmonious image. At the end of the walls of the facade with a simple structure draws attention to the deletion.

The dome of the mosque is covered with lead. This dome also appears to have an octagonal pulley. Each section of the hoop, which has Hedgehog Eaves, has a window. The mosque's minaret is located in the northern section of the main structure. The minaret can be observed to have a brick-bodied structure. There is a transition between the plinth and the cylindrical body. It can be said that the honeycomb section ends with a pointed cone. The door to the minaret opens directly into the mosque.

KurÅŸunlu Mosque does not have an inscription reaching today. Historical estimates are made according to architectural style. In this sense, it is estimated that this place of worship was inherited from the 16th century. According to estimates, the mosque is said to have been built by Grand Vizier Nasuh Pasha. He has his signature on many works in this region other than KurÅŸunlu Mosque. The mosque gets this name because the top is completely covered with lead.

description.en:
One of Gaziantep's unique values is the fabric called kutnu, and the Cevdet Eldemir Kutnu culture and art house, which is prepared for this fabric, is also the most important place in this area.

The fabric called Kutnu is actually made of a mixture of raw silk and cotton. Muhittin Eldemir was inspired to establish an Art and Culture House in order to spread the use and production of kutnu which has become a culture and to introduce kutnu to Turkey and the world. And who is Eldemir?

Muhittin Eldemir is a master of kutnu fabric and learned his profession from his father Cevdet Eldemir from his apprenticeship years. Upon the death of his father, Eldemir started activities to announce the profession and the type of fabric to wide segments, participated in exhibitions, fashion shows, and played a role in being heard kutnu fabric by wide segments. In fact, several examples of kutnu fabric, which is even the subject of the world-famous London Fashion Week, have been brought together and exhibited in the culture and art house opened in Gaziantep.

The building, named after Cevdet Eldemir being the father of Muhittin Eldemir, is based on the recognition of the kutnu fabric by posterity, which has received more attention and demand today than before as a result of intense efforts. Cevdet Eldemir Kutnu Culture and Art house, which is one of the interesting tourist places in Gaziantep, impresses the people who see historical machines, colorful fabrics and various tools in which art is performed.

description.en:
In the 16th century, when the Ottomanempire ruled, Sultan Murad III was built, the Grand Mosque still retains its unique structure thanks to the restored parts. 

Sultan Murad III builds of the Grand Mosque. But, because of iranian attacks, Shah Abbas's armies destroy large parts of the mosque and damage it. When history shows the 17th century, Sultan Ibrahim, the Sultan of the period, orders Kars Governor Dilaver Pasha to rebuild the mosque... Open for many years to worship the people of Kars, the mosque was also used as a long-standing arsenal during the Ottoman Russian war. 

The Grand Mosque restored last in 1997. The mosque, which was largely renovated as its authenticity, gain its present appearance in those years.
description.de:
Die GroÃŸe Moschee, die im 16. Jahrhundert von Sultan Murat dem III. erbaut wurde, als die Osmanen regierten, bewahrt dank der restaurierten Teile immer noch ihre einzigartige Struktur.

Sultan Murat der IIII. baute die GroÃŸe Moschee, aber aufgrund iranischer Angriffe zerstÃ¶rte die Armee von Shah Abbas einen groÃŸen Teil der Moschee und beschÃ¤digte sie. Als die Geschichte das 17. Jahrhundert zeigte, befahl der Sultan der Zeit, Sultan Ibrahim, den Kars Generalgouvernor Dilaver Pascha die Moschee wiederaufzubauen
Die GroÃŸe Moschee wurde 1997 zum letzten Mal restauriert. Die Moschee, die weitgehend originalgetreu renoviert wurde, erlangte in diesen Jahren ihr heutiges Aussehen.

description.en:
<html>The Museum of Medical and Aromatic Plants in Hatay, which is located in an important geography with its natural beauties as well as its historical beauty, has being first value for our country.

10 percent of endemic plants grown in our country grow in Hatay. No wonder such a museum has been opened in the city with such a natural treasure. Hatay, home to Turkey's first Museum of Medical and Aromatic Plants, has 300 endemic and 550 plant species are medicinal and aromatic plants of the nearly 2,000.

Today, the building, which is home to this magnificent museum, was opened to visitors as a result of the restoration in 2012. The museum, which is located inside an old Antioch house with a two-storey structure built in the 19th century, exhibits 280 plant varieties. Within 884 square meters, there is four closed and one open exhibition area. The plants, which are exhibited in glass jars and hand knitted baskets, have their final ready-to-use on display, as well as the large size photographs explaining their benefits. In extract rooms, it is possible to experience how and what for the oils of plants are used.
</html>

description.en:
The place, which houses The Hasan SÃ¼zer Ethnography Museum in Bey quarter, is essentially a very old Gaziantep House. This gives the museum a very different air and aesthetic. It is possible to find similar houses in HanifoÄŸlu Street, the Bey neighborhood in which it is located. The Hasan SÃ¼zer Ethnography Museum, which draws attention both for its richness and architectural beauty, reflects Gaziantep's history and culture at an important level.

This private house was expropriated in the early 1900s and taken over by the Ministry of Culture. Although it remains in a dilapidated state for a long time, it is ultimately considered as a museum. Codes about the traditional life of the people in Gaziantep are given here in stunning fashion with mannequins. The building, which has three floors in total, draws attention to the cellar carved into the rock. Two of the floors lead directly to the main road and the other to the neighborhood. There are many processes on the large main door. When you throw yourself through this door, you come across an area called â€˜Lifeâ€™. If you try to enter through the smaller door, you will see that the section called â€˜Salamlik (the postion of a house reserved for men)â€™ meets you.

When you visit the ground floor, you can witness embroiderie frames or wooden benches. In this section, a lot of animation is done through mannequins. Traditional pursuits such as spinning a spinning wheel or stretching silk over a gergah are preferred in this area. You can use the stairs inside the house to get to the first floor. A traditional bathhouse is located in the right section of this floor. Apart from basin of a bath and bath bowls, bone combs are also exhibited one to one. Upstairs, you can observe the traditional living rooms. Unfortunately, the closure of the Hasan SÃ¼zer Ethnography Museum is on the agenda due to financial impossibilities. The museum, which is also likely to go for restoration rather than closure, is currently closed to visitors.

description.en:
<html>Konyaalti Beach, one of the most beautiful beaches not only in Antalya but also in Turkey, is located about four kilometers west of the city center.

The beach in the district of KonyaaltÄ± stands out with its coastline of about seven kilometers surrounded by the port of Antalya on the west and the cliffs of Antalya on the East. KonyaaltÄ± Beach, one of the longest coastal beaches in the region, although there are rocky areas in between, usually extends in the form of a sandy beach. KonyaaltÄ± Beach, with its excellent location, adequate number of showers, cabins and cleaning, welcomes visitors not only from the immediate vicinity but from all over Turkey and abroad.

The beach, which has been awarded the â€˜Blue Flagâ€™ Award by the International Environmental Education Foundation because it meets the necessary criteria, is preferred for the areas where sunbeds with umbrellas can be rented.

You can enjoy eating and drinking spots close to the beach and enjoy nearby tourist accommodation. As it is also centrally located, easy access can be achieved not only by private vehicle but also by public transport.

Finally, a brief note about the sea; after two or three steps, it suddenly deepens; therefore, it is better to be careful when entering and swimming.
</html>

description.en:
<html>Hatay, the city of civilizations, brings the dominance of the Roman Empire centuries ago to the present day with striking details of the past. At this point, perhaps the most interesting and innovative structures in the region are the Titus Kaya Tunnel. 

It would not be wrong to call titus rock tunnel far ahead of the age of engineering product. More than 2,000 years ago, this tunnel was planned to protect the port area of Seleucia Pieira, an ancient city that flourished in the region more than 2,000 years ago, from floodwaters coming from the surrounding elevations and caused damage. The rocks were drilled, tons of materials were loaded and moved, and eventually a hollow with a length of about 1 km and a width of 6 meters was carve out. The Titus Rock Tunnel was the product of an astonishing effort to sustain trade. 

The historic tunnel, built and named after it by The Successor to the Roman Emperor Vespasian, can be visited today. It can walk in the astonishing historical hollow. It is recommended to go with suitable shoes due to slippery and wet floor.

The historic Titus Tunnel can be visited within certain hours in summer and winter. It's usually closed to visitors before dusk. Good discoveries!
</html>

description.en:
The Roman imperial-era temple of Augustus, located in Ankara, features a respectable archaeological site. The temple was built to commemorate the capture of Central Anatolia by the Roman Empire in 20-25 B.C. and the provision of the regional administration with the state established under the name of â€˜Galatiaâ€™. Upon its completion, the Temple of Augustus became an important center and was surrounded by settlements.

The first version of the Roman temple, which had a destroyed wall, parts of it, remains of columns and ruins, had a rectangular appearance; its long edge was 55 metres long and its short edge 36 metres long. There were three sections in the inner part of the temple, which was surrounded by two metre high columns and facing west. The temple, which retained its importance for some time, later came to be used as a church. Three windows on the south wall, which have survived to the present day, were opened as a result of the natural requirement of its use. The Temple of Augustus, which was eventually demolished and remained dormant, began to gain importance by the 16th century, when its historical significance was understood.

One of the highlights of the historical site, which is open to visit, is the fact that one of the inscriptions left by Emperor Augustus before his death is found on the surviving wall. The Temple of Augustus can be visited every day of the week and admission is free.

description.en:
HÃ¼davendigar Complex is also known as the Sultan I.Murat Complex. The complex, built in 1366, is located in the western part of the city. I. Murat HÃ¼davendigar is also known as the first sultan of the Ottoman Empire to be martyred. The area where this large complex is located is home to the oldest neighborhood in the city.


Complex consists of imaret, madrasa, mausoleum, bath and mosque. On the front side of the ablution area, two sycamore trees have a monumental nature. The area where the complex was built is referred in the form of Pythia in the past periods. The district is in the foreground with its healing waters, hot springs and baths from past to present. In a sense, it is seen as the guest house of Bursa. The area is used as a promenade for local people due to the natural beauty of the middle of the last century. Other than that, hot springs are visited in order to find healing. When you come to the Hudavendigar Complex, you may experience a wonderful view of the Bursa Plain. Recently, as the popularity and tourist value of this place has increased, breakfast places appear in the areas that see the view. Especially in summer, an ideal atmosphere is created for those who want to cool off in the shade of the sycamore trees here.


Murat Imaret is located in the western section of the mosque of the same name. Three rows of brick and one row of rubble stone were preferred in the wall sections. The inscription on the door of the almshouse mentions the restoration performed in 1906. The imaret section, which still exists today, is mostly used for cultural events. One of the important buildings in KÃ¼lliye is the Ã‡Ä±k Ã‡Ä±k Hammam. This place is also referred as â€œEnter and Exit bathâ€ by the local people. It meets the needs of the madrasa students during its construction. It is therefore a kind of bachelor bath. Today it has been restored by the municipality.
description.de:
Der HÃ¼davendigar-Komplex ist auch als Sultan Murat I-Komplex bekannt. Der 1366 erbaute Komplex befindet sich im westlichen Teil der Stadt. Murat HÃ¼davendigar ist auch als erster MÃ¤rtyrer des Osmanischen Reiches bekannt. In der Region mit diesem groÃŸen Komplex befindet sich das Ã¤lteste Viertel der Stadt.

Der Komplex besteht aus Imaret, Medresse, Grab, TÃ¼rkischem Bad und Moschee. Zwei Platanen mit monumentalen Merkmalen ziehen die Aufmerksamkeit vor der Waschung auf sich. Das Gebiet, in dem der Komplex gebaut wurde, hieÃŸ in der Vergangenheit Pythia. Der Bezirk ist mit seinem Heilwasser, den heiÃŸen Quellen und den BÃ¤dern von der Vergangenheit bis zur Gegenwart fÃ¼hrend. In gewisser Weise wird es als das GÃ¤stehaus von Bursa angesehen. Die Region wird aufgrund der NaturschÃ¶nheiten der Mitte des letzten Jahrhunderts als Erholungsgebiet fÃ¼r die lokale BevÃ¶lkerung genutzt. Abgesehen davon werden heiÃŸe Quellen besucht, um Heilung zu finden. Wenn Sie zum HÃ¼davendigar-Komplex kommen, kÃ¶nnen Sie einen herrlichen Blick auf die Bursa-Plateau genieÃŸen. Da die PopularitÃ¤t und der touristische Wert dieses Ortes in letzter Zeit zugenommen haben, kommen FrÃ¼hstÃ¼cksorte in den Gebieten hervor, die die Landschaft sehen. Besonders in den Sommermonaten wird eine ideale AtmosphÃ¤re fÃ¼r diejenigen geschaffen, die sich hier im Schatten von Platanen abkÃ¼hlen mÃ¶chten.

Das Murat Imaret befindet sich im westlichen Teil der gleichnamigen Moschee. In den Wandabschnitten wurden drei Ziegelreihen und eine TrÃ¼mmerreihe ausgewÃ¤hlt. In der Inschrift an der TÃ¼r des Imarets wurde die Reparatur 1906 durchgefÃ¼hrt. Der heute noch existierende Imaret-Bereich wird hauptsÃ¤chlich fÃ¼r kulturelle Veranstaltungen genutzt. Eine der wichtigsten Strukturen des Komplexes ist das CÄ±k CÄ±k Bad. Dieser Ort wird von den Einheimischen auch als â€Schnellbadâ€œ bezeichnet. Es erfÃ¼llt die BedÃ¼rfnisse von Medresse-SchÃ¼lern, als es gebaut wurde. Daher ist es eine Art Einzelbad. Heute wurde es von der Gemeinde restauriert.

description.en:
Ismail Bey Hammam, located on the Beylik neighborhood of Iznik, is also known as Masjid Hammam by the local people. In 1989, the venue is protected by an umbrella in the form of construction


Some details of the historical Ismail Bey Hammam, which has been inherited from the principalities period to the present day, are immediately visible, especially in the interior architecture. The upper part of the structure is covered by a spiral dome. The luminous openings in the focal point of the dome, which are spiral-sliced, can be easily observed.


Exactly what date Ismail Bey Hammam was built is unknown. However, the estimates are based on the fact that it is a Seljuk artifact. Therefore, the bath house is probably predicted to date to the 14th century. Ismail Bey Hammam, which is considered as one of the rarest examples of Turkish building art, lies in a north-south direction. The hammam has six rooms with a rectangular plan, with only the foundations remaining except the main one, which has four domes. The exterior is generally plain and designed as a indivisible structure. Rubble stone and brick are used in the walls of the structure. It is irregularly formed except for the Western Front. Bricks are preferred in muqarnas parts with covering system. Today, the upper part of the hammam is completely covered by the steel roof. In this way, it is protected against all possible external factors.


It is not known exactly why such a name was given to the place located on Sultan Hammam Street. Ismail Bey Hammam is kept on hand in Bursa for many years because it is not similar in its kind. Especially at that time, the leading names of the members of Ã‡andarlÄ±, today in the borders of Iznik because they live in this special hammam frequented. In fact, some sources claim that this is the private bath of the palace. Today, many memories of Ismail Bey Hammam have been erased.
description.de:

Insbesondere einige Details in der Innenarchitektur des historischen Ä°smail Bey Wasserbad, die aus der Zeit der FÃ¼rstentÃ¼mer stammen, sind sofort ersichtlich. Der obere Teil des GebÃ¤udes ist mit einer Spiralkuppel bedeckt. LichtÃ¶ffnungen im Brennpunkt der Kuppel, bei denen es sich um einen Spiralschnitt handelt, sind leicht zu erkennen.

Es ist nicht genau bekannt, wann das Ä°smail Bey Wasserbad gebaut wurde. Die SchÃ¤tzungen konzentrieren sich jedoch auf die Tatsache, dass es sich um eine seldschukische Arbeit handelt. Daher wird angenommen, dass das Bad wahrscheinlich aus dem 14. Jahrhundert stammte. Ä°smail Bey Wasserbad, das als eines der seltensten Beispiele tÃ¼rkischer Baukunst gilt, erstreckt sich in Nord-SÃ¼d-Richtung. Das Wasserbad hat neben dem Hauptraum mit vier Kuppeln sechs RÃ¤ume mit nur einem Fundament und einem rechteckigen Grundriss. Der Ã¤uÃŸere Teil ist im Allgemeinen glatt und als nicht geteilte Struktur ausgefÃ¼hrt. An den WÃ¤nden des GebÃ¤udes werden Schutt und Ziegel verwendet. Es wird unregelmÃ¤ÃŸig erstellt, mit Ausnahme der Westseite. Ziegel werden in Muqarnas-Abschnitten mit Abdecksystem bevorzugt. Heute ist der obere Teil des Bades vollstÃ¤ndig von einem Stahldach bedeckt. Auf diese Weise ist es vor allen mÃ¶glichen Ã¤uÃŸeren EinflÃ¼ssen geschÃ¼tzt.

Es ist nicht genau bekannt, warum der Ort in der Sultan Hamam StraÃŸe einen solchen Namen erhielt. Ä°smail Bey Wasserbad wird viele Jahre in der Stadt Bursa aufbewahrt, da es in seiner Art nicht einzigartig ist. Besonders die fÃ¼hrenden Namen der damaligen Ã‡andarlÄ±-Mitglieder kommen oft in dieses private Bad, da sie heute innerhalb der Grenzen von Iznik leben. In einigen Quellen wird behauptet, dass dies das private Bad des Palastes ist. Heute wurden viele Erinnerungen an Ä°smail Bey Hamam gelÃ¶scht.
