description.en:
The zoo in Bursa has been in service since 1998. The renovated and modernized zoo is teeming with botanical park.


When you come to Bursa Zoo, you can encounter 500 animals from 55 species. As it is known, Bursa's previous zoo was in a very poor and unhealthy state. During a school trip, one of the primary school students writes a letter expressing his sorrow about the animals. This letter greatly affected local administrators at the time and triggered the regeneration of the zoo. In place of the old Bursa Zoo, which received intense criticism, an area is formed where animals can feel themselves in their natural relative natural environment.


There are four basic sections of the zoo where families with children are of particular interest. We can list them as fish, mammals, birds and reptiles. The large section, dedicated to waterfowl, has a rather pleasant pond. Visitors to the zoo in Osmangazi District of Bursa also have the opportunity to do many social activities. There are numerous children's areas, jogging and walking areas, cafes and restaurants available to visitors. The zoo, which spans a huge area of 400 thousand square meters in total, has a 12-kilometer walkway. On the other hand, there is also a 1 kilometre track for cycling lovers.


The zoo is adjacent to SoÄŸanlÄ± Botanical Park and is considered a great chance for visitors. Because in SoÄŸanlÄ± Botanical Park, 150 different types of 8 thousand trees meet you. In this sense, it can be easily said that one of the largest greenl areas of Bursa is here. In addition, the Bursa Houses section on display here is a pleasant surprise for visitors. The zoo can be visited between 09.30 and 17.00. The closing time in summer is updated to 20.15.
description.de:

Die Tatsache, dass der Zoo an den Botanischen Park SoÄŸanlÄ± angrenzt, wird als groÃŸe Chance fÃ¼r Besucher angesehen. Denn im Botanischen Park SoÄŸanlÄ± begrÃ¼ÃŸen Sie rund 8.000 BÃ¤ume von 150 verschiedenen Arten. Gavur Kalesi Hitit zamanÄ±na dair pek Ã§ok bilgiyi sunar. DoÄŸal bir tepenin zirve noktasÄ±ndaki kayada bulunan kale, 60 metre yÃ¼kseklikte konumlanÄ±r. Sur duvarlarÄ±ndaysa aÄŸÄ±rlÄ±klÄ± olarak kiklop adÄ± verilen tarz benimsenir. Bu tarzda bÃ¼yÃ¼k taÅŸ bloklar harÃ§sÄ±z ÅŸekilde Ã¼st Ã¼ste konulur. 

Gavur Kalesiâ€™nin milattan Ã¶nce 1600â€™lÃ¼ yÄ±llarda inÅŸa edildiÄŸi dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼nÃ¼lÃ¼r. Daha sonradan yapÄ±lan araÅŸtÄ±rmalar buranÄ±n bir Hitit yapÄ±sÄ± olduÄŸu bilgisini pekiÅŸtirir. description.en:
Ankara embraces many different civilizations throughout history. The city also witnesses many battles and struggles. When you come to the city naturally, you are likely to encounter castles that have been moved to the present day as a souvenir of these struggles. Among these castles, Gavur Castle, which has a symbolic value, is worth a visit! Gavur Castle is located in the Haymana District of the capital Ankara. This place has a special place especially for the Hittites. The excavations here take place at the request of AtatÃ¼rk.

The first excavations at Gavur Castle took place in 1930 under the leadership of Von Der Osten. As a result of these studies, Osten states that there may be a mountain temple here. Another claim is that there was a royal tomb in the same area. The figures of Gods and goddesses on the relief tops immediately stand out. The castle of Gavur presents a great deal of information about the Hittite times. Located on the rock at the summit of a natural hill, the castle is positioned at an altitude of 60 metres. This place is also very close to the Babayakup River. The relief carved on the rocks contains human figures. In the fortification walls, the style called Cyclops is mainly adopted. In this style, large stone blocks are laid on top of each other without mortar.

Gavur Castle is thought to have been built in the 1600s BC. Later research reinforces the knowledge that this place is a Hittite structure. Excavations and surveys reveal that Frigians also lived in the Haymana region. In later periods, Galatians settled in the region. Galatians are a branch belonging to Golvars who live within the borders of France today. It is estimated that the Galatians crossed over thrace into the Anatolian lands. For a long time the region manages to be a center for Galatians. There is a distance of around 60 kilometers between Ankara and Gavur Castle. This place is sometimes referred directly as â€˜Gavurkaleâ€™.

GÃ¼nÃ¼mÃ¼zde kÃ¼tÃ¼phane olarak kullanÄ±lan medrese de kÃ¼lliyenin zarif mimarisiyle Ã¶ne Ã§Ä±kan kÄ±sÄ±mlarÄ± arasÄ±nda bulunuyor. Mimari aÃ§Ä±dan imaret adÄ±yla tanÄ±mlanan yoksullara yardÄ±m amaÃ§lÄ± yapÄ± da fonksiyonunu gÃ¼nÃ¼mÃ¼zde de aynÄ± hassasiyetle koruyor, semt sakinlerine aÅŸevi ÅŸeklinde hizmet veriyor. 

Genel itibarÄ±yla asÄ±rlar sonra bile ayakta olan bir tarihi deÄŸer Damat Ä°brahim PaÅŸa KÃ¼lliyesi, OsmanlÄ± mimari geleneÄŸine dair Ã§eÅŸitli detaylarÄ± yakÄ±ndan incelemek ve manevi atmosferi yaÅŸamak isteyen gezginleri bekliyor.
description.en:
Damat Ä°brahim Pasha Complex, the Ottoman structure is one of the prominent artistic and architectural elements in Nevsehir,. Completed in 1730, the historical structure is also an important value that marked the period... 

Damat Ä°brahim Pasha Complex, which also contributed to the development of the region during its construction, pioneered an important city with a growing population over time. Because after it was built, the name of the town Muskara was renamed NevÅŸehir. In a way, it would not be wrong to say the origin of the name of the city for Damat Ä°brahim Pasha Complex...

When the structural details of the complex are examined, it is seen to be consisting of, the mosque, a section to help the poor, hostel, two fountains, baths, high school, i.e. madrasas and primary school. The whole structure, located in a large area, draws attention with its inscription, stones brought from Istanbul, which contain partial details about each structure. 

The square-plan mosque is steady and open for worship even centuries later. The madrasah, which is now used as a library, is also among the highlights of the complex's elegant architecture. Architecturally, the structure to help the poor, defined as imaret, maintains its function with the same precision today and serves the inhabitants as soup kitchens. 

A historical value that in general, standing even centuries later, Damat Ä°brahim Pasha Complex, awaits travelers who want to examine the various details of the Ottoman architectural tradition closely and experience the spiritual atmosphere.
description.de:
Die osmanische Struktur Damat Ä°brahim Pasha Complex ist eines der herausragenden kÃ¼nstlerischen und architektonischen Elemente in NevÅŸehir. Das 1730 fertiggestellte historische GebÃ¤ude ist ebenfalls ein wichtiger Wert, der seine Spuren in dieser Zeit hinterlassen hat.

Der Damat Ä°brahim Pasha Komplex, der wÃ¤hrend seines Baus auch zur Entwicklung der Region beitrug, war Pionier einer wichtigen Stadt, deren BevÃ¶lkerung im Laufe der Zeit rapide zugenommen hatte. Weil der Name der Stadt MuÅŸkara nach dem Bau als NevÅŸehir geÃ¤ndert wurde. In gewisser Weise wÃ¤re es nicht falsch fÃ¼r den Damat Ä°brahim Pasha Complex, den Ursprung der Stadt zu sagen ...

Wenn man die strukturellen Details des Komplexes untersucht, sieht man, dass er aus einer Moschee, einem Abschnitt zur UnterstÃ¼tzung der Armen, einer Karawanserei, zwei Brunnen, einem Bad, einer Hochschule, dh einer Medresse und einer Grundschule besteht. Das gesamte GebÃ¤ude, das sich auf einem weiten Gebiet befindet, fÃ¤llt mit Inschriftensteinen aus Istanbul auf, die teilweise Details zu jeder Struktur enthalten.

Die quadratisch geplante Moschee ist nach Jahrhunderten noch intakt und kann angebetet werden. Die Medresse, die heute als Bibliothek genutzt wird, gehÃ¶rt mit ihrer eleganten Architektur zu den herausragenden Teilen des Komplexes. Das GebÃ¤ude, das den Armen helfen soll, das in Bezug auf die Architektur als das Imaret definiert ist, behÃ¤lt auch heute seine Funktion mit der gleichen SensibilitÃ¤t bei und dient den Bewohnern des Bezirks als SuppenkÃ¼che.

Der Damat Ä°brahim Pasha Komplex, ein historischer Wert, der auch nach Jahrhunderten im Allgemeinen fortbesteht, wartet auf Reisende, die verschiedene Details der osmanischen Architekturtradition untersuchen und die spirituelle AtmosphÃ¤re erleben mÃ¶chten.

description.en:
The islands of Yassica, which are located within the borders of Fethiye, are also adjacent to Gocek. The other name of the archipelago community, which is one of the symbol places of the Gulf of Fethiye, is YassÄ±calar. There are many islands, large and small, in this area.


The islands of Yassica, which have a sheltered and secure structure today, are suitable for many activities. Within the island, you can take part in larger blue tours other than daily boat tours. Some of the islands in this region are very small, some sailors make up special names for them. YassÄ±ca Islands resemble Kumburnu Beach as a structure. In the end section, children or those who do not know how to swim can swim safely. In this sense, it is a very ideal and reliable place for those who want to learn to swim. This swimming area is more like a swimming pool.


Boats spend the night in Yassica Islands, where you can find every shade of blue and green. The immediate coastal areas of these islands are suitable for motorized and non-motorized water sports, but also underwater diving enthusiasts often come here. One of these islands is surrounded by numerous pine and olive trees and has formed a pond in itself. Those who love to swim and, more importantly, are confident try to reach some of the islands by swimming directly. An average time of 40 minutes is enough to reach the islands by swimming.


It is possible to encounter large crowds in and around the islands of Yassica, especially in the summer months due to the intensity of the boat tours. This is why evening tours offer a calmer environment. YassÄ±ca Islands are also neighbors to two important islands such as Haji Halil and Devilli. The islands of Yassica, which are quite suitable for nature excursions with its clean bays, are also referred as â€˜Jessica Islandsâ€™ in some sources.

description.en:
The ancient city of Kadyanda in MuÄŸla, which is surrounded by history and artifacts of history, is located close to Fethiye town. About 1000 meters above the sea, the historic region is believed to have been founded in the 3000 B.C., and offers a different experience for travelers who champ at the bit


The historic settlement, on the other hand, is filled with the grueling effects of thousands of years of history. A small part of its fortifications, tombs, inscriptions and the Hellenistic Theatre in relatively good condition are seen. Although it can be seen with the trees that have come out of the stones, it knows how to keep the glory of the ancients alive.


Other parts of the city such as Kadyanda bath, running track, cistern, temple ruins are completely in ruins. There are also different remains that provide insight into the daily routine and settlements of antiquity. Objects and details, though scarcely enough to be chosen, remain traces of the artistic detail of the time.


The majority of the remains belong to the Roman period and life in the settlement is estimated to have lasted until the 7th century. According to some estimates, the reason for the abandonment of Kadyanda is due to serious water problems in the region. However, the accuracy of this thesis has not been revealed in the sources with clear evidence.


The ancient settlement, where there is also an excursion route, can thus be examined in all its details in a very comfortable way. There is also a tomb monument proposed to be seen as part of the trip, about 4 kilometers from Kadyanda. The important settlement in this historical document entourage deserves to be seen up close and awaits your visit.

description.en:
Abu Ishak, one of the great Islamic thinkers, is a hermitage built in the name of his standing. Abu Isaac, which was visited as a tomb of authority, is in fact buried in the town of Kazirun in Iran and died in Hijri 426.

It is not known exactly when the Tomb of Abu Isaac Kazeruni was held. It was built at the end of erzurum Castle's wall leading to the Double Minaret Madrasah. The tomb, which has a neat pentagon plan, is actually different from what was traditionally built during the Ottoman period. The tomb is entered through the door on the west side. There is a window above the door to illuminate the tomb .

It's all plastered. Bricks appear under the plasters poured from the upper parts and dome. It is made of brick from inside and outside, and the rest is cut stone.

There are four empty coffin in the tomb. There are two other tombs outside the tomb. One belongs to The Governor of Deli Mustafa Efendi, who died in 1813, and the other belongs to Nuri Efendi, the Undersecretary of External affairs of Sultan Abdulmecid, who died in 1843.

The Tomb of Abu Isaac Kazeruni was restored by the Ministry of Culture in 2006 and opened to tourism.
description.de:
Es ist ein Kloster, die nach Abu Ishak, einem der groÃŸen islamischen Denker, gebaut wurde. Es wird berichtet, dass der Abu Ishak, der als BehÃ¶rden-Mausoleum besucht wurde, tatsÃ¤chlich in der iranischen Stadt Kazirun begraben wurde und im Hijri Jahr 426 starb.

Es ist nicht genau bekannt, wann das Abu Ishak Kazeruni-Grab errichtet wurde. Es wurde am Ende der Mauer des Erzurumer Schlosses erbaut, die sich bis zur Medrese des Doppelminaretts erstreckt. Das Mausoleum, das einen unregelmÃ¤ÃŸigen fÃ¼nfeckigen Grundriss hat, unterscheidet sich tatsÃ¤chlich von der traditionellen osmanischen Zeit. Das Grab ist durch die TÃ¼r auf der Westseite zu betreten. An der TÃ¼r befindet sich ein Fenster, durch das das Grab beleuchtet werden kann.

Der Innenraum ist komplett mit Gips angestrichen. Unter dem Gips sind von oben und von der Kuppel Ziegel zu sehen. Es besteht aus Ziegeln von innen und auÃŸen, und der Rest ist aus Stein gemeiÃŸelt.

Es gibt vier Schreine im Mausoleum. AuÃŸerhalb des Grabes befinden sich zwei weitere GrÃ¤ber. Einer gehÃ¶rt dem Gouverneur von Ã‡Ä±ldÄ±r, der 1813 starb, Mustafa Efendi, und der andere gehÃ¶rt Nuri Efendi, dem UnterstaatssekretÃ¤r von Sultan Abdulmecid, der 1843 starb.

Das Grab von Abu Ishak Kazeruni wurde 2006 vom Kulturministerium restauriert und fÃ¼r den Tourismus verÃ¶ffentlicht.

description.en:
<html>This house of worship, which is Mardin's only Protestant church, has been one of the most important points for the city's Christians since 1860.

Mardin Protestant Church, built in 1860 by Protestants who immigrated from Diyarbakir to Mardin, becomes a frequent destination for the city's Christians in the first 100 years after its construction. The church, which was closed in 1960 as a result of a military coup in Turkey and remained closed for many years, reopens for worship in 2015 after two years of restoration work.

Mardin city, home to countless civilizations, religions and cultures in its thousands of years of history, was the capital of Assyrians and Christians in Mesopotamia in particular. In this city, people of all ethnicities and beliefs from the states that have disbanded over time as parts of a mosaic form the whole. When the majority Muslim city emigrated from a Christian community in 1860, houses of worship were inadequate and new places of worship should be built, especially for Protestants. On top of this, the Protestant Church in Mardin is built.

This structure, which has stood firmly as if it had been a challenge to time for 160 years, has an important place in terms of the city's religion and cultural tourism today. The architecture of Mardin Protestant Church, which is one of the points that those who come to visit the city does not return without stopping over, also bears traces of many different civilizations.
</html>
description.de:

Die evangelische Kirche von Mardin, die von Protestanten/Evangelikern erbaut wurde, die 1860 von DiyarbakÄ±r nach Mardin einwanderten, wird in den ersten 100 Jahren nach ihrem Bau zu einem hÃ¤ufigen Ziel der Christen der Stadt. Im Jahr 1960 blieb sie wegen eines MilitÃ¤rputschs, der in der TÃ¼rkei aufgetreten war, viele Jahren geschlossen, nach zwei Jahren Restaurierungsarbeiten wurde sie wieder zum Gottesdienst im Jahr 2015 erÃ¶ffnet.

Die Stadt Mardin, in der in ihrer jahrtausendealten Geschichte unzÃ¤hlige Zivilisationen, Religionen und Kulturen lebten, war die Hauptstadt der Assyrer und Christen in Mesopotamien. Jede ethnische ZugehÃ¶rigkeit und jeder Glaube, der im Laufe der Zeit aus den zerstreuten Staaten Ã¼brig blieb, bildete das Ganze in dieser Stadt, genau wie Teile eines Mosaiks. Als die Ã¼berwiegend muslimische Stadt 1860 von einer christlichen Gemeinde eingewandert wurde, blieben die KultstÃ¤tten unzureichend und es mussten neue KultstÃ¤tten gebaut werden, insbesondere fÃ¼r Protestanten/Evangeliker. DarÃ¼ber hinaus wird die evangelische Kirche in Mardin gebaut.

Diese Struktur, die seit 160 Jahren fest steht, als wÃ¼rde sie der Zeit widersprechen, hat heute einen wichtigen Platz im religiÃ¶sen und kulturellen Tourismus der Stadt. Die Architektur der protestantischen Kirche von Mardin, die einer der Orte ist, die die Besucher beeindruckt, weist Spuren vieler verschiedener Zivilisationen 
</html>

description.en:
<html>Midyat Caves, one of the first settlements of Mardin city, sheds light on human history with its thousands of years of history.

Since the beginning of life, one of the primary needs of mankind has been housing. Due to the lack of facilities of today, structures are often built by carved, patiently on the rocks. The people of Mardin, the cradle of civilizations, the heart of Mesopotamia, have been making living space in caves for thousands of years in accordance with this tradition.

Named after Matiate, which means the city of caves, Midyat contains many caves as much as it deserve its name... Built with a necessity brought by its geographical characteristics, these cave houses also form rock and parallel cave culture. Midyat Caves, which exhibit the most beautiful examples of art and architectural understandings shaped from the past to the present, also provide information about the concepts of patience, especially of people who have lived in the past centuries.

The houses in Midyat Caves, which were created as a result of great devotion, also give us information about the culture of social life of thousands of years ago, as they carry traces from people who have not yet moved into urbanization life.

Among those most tourists influx, Midyat Caves, consisting of in Gizzelin, Shakolin, Firiye, Kefilsannur and Linveyri Healing Caves, are also called the starting point where the city's mystical texture is formed.
</html>

Die HÃ¤user in den Midyat-HÃ¶hlen, die als Ergebnis einer groÃŸen Hingabe entstanden sind, geben uns auch Informationen Ã¼ber die soziale Lebenskultur von vor Tausenden von Jahren, da sie Spuren von Menschen tragen, die noch nicht mit der Urbanisierung begonnen haben.

description.en:
The museum, which is located within the headquarters of Ziraat Bank in Ankara-Ulus, is the first â€˜bankingâ€™ Museum in Turkey. Ziraat Bank Museum, where many valuable items, documents and antique objects related to the long-established organization's past are exhibited, is a journey in history. The historical texture of the atmosphere is also noteworthy in the museum, which became operational in 1981.

Among the works exhibited in 1863, the town of the chest, dated, historical general journal, buying and selling gold trading registries, watchman clocks, various machines, very old calculators, office supplies, phones, scales, numerous sign stands out with the bank. Bank seals, savings account wallet samples, cheques, various documents related to accounting, medallions presented to Ziraat Bank, patents and coins from various periods can also be seen during the visit to the museum.

The Ziraat Bank Museum, which is a private museum, attracts attention with its historical objects in general, but valuable examples of Turkish painting on its walls can also be examined closely. â€˜Harvest' dated 1928 and â€˜Ghazi Mustafa Kemal among the farmersâ€™ dated 1929 are among the must-see paintings in the collection.

description.en:
This special museum, also known as the birthplace of Celal Bayar and located in the Gemlik region, was opened in the name of Turkey's third president.


The historic house in Umurbey is inspired by the architectural features of the 19th century. Celal Bayar Museum opened on 26 August 1970. Both the museum and the library in the formation of Celal Bayar's efforts are concerned. This glitzy house used for the museum has three floors in total. It is considered one of the most special examples of wooden Ottoman houses. Within the museum, the original items of the house are combined with some of the materials used during the period in question.


A special section is dedicated to Mustafa Kemal AtatÃ¼rk in the Celal Bayar Museum, which is seen as a kind of Memorial Museum. On the other hand, it is seen that Celal Bayar left a special place for his Kuvay-I Milliye(Turkish Revolutionaries) years. Likewise, the Ministry of economics, the years of Ministry, the efforts of IÅŸbank during the establishment period, and the years of AtatÃ¼rk as prime minister are supported by very special photographs. Various memorials and paintings are displayed as material. At Celal Bayar Museum; the insignia, clothes, plaques, medals and pictures presented to Celal Bayar in different countries during his years as president are presented to the visitors.


Today there is a large library of 20 thousand books, newspapers or periodicals in the museum. The library is particularly prominent in recent Turkish history with its political history. In this sense, it is a very important resource for new generations. There is also a mausoleum of him right next to the Celal Bayar Museum. This mausoleum is incorporated by the government long after the museum's construction. Those wishing to visit the museum and library can consider all days except Monday. The museum is open to visitors between 10:00 and 17:00.

description.en:
<html>Edirne is a city that stands out with its historical bridges. UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ has been one of the most popular bridges in Edirne for centuries. UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼, one of the city's symbol Bridges, also forms the name of the district located here. Construction of UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼. is known to be begun during the reign of II.Murad. The bridge was completed between 1427 and 1443. The most interesting information about UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ is that it is the longest stone bridge in the world.

The architect of UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ is Muslihittin Bey, who has a very successful design. He has his signature in many other buildings in Edirne. His name is also given  a school in Edirne. UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ has a total length of 1392 meters. The width of the bridge is measured as 5.50 meters. These are the information stored in Edirne Yearbook. However, when the bridge is re-measured today, some data changes. UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ nowadays measures 1272 meters. After the repair work in 1964, its width also increased.

UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼'s first case had 174 high arches. Currently, 164 of these arches are standing. His eyes, which are located in the Ergene section, have draining eyes. The bridge has seven separate draining eyes in the total. Some plant and animal figures are used in the foot parts of the bridge. These symbolize the power of the bridge.

The fountain at the beginning of UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ has a marble inscription which was damaged during the Greek occupation. Apart from the various folds on top of this section, which is an inscription on Tamir, there are also rose motifs. The bridge contains a historic pavilion, which is used even today. This pavilion also has two balconies. In the construction of UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼, stone blocks in the form of travertine and limestone is used. The last restoration related to the bridge takes place in 2014. The General Directorate of Highways plays an important role in this repair process.
</html>
description.de:
Edirne ist eine Stadt, die sich durch historische BrÃ¼cken auszeichnet. UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ ist seit Jahrhunderten eine der beliebtesten BrÃ¼cken von Edirne. UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼, eine der symbolischen BrÃ¼cken der Stadt, bildet auch den Namen des hier gelegenen Bezirks. Der Bau von UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼. Es ist bekannt, dass es in der Zeit von Murad II begann. Die BrÃ¼cke wird zwischen 1427 und 1443 fertiggestellt. Die interessanteste Information Ã¼ber UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ ist, dass es die lÃ¤ngste SteinbrÃ¼cke der Welt ist.

Der Architekt von UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼, der ein sehr erfolgreiches Design hat, ist Muslihittin Bey. Er hat seine Unterschrift auf vielen anderen GebÃ¤uden in der Stadt Edirne. Gleichzeitig wird eine Schule in der Stadt Edirne benannt. UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ hat eine GesamtlÃ¤nge von 1392 Metern. Die Breite der BrÃ¼cke betrÃ¤gt 5,50 Meter. Dies sind die Informationen, die im Edirne-Jahrbuch aufgezeichnet sind. Wenn die BrÃ¼cke heute jedoch erneut gemessen wird, zeigt sich, dass sich einige Daten geÃ¤ndert haben. Heute misst UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ 1272 Meter. Nach den Reparaturarbeiten im Jahr 1964 hat auch seine Breite zugenommen.

In der Originalversion von UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ gab es 174 hohe BÃ¶gen. Derzeit stehen 164 dieser BÃ¶gen. In den Augen des Jugendabschnitts befinden sich Drainageaugen. Auf der BrÃ¼cke befinden sich insgesamt sieben separate Entladekammern. Einige Pflanzen- und Tierfiguren werden an den FÃ¼ÃŸen der BrÃ¼cke verwendet. Diese symbolisieren die StÃ¤rke der BrÃ¼cke.

Auf dem Brunnen am Anfang von Uzunkopru befindet sich eine Marmorinschrift, die durch die griechische Invasion beschÃ¤digt wurde. Auf diesem Abschnitt, der eine Reparaturinschrift hat, befinden sich neben verschiedenen Kurven auch Rosenmotive. Die BrÃ¼cke hat ein historisches Herrenhaus, das bis heute genutzt wird. Diese Villa hat auch zwei Balkone. Beim Bau von UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ werden SteinblÃ¶cke in Form von Travertin und Kalkstein verwendet. Die letzte Restaurierung der BrÃ¼cke erfolgt im Jahr 2014. Die Generaldirektion Autobahnen spielt bei diesem Reparaturprozess eine wichtige Rolle.

description.en:
<html>We are looking at one of the finest examples of Vaspurakan architecture. Akdamar Memorial Museum is actually an old church. 

Gagik Ardsruni, King of Armenian Vaspurakan Ist, wants to build a church on the second largest island of Lake Van. This church, which was designed by Monk Manuel, was completed in 921 B.C. and used as both a palace and a church.

The Armenian Vaspurakan Kingdom, which ruled under the Abbasids between 908-1021, leaves many works to the present day with both its architecture and culture. This museum interacts with many different civilizations due to its architecture, cultural diversity and location; it is of great importance in terms of the history of world architecture. Akdamar Memorial Museum preserves all its splendor today with its decorations and architecture.

The monumental museum, which is referred to as the 'Hripsime Type' in Armenian architecture; with Itâ€™s plan, which resembles a four-leaf clover, continues to welcome visitors with corner niches and embossing embroidery. At the same time, christianity is depicted as important names in terms of religion. These include Armenian nobles, geometric motifs, palace life and excerpts from everyday life. Restored by the Ministry of Culture in 2005, the church-palace was immediately opened to visitors as a memorial museum.
</html>
description.de:
<html>Wir untersuchen eines der besten Beispiele der Vaspurakan-Architektur. Das Akdamar Denkmal Museum ist eigentlich eine alte Kirche.

Der KÃ¶nig des armenischen Vaspurakan I.Gagik Ardsruni will auf der zweitgrÃ¶ÃŸten Insel des Van-Sees eine Kirche bauen. Diese von MÃ¶nch Manuel erbaute Kirche wurde 921 n. Chr. fertiggestellt und sowohl als Palast als auch als Kirche genutzt.

Das armenische Vaspurakan-KÃ¶nigreich, das zwischen 908 und 1021 unter den Abbasiden regierte, hinterlÃ¤sst heute viele Werke mit seiner Architektur und Kultur. Aufgrund seiner Architektur, kulturellen Vielfalt und Lage interagiert dieses Museum mit vielen verschiedenen Zivilisationen. Es ist von groÃŸer Bedeutung fÃ¼r die Weltarchitekturgeschichte. Das Akdamar Denkmal Museum bewahrt heute mit seiner Dekoration und Architektur all seinen Glanz.

In der armenischen Architektur das Denkmalmuseum "Hripsime Type"; Der Plan, der wie ein vierblÃ¤ttriges Kleeblatt aussieht, heiÃŸt seine Besucher weiterhin mit Ecknischen und PrÃ¤gungen willkommen. In dem GebÃ¤ude wurden wichtige Namen auch in Bezug auf die Religion des Christentums dargestellt. Darunter sind armenische Adlige, geometrische Motive, Palastleben und Abschnitte aus dem tÃ¤glichen Leben. Unmittelbar nach der Restaurierung des Kirchenpalastes durch das Kulturministerium im Jahr 2005 wird das Denkmal als Museum erÃ¶ffnet.

description.en:
<html>KarapÄ±nar Meke Crater Lake, a natural wonder unique all over the world; With its natural beauty, enormous scenery and tranquility, among the Konya explorers, it is the most visited spots.

A dormant volcano lies in KarapÄ±nar district of Konya... Since the Ice Age, which has exploded about 5 million years ago, this crater has been filled with water over time and turned into a lake. After millions of years, passed the volcano explodes once again 9,000 years ago. The second volcano cone falls into the same lake, and over time it becomes second lake filled with water. 

In our world, where every destruction in nature creates new natural beauties, KarapÄ±nar Meke Crater Lake, which is formed as a result of two great destruction, is breathtaking with its magnificent beauty. The lake, which is carrying a feature â€˜ Only a fish in the seaâ€™ so to say for photo shoots, is an indispensable travel destination for photography enthusiasts.
</html>
description.de:
<html>Der Karapinar Meke Kratersee ist ein weltweit einzigartiges Naturwunder; Es ist mit seiner enormen Aussicht und Ruhe einer der meistbesuchten Orte der Konya-Entdecker mit seiner natÃ¼rlichen SchÃ¶nheit,.

Ein erloschener Vulkan liegt im KarapÄ±nar-Kreisstadt von Konya. Dieser Krater, der vor etwa 5 Millionen Jahren in der Eiszeit ausgebrochen ist, wurde mit Wasser gefÃ¼llt und in einen See verwandelt. Millionen von Jahren sind vergangen und der Vulkan bricht vor 9000 Jahren erneut aus. Der zweite Vulkankegel fÃ¤llt ebenfalls in denselben See und fÃ¼llt sich im Laufe der Zeit mit Wasser, um ein zweiter See zu werden.

In unserer Welt, in der jede ZerstÃ¶rung der Natur neue NaturschÃ¶nheiten hervorbringt, atmet der KarapÄ±nar-Meke-Kratersee, der durch zwei groÃŸe ZerstÃ¶rungen entstanden ist, mit seiner groÃŸartigen SchÃ¶nheit. Der See, ein einzigartiger Ort fÃ¼r Fotoshootings, ist ein unverzichtbarer Reisepunkt, insbesondere fÃ¼r Fotografie-Enthusiasten.
</html>

description.en:
The building, which was built in Erzurum as the first mosque, built during the Ottoman period, is one of the most famous religious structures of the city.

After the fall of the IlhanlÄ± State in 1336, Erzurum was the scene of a political power battle for 200 years. Especially after the wars of Timur and Lord Alexander, most citizens emigrated, with Shah Ismail forcing the people to become Shiites. Erzurum will suffer such destruction; When the Ottoman Empire took the city in 1518, particlly a single taxpayer population could not find it.

After the city was taken from the Ottoman empire in a dilapidated state, the streets of Erzurum, which were waiting to be renovated for 20 years, receive what it wanted on the return of the Voyage of Kanuni, which went on the Iranian Campaign. Grandvizier Lala Mustafa Pasha, Cyprus conqueror, the commander of Kanuni, who initiated a long-established regeneration and reconstruction process, built the first Ottoman mosque in the city.

The mosque was completed to build in 1562; 28 windows, a central plan of integrity provided by four small domes, and the tiles on the window arches amaze those who see it. Lala Mustafa Pasha Mosque, which is the most beautiful example of Ottoman classical architecture in Erzurum city, has been frequented place by hundreds of local and foreign tourists for centuries.
description.de:
Das GebÃ¤ude, das die erste Moschee ist, die in der osmanischen Zeit in Erzurum erbaut wurde, ist eines der berÃ¼hmtesten religiÃ¶sen GebÃ¤ude der Stadt.

Nach dem Zusammenbruch des Ä°lhanlÄ± Reiches 1336 erlebte Erzurum 200 Jahre lang einen politischen Machtkrieg. Die meisten BÃ¼rger wanderten aus, besonders nach den Kriegen von Timur und Iskender Bey, als Shah Ismail die Menschen zwang, Schiiten zu werden. Es erleidet eine solche ZerstÃ¶rung, dass Erzurum, nachdem das Osmanische Reich die Stadt im Jahr 1518 eroberte, fast keine einzige BevÃ¶lkerung finden konnte.

Die StraÃŸen von Erzurum, die 20 Jahre auf eine Erneuerung warteten, nachdem die zerstÃ¶rte Stadt von den Osmanen erobert wurde, nahm der Kanuni, nach der RÃ¼ckkehr von seiner Ä°ran Feldzug, was er wollte. Lala Mustafa Pasha, der Eroberer von Zypern, einer der Befehlshaber von Kanuni, der einen radikalen Erneuerungs- und Umstrukturierungsprozess in Gang setzte, baute die erste osmanische Moschee in der Stadt.

Die Moschee wurde 1562 fertiggestellt und beeindruckt die Besucher mit 28 Fenstern, einem zentralen Plan, der aus vier kleinen Kuppeln und Fliesen auf Fenstergiebeln besteht. Die Lala-Mustafa-Pascha-Moschee, das schÃ¶nste Beispiel osmanischer klassischer Architektur in Erzurum, gehÃ¶rt seit Jahrhunderten zu den Orten, die von Hunderten einheimischer und auslÃ¤ndischer Touristen besucht werden.

description.en:
<html>The Beach Antalya Life Park, which opens the doors of a unique experience for Antalya residents and all foreign tourists, is in fact the new name of the KonyaaltÄ± Beach, which has been renovated by the Antalya Metropolitan Municipality.

KonyaaltÄ± Beach project continues to be the focus of interest of thousands of tourists with its fun activities and activities throughout the season. Offering a safe and above all a clean sea enjoyment, The Beach Antalya Park offers not only a trio of sea, sand, sun, but also all the sports and activities you can think of.

The most interesting detail in this comprehensive project implemented by Antepe, a company of Antalya Metropolitan Municipality, is the large basketball court by the sea. This park, which is a wonderful life for a metropolitan and tourism center city like Antalya, offers the opportunity to sit out to sea, chat and have a pleasant time. This park of life, which also promotes sports, is also described by locals as a â€˜European-style placeâ€™.

There are 54 businesses and 54 brands, 26 private beaches and 26 separate brands, and six kiosks serving The Beach Antalya Yesil Park, which has 400 acres of green space, 200 acres of free public beach and beach for disabled people. Sports facilities such as basketball, sailing, tennis, skateboarding, skating, football and cycling are available in the livingpPark with paid and free parking.

Serving with 3 thousand employees, Sahil Antalya Life Park also offers shopping, eating and entertainment facilities for its visitors. There is a different activity every day, especially during the summer season, in the park where the summer welcome and farewell parties take place with great enthusiasm. Bubble Show, Robot Show and concerts in The Beach Antalya Life Park is waiting for you to experience unforgettable memoriesâ€¦
</html>

description.en:
<html>Not without seeing the conical roofed houses of Harran, south of Sanliurfa, one of the oldest settlements still living in the world, its historical structures, ruins and bazda caves seen heading east in its vicinity. 

When the journey is head to the southeast, about 27 km later, the Village of Goktas and han el-bar'ur, a historical classical Anatolian Seljuk caravanserai, are encountered. The name origin of the historical structure is also quite interesting. According to the rumor, the person who built it says, 'Those who come after me will fill this place with goat manure! ' Mongols come and devastate then this beautiful place used as a barn. Among the people, the name of the 'El-Bar'ur' meaning 'goat manure' is started to be known, and thus the name of the historical caravanserai comes to the present day in the form of Han El-Bar.ur. 

Han El-Bar'ur is in ruins in general, but the entrance door and inscription are still standing. Inscription means identity; the construction process of the historical structure was completed in 1129 and was built by a person named al-Hajj HÃ¼sameddin Ali Bey is recorded in this document written on stone... There is another inscription which is on the entrance door of the building. 

In a relatively hilly area, the original plan of the caravanserai built on the Harran-Baghdad road is known to have mosques, barnplaces, hammam, various rooms and a military room. A courtyard close to the square measuring 43-44 meters is located in front of the caravanserai. 
</html>
description.de:

description.en:
Segmenler Park is located in KavaklÄ±dere District of Ankara. Located close to AtatÃ¼rk Boulevard, the park opened in 1983 with an enthusiastic ceremony. Inside the park, there is a rather flamboyant amphitheater. In total, 67 thousand square meters of space covering an area; pools, children's gardens, travel zones take up an important place. On the other hand, the monument of the SeÄŸmenler finds its place among the symbols of this region. As it is located in the center of the city, Ankara residents often encounter Segmenler Park.

40 thousand square meters of this special and nature-friendly park, which is situated on a valley where two streets converge, is divided into lawns. The children's play area covers approximately 260 square meters. There are also many sections within the Segmenler Park, from water pools to children's gardens. The open-air theatre, seen as one of the most important parts of the park, is functionally used in the summer. This place is of greater interest in the summer months, especially since it is in the form of an open-air theatre. The changing colors of the tree leaves here throughout the year offer a fascinating display. This attracts photography enthusiasts to the region, especially in autumn and winter. Segmentler Park has a wealth of appeal to people of all ages from 7 to 77. The fact that this place is in a valley gives you the opportunity to cool off in the summer. Ankarans who want to cool off and get away from the noise of the city therefore holds it in high esteem.

In Segmenler Park, you can always meet young people who play music in joy or families with children who want to enjoy being together. The grass here is the right place to rest in peace and watch the sky. You can take part in many activities, especially motion pictures, to spend a pleasant time with friends or just to get away from stress. There are many options to reach this famous park in Ã‡ankaya district.

description.en:
<html>Konya Industrial School, which the Ottoman Empire built by adopting a European style of education, is one of the most beautiful examples of Ottoman architecture in recent times.

In the Ottoman Empire, the movement of modernization begins with the Reform Period. One of the first movements of modernization is to adopt the European understanding of education. Ottoman, built new structures in order to adopt this type of education in the Sultan Abdulhamid II period. He built today's Konya Industrial School. The structure, which was founded in 1898, was completed in 1901. One of the most beautiful examples of the young Ottoman architectural period, the school also stands out with its spacious interior structure.

In 1558, Konyaâ€™s covered bazaar, built by the Ottoman Sultan Magnificent Sultan Suleiman, succumbed to time and became a ruin. The remains of the nine-domed bazaar were completely destroyed by Abdulhamid II who starts training here in order to support education in the same place and to increase the level of knowledge and well-being of his people. The architecture of Konya Industrial School is written by the governor of Konya at the time and is built by The Provincial Engineer Åefik Bey.

Konya Industrial School is one of the schools that have been standing for more than 100 years, as well as the architectural beauty of Turks, that are a nation, always cares very much about education from the past to the present.
</html>

Im osmanischen Staat beginnt die Modernisierungsbewegung mit der Tanzimat-Zeit. Eine der ersten MaÃŸnahmen des Modernisierungsansatzes ist die Ãœbernahme des europÃ¤ischen Bildungsansatzes. Nachdem die Osmanen neue Strukturen errichtet hatten, um diese Art der Bildung zu Ã¼bernehmen, bauten sie sie wÃ¤hrend der Regierungszeit von Sultan AbdÃ¼lhamid dem II., die heutige Konya Industrieschule.  Das GebÃ¤ude, dessen Grundstein 1898 gelegt wurde, wurde 1901 fertiggestellt. Die Schule, die eines der besten Beispiele der jungen osmanischen Architekturzeit ist, fÃ¤llt auch durch ihr gerÃ¤umiges Interieur auf.

Konya Bedesten, das 1558 vom osmanischen Sultan Suleyman dem PrÃ¤chtigen erbaut wurde, konnte nicht bewahrt werden und wurde zu einer Ruine. AbdÃ¼lhamid der II., der die verbleibenden Mauern der neunkuppeligen Bedesten vollstÃ¤ndig abriss, initiierte hier Bildung, um sowohl die Bildung zu unterstÃ¼tzen als auch das Wissen und das Wohlergehen seiner BevÃ¶lkerung zu verbessern. Die Architektur der Konya Industrieschule wurde vom damaligen Konya-Gouverneur geschrieben und vom Provinz Ser Ingenieur Åefik Bey erbaut.

Konya, eine Nation, die der Bildung von der Vergangenheit bis zur Gegenwart immer groÃŸe Bedeutung beimisst, ist die Konya Industrieschule neben ihrer architektonischen SchÃ¶nheit eine der Schulen, die seit mehr als 100 Jahren besteht.

description.en:
Erzurum Kazim Karabekir Stadium, where the football club known as 'Dadaslar' and The Metropolitan Municipality Erzurumspor matches are hold, is also among the city's landmarklocations. 

Erzurum Kazim Karabekir Stadium, which stands out as one of the largest stadiums in the east of Turkey, has a rectangular plan. The 105-meter-long, 68 meters of natural grass surrounds the area with a capacity of 25 thousand people, as well as sections such as buffet and WC. 

The stadium, which was recorded in meeting the FIFA criteria, began to serve under the name of Erzurum Kazim Karabekir Stadium as part of the renovation project completed in 2010 after names such as Cemal GÃ¼rsel Stadium and Yeni Erzurum Stadium as of 1968, when it was first built. In this process, the previously open goal was closed in cold and rainy weather in order to increase the comfort of spectators. Located close to the city centre, the stadium also has large-capacity parking areas. 

The opening/closing ceremonies of the Intercollegiate Winter Olympics in 2011, which have attracted a lot of international attention, and been host to the Turkish Super Cup final in 2012, are the leading attractions in the city's sports field.

Erzurums Kazim Karabekir Stadion zeichnet sich als eines der grÃ¶ÃŸten Stadien im Osten der TÃ¼rkei, mit einem rechteckigen Grundriss. Es besteht aus einer 105 Meter langen, 68 Meter breiten NaturrasenflÃ¤che mit Sitzgelegenheiten fÃ¼r 25.000 Personen sowie Abschnitten wie Buffet und WC.

Das Stadion, das nach den FIFA-Kriterien aufgezeichnet wurde, wurde im Rahmen des 2010 abgeschlossenen Renovierungsprojekts, nachdem es ab 1968 unter den Namen Cemal-GÃ¼rsel-Stadion und Yeni-Erzurum-Stadion gebaut worden war, als Erzurum-KazÄ±m-Karabekir-Stadion genutzt. Dabei wurden die bisher geÃ¶ffneten TribÃ¼nen hinter dem Tor geschlossen, um den Komfort des Publikums bei kaltem und regnerischem Wetter zu verbessern. Das Stadion, das sich in der NÃ¤he des Stadtzentrums befindet, verfÃ¼gt auch Ã¼ber ParkplÃ¤tze mit groÃŸer KapazitÃ¤t.

Im Jahr 2011 zeigte das internationale Publikum groÃŸes Interesse an den ErÃ¶ffnungs- und Abschlussfeierlichkeiten der interuniversitÃ¤ren Olympischen Winterspiele und im Jahr 2012 wurde im Stadion das Finale der Super Cup TÃ¼rkei verwirklicht.Somit wurde das Stadion eine der wichtigsten Ort fÃ¼r den Sportbereich.

UniversitÃ¤ten in der 2011 Olympischen Winterspiele auf groÃŸes Interesse in der internationalen Gemeinschaft zwischen den Ã–ffnungs- / SchlieÃŸ Zeremonien und  die 2012 Super-Cup-Finale in der TÃ¼rkei zeigte befindet sich auch das Stadion, ist es eines der Wendepunkt im Sportbereich der Stadt.

description.en:
Esat Pasha Mosque, one of the buildings that stands out for its elegant minaret and simplicity in Erzurum, the city of Mosques, has been on a high hill that has dominated the city for hundreds of years. 

According to the marble book located above the entrance gate of the mosque, it was built in the name of Mahmoud by Esat Muhlis Pasha, who served as governor of Erzurum for seven years between 1830 and 1836, was appointed by Sultan Muhlis Pasha. The construction of the mosque  the Nuru Osmaniye Mosque is taken as an example in Istanbul. In addition, due to its dilapidated, it was repaired in 1852 in the time of Erzurum Governor Zarif Mustafa Pasha. 

Esat Pasha Mosque, one of the beautiful monuments of the city, is seen to have regained its old days after the restoration in 2017. The mosque is known as the highest viewing point in Erzurum with its unique minaret as well as aesthetic eye filling with regular and high quality cutting stone workmanship. There are about 40 tombs in the south, and the scholars and pasha who served in Erzurum were buried and sultan Abdulmecit's tugra is on his inscription.
description.de:
Die Esat-Pascha-Moschee, die durch ihr elegantes Minarett und ihre Schlichtheit auffÃ¤llt, befindet sich seit Jahrhunderten auf einem hohen HÃ¼gel mit Blick auf die Stadt, in der Moscheenstadt Erzurum

Laut der Marmorinschrift an der EingangstÃ¼r der Moschee wurde sie von Esat Muhlis Pascha, der zwischen 1830 und 1836 sieben Jahre lang als Gouverneur von Erzurum fungierte,im Namen vom II. Sultan Mahmud erbaut. Die Nuru-Osmaniye-Moschee in Istanbul wurde beim Bau als Beispiel der Moschee genommen. AuÃŸerdem wurde es 1852 wÃ¤hrend der Zeit des Gouverneurs von Erzurum, Zarif Mustafa Pascha, erneut repariert.

Es ist zu sehen, dass die Esat-Pascha-Moschee, eines der SchÃ¶nheitsdenkmÃ¤ler der Stadt, nach ihrer Restaurierung im Jahr 2017 ihre alten Tage wiedererlangt hat. Die Moschee gilt als den Standort mit dem hÃ¶chsten Betrachtungswinkel in Erzurum mit ihrem einzigartigen Minarett sowie ihrer Ã¤sthetisch ansprechenden einheitlichen und hochwertigen Steinschliffverarbeitung. Gelehrte und Paschas, die in Erzurum arbeiteten, wurden in dem Grab beigesetzt, in dem sich im SÃ¼den etwa 40 GrÃ¤ber befinden und auf dem die Inschrift von Sultan AbdÃ¼lmecit steht.

12 odasÄ± bulunan ve mimarisiyle de dikkat Ã§eken SaklÄ± Konakâ€™ta silahlar, el yazmasÄ± kitaplar, antika deÄŸere sahip yÃ¼zlerce eÅŸyanÄ±n yanÄ± sÄ±ra OsmanlÄ± Ä°mparatorluÄŸuâ€™nun MÄ±sÄ±r Valisi Said PaÅŸaâ€™ya ait olan yaklaÅŸÄ±k 250 senelik kap ile KurtuluÅŸ SavaÅŸÄ± yÄ±llarÄ±ndan kalma tÃ¼fek gibi nadide eserler de yer alÄ±r.

description.en:
The Hidden Mansion, also called Antep Palace, is almost a reflection of time in Gaziantep. How could it is not? This sophisticated structure welcomes guests from Turkey and around the world and city-dwellers for  300 years with its historical richness.

Hidden Mansion, which is basically a museum opened to visit in 2011, exhibits close to 2 thousand copper items of historical importance. With this diversity, it is among the most respected museum not only in Turkey but also in the world.

The beginning story of the museum is based on the idea of exhibiting the works that put together artifacts collected over the years by Ali Atalar who is an author and a collector in a historical structure. The passion that started in high school years of Atalar, who has books on history, crafts, copper, turns into a cultural identity that is passed on to future generations in Antep mansion.

Hidden Mansion, which has 12 rooms and is notable for its architecture, also includes weapons, manuscript books, a close 250-year-old cover belonging to Said Pasha, the governor of Egypt of the Ottoman Empire, and rare works such as rifle dating from the war of Independence.

The museum, which promises a different trial of antiques, also has an outdoor space where religious breakfast can be served and tea and coffee can be enjoyed. In this way, visitors to the museum can listen in a positive atmosphere where the wealth of culture is of high value among the antique copper items.

description.en:
<html>80 Binde Devr-Ä° Alem Park, which was opened in 2014 in Meram district of Konya, gives a pleasant experience for families and children. Devr-i Alem Park in 80 Thousand, which is the first in terms of concept structure in Turkey, stands out with its width and modern understanding design. 

80 Binde Devr-i Alem Park consists of three parts: 'T-Rex Park', 'Cotton Candy Park' and 'Cihan-Ä± Turkish Park'. Each section with their different content structure and architecture allows everyone, young or old to have fun moments when they come to visit.

The part, dubbed 'T-Rex Park', eerie sounds of moving dinosaur models can be heard. The high level sounds of dinosaurs, as it bereal, cause to feel like youâ€™re on the movie set. 

There are also resting areas in the park, which has 50 different models. It's a pleasure to explore models of endangered dinosaurs millions of years ago and take pictures. 

The other part is 'Cotton Candy Park', where the children can see giant models of fairy tale heroes on the basis of a positive contribution to their imagination. 

Finally, the 'Cihan-Ä± Turkish Park' has miniatures of more than 100 architectural buildings that are culturally valuable. 
</html>

description.en:
<html>BaÅŸkale Travertines in Van, which which also has fairy chimneys like NevÅŸehir and travertines like Pamukkale, amaze visitors with its beauty. 

The carbon dioxide in the water that suddenly comes to light evaporates and a thin layer of calcium carbonate coats the rocks. These layers accumulate over time form travertines with soft lines. Although this extraordinary beauty in the rare natural phenomena segment is seen in two different places in Turkey, the one in the Pamukkale is the only widely known one. Van's Baskale Travertines wait to be discovered...

Travertines, which fascinate with its beauty, are located 35 km from the city centre. This is the only place to increase the city's tourism outside the ruins of Urartu heritage. It is discovered quite late but it also manages to attract more tourists every year.
</html>
description.de:
<html>In den Gebieten Nevsehir gibt es die Feenkamine und in Pamukkale die Travertinen und in Van beeindrucken die BaÅŸkale Travertinen durch ihre SchÃ¶nheit.

Das Kohlendioxid im Wasser taucht plÃ¶tzlich auf und das Calciumcarbonat in einer dÃ¼nnen Schicht haftet an den Gesteinen. Diese Schichten, die sich im Laufe der Zeit ansammeln, bilden Travertine mit weichen Linien. Diese auÃŸergewÃ¶hnliche SchÃ¶nheit im Segment der seltenen Naturereignisse ist nur in Pamukkale bekannt, obwohl sie an zwei verschiedenen Orten in der TÃ¼rkei zu sehen sind. BaÅŸkale Travertine der Stadt Van warten darauf, entdeckt zu werdenâ€¦

Die Travertine, die durch ihre SchÃ¶nheit beeindrucken, befinden sich 35 Kilometer vom Zentrum entfernt. Dies ist der einzige Ort, der den Tourismus der Stadt auÃŸerhalb der Ruinen des Urartu-Erbes steigert. Es wird ziemlich spÃ¤t in BaÅŸkale Travertinen entdeckt, aber es schafft es immer noch, jedes Jahr mehr Touristen anzulocken.
</html>

description.en:
<html>The museum, named after our national poet Mehmet Akif Ersoy, is located in Ã‡anakkale. The building where the museum is located is allocated by the Tacettin Sheikh who admired it during the war of independence. It is even known that Mehmet Akif Ersoy wrote The National Anthem in this house.

The house is named â€˜Mehmet Akif Ersoy Houseâ€™ by the joint decision taken by the City Council in 1949. Immediately the same year, the house was converted into a museum. Unfortunately, however, it remains in disrepair for a long time and is ruined in time. After many years, Professor Dr. Ihsan DoÄŸramacÄ± undertakes the restoration of this special house on the condition that it remains true to its original state. After the repair work, the house is opened to visitors. These repairs are completed with the support of Hacettepe University. At the same time, the Ministry of Culture, The General Directorate of foundations and the Religious Foundation have important contributions during the restoration work at the fund level. Mehmet Akif Ersoy Museum House is opened again with a magnificent ceremony held on December 24, 1984.

The historic house is notable for its high courtyard walls. It is necessary to use the small courtyard door to enter the garden section of the house. The historic building, located right in the middle section of the garden, has two storeys and is of wooden construction. On the upper floor of the building, which resembles the historic Ankara houses as an architectural style, important photographs of the great poet are found. This section is also set up as a lounge with meeting. The meeting room is considered the most magnificent spot in this historic house. In the middle section of the room, pencil-work decorations immediately stand out.

The museum, located in BayramiÃ§ District, is frequently visited in groups, especially by students studying in Ã‡anakkale. The museum, which has two floors in total, contains many memories of the poet's childhood and youth years.
</html>
description.de:
Das nach unserem Nationaldichter Mehmet Akif Ersoy benannte Museum befindet sich in Ã‡anakkale. Das GebÃ¤ude, in dem sich das Museum befindet, wird von Tacettin Åeyhi zugeteilt, der ihn wÃ¤hrend des UnabhÃ¤ngigkeitskrieges bewunderte. Es ist sogar bekannt, dass Mehmet Akif Ersoy die Nationalhymne in diesem Haus geschrieben hat.

Das Haus heiÃŸt "Mehmet Akif Ersoy Haus", mit der gemeinsamen Entscheidung des Stadtrats von 1949. Im selben Jahr wird das Haus in ein Museum umgewandelt. Trotzdem bleibt es leider lange vernachlÃ¤ssigt und wird im Laufe der Zeit zerstÃ¶rt. Nach vielen Jahren Ã¼bernimmt Professor Doktor Ä°hsan DoÄŸramacÄ± die Restaurierung dieses besonderen Hauses, sofern es seinem ursprÃ¼nglichen Zustand treu bleibt. Nach den Reparaturarbeiten wird das Haus fÃ¼r Besichtigungen geÃ¶ffnet. Diese Reparaturen werden mit UnterstÃ¼tzung der Hacettepe UniversitÃ¤t durchgefÃ¼hrt. Gleichzeitig leisten das Kulturministerium, die Generaldirektion Stiftungen und die Religionsstiftung wichtige BeitrÃ¤ge bei den Restaurierungsarbeiten auf Fondsebene. Das Mehmet Akif Ersoy Museum Haus wird am 24. Dezember 1984 mit einer groÃŸartigen Zeremonie wiedererÃ¶ffnet.

Das historische Haus fÃ¤llt mit seinen hohen Innenhofmauern auf. Es ist notwendig, die kleine HoftÃ¼r zu benutzen, um den Gartenteil des Hauses zu betreten. Das historische GebÃ¤ude befindet sich in der Mitte des Gartens, hat zwei Etagen und eine Holzstruktur. Im Obergeschoss des GebÃ¤udes, das architektonisch den historischen Ankara-HÃ¤usern Ã¤hnelt, befinden sich wichtige Fotografien des groÃŸen Dichters. Dieser Bereich ist auch als Versammlungs- und Aufenthaltsraum konzipiert. Der Versammlungsraum gilt als der prÃ¤chtigste Punkt dieses historischen Hauses. In der Mitte des Raumes fallen sofort handgezeichnete Ornamente auf.

Das Museum befindet sich im Bezirk BayramiÃ§ und wird hÃ¤ufig in Gruppen besucht, insbesondere von Studenten, die in Ã‡anakkale studieren. Das Museum, das insgesamt zwei Stockwerke hat, enthÃ¤lt viele Erinnerungen an den Dichter, insbesondere aus seiner Kindheit und Jugend.

description.en:
The Small Theatre, which has a separate place between the cultural and art structures in Ankara, is a medium-sized stage located in the Ulus District in Altindag District. The venue, one of the first theatre buildings, opened exactly on October 1, 1949. The building consists of two floors, an entrance and a balcony, so it accepts spectators on two levels.

The Small Theatre attracts attention with its classic interior design, comfortable seats, comfortable navigation and historical scene with embroidered, varnished. Today, the theatre has a capacity of about 500 spectators and is located in a nostalgic building with parking facilities.

In addition to the Small Theater, which was completed in 1930, the building also houses the Ankara State Theater is also known as the II. Evkaf Apartment Building. The building near the Youth Park, the area's prominent sightseeing and recreation area, has also been used as abode by famous names. Examples include The Painter Saip Tuna, the Poet Orhan Veli Kanik, and, a master of Turkish literature Ahmet Hamdi TanpÄ±nar.

description.en:
<html>Hadrian's Gate is one of the gates of the walls of the Roman Empire that surrounded the ancient city of Antalya in the 2nd century BC. The magnificent gate commemorating a visit by Hadrianus, who remained Roman Emperor between 117-138 and 130, is also known by the inhabitants of the region as the three gates because of its appearance.

Hadrian's Gate, which has three crossing points (eyes), came to the present day very well protected, and this feature is probably due to the fact that it was made mainly of marble with the complete closure of the castle walls built later. In this way, the historical structure which has reached the present day in a very good way, was uncovered by the destruction of the castle walls.

It is known that the upper floor of Hadrian's Gate, which is famous for its carved and relief decorations made of white marble except for its columns, was found, but this part was demolished over time. The inscription, artistic details and columns made with Corinthian style are notable and the various statues presumed to be located above Hadrian's Gate have not survived to the present day, among other information with high accuracy. In addition, various sculptures are exhibited around the historic gate, whose original decking in a very good condition can also be seen closely.

Easy access, central location and being free of charge, Hadrian's gate, featured as one of the most preferred one, situated between AtatÃ¼rk Avenue and Old Antalya, which are the busiest areas, promises traveling to literally thousands of years historyâ€¦ In the meantime, once we passed through the gate, the Hidirlik Tower, another 2nd century structure, which exits. A close-up view of the historic tower, famous for its views, is also recommended.
</html>

description.en:
Do not include only museums, parks, mosques, madrasas in your list when you come to the capital Ankara and plan a trip. There are many important natural beauties waiting for you. Davutoglu Bridge, which has a special place among them, is located in the district of NallÄ±han. Davutoglu Bridge, which is shown among the most important bridges of the city in many respects, is the extension of Sariyar Dam Lake. The bridge, which has an arch-shaped appearance, is made up of steel. DavutoÄŸlu Bridge stands out largely with its interesting views. The erosion zone in particular can be delightfully viewed from exactly this point. It is positioned directly facing the bridge through the erosion zone. The local people often visit the DavutoÄŸlan Bridge, especially since this magnificent view has been discovered recently.

With the visual feast it has created, the place which gives very special frames for the lovers of photography faces you with an impressive region such as KÄ±ztepe. During the winter months, Davutoglu Bridge takes on a very privileged atmosphere. Especially when the rock or soil that starts to play red color, white snow comes together with the landscape is very fascinating. Davutoglu Bridge is considered as a very accurate starting stop for a trekking plan to be made towards the outskirts of KÄ±zÄ±ltepe. Many people who come to the NallÄ±han region visit the Davutoglu Bridge to participate in this trekking event.

Davutoglu Bridge is also referred as â€˜Ã‡ayÄ±rhan Bridgeâ€™ in some sources. It is referred as Ã‡ayÄ±rhan because the name of Ã‡ayÄ±rhan is located at the entrance point of the bridge. The reason it is known as Davutoglu Bridge is that a village of the same name is located nearby. The exact date on which the Davutoglu Bridge was built is unclear. Estimates are that it was made during the same period as the SarÄ±yar Dam. The KuÅŸ Cenneti (Bird Sanctuary), which attracts many visitors, is very close to the site of the Davutoglu Bridge.

description.en:
<html>Payas Fortress in Hatay, one of the Turkeyâ€™s historic cities on the Mediterranian coast, it is one of the highlights of the tourist attraction located on the coast of Ä°skenderun Bay, which is an important trade centre in region.

It is known that its construction was completed in 1571. Payas Fortress, a long route known as the Haji Road, which is important to Muslims, has remained active for many centuries in this context. The castle, which also has a base location for the southern regions for the Ottoman Empire, has subsequent additions to various needs such as mosques and baths as well as its robustness. This detail indicates that the importance of the castle over time is even greater. On the other hand, there is another section within the castle that hand out food to the poor, etc. 

The castle, which survived by being preserved very well, is among the precious Ottoman architectural structures in Hatay.
</html>
description.de:

Die Burg im gleichnamigen Stadtteil Payas ist ein historisches osmanisches Verteidigungs- und VersorgungsgebÃ¤ude. Es hat acht TÃ¼rme und besteht aus vier Ecken.

Es ist bekannt, dass der Bau im Jahre 1571 abgeschlossen wurde. Die Payas-Festung, die fÃ¼r Muslime wichtig ist und sich auf einem langen Weg befindet, der als Kreuzweg bekannt ist, ist in diesem Zusammenhang seit vielen Jahrhunderten aktiv. Das Schloss, das auch als StÃ¼tzpunkt fÃ¼r die sÃ¼dlichen Gebiete des Osmanischen Reiches dient, verfÃ¼gt neben seiner Robustheit Ã¼ber zusÃ¤tzliche ErgÃ¤nzungen fÃ¼r verschiedene BedÃ¼rfnisse wie Moscheen und BÃ¤der. Dieses Detail zeigt, dass die Bedeutung der Burg im Laufe der Zeit zugenommen hat. Auf der anderen Seite gibt es hier auch einen Abteil im Schloss, wo man Essen fÃ¼r die Armen uÃ¤. verteilt werden.

Das bis heute erhaltene Schloss gehÃ¶rt zu den wertvollsten osmanischen Bauwerken in Hatay.

description.en:
There are few cities in Turkey that can compete with the historical fabric of Bursa. Especially in this ancient city, which is home to numerous buildings with an emphasis on Ottoman tradition, the icons are too much to be underestimated.


 Bursa is a city that is known for its historical value. For instance, when said green or Hacivat and KaragÃ¶z, Bursa comes to mind initially. Especially because events in the historical stage show that entertains children during Ramadan pass in Bursa. In this aspect, this historical duo hosts sculptures, cultural facilities with its name and visual elements.


The Old Mirrored Bazaar is an authentic spot, also known as Hacivat handicrafts. It is one of the easiest jobs in the world to find almost everything that is sought in the name of fabric and silk in the bazaar famous for its friendly people. Various sizes of tourist items can also be purchased in the bazaar within the color feast.


The construction of the Old Mirrored Bazaar, one of the popular shopping and sightseeing places of Bursa, dates back to the 14th century. This bazaar, which was one of the first structures built after the region was under Ottoman rule from the Byzantine Empire, serves as a bathhouse for centuries. The bazaar, which has received its share of many major fires and earthquakes in Bursa in time, enters service as the bazaar after the restoration work underwent in 1958.

Der alte Spiegel Bazaar ist ein authentischer Ort, auch bekannt als Hacivat Handwerke. Es ist das Einfachste auf der Welt, auf dem Bazaar, der fÃ¼r seine lÃ¤chelnden Menschen bekannt ist, fast alles zu finden, was als Stoff und Seide benÃ¶tigt wird. Touristische GegenstÃ¤nde in verschiedenen GrÃ¶ÃŸen kÃ¶nnen auch auf dem Bazaar am bunten Ort gekauft werden.


Das Baujahr von Eski AynalÄ± Ã‡arÅŸÄ±, einem der beliebtesten Einkaufs- und SehenswÃ¼rdigkeiten in Bursa, geht auf das 14. Jahrhundert zurÃ¼ck. Dieser Bazaar, der eines der ersten GebÃ¤ude war, das nach dem Ãœbergang der Region vom Byzantinischen Reich zur osmanischen Herrschaft errichtet wurde, dient jahrhundertelang als Badehaus. Der Bazaar, der seinen Anteil an vielen groÃŸen BrÃ¤nden und Erdbeben in Bursa hatte, wurde nach seinen Restaurierungsarbeiten im Jahr 1958 als Bazaar in Betrieb genommen.

description.en:
The discovery of a historic habitat is sure to be exciting enough for archaeologists or explorers to take heart rhythms to an uncontrollable level. Remember the archaeologist in the series Atiye on Netflix. Their excitement is one thing, and the travelersâ€™ another. It is a wonderful feeling for travellers to explore the newfound places, to inhale the texture of their culture. One of the destinations that makes this feeling surprisingly strong is the YeÅŸilova mound in Izmir. It's hard to believe, but this is a settlement dating back 8 thousand years.

It is one of the oldest settlements in Anatolia. Who knows what the discoverers have experienced, and today travellers can visit this stunning route even on the municipal bus between Bornova and Kemer. Access is also possible by private car or tours.

The details of the historic settlement are quite extensive. It contains 4 different cultural layers and 14 different architectural layers. Its height from the sea is about 20 meters, and its dimensions are around 200 x 150 meters.

Excavations are underway at YeÅŸilova HÃ¶yÃ¼k(Mound), which was discovered in 2003. The visitor center of YeÅŸilova HÃ¶yÃ¼k(Mound), which was opened in this context, was built both to see the excavation site and to perform various activities. It is notable for its modern architecture. In it, you can see the results of the excavations.

At the same time, information about the settlement area is given with the visuals of pots and pans, vases and everyday items found in the excavations. Trainings are taking place under the guidance of experts in departments such as the Archeo-park and the Neolithic village.

The centre, prepared with a sophisticated approach, is one of Bornova's most tourist-attracting cultural attractions.

description.en:
Located on Ã‡ubuk Stream, Ã‡ubuk Dam is approximately 10 kilometers north of the capital Ankara. Construction of this large dam started in 1930 and continues for six years. Ã‡ubuk Dam is one of the dams that has responded to the water needs of the people of Ankara since 1936. The water supply of the regional industry also occurs to a certain extent from here. The most interesting feature of the dam is that it was undoubtedly the first dam of the Republican Era. The total volume of the dam, which stands out as a body fill type, is 120 thousand cubic meters. The total height is 25 meters, provided that it is calculated over the stream bed. It offers a total drinking water capacity of around 3 hectometer cube per year. The volume in the lake portion of the Ã‡ubuk Dam, which is also a dam for flood control purposes, is 12.50 cubic meters.

During the foundation phase of Ã‡ubuk Dam, the great leader Mustafa Kemal AtatÃ¼rk had important initiatives. He is also personally involved in the grand opening on 3 November 1936. This dam provides considerable irrigation of the Ankara Plain. On the other hand, Ã‡ubuk Dam is considered as an important natural beauty in recent periods. In this context, the local people often consider this area as a promenade. Being 5 kilometers from the district center of Ã‡ubuk is considered as an important advantage in transportation. Fertile streams such as KÄ±ÅŸla, Ã‡ayÄ±r, KÄ±rkpÄ±nar and HacÄ±kadÄ±n feed this place for most of the year. Water taken from here is directed to Pursaklar treatment plants.

The total length of the Ã‡ubuk Dam, which both meets the water needs of the people of the region and is considered as a kind of natural beauty, is around 34 kilometers. A period of serious contamination begins due to the mixing of sewage and water intake is stopped from here. In addition, alluvials that begin to fill in the dam bowl are also effective in cutting water intake.

description.en:
<html>Although almost all of the landscape photos related to Antioch a including it, SarÄ±miye Mosque is unrecognized yet, it remains its mystery in itself. In Antakya, only information is available in the inscription at the entrance of the courtyard about this house of worship, which is located in the class of rare mosques with little information about it.

Sarimiye Mosque has only two data that can reach about it to this day. According to the inscription at the entrance of the courtyard, the mosque was repaired by SarÄ±mi Haji Halil in 1131 according to the hijra calendar. Although it is not known who this person is, the second information is that the word 'SarÄ±mi' means 'Sharp Sword' in Arabic. 

In many posters, posters and photographs depicting Antioch as of its location, all photos taken from the courtyard of the Catholic Church are located in the same frame as SarÄ±miye Mosque and the church's bell tower. But few people know which mosque this minaret belongs to!

Although the cutting stone architecture of the mosque belongs to a known style, the minaret in the mosque courtyard has an importance for the history of art. The wooden entrance door under the minaret is located in a deep niche. There are stone shapes on both sides of the niche. 
</html>
description.de:
<html>Obwohl es in fast allen Landschaftsfotografien von Antakya enthalten ist, bewahrt die SarÄ±miye-Moschee, die auf irgendeine Weise nicht erkannt wird, auch ihr Geheimnis in sich. Ãœber diese KultstÃ¤tte in Antakya in der Klasse der seltenen Moscheen ist nur eine Inschrift am Eingang des Innenhofs erhÃ¤ltlich, die nur sehr wenige Informationen Ã¼ber die Moschee enthÃ¤lt.

Es gibt nur zwei wichtige Informationen Ã¼ber die Sarimiye-Moschee, die heute erreicht werden kÃ¶nnen. Laut der Inschrift am Eingang des Hofes wurde die Moschee 1131 nach dem Hijri-Kalender von Sarimi HacÄ± Halil repariert. Obwohl nicht bekannt ist, wer diese Person ist, ist die zweite Information, dass das Wort "Sarimi" auf Arabisch "Scharfes Schwert" bedeutet. 

Auf allen Postern und Fotos, die Antakya darstellen, befinden sich die Sarimiye-Moschee und der Glockenturm der Kirche in demselben Rahmen wie auf allen Fotos, die aus dem Innenhof der katholischen Kirche stammen. Aber nur wenige wissen, zu welcher Moschee dieses Minarett gehÃ¶rt!

Obwohl die gemeiÃŸelte Steinarchitektur der Moschee zu einem bekannten Stil gehÃ¶rt, ist das Minarett im Innenhof der Moschee kunstgeschichtlich bedeutsam. Die hÃ¶lzerne EingangstÃ¼r unter dem Minarett befindet sich in einer tiefen Nische. Es gibt Steinformen auf beiden Seiten der Nische.
</html>

description.en:
<html>The Western Cape is one of the regions most visited by local tourists in Ã‡anakkale. Located at the western end of Bozcaada, this cape is an ideal place to watch the sunset. Most visitors prefer to have a picnic in this area by taking Island wine with them. It is possible to encounter large crowds here, especially in the summer months. Even watching the sunset has become a culture for this area. Therefore, the number of vans will increase towards sunset time.

Wind turbines located in this area are the symbol of the island. These turbines contribute to electricity generation since 2000. It also creates the third wind power plant in the country. It produces 30 times more energy than the island needs. The energy, which is enough for about 30 thousand people, is transferred directly from the bottom of the sea to the mainland. Compared to coal plants, there is an oxygen saving of about 80 thousand trees per wind rose. In another phrase, 17 wind roses save a wooded forest of more than 1 million. Even with one of the wind roses, Bozcaada's energy needs are met. Bozcaada wind Roses are among the places visited by visitors. Because of its interesting appearance, those who come here often take pictures in front of wind roses. Bozcaada wind Roses are also in visual harmony with the Polente Lighthouse, which is located in the same region.

It is also a preferred method to rent a bicycle to reach the wind roses on the island. Here you can also enter the sea in coves you like. The road to the wind Roses is quite enjoyable. It is only known that the road on the Frost side is relatively bumpy. In this respect, wind roses require a certain condition to reach. This is true for those who prefer biking.
</html>

description.en:
<html>The Ã‡atak Canyon within Kastamonu, one of Turkey's cities on the Asian continent, close to the Black Sea, is among the region's 'adventure-intertwined' tourist destinations. 

The surveillance area, a few hundred meters high, where a large panoramic view of the canyon can be viewed, is one of the city's most important tourist attractions. It certainly promises a different experience. This area, which is reached by 6 km by car and about 1 km of the remaining by walking, is unique for adventure lovers. 
Guests can walk on to the two separate terraces, which are reached by about 7 km. One of the terraces is wood and the other offers the pleasure of walking on glass and cruising the canyon. 

The terrace, supported by steel construction, walking on glass, stands out with its details and modern design. It is worth noting that the experience is not recommended for those who fear heights. The other terrace made of wood is relatively less scary because you canâ€™t see the cliff under your feet. It is just in your face. 

One of the city's fantastic sightseeing areas for nature tourism enthusiasts, Ã‡atak Canyon is unique with its excellent location and atmosphere. It's tempting with its fresh air, view and adrenaline, especially the glass terrace. 
</html>

<html>Die TÃ¼rkei ist in Asien und Kastamonu ist eine Stadt in der NÃ¤he des Schwarzen Meeres und der Ã‡atak Canyon liegt innerhalb der Grenzen dieser Stadt. Dieser Canyon gehÃ¶rt zu den "abenteuerlichen" Touristenzielen dieser Region.

Das wenige hundert Meter hohe Beobachtungsgebiet mit weitem Panoramablick auf das Canyon ist einer der wichtigsten Touristenattraktionen der Stadt. Es verspricht definitiv eine andere Erfahrung. Dieses Gebiet, das mit dem Auto Ã¼ber 6 km und die restlichen 1 km zu FuÃŸ erreicht werden kann, ist einzigartig fÃ¼r Abenteuerliebhaber.
Sie kÃ¶nnen Ã¼ber zwei Terrassen gehen, die Sie Ã¼ber 7 km erreicht haben, und den weiten Canyon darunter beobachten. Eine der Terrassen ist aus Holz und die andere bietet das VergnÃ¼gen, auf dem Glas zu spazieren und den Canyon zu beobachten.

Die von einer Stahlkonstruktion getragene Terrasse, die auf dem Glas lÃ¤uft, zieht mit ihren Details und ihrem modernen Design die Aufmerksamkeit auf sich. Es ist erwÃ¤hnenswert, dass die fragliche Erfahrung nicht fÃ¼r diejenigen empfohlen wird, die HÃ¶henangst haben. Die andere Holzterrasse ist relativ weniger beÃ¤ngstigend, da sich unter Ihren FÃ¼ÃŸen keine Klippe befindet, sondern direkt vor Ihnen.

Der Ã‡atak Canyon, einer der fantastischen SehenswÃ¼rdigkeiten der Stadt fÃ¼r Naturtouristen, ist mit seiner hervorragenden Lage und AtmosphÃ¤re einzigartig. Es ist attraktiv mit seiner frischen Luft, Aussicht und vor allem dem Adrenalin, das die Glasterrasse bietet.
</html>
