description.en:
<html>The Namazgah bastions located within the boundaries of Ã‡anakkale were built during the reign of Sultan Abdul Aziz. These bastions, originally known as Rumeli Aziziye Bastion, were known as the place where friday prayers were performed during the Gallipoli campaign.

During the Ã‡anakkale war, this place stands out as a relatively sheltered place. It is therefore seen as the headquarters of the troops. Given its position, it appears to have remained in the background during the war, but it can still be considered as one of the main defensive areas of the Strait. This is a real headquarters especially for the 4th Heavy Artillery Regiment and 2nd Heavy Artillery Regiment.

The Namazgah bastions are right next to the Kilithabir Castle. At this point, there are 16 separate coastal cannons in total during the war period. Two of these are registered as anti-aircraft cannons. The Namazgah was made modern in 1892. In 1915, it was included in the war. The Namazgah bastions, one of the largest and strongest bastions of the defense leg, begin at the end of the castle. The first bonettes of the Bastion are naturally seen at this point. - by the way, the wordâ€™ bonet ' has entered Turkish for the purpose of being used as a hat.- Camouflage is the main reason for its use in the field. These bonets consist of solid walls and soil. In this way, the arsenal is protected against the current attacks.

The Namazgah bastions have been put into a form suitable for visiting today. Therefore, after parking your car in the parking lot in the entrance area, it is possible to walk freely in the bastions. Already, the first time you enter the Namazgah Bastion immediately on the left side of the door will, a nice model meet you. Thanks to this model, you can easily observe the whole of the bastions. At the point opposite the entrance, you can see the part of the museum that attracts the most visitors. This place is also specially constructed for individuals with disabilities in the context of the unimpeded History Project. At the entrance of the museum, there is a comprehensive historical information about the Namazgah Bastions.
</html>
description.de:
Die Namazgah-Bastion innerhalb der Grenzen von Ã‡anakkale wurde wÃ¤hrend der Regierungszeit von Sultan Abdulaziz erbaut. Diese Bastionen, deren ursprÃ¼nglicher Name als Rumeli Aziziye Bastion bekannt war, wurden spÃ¤ter als der Ort bezeichnet, an dem wÃ¤hrend des Ã‡anakkale-Krieges gemeinsam Freitagsgebete verrichtet wurden.

WÃ¤hrend des Ã‡anakkale-Krieges ist dieser Ort ein relativ geschÃ¼tzter Ort. Daher wird es als Zentrum der Truppen angesehen. Gemessen an seiner Lage scheint es wÃ¤hrend des Krieges im Hintergrund geblieben zu sein, kann aber immer noch als eines der Hauptverteidigungsgebiete der Meerenge angesehen werden. Dies ist ein wahres Zentrum, insbesondere fÃ¼r das 4. schwere Artillerie-Regiment und das 2. schwere Artillerie-Regiment.

Die Namazgah Bastion befindet sich ebenfalls direkt neben der Kilithabir Burg. Zu diesem Zeitpunkt gibt es wÃ¤hrend der Kampfperiode insgesamt 16 verschiedene Landkanonen. Zwei davon sind als FlugabwehrgeschÃ¼tze registriert. Namazgah wurde 1892 modernisiert. 1915 wurde er in die Mitteilung aufgenommen. Die Namazgah-Bastion, eine der grÃ¶ÃŸten und stÃ¤rksten Bastionen des Verteidigungsbeins, beginnt genau am Ende der Burg. Die ersten Bonetten der Basis sind an dieser Stelle natÃ¼rlich zu sehen. - Ãœbrigens hat das Wort "Bonet" auf TÃ¼rkisch "Hut" bedeutet. - Der Hauptgrund fÃ¼r seine Verwendung auf dem Feld ist die Tarnung. Diese Bonetten bestehen aus festen WÃ¤nden und Erde. Auf diese Weise werden Arsenale vor bestehenden Angriffen geschÃ¼tzt.

Die Namazgah-Bastion wurde in eine Form gebracht, die fÃ¼r einen heutigen Besuch geeignet ist. Nachdem Sie Ihr Auto auf dem Parkplatz im Eingangsbereich geparkt haben, kÃ¶nnen Sie die Bastionen problemlos umrunden. Ein schÃ¶nes Modell wird Sie auf der linken Seite der TÃ¼r begrÃ¼ÃŸen, sobald Sie die Namazgah-Bastion betreten. Mit diesem Modell kÃ¶nnen Sie problemlos die gesamten Bastionen beobachten. An der Stelle gegenÃ¼ber dem Eingang sehen Sie den Museumsbereich, der die meisten Besucher anzieht. Dieser Ort ist auch speziell fÃ¼r behinderte Menschen im Rahmen des Barrierefreie Historie Projekt konzipiert. Am Eingang des Museums befindet sich eine umfassende historische Information Ã¼ber die Namazgah-Bastion.

description.en:
<html>Antalya Cultural Center or ACC, abbreviated as, offers services under the leadership of Antalya Cultural Arts Center.

Antalya Cultural Center, which is one of the most important cultural places of the city, started its operations in 1996. Built on an area of 9 thousand square meters, ACC has two separate halls in total. One of these halls has a capacity of 338 and the other 817 people. Both halls host period-by-period events such as exhibitions, conventions or cocktails.

It is among the venues considered in the first place for many large-scale events and organizations in the city. Prestigious formations such as the Antalya State Opera and Ballet and the Antalya State Symphony Orchestra often exhibit their stage performances here. The cultural centre includes a separate dressing and relaxation area for artists, a final make-up room and a cafÃ©.

Not only Antalya city, but also all of Turkey's most modern, technological infrastructure, one of the most robust cultural centers of the ACC; one fire curtain, one buffle and one cinema curtain is located. The number of moving curtains placed on the walls of the hall is nine in total. The fire curtain creates a safe set between the stage and the audience area in the event of a possible fire in the Hall.

The balcony portion of the Great Hall has a capacity of 125 people. Stage depth is 14 meters and stage mouth height is eight meters. The microphone layout is set so as not to disrupt the natural acoustics. Likewise, the suspended ceiling supports this process from a technical point of view. Even if no microphone is used in conference-like activities, the sound reaches the entire hall easily. It is possible to witness performances from different disciplines such as ballet, cinema and theatre throughout the year. One of the most interesting parts of the hall is the orchestra pit. The orchestra pit is controlled by an electro-mechanical control.
</html>

description.en:
KemeraltÄ± Bazaar, which reflects the original texture of Izmir, is easily reached by following the roads behind the Famous Clock Tower in the Konak district of the city. Shopping is the first place that comes to mind.

It's hard to believe, but this market is home to 15 thousand business places. It is possible to find almost everything that is wanted and causing curiousity among the shops that are spread over a wide area.It does not escape the attention that it retains its historical identity; it stretches between inns, baths, historical fountains and shopping routes. In KemeraltÄ± Bazaar, for example, there are about 20 Inns at various points.

It is almost an orientation point for visitors. There is a wide variety of local and foreign brands from stores to spice shops, from wedding dressers to goldsmiths . It's also possible to catch a breath in cafes and eat in historic restaurants. A large number of businessmen can also be seen in the area. In the meantime, the bazaar is located in a very central destination and there are a variety of activities nearby and historical sightseeing areas adjacent to your route.

KemeraltÄ± Bazaar is one of the pleasant places that makes Izmir the Izmir. It offers the luxury of enjoying the moment with a charming ambience.

You can shop at modest prices and taste delicious delicacies here. Don't forget the local banquets.

description.en:
Rice Khan is one of the historical shopping points with an emphasis on Ankara's unique history. The khan, which came in its original form from the 18th century to the present day and is located in a very beautiful garden, is very spacious with its 3-storey structure and houses many shops within it.

The historic building, which serves as a mansion for those who came to the city at the time, is alive today with antique shops. There are already more than 40 antique shops in the Rice Khan, which has a separate location due to being the â€˜first wooden khanâ€™ in Ankara.

Rice Khan, known for its historical texture and friendly tradesmen, is one of the haunts in Ankara when it is called Antique. With its small stools in front of each shop, it is also possible to find almost any items that may be needed in the inviting antique shops. Old carpets, miniatures, rugs, porcelain, antique, old lamps, tables, gramophone, cameras, old technological products, with elegant wooden furniture, and appliances manufactured from various materials, so to speak, between objects of different types, Rice Khan which promises a time-travel is also among one of the popular venues visited by many domestic and foreign tourists.

description.en:
<html>The first place that many people think of when it is called Edirne is probably the Selimiye Mosque. Selimiye Mosque, which is regarded as a symbol for the city, is a work that those who come to the city never forget to visit. This particular mosque is considered to have been commissioned by II. Selim to Mimar Sinan, but there is no clear information about this. The construction process of the Selimiye Mosque, which is regarded as one of the most valuable works of the city of Edirne but also of the Ottoman Empire, began in 1568. II. Selim comes to the city to sign a peace treaty with the Austrians and stays here for a long time. It is known that he has been interested in Edirne since his youth. Due to II.Selim's death, it has to be opened quickly long before planned.

The Selimiye Mosque was recently honored by UNESCO by being included in the tentative list of World Heritage sites. In 2011, its 'temporary' status was removed and it was deemed to have entered this list in real terms. Mimar Sinan was 80 years old when he built the mosque. Therefore, for the Selimiye Mosque, he used the phrase " my masterwork." The mosque, which proudly presents Ottoman art to the world, is regarded as a masterpiece. Today, the property rights of the mosque belong to the Sultan Selim Foundation. The mosque is located in Kavak Square on Yeni Mahalle in Edirne city centre. Yildirim Bayezid also built a palace in the same area in previous years.

The most notable part of Selimiye Mosque is its four minarets. These four minarets are easily spotted even from far away. The mosque is largely made of material in cut stone. Selimiye Mosque, which holds the title of being the largest mosque in the period of its construction, is a subject of curiosity and subject of research about how its huge dome was not destroyed when taken into account todayâ€™s technological and engineering knowledge. Each detail of the Selimiye Mosque, which covers a huge area of 2,475 square meters and is also an example of urban planning, just like the Suleymaniye Mosque in Istanbul, was constructed with passages from the mastery of Mimar Sinan. The height of the mosque is 43 meters above the ground. The length of the dome is higher than  Hagia Sophia.
</html>
description.de:
Wenn es um Edirne geht, ist der erste Ort, an den viele Menschen denken, wahrscheinlich die Selimiye-Moschee. Die Selimiye-Moschee, die als wahres Symbol der Stadt gilt, ist ein Werk, das die Besucher der Stadt nie verpassen. Diese spezielle MoscheeEs wird angenommen, dass es von Mimar Sinan von Selim II. gebaut wurde; jedoch gibt es keine klaren Informationen zu diesem Thema. Der Bauprozess der Selimiye-Moschee, die als eines der wertvollsten Werke nicht nur von Edirne, sondern auch des Osmanischen Reiches gilt, beginnt 1568. Selim II. kommt in die Stadt, um einen Friedensvertrag mit den Ã–sterreichern zu unterzeichnen und bleibt dort lange. Es ist bekannt, dass er sich seit seiner Jugend fÃ¼r Edirne interessiert.. Wegen Selims II Tod muss er lange vor seinem geplanten Start hinausstÃ¼rmen.

Die Selimiye-Moschee wurde kÃ¼rzlich von der UNESCO mit der Aufnahme in die vorlÃ¤ufige Liste des Weltkulturerbes ausgezeichnet. Im Jahr 2011 wurde der Status â€TemporÃ¤râ€œ abgeschafft und es wurde davon ausgegangen, dass er real in diese Liste aufgenommen wurde. Mimar Sinan war 80 Jahre alt, als er die Moschee baute. Aus diesem Grund benutzte den Ausdruck. â€œEs ist mein Meisterwerkâ€ fÃ¼r die Selimiye-Moschee. Die Moschee, die der ganzen Welt stolz osmanische Kunst prÃ¤sentiert, gilt als wahres Meisterwerk. Heute gehÃ¶ren die Eigentumsrechte der Moschee der Sultan-Selim-Stiftung. Die Moschee befindet sich am Kavak-Platz in der Yeni Mahalle im Stadtzentrum von Edirne. In den vergangenen Jahren baute YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m Bayezid in der gleichen Gegend einen Palast.

Der auffÃ¤lligste Teil der Selimiye-Moschee sind die vier Minarette. Diese vier Minarette sind auch von weitem leicht zu erkennen. Die Moschee besteht hauptsÃ¤chlich aus geschnittenem Steinmaterial. Die Tatsache, dass die Selimiye-Moschee, die den Titel der grÃ¶ÃŸten Moschee der Zeit ihres Baus trÃ¤gt, trotz des heutigen technologischen und technischen Wissens nicht zusammengebrochen ist, ist eine Frage der Neugier und Forschung. Auf einer FlÃ¤che von insgesamt 2.475 Quadratmetern wurde jedes Detail der Selimiye-Moschee mit Passagen des Meisters von Mimar Sinan erbaut, da es genau wie die SÃ¼leymaniye-Moschee in Istanbul ein Beispiel fÃ¼r Stadtplanung ist. Die HÃ¶he der Moschee Ã¼ber dem Boden betrÃ¤gt 43 Meter. Die Kuppel befindet sich vor der Hagia Sophia.

description.en:
Kapan Khan, located in the western section of the Great Mosque in Bursa, is built by I.Murat. The written sources quoted about the khan emphasize that this place essentially functioned as a guest house rather than as a trading house. In the same area, during the arrangement of AtatÃ¼rk Street, a section of the walls unfortunately remain in a state of collapse. This section of the khan is divided into roads. This unfortunate situation is known to have occurred between 1903 and 1906. The name of the street in question was previously Palace Street. Kapan Khan also encountered a major fire disaster in 1958. It loses its old popularity even though it is repaired again after the fire.


When the khan was first built, agricultural products were marketed here. Today, some rooms on the north side are standing, with the entrance having a vault cover. When you visit Kapan Khan, you can see largely with planting or textile workshops. In some sources it is stated that this impressive place was created by Isa Bey. The same sources also say that the khan was built in order to provide income to the complex in this region. The name of the khan evolves from the Arabic word â€˜Kabbanâ€™. The word 'Kabban' is called the instruments used in the name of weighing the products offered at the khan entrances.


The area covered by Kapan Khan is about 80 square meters. Both the ground floor and the first floor of this place have entrance sections. A total of 44 rooms are created for both passengers and traffickers who come here with caravans. In the eastern section of the khan, there may be a special section thought to house the horses brought here. Consisting of portico rooms around a courtyard, Kapan Khan had 29 Rooms in total in 1685. Accordingly, it is estimated that other rooms were included in the khan in later periods. Since the khan has undergone numerous repairs since the first time it was built, it loses its original identity and function at a very heavy rate.
description.de:
Der Kapan Khan im westlichen Teil der GroÃŸen Moschee in Bursa wurde von Murat dem I. erbaut. Aus den schriftlichen Quellen Ã¼ber das Gasthaus geht hervor, dass dieser Ort hauptsÃ¤chlich als GÃ¤stehaus und nicht als GeschÃ¤ftshaus fungiert. Leider mÃ¼ssen einige der Mauern wÃ¤hrend der Anordnung der AtatÃ¼rk-StraÃŸe in der gleichen Gegend abgerissen werden. Dieser Teil des Gasthauses wird mit der StraÃŸe geteilt. Es ist bekannt, dass diese unglÃ¼ckliche Situation zwischen 1903 und 1906 auftrat. Der Name der fraglichen StraÃŸe war zuvor Saray StraÃŸe. Kapan Khan stÃ¶ÃŸt 1958 auch auf eine groÃŸe Brandkatastrophe. Obwohl es nach dem Brand repariert wird, verliert es seine frÃ¼here PopularitÃ¤t.

Landwirtschaftliche Produkte werden hier vermarktet, als das Gasthaus gebaut wurde. Heute stehen einige RÃ¤ume auf der Nordseite mit einem gewÃ¶lbten Eingang. Wenn Sie Kapan Khan besuchen, kÃ¶nnen Sie NÃ¤h- oder TextilwerkstÃ¤tten begegnen. In einigen Quellen wird angegeben, dass dieser beeindruckende Ort von Isa Bey geschaffen wurde. In den gleichen Quellen steht, dass das Gasthaus gebaut wurde, um dem Komplex in dieser Region Einkommen zu verschaffen. Der Name des Gasthauses leitet sich vom arabischen Wort "Kabban" ab. Das Wort "Kabban" bezieht sich auf die Werkzeuge, mit denen die an den EingÃ¤ngen des Gasthauses prÃ¤sentierten Produkte gewogen werden.

Die von Kapan Khan bedeckte FlÃ¤che betrÃ¤gt rund 80 Quadratmeter. Es gibt Eingangsbereiche sowohl im Erdgeschoss als auch im ersten Stock. Insgesamt werden 44 Zimmer fÃ¼r Passagiere und Wohnwagen geschaffen, die mit Wohnwagen hierher kommen. Ein spezieller Abschnitt kann im Ã¶stlichen Teil des Gasthauses erwÃ¤hnt werden, in dem die hierher gebrachten Pferde untergebracht werden sollen. Kapan Han, das aus Portikuszimmern rund um einen Innenhof besteht, soll 1685 insgesamt 29 Zimmer haben. Dementsprechend wird geschÃ¤tzt, dass andere RÃ¤ume in der nÃ¤chsten Periode eingeschlossen wurden. Da das Gasthaus seit seinem ersten Bau viele Reparaturen durchlief, verliert es seine ursprÃ¼ngliche IdentitÃ¤t und Funktion mit sehr hoher Geschwindigkeit.

description.en:
<html>Halime Hatun Tomb is the mausoleum of one of the most important Turkish women. Halime Hatun, who gave his name here, is the mother of Osman Gazi, who founded an empire that will last 600 years, and Ertugrul Gazi's wife. Halime Hatun is one of the few very important individuals in history and has a great place in Turkish history.

Turks always care about women. So that if the ruler makes a decision without their partner, that decision is considered invalid. Turkish woman rides horses, throws arrows, guides her people when emigrating, and even chooses her own place to stay. Halime Hatun is one of the most important turkish women who holds a place that can not be reneeded in the state office...

The mausoleum of Halime Hatun, the mother of Osman Gazi, who founded the Ottoman Empire, which ruled for 600 years; Located in the heart of Mesopotamia, in the gevaÅŸ district of Van. This tomb, which also includes the Anatolian Seljuk tomb right next to it, is a depiction of a mother who is embraced by her sons in an architectural sense. 

The tomb, built by Melik Ä°zzeddin, is the work of Assad, son of AhlatlÄ± Pehlivan. The work has a 12-pointed body and has a cone-shaped roof. Geometric writings, medallion shapes and plant motifs are found in the structure, which has separate machining in each corner.

This 685-year-old work, which sheds light on Anatolian Seljuk history and has never deteriorated to this day, awaits its visitors with all its greatness.
</html>
description.de:
<html>Halime Hatun Kuppel ist das Mausoleum einer der wichtigsten tÃ¼rkischen Frauen. Halime Hatun, die hier ihren Namen gab, ist die Mutter von Osman Gazi, der ein 600 Jahre langes Reich grÃ¼ndete, und die Frau von ErtuÄŸrul Gazi. Halime Hatun, das in der Geschichte sehr besonders ist, hat einen groÃŸen Platz in der tÃ¼rkischen Geschichte.

TÃ¼rken schÃ¤tzen Frauen immer. So sehr, dass der Herrscher, als er eine Entscheidung traf, als unwichtig betrachtet wurde, wenn er keine Frau bei sich hat. Die TÃ¼rkin reitet auf einem Pferd, schieÃŸt auf einen Pfeil, fÃ¼hrt ihr Volk bei der Auswanderung und wÃ¤hlt sogar ihre eigene Unterkunft aus. Halime Hatun ist auch, eine der wichtigsten tÃ¼rkischen Frauen, die einen unbestreitbaren Platz im Staat haben â€¦

Das Mausoleum von Halime Hatun, der Mutter von Osman Gazi, der das Osmanische Reich grÃ¼ndete, das 600 Jahre lang regierte; Es befindet sich im Herzen von Mesopotamien im Stadtteil GevaÅŸ in Van. Diese Kuppel, in der sich auch das anatolische seldschukische Grab befindet, zeigt eine Mutter, die ihre Kinder architektonisch umarmte.

Die von Melik Izzeddin erbaute Kuppel ist das Werk von Assad, dem Sohn von Ahlatli Pehlivan. Die Arbeit, die einen Hauptteil mit 12 Ecken hat, hat ein kegelfÃ¶rmiges Dach. Geometrische Schriften, Medaillonformen und Pflanzenmotive finden sich im GebÃ¤ude, das an jeder Ecke separate Gravuren aufweist.

Dieses 685 Jahre alte Werk, das die Geschichte der anatolischen Seldschuken beleuchtet und bis heute erhalten bleibt, wartet mit seiner ganzen GrÃ¶ÃŸe auf seine Besucher.
</html>

description.en:
DereyamanlÄ± Church, one of the oldest churches in Cappadocia region, has been defying time since the end of the 4th century.

Christians in Nevsehir, who played a major role in the spread of the religion of Christianity to Anatolia, fled the persecution of The Pagan Roman Emperor Constantine I, creating a new area of life and belief here. The Christian people, who go on the path of providing integrity by consolidating the natural beauty of the city with churches, give NevÅŸehir its historical monuments today.

The people who had to migrate to cappadocia region in 64 BC and built countless churches here take a deep breath as Constantine I moved to the religion of Christianity just before his death. A decent living space is created with villages, palaces and churches built using the art of decoration without disturbing the fabric of the city. The construction of DereyamanlÄ± Church dates back to the 4th century. 

DereyamanlÄ± Church amazes those who see it with its walls, where hand-embroidered geometric motifs and biblical excerpts are depicted in red paint. One of the structures that are 'irreversible without sight' for all guests of the city, the church sheds light on both Christianity and human history.

Das christliche Volk, das auf dem Weg ist, eine Einheit zu erreichen, indem es die natÃ¼rliche SchÃ¶nheit der Stadt mit Kirchen verstÃ¤rkt, bringt NevÅŸehir heute zu seinen historischen DenkmÃ¤lern.

Menschen, die 64 n. Chr. in die Region Kappadokien einwandern mussten und hier zahlreiche Kirchen bauten, atmen tief durch, als Konstantin der I. kurz vor dem Tod in die christliche Religion Ã¼berging. Mit DÃ¶rfern, PalÃ¤sten und Kirchen, die mit dekorativer Kunst gebaut wurden, ohne die Struktur der Stadt zu ruinieren, wird ein anstÃ¤ndiger Lebensraum geschaffen. Der Bau der DereyamanlÄ±-Kirche stammt aus dem 4. Jahrhundert.

Die DereyamanlÄ±-Kirche Ã¼berrascht diejenigen, die sie mit ihren WÃ¤nden sehen, in denen handgeprÃ¤gte geometrische Motive und aus der Bibel zitierte Szenen rot gestrichen sind. Als eine der Strukturen, die fÃ¼r alle GÃ¤ste der Stadt â€unwiderruflichâ€œ sind, beleuchtet die Kirche sowohl das Christentum als auch die menschliche Geschichte.

description.en:
<html>The first museum in Antalya, a cultural treasure with its thousands of years of history, was founded in 1922. The museum established at the Alaaddiin Mosque stored artifacts compiled from the city and its surroundings. The works were moved to Yivli Minaret and complex in 1934 and were opened to visitors in 1937. The collection, enriched by archaeological finds in Perge and Side, began to be seen in its present building in 1972. Finally, in 1985, its current location was further enriched with an unchanged series of works.

Today, many exhibition halls, children's Section, Open-Air galleries are divided into sections in the Antalya Museum, visitors, a chronological order and thousands of artefacts on topics can examine closely, history can go on a journey.

The halls in the museum are as follows: Natural History and Prehistory, small artifacts, Hall of Gods, Hall of small artifacts-2, Emperors, grave cultures, halls of mosaics and icons, coins, Ethnography halls, and finally children's section.

In these halls, fossils belonging to various times, tools found in Karain Cave, examples of ceramic art dating back to the 12th century BC, statues of Gods, statuettes, vessels and vases belonging to the 2nd century BC can be examined. In addition, portrait statues unearthed from Perge excavations, two sarcophagi, The Philosophers mosaic found in Seleukeia excavation, coins dating from the 6th century BC to the present day, some gold and silver treasures unearthed in the region can be seen.

The Ethnography Hall has a large collection of Seljuk and Ottoman tiles, religious artifacts, carpets and trappings that shed light on the cultural past. The museum, established in the heart of Antalya, is located on an area of more than 30 thousand square meters in MuratpaÅŸa district.
</html>

description.en:
After Vietorio Falls (120 meters) and Niagara Falls (51 meters), Tortum Falls, the world's third largest waterfall, has a height of 48 meters and a width of 22 meters. The waterfall, which amazes those who see it with its worldwide features and stunning views, creates a unique ambience with its rainbow.

Tortum Waterfall, which was formed as a result of a landslide experienced in the 18th century of the mountain near the village of BalÄ±klÄ±, was formed by the closure of the Tev Valley, where tortum river flows. The height of the waterfall and its surroundings above sea level is 1,000 meters. The lake, which occurs at the end of the waterfall, is in the form of a natural pool. And here currently you can do water sports.

There are viewing balconies in front of the waterfall; Local, foreign tourists who come here enjoy the waterfall view with a magnificent lyintity structure, while listening to the roaring sound. As this follow-up climbs to the balconies, it is said that the air taken on the tracking stairs is good for people with shortness of breath and heart disease.

The most spectacular months of Tortum Waterfall, which takes on a different beauty at all periods of the year, are April and May. In June, there was a decrease in the amount of water. The waterfall and its surroundings are among the most popular promenade areas of Erzurum. Tortum Waterfall supply energy to the country besides the tourism. It is worth noting that the last hydroelectric power plant was built in 1952-1960.
description.de:
Der Tortum-Wasserfall, der nach dem Vietorio-Wasserfall (120 m) und den NiagarafÃ¤llen (51 m) der drittgrÃ¶ÃŸte Wasserfall der Welt ist, hat eine HÃ¶he von 48 m und eine Breite von 22 m. Der Wasserfall, der die Menschen mit seiner weltklassischen Eigenschaft und atemberaubenden Landschaft fasziniert, schafft mit seinem geformten Regenbogen eine einzigartige Ambiente.

Der Tortum-Wasserfall, der durch den Erdrutsch im 18. Jahrhundert entstanden ist, entstand durch die SchlieÃŸung des Tev-Tals, in dem der Tortum-Strom flieÃŸt. Die HÃ¶he des Wasserfalls und seiner Umgebung Ã¼ber dem Meeresspiegel betrÃ¤gt tausend Meter. Der See, der sich am Ende der Stelle bildet, an der der Wasserfall flieÃŸt, hat die Form eines natÃ¼rlichen Beckens. Und hier werden heute Wassersportarten gemacht.

Es gibt Aussichtsbalkone vor dem Wasserfall und einheimische und auslÃ¤ndische Touristen, die hierher kommen, genieÃŸen die herrliche Aussicht auf den Wasserfall und lauschen die GerÃ¤usche des Wasserfalls. Es wird gesagt, dass die Luft, die auf der Aussichtstreppe auf diesen Aussichtsbalkonen eingeatmet werden, gut fÃ¼r Menschen mit Atemnot und Herzkrankheiten ist.

Die schÃ¶nsten Monate des Tortum-Wasserfalls, der zu jeder Jahreszeit eine andere SchÃ¶nheit hat, sind April und Mai. Im Juni nimmt die Wassermenge ab. Der Wasserfall und seine Umgebung zÃ¤hlen zu den beliebtesten Promenadengebieten von Erzurum.

ErwÃ¤hnenswert ist auch, dass das Wasserkraftwerk zuletzt zwischen 1952 und 1960 errichtet wurde. Neben dem Tourismus trÃ¤gt der Tortum-Wasserfall dank des Kraftwerks zur ElektrizitÃ¤t des Landes bei.

description.en:
Yakutiye Madrasah, which is processed with fine patterns such as needle lace, from the Ilhans period; It was built by Emir Hodja Jalalettin Yakut during the reign of Olcaytu, the ruler of the period. 

The madrasah with closed courtyard, iwan and rivaq has managed to stand since 1310. The structure, which is the largest in Anatolia among these types of madrasas, is also among the symbol works of Erzurum. 

Sultan Olcaytu's on behalf of Gazan Khan and Bolugan Hatun makes this madrasah hodja Yakut Gazani. The place, which was operated as a madrasah until the Ottoman period, was used as a foundry after a while and has been operating as a military warehouse since the end of the 19th century. In 1964 and 1973, the Directorate of Foundations underwent repairs in Republic period. Yakutiye Madrasah was last restored by the Ministry of Tourism in 1991 and won the form of the Archaeological Museum.

To the west of YakupoÄŸlu Madrasah, there is a taÃ§kapÄ±, a cubic base to the south, a cylindrical-bodied minaret and a cylindrical cone corner tower reflecting the same formal features in the northern corner. Especially in the side wings of the TaÃ§kapÄ±, the tree of life depicted from a water source like coming out the vases, two lion figures on each other, and double-headed eagle figures on it are important for Islamic iconography.
description.de:
Yakutiye Medrese aus der Ä°lhanlÄ±-Zeit wurde mit feinen Mustern verarbeitet und es wurde von Emir Hodja Celalettin Yakut wÃ¤hrend der Regierungszeit von Olcaytu gebaut.

Die Medresse mit geschlossenem Innenhof, Iwan und Portikus ist seit 1310 erhalten geblieben. Die Struktur, die unter den Medresen dieser Art die grÃ¶ÃŸte in Anatolien ist, gehÃ¶rt auch zu den Symbolwerken von Erzurum.

Im Auftrag von Sultan Olcaytu Gazan Han und Bolugan Hatun wurde diese Medresse von Hoca Yakut Gazani gebaut. Der Ort, der bis in die osmanische Zeit als Medrese diente, wurde nach einer Weile als GieÃŸerei genutzt und diente seit dem spÃ¤ten 19. Jahrhundert als MilitÃ¤rlager. Das Fundament der Stiftungen wurde 1964 und 1973 nach der republikanischen Zeit repariert. Yakutiye Medrese wurde schlieÃŸlich 1991 vom Tourismusministerium restauriert und erhielt die Form eines ArchÃ¤ologischen Museums.

Westlich von YakupoÄŸlu Medrese befindet sich ein Kronentor, im SÃ¼den ein Minarett mit kubischer GrundflÃ¤che und zylindrischem KÃ¶rper und in der nÃ¶rdlichen Ecke ein Eckturm mit zylindrischem Kegel, der die gleichen formalen Merkmale aufweist. Besonders in den Nischen an den SeitenflÃ¼geln der Krone ist ein Lebensbaum aus einer Wasserquelle, als ob es aus einer Vase kommen wÃ¼rde, abgebildet, und zwei LÃ¶wenfiguren, die sich gegenÃ¼berstehen, und die Doppeladlerfiguren sind fÃ¼r die islamische Ikonographie wichtig.

description.en:
Hodja Muslihiddin mosque is a palce built in the time of the Ottoman Sultan Ã‡elebi Mehmet and is a place of high historical value.


Hodja Muslihiddin, who gave his name to the mosque, built this place in 1493. The mosque measures between 7.67 and 8.10 meters of internal measurements are among the information found. The last communion place, one of the places of interest, has a depth of about 5 meters. Hodja Muslihiddin mosque is also named as â€˜Court Mosqueâ€™ by local people.


The windows in the eastern part of the historical place of worship are pointed arched. The bricks that are woven here use interesting motifs such as negro or bird's beak. On the window pediments, more baklava motifs were preferred. The final congregational area is at the lower level of the main worship section. This area has a wooden ceiling and its upper section is covered by a private roof. The main worship section is found to be based on prismatic triangles. The dome has an octagonal shaped pulley as a structure. People who want to go to the minaret should use the stairs located in the eastern part of the main place of worship.


Hodja Muslihiddin mosque is located on the corner where Ibrahim Pasha Street and Girls ' High School Street meet exactly. To reach the mosque, one can walk from the city centre, especially through Tahtakale Square. In the construction of the mosque, his signature found in the construction process, Hoca Muslihiddin Effendi was also the person who personally built the Irgandi Bridge.


Although rarely, some sources say that the mosque was built by the Grand Vizier Ibrahim Pasha, not by the teacher Muslihiddin Effendi. Since the interior of the mosque has been plastered in places, its original state has been lost to a certain extent. During the first period when the Hodja Muslihiddin mosque was built, it essentially functions as a neighborhood Masjid. The conversion of this Masjid into a mosque took place in 1615. Since the conversion process was carried out with the permission of the Sultan at that time, the 18th Ottoman Sultan and 97th Islamic caliph Sultan Ibrahim have his permission.


Today, the presence of an impressive plane tree and a historical fountain in the front section of the Hodja Muslihiddin mosque adds a natural mystic air to the grandeur of the building.

description.en:
<html>Sanliurfa, the ancient city that fascinates its abundance, Euphrates River, its people, its authentic texture and atmosphere, is located in the southeast of Turkey, which has large lands spread across Asia and Europe. 

The texture of the short stone structures, combined with the soil and sky on farmland all over the city, is the sky of the city by meeting with natural riches. In this context, KasaptaÅŸÄ± Park, which is one of the public projects in the focus of health, sports and rest, is among the prominent structures of ÅanlÄ±urfa. 

KasaptaÅŸÄ± Park, which is spread over a large area in Refahiye Neighborhood, close to the city center, has been a standout investment in recent years. The park, which offers the opportunity to have a pleasant time and socialize in a wide area intertwined with nature for the residents of the region, also attracts attention with its recreation areas and social facilities. 

KasaptaÅŸÄ± Park features sports fields, hiking and jogging trails. Especially on weekends, the areas in question, which constitute the meeting point for sports lovers, are appreciated for their well-being. 

With its well-maintained and stylish landscape, benches where sunset can be watched, KasaptaÅŸÄ± Park is one of the attractions in the region. 

</html>

Die Textur der kurzen Steinstrukturen, die sich mit dem Boden und dem Himmel in den landwirtschaftlichen FlÃ¤chen in der ganzen Stadt verbinden, trifft auf den natÃ¼rlichen Reichtum und bildet die Silhouette der Stadt. In diesem Zusammenhang gehÃ¶rt der KasaptaÅŸÄ±-Park, eines der Ã¶ffentlichen Projekte im Schwerpunkt Gesundheit, Sport und Freizeit, zu den herausragenden Bauwerken von ÅanlÄ±urfa.

Der KasaptaÅŸÄ±-Park erstreckt sich Ã¼ber ein weites Gebiet im Refahiye-Viertel in der NÃ¤he des Stadtzentrums und ist eine der bemerkenswerten Investitionen der letzten Jahre. Der Park, der den Bewohnern der Region eine angenehme Zeit und Gelegenheit zur Sozialisierung bietet, zieht mit seinen Erholungsgebieten und sozialen Einrichtungen Aufmerksamkeit auf sich.

Im KasaptaÅŸÄ± Park gibt es SportplÃ¤tze, Wander- und Laufstrecken. Diese Bereiche, die vor allem am Wochenende den Treffpunkt von Sportliebhabern darstellen, werden durch ihre gute Pflege geschÃ¤tzt.
Der KasaptaÅŸÄ± Park ist eine der Attraktionen in der Region mit seiner gepflegten und stilvollen Landschaft und BÃ¤nken, auf denen der Sonnenuntergang beobachtet werden kann.

</html>

description.en:
<html>The Ancient City of Kilistra, which appeared as we were walking on the King's Road of Konya, sheds light on the present day with its history dating back to the 3rd century BC.

The Ancient City of Kilistra is filled with some of the most magnificent works of the Hellenistic Period, dating back to 323 BC, the year of the great Alexander's death, to 30 BC, when the Romans seized Egypt. Especially when Christianity is spreading rapidly in Anatolia, the city that grew with great momentum; it has a mystical atmosphere with its ancient roads, bunkers, churches and many settlements.

Kilistra, which has structures that look just like fairy chimneys in Cappadocia district of NevÅŸehir, is also called Cappadocia of Konya. Built on the King's Road, which is of strategic importance to the Romans, this place is particularly prominent with its cross-planned chapel and Hyacinth Church. The ancient city, where explorers who search the paths of monasteries can watch the entire Konya Plain from the scout towers, is also one of the important cultural and faith tourism points of Konya.

The Ancient City of Kilistra, which takes its travellers on a real time journey, so to speak, has a very important place in terms of christian history. The city, home to Azize Theakla, who escaped pagan rule, has been subjected to numerous attacks throughout its history. Kilistra, whose role in the spread of Christianity to Anatolian lands is one of the points that Konya visitors do not go without seeing, which has reached the present day over time and is eroded and worn out in a form similar to the fairy chimneys.
</html>
description.de:

Dieser Ort, der an der KÃ¶nigsstraÃŸe erbaut wurde, die fÃ¼r die RÃ¶mer von strategischer Bedeutung ist, macht mit seiner kreuzfÃ¶rmigen Kapelle und der Hyazinthenkirche auf sich aufmerksam. Die antike Stadt, in der die Entdecker, die auf den Wegen der KlÃ¶ster unterwegs sind, die gesamte Konya-Ebene von den WachtÃ¼rmen aus beobachten kÃ¶nnen, ist auch einer der wichtigsten Kultur- und Glaubenstourismusorte von Konya.

Die antike Stadt Kilistra, die ihre Reisenden auf eine echte Zeitreise mitnimmt, hat einen wichtigen Platz in der Geschichte des Christentums. Die Stadt, in der Azize Theakla lebte, die der heidnischen Herrschaft entkommen war, ist im Laufe ihrer Geschichte auch vielen Angriffen ausgesetzt. description.en:
<html>Mermerli Beach, which is located in Antalya KaleiÃ§i and one of the smallest but also one of the most private beaches of the city, is located in the southern part of the Marina. The beach, named after Mermerli KÃ¶ÅŸk in the southeast of the port years ago, has the distinction of being the city's first beach when Antalya's tourism potential is not so high.

According to local historians in the 1930s, marble beach was surrounded by wooden screens and used as a bathing place. However, the exact date of the beach's opening to the public dates back to the 1970s. The unique landscapes and historical texture of the region offered by the travertines rising from both slopes are certainly worth experiencing. Enjoying the trio of sea, sand and sun and breathing this historic atmosphere will be a unique experience.

Mermerli Beach, which consists of rocky ground, also has sun loungers and umbrellas. With the takeover of the private enterprise, Mermerli Beach becomes cleaner and more orderly as of today. Mermerli Beach, where the quality of service is very high, is often preferred by families with children because it has a blue flag and the sea is undulating.

Although the beach is small, as long as it is not the peak season, visitors can easily sunbathe and enter the sea in Mermerli Beach. Daily sun loungers and umbrellas can be rented at Mermerli Beach, where there is food and beverage facilities. The nearest camp site to Mermerli Beach is Roadside Camping, located in the historical KaleiÃ§i District of MuratpaÅŸa, Antalya. Just a walk from the beach, you can consider apartment, boutique and hostel-style accommodation.
</html>

description.en:
<html>The ancient city of Syedra is located within the borders of Seki Village, which is located about 20 kilometers from Alanya â€“ Gazipasa road, and 20 kilometers east of Alanya district center. As a result of the excavations carried out by Alanya Archaeological Museum, it is thought that the date of establishment of the city dates back to the 7th century BC.

After seeing the walls surrounding the ancient city of Syedra, which existed until the 13th century, you should also see the plastered water cisterns. There is no doubt that it will be a unique experience to see the structures that have survived from antiquity to the present day.

One of the most interesting places of the ancient city of Syedra is the niche carved into the cave and rock and decorated with frescoes around it. Also known as the Baptist cave, this structure and the ruins of a flamboyant bathhouse in the eastern part of the ancient city are definitely worth seeing. Especially the mosaic decorations on the floor of the bath are very remarkable.

With a length of 250 metres and a width of 10 metres, you can walk the colonnaded street covered with a wooden roof to the southeast of the ancient city of Syedra and see the most important sports centre of the city. You can visit the necropolis, acropolis, ruins of houses, city walls, shops, agora and temple as well as this area where sports matches and competitions were held from those times. Most of the finds and antiquities obtained from the excavations carried out since 1994 are exhibited in the Alanya Museum.

If you go to the top of the road to the ancient city of Syedra, where admission is free, you can see the unique views of Alanya Castle and the Mediterranean Sea. The lintel of the gate, which is regarded as the entrance of the ancient city of Syedra and which has a monumental nature, welcomes its visitors with all its glory. The triple irrigation system, just to the right of the entrance door, also catches the eye. Although not all of the magnificent structure, which has the characteristic of being the only bathhouse in the city, has survived today, the mosaics on its floor still remain all its beauty.
</html>
description.de:

Nachdem Sie die Mauern rund um die antike Stadt Syedra gesehen haben, die bis zum 13. Jahrhundert bestand, sollten Sie unbedingt die verputzten Wasserzisternen sehen. Zweifellos wird es ein einzigartiges Erlebnis sein, die GebÃ¤ude zu sehen, die von der Antike bis heute erhalten geblieben sind.

Einer der beliebtesten Orte in der antiken Stadt Syedra ist die geschnitzte HÃ¶hle und der Felsen. Die Umgebung ist mit Fresken geschmÃ¼ckt. Die meisten Funde und antiken Artefakte, die bei den seit 1994 durchgefÃ¼hrten Ausgrabungen erhalten wurden, sind im Alanya-Museum ausgestellt.


Wenn Sie auf der StraÃŸe zur antiken Stadt Syedra nach oben gehen, wo der Eintritt frei ist, kÃ¶nnen Sie die einzigartige Aussicht auf die Burg Alanya und das Mittelmeer genieÃŸen. description.en:
The Sheikhkonevi Mosque in Bursa was built by Haji Sinan of Konya. The word â€˜Koneviâ€™, which gives the mosque its name, means Konyali (people being from Konya) for that period. According to the inscription in the entrance section of the historical mosque, this place was built in 1537. The mosque has a square plan and measures 7 x 7 meters long. At the same time, the entrance section of the space again contains the last congregational section with a depth of about three and a half meters. The dome covering the original worship area from the top is closed later thanks to a wooden ceiling.


Two rows of rubble stones and two rows of bricks are preferred on the facade walls. The original texture is damaged due to the addition of the space later. The minaret in the eastern part of the mosque is the only one of minaret balcony. At the same time, the cones here are sharp. To reach the minaret, a door is used in the eastern part of the main place of worship. A total of five hedgehog eaves are listed under the balcony of the minaret. The wooden window sashes belonging to the mosque are currently transferred to the Museum of Turkish and Islamic Works. In the meantime, it is understood that there was also a library with valuable manuscripts in it during the first period when the mosque was built in its inscription.


The mausoleum belonging to Sheikh Sadreddin Konevi, who built the mosque, is also located in the eastern part of the mosque. The mausoleum is square, just like the mosque. There is also a small pool in the courtyard part. 12 marble columns are connected by Bursa arches. The Sheikhkonevi states in his will that he did not want any housetop or mamure on his tomb. The shrine is built in accordance with this testament. Three lines of inscription are inscribed. The Sheikhkonevi Mosque is still intact today and is open for worship. The historical mosque is located on KonyalÄ± Sokak in Osmangazi district.
description.de:
Die Åeyhkonevi-Moschee in Bursa wurde von HacÄ± Sinan aus Konya erbaut. Das Wort "Konevi", das der Moschee ihren Namen gab, bedeutet â€œaus Konyaâ€ fÃ¼r diese Zeit. Nach der Inschrift im Eingangsbereich der historischen Moschee wurde dieser Ort 1537 erbaut. Die Moschee mit quadratischem Grundriss ist 7 x 7 Meter lang. Gleichzeitig befindet sich im Eingangsbereich des Ortes der letzte Gemeindeabschnitt mit einer Tiefe von etwa dreieinhalb Metern. Die Kuppel, die den Hauptgebetsbereich von oben bedeckt, wird spÃ¤ter mit einer Holzdecke geschlossen.

In den FassadenwÃ¤nden sind zwei Reihen Schutt und zwei Reihen Ziegel bevorzugt. Die ursprÃ¼ngliche Textur wird durch die spÃ¤tere Erweiterung des Raums beschÃ¤digt. Das Minarett befindet sich im Ã¶stlichen Teil der Moschee und ist der einzige Balkon. Auch der konische Teil dieses Ortes ist spitz. Eine TÃ¼r zum Minarett befindet sich Ã¶stlich des Hauptgottesdienstortes. Insgesamt fÃ¼nf Spitze-Traufen sind unter dem Umgang des Minaretts aufgefÃ¼hrt. Die zur Moschee gehÃ¶renden hÃ¶lzernen FensterflÃ¼gel werden derzeit in das tÃ¼rkische und islamische Kunstmuseum Ã¼berfÃ¼hrt. Dabei gab es in der ersten Zeit, als die Moschee in ihrer Inschrift gebaut wurde, eine Bibliothek mit wertvollen Manuskripten.

Das Grab von Sheyh Sadreddin Konevi, das die Moschee errichten lieÃŸ, befindet sich im Ã¶stlichen Teil der Moschee. Das Grab ist ein quadratischer Grundriss wie eine Moschee. Der Innenhof hat auch einen kleinen Becken. 12 MarmorsÃ¤ulen sind mit Bursa-BÃ¶gen verbunden. Er gibt an, dass er in seinem Testament keinen Dach oder Urbanisierung auf seinem Grab haben wollte. Das Grab ist nach diesem Testament gebaut worden. Es ist zu sehen, dass die Inschrift von drei Zeilen geschrieben ist. Die Sheyhkonevi-Moschee ist noch heute intakt und kann angebetet werden. Die historische Moschee befindet sich in der KonyalÄ±-StraÃŸe im Bezirk Osmangazi.

description.en:
Offering a period of office and exhibition functions, the Ankara Palas, which remained a hotel for many years after its construction was completed at the end of the 1920s, is one of the most important historical buildings in the capital.

Ankara Palas, which is used as a state guest house today, attracts attention with its aesthetic details. The structure offers striking details in its exterior, with its beams, columns and lighting in the foreground. The structure has an intriguing story. At the beginning of 1920s, Ankara Palas started its construction with the idea of being a club for congressman, after its architect quit the business, it is continued by architect Kemalettin Bey. However, the plan was changed and the structure, which is believed to have been completed towards the end of 1927, was leased from the General Directorate of Foundations and remained a hotel until 1969. Subsequently, Ankara Palas was operated by a trade union in the form of a hotel between 1972 and 1975, and served under the Ministry of Industry and Technology and then the Ministry of Foreign Affairs between 1976-1982. After all, the structure, which belongs to the Republic of Turkey Ministry of Foreign Affairs, is of great value in terms of Ankara's visual and historical silhouette.

description.en:
Uftade Mosque, one of the most prominent spiritual values in Bursa, is located in the District of Osmangazi. In the garden of the mosque, which is one of the most visited locations in the city, there is also the Tomb of Uftade Mahmud Muhiddin.


Uftade Mahmud Muhiddin was born in 1490 as one of the leading spiritual elders of Bursa. He is a muezzin in Bursa Grand Mosque. He is loved by the beauty of his voice, becomes a disciple, donate his financial gains. Uftade is a Persian word meaning â€˜fallingâ€™. He hears this nickname in his dream and uses it as his pen name in his poems. Over time, he becomes known by his nickname, which precedes his name.


Uftade Mahmud Muhiddin, who closes his eyes on life at age 92, gives the name of Uftade, which is identified with him, as the name of the mosque he built. Today, one of the most well-known mosques in Bursa, Uftade Mosque welcomes many visitors every year with its spirituality and authentic texture. Those who come to the relatively small mosque measuring 13 x 13 meters must also visit the tomb in its garden.

Mit der SchÃ¶nheit seiner Stimme bekommt er Liebe, bekommt SchÃ¼ler und vergibt seine Verdienste. FÃ¼r Ãœfdete wird es als persisches Wort "Fallender" genannt. Er hÃ¶rt diesen Spitznamen in seinem Traum und verwendet ihn als Pseudonym in seinen Gedichten. Im Laufe der Zeit wurde er fÃ¼r seinen Spitznamen bekannt, der vor seinem Namen stand.

Heute begrÃ¼ÃŸt die Ãœftade-Moschee, eine der berÃ¼hmtesten Moscheen in Bursa, jedes Jahr viele Besucher mit ihrer SpiritualitÃ¤t und authentischen Textur. Diejenigen, die zu der relativ kleinen Moschee kommen, die 13 x 13 Meter misst, besuchen auch das Grab in ihrem Garten.

description.en:
<html>Kum(Sand) Island, which is located within the borders of Ã‡anakkale, has been frequented by rheumatism patients especially in the recent period. In this context, it can be said that many people from outside the city are interested in the island. The island, which stands out with a coastal connection of about 100 meters, has the appearance of a small pond. It is believed that the island is healing, especially during the summer months when interest begins to increase. An interesting feature of Sand Island is that it suddenly turns pink in spring. Amateur or professional photographers flock to the area to witness this visual feast. Here, the image formed by the blooming of flowers is very impressive. This particular island also has an interesting story that has been told for years. According to the belief, this island is formed by growing as a result of an hermit let the chips fall as they may.

Rumour has it that Gazi SÃ¼leyman Pasha wants to come to Gallipoli on rafts. Meanwhile, a man named Mad Red Sultan wants to ride the same raft. The Mad Red Sultan is stubborn and determined. They don't want to take him to the raft, so Tue starts moving. Kizil Deli Sultan, known as Evliya, sees the rafts moving, throws the sand at his skirt and follows the rafts. These sands miraculously turn into an island. At that time, Gazi Suleyman Pasha and his companions were worried about the closing of the Strait and took the Red Mad Sultan, whom they believed to have been conquered in fear, to the raft and then they crossed to Gallipoli together.

Sand Island, which is one of the most important points of health tourism in Ã‡anakkale, is within the borders of Ã‡ardak resort. Visitors who come to the region hoping for healing prefer to bury themselves in the sand. As the region begins to popularize in this direction, service areas also increase. At the same time, some accommodation facilities also provide services in this direction.
</html>
description.de:
Kum Ada, das innerhalb der Grenzen von Ã‡anakkale liegt, war ein hÃ¤ufiges Ziel, insbesondere fÃ¼r Rheuma-Patienten. In diesem Zusammenhang kann gesagt werden, dass viele Menschen auÃŸerhalb der Stadt Interesse an der Insel zeigen. Die Insel, die mit einer Uferverbindung von ca. 100 Metern Aufmerksamkeit erregt, sieht aus wie ein kleiner Teich. Es wird angenommen, dass die Insel, auf der das Interesse vor allem in den Sommermonaten zuzunehmen begann, heilt. Ein interessantes Merkmal von Kum Ada ist, dass es im FrÃ¼hling plÃ¶tzlich rosa wird. Um dieses visuelle Fest mitzuerleben, strÃ¶men Amateur- oder Profifotografen in die Region. Hier ist das Bild, das durch das BlÃ¼hen von Blumen entsteht, Ã¤uÃŸerst beeindruckend. Diese besondere Insel hat auch eine interessante Geschichte, die seit Jahren erzÃ¤hlt wird. Nach dem Glauben wÃ¤chst diese Insel als Ergebnis eines Heiligen, der den Sand auf seinem Rock ins Meer gieÃŸt.

Der Legende nach will Gazi SÃ¼leyman Pasha auf den FlÃ¶ÃŸen nach Gelibolu kommen. In der Zwischenzeit mÃ¶chte jemand namens KÄ±zÄ±l Deli Sultan dasselbe FloÃŸ fahren. KÄ±zÄ±l Deli Sultan ist eine hartnÃ¤ckige und entschlossene Person. Das FloÃŸ beginnt sich zu bewegen, weil sie ihn nicht gehen lassen wollen. KÄ±zÄ±l Deli Sultan, der als Evliya bekannt ist, wirft den Sand auf seinen Rock und folgt den FlÃ¶ÃŸen, als er sieht, dass sich die FlÃ¶ÃŸe bewegen. Dieser Sand verwandelt sich auf wundersame Weise in eine Insel. Zu dieser Zeit machten sich Gazi SÃ¼leyman Pascha und sein Gefolge Sorgen um die SchlieÃŸung des Bosporus, und er nahm den KÄ±zÄ±l Deli Sultan, von dem sie glaubten, er sei Heiliger, und ging dann zusammen nach Gelibolu.

Kum Ada, einer der wichtigsten Punkte des Gesundheitstourismus in Ã‡anakkale, liegt innerhalb der Grenzen der Stadt Ã‡ardak. Besucher, die in die Region kommen, um Heilung zu finden, vergraben sich lieber im Sand. Mit der PopularitÃ¤t der Region in dieser Richtung nehmen auch die Versorgungsgebiete zu. Gleichzeitig dienen einige UnterkÃ¼nfte auch in diese Richtung.

description.en:
<html>One of the most interesting districts of Edirne which is AyÅŸe KadÄ±n hosts a large number of historical sites. Kadi Bedrettin Mosque, one of these places, is located on the famous Talat PaÅŸa Street in the district. As the name suggests, the mosque is built by Mevtana Bedrettin Mahmud, known as Kadi Bedrettin. He is also the father of Shaykh al-islam Åemsettin Ahmet. The construction process of the mosque corresponds to the year 1530. The Arabic inscription, which covers this and other information, is located just above the door at the entrance.

Kadi Bedrettin mosque has a very spacious courtyard. The mosque is designed as a square plan and has eight pointed pulleys. The cut stones used in its construction attract attention. In each order, sequences of cut stones and brickwork follow each other. There are two round-arched windows on either side of the Kadi Bedrettin mosque. On the other hand, a round-arched window is placed in the middle of the windows above these structures. Two sections of the mihrab walls have pointed arched windows. The mihrab consists of seven corners in total. In terms of embellishment, unfortunately, it has moved away from its authenticity.

The last congregation area at the front of the mosque has marble columns and is covered with glass. This section, like the mihrab, seems to have lost its authenticity. This area is covered on the occasion of a pandantive dome. The minaret adjacent to the congregation area is round-bodied and quite high. The minaret is single minaret balcony and there are relief-shaped stone friezes at the bottom

It is possible to enter the harime (sacred area) by means of the crowned gate on the north walls. It is separated from the cad by the high walls that form the courtyard. Kadi Bedrettin Mosque and the historical AyÅŸe KadÄ±n Mosque are located in  a very close distance. It is the first historical mosque encountered, when people visit from Istanbul to Edirne city center.
</html>
description.de:
AyÅŸe KadÄ±n, einer der interessantesten Stadtteile von Edirne, beherbergt viele historische Orte. Die KadÄ± Bedrettin Moschee ist einer dieser Veranstaltungsorte und befindet sich in der berÃ¼hmten Talat PaÅŸa StraÃŸe im Bezirk. Wie der Name schon sagt, wurde die Moschee von Mevtana Bedrettin Mahmud, bekannt als KadÄ± Bedrettin, erbaut. Er ist auch der Vater von ÅeyhÃ¼lislam Åemsettin Ahmet. Die Bauzeit der Moschee entspricht dem Jahr 1530. Die arabische Inschrift mit dieser und anderen Informationen befindet sich direkt Ã¼ber der TÃ¼r am Eingang.

Die Kadi Bedrettin Moschee verfÃ¼gt Ã¼ber einen sehr gerÃ¤umigen Innenhof. Entworfen in Form eines quadratischen Plans, hat die Moschee eine achtzackige Riemenscheibe. Schneidsteine, die bei der Herstellung verwendet werden, ziehen Aufmerksamkeit auf sich. In jeder Reihenfolge folgen die schnittsteinsequenzen und ziegellinien einander. Auf beiden Seiten der Kadi Bedrettin Moschee gibt es zwei runde gewÃ¶lbte Fenster. Auf der anderen Seite wird ein weiteres rundes gewÃ¶lbtes Fenster in der Mitte der Fenster Ã¼ber diesen Strukturen platziert. In zwei Teilen der WÃ¤nde des Altars befinden sich spitz gewÃ¶lbte Fenster. Der Altar besteht aus insgesamt sieben Ecken. In Bezug auf die Dekoration hat es sich leider von seiner AuthentizitÃ¤t entfernt.

Der letzte kommunionbereich an der Vorderseite der Moschee ist mit einer MarmorsÃ¤ule und Glas bedeckt. Es scheint, dass dieser Abschnitt wie der Altar seine OriginalitÃ¤t verloren hat. Dieser Bereich wird anlÃ¤sslich der â€œPandantifliâ€ -Kuppel bedeckt. Das Minarett neben dem Gemeindegebiet hat einen runden KÃ¶rper und ist ziemlich hoch. Das Minarett ist die einzige Ehre, und unten sind steinfriese in Form von Reliefs.

Dank der KronentÃ¼r an den NordwÃ¤nden ist es mÃ¶glich, Harime (das Heiligtum) zu betreten. Durch die hohen WÃ¤nde, die den Hof bilden, ist es von der StraÃŸe getrennt. Es ist eine sehr enge Entfernung zwischen der Kadi Bedrettin Moschee und der historischen AyÅŸe KadÄ±n Moschee. Es ist die erste historische Moschee, die begegnet, wenn Sie von Istanbul ins Stadtzentrum von Edirne fahren.

description.en:
Izmir is a city famous for its museums with traces of its ancient past. One of the prominent buildings in this context is the Izmir Archaeological Museum (Ethnography).

First opened in 1927, the museum was later moved to Konak district, its present location, with a larger number of artifacts in it. Here, artifacts found as a result of archaeological excavations carried out in the surrounding areas of the city are on display.

The Izmir Archaeological Museum, which houses a large collection of excavations in leading regions such as Smyrna, Ephesus, Pergamon, Miletus, Sert and Iasos, is not wrong to call the light held on the history being thousands of years old of the western part of Anatolia.

There is an invitation to a wealth befitting the identity of the Aegean, which has been the center of civilization throughout history. There are ancient busts on the ground floor. Korean and athlete statues, for example, are quite famous.
On the upper floors, there are artifacts from a wide range of dates dating from prehistoric times to the Byzantine Empire. Figurines, pottery, lamps can be seen.
Striking structures of the Hellenistic period can also be seen in the museum.

The so-called Treasury Department can involuntarily dazzle you with precious grave gifts and coins. One of the important works in the section is Halicarnassus, the Roman statue of Demeter, which is under water in present-day Bodrum.

The Izmir Archaeological Museum, which is open 7 days a week during summer and winter periods at different time intervals, can be visited with a modest entrance fee.

description.en:
Ankara is perceived as a colorless and gray city from the outside, but this is largely due to the fact that it is a bureaucratic city. The sense of distance being a capital city will break immediately when you start spending time here. Ankara is on the way to being a very colorful and energetic city, contrary to what is seen from outside. Most of the recent investments are directed towards this.

Fairytale Island is also known as Wonderland. The area, which has a fairytale atmosphere that will give it its name, appeals to visitors of all ages. It is one of the largest areas opened with this theme in Europe. When you arrive at Fairytale Island, you may encounter a large number of cartoon, fairy tale or animated characters. In this sense, it also offers a sense nostalgia opportunity for adults. Fairy tale Island, which is installed in a giant area of 1 million 320 thousand square meters, is almost a place that touring is not enough.

You can relieve all the stress of daily life by visiting the fairytale land, which contains the unforgettable superheroes that expand the horizons of our dream world. The area receives a great deal of attention from families with children, especially on weekends. The colorful landscapes and decor in fairytale land, which always manages to be very cheerful and energetic, enable you to reinforce this atmosphere.

There is also an interesting plateau reflecting the Stone Age. In order to make a pleasant journey in the time tunnel, you can travel in the plateau for a long time. You can take a boat tour in the lake area or go for activities such as Go-Karts. On the other hand, there are skateboarding rinks, golf courses and an amusement park. It is also possible to attend adult and children's theatres throughout the year. Many of the events or trails organized by private businesses are charged. Although it remains open until 19:00 in the evening in winter, this period is kept a little longer in summer.

description.en:
Cer Modern, located in SÄ±hhÄ±ye district, has an important place in the scope of modern art centers in Ankara. Cer Modern, known not only for its exhibitions but also for its colorful activities, is defined as a common area where phenomena such as aesthetics, emotional integrity, quality, understanding and intellectual identity coexist.

Exhibitions of paintings and photographs can often be seen at Cer Modern. Exhibitions in different branches such as sculpture, ceramics, printmaking are also held from time to time. Calling on exploring Modern art, Cer Modern provides this by uploading some necessary information to the experience. The fact that visitors of all ages assimilate the works and activities that they see and watch points to the main purpose of the modern Art Center.

In addition to the large exhibition areas, various meetings and launch events are held at Cer Modern, which serves as a venue for corporate needs. Thanks to its location in the centre of the exhibition area, where entrance is paid for, access is easy by private car, public transport or on foot.

description.en:
<html>Located in Ã‡anakkale, Bozcaada is one of the places that adds value to summer tourism. In this sense, the island is of great interest in the summer months. Although there are many beaches here, Ayazma Beach has been popular for a long time. The most important reason for this is that the beach has a fairly large sun terrace. Those who come to the beach can rent umbrellas and sunbeds at affordable prices. The beach is also ideal for families in terms of atmosphere.

It is a distance of seven kilometers between Ayazma Beach and the center of Bozcaada. You can reach the beach in a few minutes by minibuses departing from the centre of the town. On the other hand, it is also possible to provide transportation with rental scooters. This is an option preferred by more young people recently. Ayazma Beach is among the most visited beaches of the island, so many restaurants, markets and cafes have been opened in the region. On the other hand, it is also possible to take part in activities such as jet-skis, sea bikes or bananas around the beach.

Bozcaada Ayazma Beach is generally accepted as a clean sea. The nearest beach is Habbele Beach. There is a distance of around 56 kilometers between Ã‡anakkale Airport and the beach. When you take a walk around the beach, you can discover quite interesting coves. As with other beaches of Bozcaada, the sea here is not very hot.

The beach is full of gold and fine sand. The sea has a turquoise color that attracts people. In this sense, despite its popularity, it stands out as one of the rare beaches that can remain clean. Although the nightlife on the island is not very lively, it is still possible to talk about certain nightclubs. The beach generally starts to move in the last week of May. The season continues until the middle of October. The most crowded period of the beach corresponds to the month of August.
</html>
description.de:

Obwohl es hier viele StrÃ¤nde gibt, ist Ayazma Beach seit langem beliebt. Der wichtigste Grund dafÃ¼r ist, dass der Strand eine sehr groÃŸe Sonnenterrasse hat. Auf der anderen Seite ist es mÃ¶glich, Transporte mit Mietrollern anzubieten. Dies ist eine Option, die in letzter Zeit vor allem von jungen Menschen bevorzugt wird. Auf der anderen Seite ist es mÃ¶glich, an AktivitÃ¤ten wie Jetski, Tretboot oder Banane am Strand teilzunehmen.

Bozcaada Ayazma Beach wird allgemein als sauberes Meer akzeptiert. Habbele Beach ist der nÃ¤chste Strand hier. Zwischen dem Flughafen Ã‡anakkale und dem Strand liegt eine Entfernung von etwa 56 Kilometern. Wenn Sie einen kleinen Spaziergang um den Strand machen, kÃ¶nnen Sie interessante Buchten entdecken. Wie an anderen StrÃ¤nden von Bozcaada gilt das Meer hier nicht als sehr heiÃŸ.

Der Strand ist voller Gold und feinem Sand. Die tÃ¼rkisfarbene Farbe des Meeres zieht Menschen an. In diesem Sinne fÃ¤llt es als einer der seltenen StrÃ¤nde auf, die trotz ihrer Beliebtheit sauber bleiben kÃ¶nnen. Obwohl das Nachtleben auf der Insel nicht sehr aktiv ist, ist es immer noch mÃ¶glich, Ã¼ber bestimmte Nachtclubs zu sprechen. Im Allgemeinen wird der Strand in der letzten Maiwoche lebhaft. Es ist zu sehen, dass die Saison bis Mitte Oktober andauert. Die am stÃ¤rksten frequentierte Zeit des Strandes entspricht dem Monat August.

description.en:
Hagia Sophia Museum is one of the most visited tourist destinations in Trabzon. It's also a rich structure that sheds light on the ancient history of the city. The building, which was converted from church to mosque after the conquest of the Ottoman Empire, was opened to visitors after centuries of function in different ways, including a hospital, and was completed in 1962. 

The late Byzantine church with square-cross plan stands out with its marble columns, retangled entrances and tiled roof with different heights, in addition to its characteristic architectural elements. Embellishments, embossed, angels, Jesus Christ, Adam and Eve are some of the highlights of the visual details. Various religious scenes are present in this context with the crucifixion of Jesus Christ. Eagle motifs, which is also the symbol of the family that reigned in the city, panels and plant motifs within the structure, where the influences of Islamic art are also noticeably high, are among the must see... 

Hagia Sophia Museum, which also attracts with itâ€™s floor mosaics, is an experience full of surprises that tourists are attracted to. The forenst area to reach the museum is also very interesting. In general, it is one of the important locations to visit and seeand also to take plenty of pictures.
description.de:
Das Hagia Sophia Museum ist eine der meistbesuchten SehenswÃ¼rdigkeiten in Trabzon. Es ist auch eine reiche Struktur, die Licht auf die alte Geschichte der Stadt gibt. Das GebÃ¤ude, das nach der Eroberung der Stadt des Osmanischen Reiches von einer Kirche in eine Moschee umgewandelt wurde, wurde aufgrund der 1962 abgeschlossenen Arbeiten als Museum erÃ¶ffnet, nachdem es jahrhundertelang verschiedene Funktionen einschlieÃŸlich des Krankenhauses bot.

ZusÃ¤tzlich zu ihren charakteristischen architektonischen Merkmalen fÃ¤llt die spÃ¤tbyzantinische Kirche mit ihrem quadratischen Grundriss mit ihren MarmorsÃ¤ulen, Portiken und ZiegeldÃ¤chern unterschiedlicher HÃ¶he auf. Verzierungen, Reliefs, Engel, Teile vom Prophet Jesus und Adam und Eva sind einige der visuellen Details, die auffallen. In diesem Zusammenhang stehen verschiedene religiÃ¶se Szenen mit der Kreuzigung vom Propheten Jesus zur VerfÃ¼gung. Die Auswirkungen der islamischen Kunst auf die Struktur sind ebenfalls spÃ¼rbar. DarÃ¼ber hinaus gehÃ¶ren Adlermotive, Tafeln und Blumenmotive, die Symbole der Familie, die in der Stadt regierte, zu denen ... 

Das Hagia Sophia Museum, das auch mit seinen Bodenmosaiken auffÃ¤llt, ist ein Erlebnis voller Ãœberraschungen, die Touristen anziehen. Sehr interessant ist auch das Waldgebiet, das zum Museum durchquert wird. Im Allgemeinen ist es einer der wichtigsten Orte, die besucht und fotografiert werden mÃ¼ssen.

description.en:
Many mosques in the city of Artvin continue to challenge history. One of them is the Mosque of Ortacalar Village.


Ortacalar village mosque, as its name suggests, is located within Ortacalar village, one of the most popular villages of Arhavi district in Artvin. It is known that the historic mosque was built in 1757. The mosque, which is especially noted for its decorations in the pulpit and ceiling sections, was restored in 1908 with the addition of a wooden ceiling and pulpit. In 1955, the minaret part was added. Just nine years after that, the mosque is given its final shape. Although minor repairs took place in later years, these processes do not affect worship. Worship always takes place actively in the mosque.


The worship area in the mosque, which is located above an area that begins to slowly descend towards the southern section, has two floors. The entire mosque has a hipped roof from the outside. The upper section of the main facade has a wooden structure. In the immediate middle part of the structure, the navel decorations draw attention. More than the facade section, the ceiling or pulpit decorations are in the foreground. The minaret portion is not adjacent to the mosque. This section was added later. The same applies to the wooden ceiling and pulpit. The mosque is included in the class of mosques with single minarets and is the only one with minaret balcony. It is seen that the door entered into the Harime(sanctuary) is embroidered and painted in wood. In the middle part of the ceiling there is an octagonal shaped navel ornament.


Ortacalar village mosque also referred as Ortacalar Central Mosque. This historic mosque, which embodies the natural atmosphere of the region, has a detailed craftsmanship. The mosque's workmanship is even more remarkable when it is considered the period in which it was built. Ortacalar village mosque, which managed to come to this day without any problems, admires its visitors with its architectural features and colorful decorations.
description.de:
Viele Moscheen in der Stadt Artvin fordern weiterhin die Geschichte heraus. Eine davon ist die Ortacalar Dorfmoschee.


Die Ortacalar Dorfmoschee befindet sich, wie der Name schon sagt, im Dorf Ortacalar, einem der beliebtesten DÃ¶rfer des Arhavi-Bezirks in Artvin. Es ist bekannt, dass die historische Moschee 1757 erbaut wurde. Die Moschee, die besonders mit ihren Ornamenten in den Bereichen Kanzel und Decke auffÃ¤llt, wurde 1908 durch HinzufÃ¼gen von Holzdecke und Kanzel restauriert. 1955 wird das Minarett hinzugefÃ¼gt. Neun Jahre spÃ¤ter erhÃ¤lt die Moschee ihre endgÃ¼ltige Form. Obwohl in den folgenden Jahren kleinere Reparaturen durchgefÃ¼hrt wurden, wirken sich diese Prozesse nicht auf die Anbetung aus. In der Moschee gibt es immer ein aktives Gebet.


Die Moschee, die sich in einer Region befindet, die langsam in Richtung SÃ¼den sinkt, hat zwei Stockwerke. Die gesamte Moschee ist von auÃŸen ein Walmdach. Der obere Teil der Hauptfassade hat eine Holzstruktur. Im mittleren Teil des GebÃ¤udes fallen Nabeldekorationen auf. Decken- oder Kanzeldekorationen sind markanter als die Fassade. Der Minarettteil grenzt nicht an die Moschee. Dieser Abschnitt wurde spÃ¤ter hinzugefÃ¼gt. Gleiches gilt fÃ¼r Holzdecken und Kanzeln. Die Moschee gehÃ¶rt zur Klasse der einzelnen Minarettmoscheen und verfÃ¼gt Ã¼ber einen einzigen Balkon. Es ist zu sehen, dass die im Harim betretene TÃ¼r aus Holz gestickt und bemalt ist. In der Mitte der Decke befindet sich eine achteckige Nabelverzierung.


Die Ortacalar Dorfmoschee ist auch als Ortacalar Zentralmoschee bekannt. Diese historische Moschee, die die natÃ¼rliche AtmosphÃ¤re der Region enthÃ¤lt, ist detailliert verarbeitet. Die Verarbeitung der Moschee ist bemerkenswerter, insbesondere wenn man die Bauzeit berÃ¼cksichtigt. Die Ortacalar Dorfmoschee, die heute ohne Probleme entstanden ist, fasziniert diejenigen, die sie sehen, mit ihren architektonischen Merkmalen und farbenfrohen Dekorationen.

description.en:
How's your condition? If you have the necessary equipment ready for a long and challenging walk, you should meet the Zemi Valley, NevÅŸehir's favorite trekking area. The valley, which is among the longest natural hiking trails in the region, is located on the NevÅŸehir-Urgup road. 

When you step through the entrance with souvenir-selling stalls, itâ€™s waiting you for a long way to come with different challenges. There are sloped plots that have difficult places to jump here. In addition to the path way that can be easily walkable, there is also a different area where steep cliffs are dense. 

During the two-hour walk, bird sounds, butterflies and color potpourri will give you pleasant moments. You can have small breaks for various fruit trees. At some points there are sunflowers and vineyards, and even in summer, we recommend that you always have an outdoor vest with you in the cool Zemi Valley. There should be water in your travel kit. 

The Zemi Valley is a high-profile sightseeing area with surprises and visual elegance in general. At some point in this region, the views of the Fairy Chimney promise a visual feast. In the valley where fairy chimneys are located, pigeons, some old churches where officials must unlock, and Roman cemeteries can be seen during the trip.
description.de:
Wie ist Ihre Kondition? Wenn Ihre AusrÃ¼stung fÃ¼r lange und schwierige SpaziergÃ¤nge bereit ist, sollten Sie das Zemi-Tal kennenlernen, das beliebteste Trekkinggebiet von NevÅŸehir. Das Tal, das zu den lÃ¤ngsten natÃ¼rlichen Wanderwegen der Region gehÃ¶rt, liegt auf dem Weg zwischen NevÅŸehir und ÃœrgÃ¼p.

Ein langer Weg mit verschiedenen Schwierigkeiten erwartet Sie, wenn Sie vom Eingang anfangen, wo es SouvenirlÃ¤den gibt. Hier gibt es unebene und abfallende Gebiete, die Schwierigkeiten verursachen und es gibt Orte zum Ãœberspringen. Neben dem leicht zu begehenden Weg gibt es auch ein anderes Gebiet mit steilen Felsen.

WÃ¤hrend des zweistÃ¼ndigen Spaziergangs leisten Ihnen Vogelgezwitscher, Schmetterlinge und kunterbunte Farben angenehme Momente. Unter verschiedenen ObstbÃ¤umen kÃ¶nnen kleine Pausen eingelegt werden. An einigen Stellen gibt es Sonnenblumen und Weinberge. Wir empfehlen, dass Sie im Zemi-Tal immer eine Outdoor-Weste dabei haben, da es auch im Sommer kÃ¼hl ist. Wasser sollte auch in Ihrem Reisekit enthalten sein.

Das Zemi-Tal ist ein bekannter Ausflugsort mit seinen Ãœberraschungen und seiner visuellen Eleganz im Allgemeinen. Die Feenkaminen an einigen Stellen in dieser Region versprechen ein visuelles Fest als SehenswÃ¼rdigkeit. In dem Tal befinden sich TaubenschlÃ¤ge, obwohl sie leer sind, wo sich auch Feenkaminen befinden. Bei manchen TaubenschlÃ¤gen muss es von Beamten aufgesperrt werden, um alte Kirchen und GrÃ¤ber aus rÃ¶mischer Zeit zu sehen.

description.en:
When you visit the city of Ankara, you may encounter many places that reflect the historical and cultural codes of the city. One of these places, AlagÃ¶z Headquarters Museum, is among the museums that the local visitors are excited about. This is a very valuable museum in terms of reflecting the events of the Battle of Sakarya. During the Battle of Sakarya, when the enemies reached PolatlÄ±, the Western Front Command considered the village AlagÃ¶z as a headquarters. The farm of TÃ¼rkoÄŸlu Ali Agha, who lives in the village, is the headquarters of this headquarters.

The farm is quite suitable for this as a structure. After the war, the farm is returned to its original owners. Ali TÃ¼rkoÄŸlu and his children continue to live in this farm continuously until 1965. His heirs transferred the farm to the Ministry of Education after 1965. Immediately two years after that, the transfer of Antiquities and Museums to the General Directorate will take place. The Directorate of Anitkabir Museum undertakes the restoration in this process. On November 10 of 1968, only the upper section is organized and opened to visitors. The arrangement of the rooms in the lower section was suspended until 1983. After that year, the rooms downstairs are also open to visitors. The AlagÃ¶z Headquarters Museum currently consists of 12 separate rooms in total. Some of these rooms can be listed as souvenir room, bookshelf, garment room, servant room and staff room.

The farm that houses the museum building bears witness to a crucial episode of that critical battle that lasted 22 days. For this reason, all the figures in the museum are based on what was left of the war. Details of the plan, photos, documents, will take you on an exciting journey. AlagÃ¶z Headquarters Museum, located on Ankara and PolatlÄ± road, although located in the village of AlagÃ¶z, is essentially an easy reach. You can easily reach the museum with minibuses departing from PolatlÄ±.
