description.en:
AtabarÄ± Ski Resort and Mersivan plateau, located about 18 kilometers away from Artvin city center, has been a very developed and exemplary place in terms of accommodation and food and drink options since it started to serve.


This AtabarÄ± Ski Resort and Mersivan Plateau, one of the most popular points of nature tourism in the city, encounter intense interest during the winter months. The center, which is located exactly on Mount Mersivan, is one of the most important places in Turkey that attracts tourists every period of the year. The centre, which has a total length of around 800 metres from the main track, also has sportsman changing rooms and parking spots. On the other hand, it is also possible to take advantage of snow track or snow bikes within the scope of special service.


AtabarÄ± Ski Center and Mersivan Plateau usually opens in December and March which have the highest rank of tourists. The summit of the center is 2030 meters. Snow in the region varies between 50 centimetres and 140 centimetres depending on which month it is. This tourist center located in 1870 meters; there are three separate runways, which are A,B and C. Runway A is 70, runway B is 54 and runway C is 11 metres wide. The longest runway is in the center, which is runway C with 600 metres, and the runways are also classified as easy, medium and difficult.


If wanted, technical support can be obtained from the experts in the center where the possibility of skiing with experts is also available. Where many elements for the needs of holidaymakers have been considered to the utmost detail, it is also possible to meet all the shopping needs without moving away from the centre. The capacity of the AtabarÄ± Ski Resort and Mersivan Plateau is currently limited to 120 people. In addition, the car park has a vehicle capacity of 60. Holidaymakers can benefit from this right for free.

description.en:
The first ideas about the establishment of the Gendarmerie Museum in Ahlatlibel district in the capital were matured in 1995. A year from that, concrete preparations for the museum begin. After extensive field research and editing process, all collections to be exhibited will be completed in 2005.

Gendarmerie Museum; after a long break, opened on 21 November 2005. The main purpose of the opening of this museum is to present sections of the Gendarmerie's services throughout history and to pass them on to future generations. On the other hand, many photographs, documents and materials about the organization are requested to be presented to visitors in this area.

When you come to the Gendarmerie Museum, the Ottoman State Exhibition Hall meets you immediately on the first floor. On one upper floor,there is an exhibition hall reflecting the Republican period. Those interested in the historical development of the gendarmerie can visit this floor. You can witness how much change has been made, especially in the weapons, materials, clothes and uniforms used in historical development. All of these works are exhibited chronologically in this section. The Gendarmerie Museum, which is one of the most visitor-attracting museums in Ankara, became the â€˜1st ' in 2007. The class gains the â€™Military Museum' qualification. The Gendarmerie Museum, which has a great Military Heritage, receives great support from the organization in terms of archives.

You can take buses to AhlatlÄ±bel to go to Ankara Gendarmerie Museum. The museum is open to visitors every day during the week. The Military Museum located on Ahlatlibel quarter can be visited between 09:30 and 16:30. The transportation of the Gendarmerie Museum is not easy because it is located in a military zone. The Gendarmerie Museum, a relatively small museum, is known as the first museum in Turkey to open with this theme. In this way, although it is small as a building, it is extremely dense in terms of materials to be exhibited.

description.en:
Besides the natural beauty of Artvin, its historical and cultural sites attract many visitors. One of them which is the Rabat Church, can also be referred as â€˜New Rabat Churchâ€™ in some sources. This historical and special structure, which visitors to the city do not usually skip when visiting, is located in the village of BulanÄ±k, ArdanuÃ§ district. ArdanuÃ§ district is home to many cultural and historical places of Artvin, so you will be able to have a chance to explore different places in a short period. Rabat Church, which is located exactly on the Ã‡amlÄ±k quarter, is architecturally similar to other churches in Artvin.


Unfortunately, it is not known when it was built and by whom it was built. There is no inscription that conveys information on this subject. Despite this, it is estimated that it was built during the reign of the Kingdom of Bagratli in the Middle Ages. The most beautiful aspect of the church is its decorated stones with plant motifs. The building, which has important architectural details, is also very close to a place of high tourist value, such as Gevhernik Castle. On the other hand, after arriving here, the Monastery of Opiza is also among the places close to here.


Located only 17 kilometers away from the district center, the church's architectural structure with triangular niches.draws attention These allow the inner plan to reflect outward. Relief plant motifs are featured on both facades. In the Church of Rabat, which was built with smooth cut stones, or in other words, In The New Church of Rabat, it is seen that its niches were used in the dome pulley in an interesting way.It is also occasionally referred asâ€™ BulanÄ±k Monastery'. The large stream in BulanÄ±k can be reached by means of hidden passages just inside the monastery. Unfortunately, some of these passages are unusable today. The church is already abandoned in the 16th century and remains in disrepair for a long time. Today, unfortunately, only the church part of the monastery is found.
description.de:
Neben den NaturschÃ¶nheiten von Artvin ziehen die historischen und kulturellen StÃ¤tten viele Besucher an. Eine von ihnen, die Rabat-Kirche, kann in einigen Quellen als "Neue Rabat-Kirche" bezeichnet werden. Dieses historische und private GebÃ¤ude, in dem diejenigen, die in die Stadt kommen, den Besuch im Allgemeinen nicht auslassen, befindet sich im Dorf Bulanik im Bezirk ArdanuÃ§. Da im Stadtteil ArdanuÃ§ viele kulturelle und historische StÃ¤tten von Artvin beheimatet sind, kÃ¶nnen Sie in kurzer Zeit verschiedene Orte entdecken. Die Rabat-Kirche, die genau im Bezirk Ã‡amlÄ±k liegt, Ã¤hnelt architektonisch anderen Kirchen in Artvin.


Leider ist nicht bekannt, wann und von wem die Rabat-Kirche gebaut wurde. Es gibt keine Inschrift, die Informationen zu diesem Thema Ã¼bermittelt. Es wird jedoch geschÃ¤tzt, dass es im Mittelalter wÃ¤hrend der Regierungszeit des KÃ¶nigreichs Bagrat erbaut wurde. Der schÃ¶nste Aspekt der Kirche sind die Steine â€‹â€‹mit Pflanzenmotivdekoration. Das GebÃ¤ude, das wichtige architektonische Details aufweist, befindet sich auch ganz in der NÃ¤he eines Ortes von hohem touristischen Wert wie der Burg Gevhernik. Auf der anderen Seite befindet sich nach Ihrer Ankunft auch das Opiza-Kloster in der NÃ¤he.


Dreieckige Nischen machen auf die architektonische Struktur der Kirche aufmerksam, die nur 17 Kilometer vom Stadtteilzentrum entfernt ist. Dadurch kann der innere Plan nach auÃŸen reflektiert werden. GeprÃ¤gte Pflanzenmotive sind beidseitig platziert. Es ist zu sehen, dass die Nischen in der Kuppelrolle der Rabat-Kirche oder mit anderen Worten in der Neuen Rabat-Kirche, die aus glatt geschnittenen Steinen gebaut wurde, verwendet wurden. Es wird manchmal als "Bulanik-Kloster" bezeichnet. Dank der GeheimgÃ¤nge direkt im Kloster ist der groÃŸe Bach in Bulanik zu erreichen. Leider sind einige dieser Passagen heute unbrauchbar. Die Kirche wurde bereits im 16. Jahrhundert verlassen und bleibt lange Zeit vernachlÃ¤ssigt. Leider gibt es heute nur einen kirchlichen Teil des Klosters.

description.en:
One of the striking traces left by the Ottoman Empire in history is undoubtedly the acceptance of Jewish people who were forcibly removed from Spain. Thus, the Jews in Spain, whose number was 300 thousand in the 15th century, were taken to the Lands of the Ottoman Empire and provided to lead the Jewish generation in Bursa that dates back to today.


GerguÅŸ Synagogue is opened in the 16th century as part of services for the Jewish presence in Bursa. Synagogue, which is in a very good condition today, bears traces of the cultural heritage of the Jews in the Ottoman Empire for hundreds of years and fills the eye with its architecture.


The synagogue, named after the Hebrew word â€˜gerushâ€™, which means â€˜banished, exiledâ€™, is a full-fledged building for Jews where they can perform their religious worship. The place of worship, which continues to serve today as it did 500 years ago, is among the important religious buildings visited by many tourists who come to visit Bursa today.


GeruÅŸ Synagogue, whose architecture is seen to be rectangular, was built by II.Selim being one of Sultans of The Ottoman Empire.


Reflecting the architectural tradition of the period with its two doors, columns, marble floors and cut stone walls, the synagogue, which even today fills the eye with its splendor, enhances its visual appearance with its spiral staircase. The Gerush Synagogue, which reflects the grandeur of simplicity just like the works of Mimar Sinan, reinforces the mysticism of its atmosphere with its carpets and chandeliers.


Finally, it is worth noting that the Gerush synagogue, where 150 people can worship at the same time, is a place of worship that is open to visitors every day of the year, including Eid holidays.
description.de:
Eine der markanten Spuren, die das Osmanische Reich in der Geschichte hinterlassen hat, ist zweifellos die Akzeptanz von Menschen der jÃ¼dischen Religion, die gewaltsam aus Spanien entfernt wurden. So wurden die Juden in Spanien, deren Zahl im 15. Jahrhundert 300.000 erreichte, in das Gebiet des Osmanischen Staates gebracht und dazu gebracht, die jÃ¼dische Generation in Bursa bis heute zu fÃ¼hren.


Die GerguÅŸ-Synagoge wird im 16. Jahrhundert im Rahmen von Gottesdiensten fÃ¼r die jÃ¼dische PrÃ¤senz in Bursa erÃ¶ffnet. Die Synagoge, die sich heute in einem sehr guten Zustand befindet, weist Spuren des kulturellen Erbes der Juden im jahrhundertealten Osmanischen Reich auf und beeindruckt durch ihre Architektur.


Die Synagoge, die ihren Namen vom Wort "geruÅŸ" hat, was auf HebrÃ¤isch "vertrieben, verbannt" bedeutet, ist eine vollwertige Struktur fÃ¼r Juden, in der sie ihren religiÃ¶sen Gottesdienst verrichten kÃ¶nnen. Die KultstÃ¤tte ist bis heute wie vor 500 Jahren ein Gottesdienst und eine der wichtigsten religiÃ¶sen Strukturen, die viele Touristen besuchen, die heutzutage Bursa besuchen.


GeruÅŸ Synagoge, der in seiner Architektur einen rechteckigen Grundriss hat, ist einer der Sultane des Osmanischen Reiches. Es wurde von Selim gebaut.


Die Synagoge, die mit ihren zwei TÃ¼ren, SÃ¤ulen, dem Marmorboden und den geschnittenen Steinmauern die architektonische Tradition der damaligen Zeit widerspiegelt und auch heute noch durch ihre Pracht beeindruckt, verstÃ¤rkt ihre Sichtbarkeit durch Wendeltreppen. Die GeruÅŸ Synagoge spiegelt die Pracht der Einfachheit wider, genau wie in den Werken von Mimar Sinan, und verstÃ¤rkt mit seinen Teppichen und Kronleuchtern die mystische AtmosphÃ¤re.


SchlieÃŸlich ist auch anzumerken, dass die GeruÅŸ-Synagoge, in der 150 Menschen gleichzeitig anbeten kÃ¶nnen, ein Ort der Verehrung ist, der an jedem Tag des Jahres, einschlieÃŸlich an Feiertagen, fÃ¼r Besucher geÃ¶ffnet ist.

description.en:
It can generally be said that Fethiye is one of the most popular tourist destinations of MuÄŸla, a city at the confluence of Turkey's Aegean Sea and Mediterranean coasts, is the meeting point of the beaches. Kabak Beach is one of the most prominent spots in the district, with sophisticated beaches following each other along the azure coastline.


The beach on the coastline of Kabak Bay has a length of about 200 meters. The sand is gravelly; you are walking on a gravelly surface, not among the thin sands. On the other hand, a sea of unique beauty meets your exciting steps towards the Aegean.

Meanwhile, it's a narrow beach in terms of width. As a solution proposal, other nearby beaches may be preferred on very busy days.


The surroundings of Kabak Beach, which is a peaceful location in general, are also very pleasant. There is no sign of high hotels. There are accommodation options with camping businesses, mainly in small houses called wood or bungalows. Short-term stays are busy as it is one of the major stops on the famous walking route known as the Lycian Way. For this reason, it may be a reasonable choice to make a reservation, especially if you are going to visit the area during the summer months, including accommodation.


An important detail for those wondering; there are places on the beach where you can shower.


The sea of the beach, which borders a village that also offers accommodation, has suddenly increased depths. Therefore, caution is recommended.

In addition, the experience of swimming in the slightly choppy and turbid sea during the busy months is involved.

description.en:
Although Ankara is generally at the forefront of some works made after the Republican period, the historical heritage of this particular city dates back to much older periods. Tannery Mosque, which is part of this history, is located on the Bentderesi quarter.

Tannery Mosque has a wooden and stone pedestal structure in general, although the roof part consists of tiles. The minaret of the Tannery Mosque, which has a rectangular plan, is located in the eastern part and is cylindrical in shape. It is emphasized that this minaret was later renovated. The minaret is also single-minded and wooden. It is understood from written sources that the original minaret had a square pedestal. In the northern part of the harem, women gathering place carried by means of wooden supports stand out. According to the inscription in the mosque, ÅÃ¼krÃ¼ Effendi, one of Necmeddin's descendants, undertook the repair of this place in 1900. Although Tannery Mosque has a repair inscription, there is no construction inscription. Nevertheless, it is estimated that the mosque was built in the 18th century by looking at the architectural details.

The Tannery Mosque loses its original texture over time. Despite this, this place, which bears witness to history, is still described as an exciting place of worship for local visitors. In 1979, a very radical decision was made regarding the Tannery Mosque. Accordingly, the mosque is largely demolished and rebuilt. The repair inscription is located on the wall of the eastern section of the last parish place. For some information, registration receipts are shown as references. The final parish area has two floors in total. The structure built in place of the old mosque is covered with a dome. The Tannery Mosque is sometimes referred  as the Tabaklar Mosque among the locals. A mosque with the same name is also located in Albanian, and therefore the two mosques are often confused.

description.en:
<html>Edirne, the westernmost part of Turkey, was one of the cities that marked the last period of the Ottoman Empire. A large number of military structures called tabya were built in Erzurum in the east and Edirne in the west to defend against the Russians who pursued an expansionist policy. Among these, the HÄ±dÄ±rlÄ±k Bastion, which is among the most important military place and protection zone of Edirne, was also built. Bastion, which stands out with its atmospheric features, evokes the feeling of a spiritual treasure in its visitors.

This military structure, in extremely good condition, was established before the Ottoman-Russian war of 1877-1878. In addition to the war in question, it was also used actively in the bloody Balkan wars of the early 20th century. HÄ±dÄ±rlÄ±k TabyasÄ±, the largest bastion in Edirne, was home to many artillery batteries, ditches, wards and various weapons.

The building, which is used as headquarters, is also at the highest point of the city within the boundaries of HÄ±dÄ±rlÄ±k District. The location on a hill that dominates the area is also still remarkable for its elegant landscape.

There are also green areas where you can sit and relax in the Hidirlik TabyasÄ±, where transportation is possible by services departing from HÄ±dÄ±rlÄ±k District, in addition to private vehicles.
</html>
description.de:
Edirne, der westlichste Teil der TÃ¼rkei, war eine der StÃ¤dte, die die letzte Periode des Osmanischen Reiches markierten. In Erzurum im Osten und Edirne im Westen wurde eine groÃŸe Anzahl militÃ¤rischer Strukturen errichtet, die Bastionen genannt wurden, um sich gegen die Russen zu verteidigen, die einer expansiven Politik folgten. Unter ihnen wurde die HÄ±dÄ±rlÄ±k-Bastion gebaut, die zu den wichtigsten militÃ¤rischen Orten und Schutzzonen von Edirne gehÃ¶rt. Die Bastion, die sich durch ihre AtmosphÃ¤re auszeichnet, vermittelt den Besuchern das GefÃ¼hl, ein spiritueller Schatz zu sein.

Diese Ã¤uÃŸerst gute militÃ¤rische Struktur wurde vor dem Osmanisch-Russischen Krieg zwischen 1877 und 1878 errichtet. Neben dem Krieg wurde es zu Beginn des 20. Jahrhunderts in den blutigen Balkankriegen sehr aktiv eingesetzt. In der HÄ±dÄ±rlÄ±k-Bastion, der grÃ¶ÃŸten Bastion von Edirne, befanden sich auch viele Artilleriebatterien, SchÃ¼tzengrÃ¤ben, Stationen und verschiedener Waffen seiner Zeit.

Das GebÃ¤ude, das als Hauptquartier genutzt wird, befindet sich auch an seinem hÃ¶chsten Punkt innerhalb der Grenzen des HidirlÄ±k-Viertels der Stadt. Der Ort auf einem HÃ¼gel, der die Gegend dominiert, zieht auch mit seiner stilvollen Landschaft die Aufmerksamkeit auf sich.

Neben einem privaten Fahrzeug gibt es auch ein Shuttleservice vom Bezirk HÄ±dÄ±rlÄ±k zu den GrÃ¼nflÃ¤chen, in denen Sie in HÄ±dÄ±rlÄ±k TabyasÄ± sitzen und entspannen kÃ¶nnen.

description.en:
The 2,500-year-old Erzurum Castle, which was left from Urartu to Byzantine Empire and one of them to Ottoman Empire, plays a fundamental role in the defense of the city.

The history of Erzurum Castle extends to the Urartu thousands of years... The castle, built 2,500 years ago, was later taken by the Byzantine Empire and built by Emperor Theodosius itâ€™s inner castle. The inner castle built in 415 maintains its first day stand for thousands of years and gives information about the city's history of defense.

Erzurum Castle consists of two castles; Inner Castle and Outer Castle. In the early periods, there are soldiers and guards who defend the city within the Inner Castle. The Outer Castle is divided into streets and neighborhoods, and it hosts the people of the city. With the passage of Erzurum to the Ottoman Empire, the Inner Castle Masjid is built next to the northern wall of the Inner Castle. In the following years, the Ottomans who wanted to Turkize the castle, Ali Aga fountain, abu Isaac-Ä± Kazeruni Tomb and The Tomb of fortys, adding here, they make the castle the eternal resting places of the important clerics. 

Erzurum Castle has four gates named Georgian, Erzincan, Tabris and Ä°stanbul. Although much of the walls are succumbed to time, it greets visitors with these imposing entrance gates and its magnificent walls.
description.de:
Das 2.500 Jahre alte Schloss Erzurum, das von den Urartanern bis zum Byzantinischen Reich und von ihnen bis zum Osmanischen Reich erhalten blieb, spielt eine grundlegende Rolle bei der Verteidigung der Stadt.

Die jahrtausendealte Geschichte der Erzurumer Burg reicht bis zu Urartu zurÃ¼ck ... Die vor 2 tausend 5 hundert Jahren erbaute Burg wurde spÃ¤ter vom Byzantinischen Reich Ã¼bernommen und der innere Burgteil wurde von Kaiser Theodosius erbaut. Die im Jahr 415 erbaute innere Burg bewahrt ihren ersten Tag seit Tausenden von Jahren und gibt Auskunft Ã¼ber die Geschichte der Stadtverteidigung.

Das Erzurum Schloss besteht aus zwei Burgen; Innenburg und AuÃŸenburg. In den ersten Bauabschnitten des Schlosses befanden sich Soldaten und Wachen, die die Stadt verteidigten. Das Ã„uÃŸere Schloss hingegen ist in StraÃŸen, Gassen und Viertel unterteilt und beherbergt die Menschen der Stadt. Als Erzurum an den osmanischen Staat Ã¼berging, wurde die innere Burg Masjid neben der Nordwand der inneren Burg errichtet. Die Osmanen, die die Festung TÃ¼rken wollten, fÃ¼gten in den folgenden Jahren den Ali-Aga-Brunnen, das Abu-Ishak-i-Kazeruni-Grab und das KÄ±rklar-Grab zu den ewigen RuhestÃ¤tten der Geistlichen hinzu.

Das Schloss Erzurum hat vier Tore mit den Namen Georgian, Erzincan, Tabriz und Istanbul. Obwohl die meisten seiner Mauern mit der Zeit zerstÃ¶rt wurden, begrÃ¼ÃŸen sie ihre Besucher mit diesen imposanten EingangstÃ¼ren und prÃ¤chtigen Mauern.

description.en:
Gaziantep is an interesting city for travelers as well as for science and space enthusiasts, and one of the most visited places in this area is the Planetary and Science Center.

The Planetary and Science Center is  located within the 100. Century AtatÃ¼rk Culture Park which is one of the city's largest green spaces. The center, which is built on a total area of 5 thousand square meters with 3,500 square meters closed-area, offers answers to almost every question of space and astronomy enthusiasts. In this axis, a specially designed hall provides a visual explanation of the movements of the planets along with all the details. The place, which has a dome shaped like a hemisphere, becomes a sort of stage for astronomical images. The Planetary and Science Center promises to embark on a journey into space, where humanity has struggled to discover the most for thousands of years, stemming from its mysterious and yet intriguing signatories.

There are also workshops in the centre, which can be accessed daily from 08:00 to 17:00. In addition to this, workshops on concepts such as recycling, art and zero waste are met with intense interest by the students.

description.en:
<html>In the east of the Mediterranean, Hatay on Turkey's border with Syria stands out for its natural beauties as well as its historical values. Erzin Mineral springs, which gave itâ€™s name to the district where it is located at this point, is a hidden paradise, so to say. 

Erzin Mineral Springs, in the heart of the land where there are mostly small-sized trees, is getting more and more attention in the focus of nature and health tourism. Erzin Mineral Springs' hot spring water, which also has accommodation for touristic needs nearby, is noted to be good for many diseases. 

Hot spring waters, which stand out with its parameters such as both temperature and pH value, contain elements of a rich composition, especially bicarbonate, carbon dioxide, sulfate, calcium, magnesium. In this way ailments are said to be beneficial such as, digestion, rheumatic, dermatology,osteolysis, urinary tract. Especially the spas, where the elderly are more interested, are open throughout for 12 months. 

The hot springs, known for its serene atmosphere, are open all year long, famous for its view and fresh air. Finally, the intensity in Erzin Mineral springs is increasing especially in spring and summer. 
</html>
description.de:
<html>Hatay, die sich am Ost-Mittelmeer und an der syrischen Grenze befindet, ist sowie mit ihrem historischen Wert und ihrer natÃ¼rlichen SchÃ¶nheit im Vordergrund. An diesem Punkt ist die Erzin Heilquelle, die dem Stadtteil ihren Namen gab, ein verstecktes Paradies.

Erzin Heilquelle, im Herzen des Landes, in dem kleine BÃ¤ume dominieren, zieht Tag fÃ¼r Tag mehr Aufmerksamkeit in den Mittelpunkt des Natur- und Gesundheitstourismus. Es wird darauf hingewiesen, dass das Thermalwasser von Erzin Heilquelle, das auch UnterkÃ¼nfte fÃ¼r touristische BedÃ¼rfnisse bietet, fÃ¼r viele Krankheiten gut ist.

Das Thermalwasser, die durch ihre Parameter wie Temperatur und pH-Wert auffallen, enthalten zusammensetzungsreiche Elemente, insbesondere Bicarbonat, Kohlendioxid, Sulfat, Calcium und Magnesium. Auf diese Weise wird festgestellt, dass es gegen Krankheiten wie Verdauung, Rheuma, Haut, Osteoporose und Harnwege vorteilhaft ist. Die heiÃŸen Quellen, an denen Ã¤ltere Menschen mehr Interesse haben, sind 12 Monate lang offen.

Die fÃ¼r ihre Landschaft und saubere Luft bekannten heiÃŸen Quellen sind fÃ¼r ihre ruhige AtmosphÃ¤re bekannt und dienen das ganze Jahr Ã¼ber. SchlieÃŸlich nimmt es an Besuchern in Erzin Heilquellen vor allem im FrÃ¼hjahr und Sommer zu.
</html>

description.en:
The Incirliin cave is located in Milas, one of the tourism-identified districts of Mugla, and promises its visitors a sophisticated, stunning experience inspired by the beauty of the region it is located in. This place is also shown among the most interesting caves in Anatolian geography with its geological shapes, historical ruins.


It is classified as a fossil cave that is relatively dry and has completed its development through fault influence. During rainy times, water can drip from the ceiling. It also contains shallow ponds formed by raindrops at its base.

It draws attention to its caged structure. The 155-metre section of the cave, which has a length of 345 metres, is navigable along with its wide entrance. This section has been provided with a full-fledged understanding of tourism through walking paths, lighting elements and security measures. The possibility of safe travel is offered.


With its stalactites, columns and dripstone pools, the section called as DamlataÅŸ Gallery at the end of the cave, which makes the visitors wonder, must be experienced closely. Because the shapes here are very interesting. Moreover, the development of new shapes continues because the geological formation is not complete.

description.en:
<html>KarapÄ±nar Sultan Selim Mosque and Complex, whose architect is thought to be Great Mimar Sinan Aga and breathtaking at the glory of simplicity, is one of the points frequented by many tourists with its beauty that has survived from the 1500s to the present day.

We were in the Ottoman Empire when Suleiman the Magnificent was ruler. In the mid-1500s, Sultan Suleiman and his son Selim built a religious structure in Konya. Although the mosque, which has been completed, is popularly referred to as Cami-i Cedid or Cami-i Sharif-i Sultan Suleiman, it continues to be remembered today under the name KarapÄ±nar Sultan Selim Mosque and Complex. Although most historians believe that this structure is a built in Selim II period but as a result of recent investigations, the mosque is proven by the documents commissioned by Kanuni. 

In fact, there is no conclusive proof of the architect but it is tought to belongs to Mimar Sinan when his style and history are examined. Fatih Mosque, Sahabeddin Uzluk Mosque and Hagia Sophia are a kind of combination of plans; as grand and also simple... As of the 16th century, new structures have been added to KarapÄ±nar Sultan Selim Mosque and Complex, one of the rarest works of the classical Ottoman architectural period and Mimar Sinan. Time passes and two madrasas, a small-scale astronomy research and a library are added around the mosque. After all these additions, the mosque, which has become a complex, is still open for worship today.

With the art of Muqarnas embellishment on it, which consists of geometric shapes, offers a visual feast to its visitors, and meets its explorers with rich marble craftsmanship. KarapÄ±nar Sultan Selim Mosque and Complex, which are one of the sighting points that should not be returned without seeing, yellow its visitors with its nobility and mystical air in its architecture.
</html>

description.en:
The Chestnut Market Mosque, which borders the Konak district in Izmir, is considered as a sophisticated work that deeply affects the city's skyline. The date of construction of the mosque, which rises among the many shops in Anafartalar Street where business life is extremely busy, is not clear.

On the other hand, it is known that the Ahmet Agha mosque was located at the point in earlier times. In this respect, the Chestnut market mosque may have been built in the 1800s.

The Chestnut Market Mosque has its own unique place among the historical mosques of Izmir. Because it is separated from many mosques by its architectural details. It has two storeys and a square plan for worship and the upper floor is covered with a dome.

Downstairs there are shops and warehouses. There is also a final parish. This section serves as a crossing between the mosque and the courtyard with a single minaret.

The mosque stands out in its exterior design with its large windows and stonework. Inside, it houses a beautiful altar, which is notable for its elegant decorations.The mihrab can be defined as a hollow area in mosques where the imam performs prayers in front of the congregation.

The boards at the last communion place are also a must-see.

description.en:
Izmir's Havra Street is famous enough to be the subject of films and books. Havra Street, which is interesting with its unique atmosphere, offers an important advantage in terms of visiting the Konak district. However, the number of people living in Izmir who are unaware of this particular region is not small. Havra Street is located in the District of Namazgah. The street, which is very close to the cemetery, is probably referred by this name because of its synagogues. The characteristic common features of the synagogues in the region attract attention immediately. There are four separate columns in the hall parts of the structures built in the central system. These are also used as reading spaces.

Synagogues such as Signora, Shalom, Algazi, Bikur Holim, Etz Hayim, Hevra, Bet Hillel are located in the Havra Street located at Konak 927 Street. Many details about this historical street are shared in the academic Selin SÃ¼ar's research book â€œHavra Sokakâ€. A significant majority of the synagogues here were built in the 15th and 16th centuries. Some of these are still open to worship and visit. It is known that the fire of Izmir was extinguished in front of the synagogue named Shalom in Havra Street. This is considered as an important chance for the preservation of the religious sites here.

The most important reason for the existence of a busy place such as Havra Street is that Izmir has been home to Jews for many years. Jews are mainly stationed in the vicinity of IkiceÅŸmelik or Agora. Jews are seen opening new synagogues in every district where they are dispersed. Especially after the 19th century, the number of Jews in Izmir reaches serious levels. They are scattered in many regions from Frenk district to Karantina, IkiÃ§eÅŸmelik to KarataÅŸ. However, the area around Havra Street is always the oldest area in which they settled, which leads to the accumulation of special memories.

description.en:
<html>Canakkale welcomes domestic and foreign guests throughout the year with its natural sites as well as its historical sites. Mihli waterfall, one of the popular places of the city, is located in KÃ¼Ã§Ã¼kkuyu district. This place is also known as Mihli streamlet. On your way to KÃ¼Ã§Ã¼kkuyu, you will find the First Lieutenant District at the 5th kilometer of the road. This is also a famous promenade. Mihli streamlet, located just inside the area, fills the eye with a great variety of trees.

There is also an Old Mill left over from the Greeks in the area. The mill is recently restored. Again, an arched bridge from the Roman period accompanies this mill.

Mihli waterfall, one of the most popular places of KÃ¼Ã§Ã¼kkuyu in the AyvacÄ±k district of Ã‡anakkale, helps the local people cool down especially during the scorching summer days. The sky is almost invisible due to the density of trees in the area. Just a few kilometres ahead of the mill, there is a pond suitable for swimming. Mihli Falls flows into this pond exactly. Mihli streamlet, where the sounds of birds are heard all the time, attracts attention with its green vegetation and fresh air. The waterfall, which is also close to the Kaz Mountains, is on the road from Edremit to Assos. You may have problems with the lack of signs while driving your car towards the region.

Entrances to the area have not been toll-free since recently. Multiple ponds are found in this area. Especially in the summer months, the area around the pond is always crowded. After leaving the Promenade, there is a beautiful footpath that leads to tea on the left side. You can take plenty of photos on this road and immortalise those wonderful moments. The area where mihli waterfall is located is a very attractive place for those interested in nature sports today.
</html>

description.en:
Located close to the Ani Walls within Kars borders with more than a thousand years, the Church of Abukhamrents (PolatoÄŸlu) is among the city's standout historical values. 

Built on a plateau in the 10th century by The Armenian Prince Pahlavuni, the church stands out for its cylindrical design, supported by columns beneath its conical dome. The Church of Abukhamrents (PolatoÄŸlu), which has relatively small dimensions, has one entrance and has a window in every corner that allows strong indoor lighting. 

An architecturally motivated thought of the church, which has been in good condition in general, including its restored dome in recent years, may have been used in the form of a mausoleum... It is also known that various tombs are buried around it. 

Kars, better known for its legendary dairy products and especially cheese, is also famous for its steakhouses in the city center. If you want to visit the historic points, there's no limit to what they can offer you. At this point, Ani Ruins Place, a real cultural point and The Abukhamrents (PolatoÄŸlu) Church are also ideal for your list of must-see.
description.de:
Die Abukhamrents-Kirche (PolatoÄŸlu) in der NÃ¤he der Ani-Mauern innerhalb der Grenzen von Kars, die eine mehr als tausendjÃ¤hrige Geschichte hat, gehÃ¶rt zu den herausragenden historischen Werten der Stadt.

Die im 10. Jahrhundert vom armenischen Prinzen Pahlavuni auf einem Plateau erbaute Kirche fÃ¤llt durch ihre zylindrische Form auf, die von SÃ¤ulen unter der konischen Kuppel getragen wird. Die Kirche von Abukhamrents (PolatoÄŸlu), die relativ kleine Abmessungen hat, hat einen einzigen Eingang und hat Fenster, die eine starke Innenbeleuchtung ermÃ¶glicht.

Eine architektonische Ansicht Ã¼ber die Kirche, die in gutem Zustand ist, einschlieÃŸlich der Kuppel, die in den letzten Jahren restauriert wurde, kÃ¶nnte in Form eines monumentalen Grabes verwendet worden sein. Es ist auch bekannt, dass mehrere GrÃ¤ber um ihn herum bestattet wurden.

Kars, das fÃ¼r seine legendÃ¤ren Milchprodukte und insbesondere KÃ¤se bekannt ist, ist auch fÃ¼r seine Fleischrestaurants in der Innenstadt bekannt. Wenn Sie historische Orte besichtigen mÃ¶chten, gibt es keine Grenzen dafÃ¼r, was die Stadt Ihnen bieten kÃ¶nnte. An diesem Punkt sind die Ani-Ruinen, ein echter Kulturpunkt, und die Abukhamrents (PolatoÄŸlu) -Kirche ist auch ideal fÃ¼r Ihre touristische Reise in Kars, die man unbedingt gesehen haben muss.

description.en:
Saklikent National Park is one of the favorite destinations of Mugla that makes contact with nature possible. Most of the area in Antalya, about 10 percent of it is in Seydikemer District of MuÄŸla.


Saklikent National Park, in which there is no settlement, is famous for its natural wonder canyon, which is admired by the visitors. It also guarantees fresh air with its predominantly vegetation of Turkish pine, larch, cedar and maquis. The huge cedar trees, which feature memorials, are particularly striking. Some of the local bulbous plants among the favorites of the photo lovers also offer a visual feast.


The animal presence in the area is also intriguing. You can see squirrels and rabbits as you walk. There are clumsy badgers and wild boars in the Woodland. fox is also present. In addition to this mammal species, it is home to birds such as Hawks, partridges, woodpeckers, and snake species such as tortoises, snakes, lizards from this paradise corner.


There's a parking lot at the entrance. Let us also state that transportation with dolmush is possible. In addition, there are structures for various needs such as toilets, Masjid, Buffet, Country Coffee Shop.Tent camping ison the carpet. Picnic areas can also be used. Several souvenir units are also located in the area.


In Saklikent National Park, where hiking routes are of great interest, activities such as photography, fishing in the lake, cycling sport can be done, and nature and scenery can be enjoyed.

description.en:
Besides its beauty, the Valley of Lovers, which fascinates itself with its story, is the mystical place that contains all the legends of the city.

NevÅŸehir, which is famous all over the world with its Fairy Chimneys, with its 60 million-year history. It is a unique city that began to occur in the III. Geological Period. NevÅŸehir's Lovers Valley, one of the most important places in the world with its history of civilization dating back to 3000 BC, is also the subject of fairy tales. Of course, it's normal for a fairytale city to be the subject of fairy tales.


There is a disagreement between two families living in the village of The Valley of Lovers, according to the tale, which is long enough to be told and so old, starting once upon a time. Discussions cannot be prevented and the village is divided into two. With the time passing there are those who oppose this situation and argue that young people from the two families should be married. A secret meeting is set and two chosen young people from two families have been met. 

Young people fall in love at first sight... The people of both villages oppose it, first, but then they accept it and marry the young people. One of the villagers who can't stand the happiness of the couple with children betrays and kills the father of the baby, just like Yehuda betrayed Jesus Christ... The woman who can't stand it commits suicide by jumping out of the valley, and her children are both orphans and orphans.

This is the story, which is told that after these bad events, God has also rained stones and wrath the village. Since then, this valley, which has been a representation of pure love, has been called the Valley of lovers... 
Let alone whether or not to believe the fairy tale, let us fall in love with life from the Valley of lovers, which is obviously the most beautiful place in Cappadocia.
description.de:
Tal fÃ¼r Verliebte, das sich sowohl durch seine Geschichte als auch durch seine SchÃ¶nheit fasziniert, ist der mystischste Ort, der alle Legenden der Stadt enthÃ¤lt.

NevÅŸehir, das mit seinen Feenkaminen auf der ganzen Welt berÃ¼hmt geworden ist, hat eine 60-Millionen-jÃ¤hrige Geschichte. Es ist eine einzigartige Stadt, die sich in der geologischen Zeit zu bilden begann. NevÅŸehirs Tal der Verliebten, das die bemerkenswerteste Geschichte der Welt hat, ist mit seiner Zivilisationsgeschichte, die bis 3000 v. Chr. zurÃ¼ckreicht, wie ein MÃ¤rchen. NatÃ¼rlich ist es ganz normal, dass das Tal einer Stadt wie ein MÃ¤rchen ist und ein Thema  eines MÃ¤rchens wird.

Es war einmal eine lange und alte Geschichte, wo es eine Meinungsverschiedenheit zwischen zwei Familien gab, die im Tal der Verliebten lebten. Diskussionen konnten nicht verhindert werden und das Dorf ist zweigeteilt. Nach einer Zeit gab es Personen, die dafÃ¼r zusagten, dass die Verliebten von den zwei Familien heiraten sollten.  Ein Treffen wird heimlich verwirklicht und zwei junge Leute aus zwei Familien werden zusammengebracht.

Auf den ersten Blick verlieben sich die jungen Leute ineinanderâ€¦ Die Leute der beiden DÃ¶rfer sind zuerst dagegen, akzeptieren es dann und lassen sie heiraten. Einer der Dorfbewohner, der das GlÃ¼ck des Paares mit seinen Kindern nicht ertragen kann, verrÃ¤t die Liebe und tÃ¶tet den Vater des Babys, genau wie Yehudas Verrat an Jesus. Die Frau, die es nicht ertragen konnte, begang Selbstmord, indem sie aus dem Tal sprang, und ihre Kinder blieben als Waisen.

Die Geschichte erzÃ¤hlt davon, dass Gott nach diesen schlechten Ereignissen Steine â€‹â€‹in den Zorn des Dorfes gegossen hat. Seit diesem Tag heiÃŸt dieses Tal, das die reine Liebe darstellt, Tal der Verliebten ...
Ob wir daran glauben oder nicht, verlieben wir uns doch in das Leben im wundervollen Tal der Verliebten, das der schÃ¶nste Ort Kappadokiens ist.

description.en:
<html>GÃ¶kÃ§eada is a tourist paradise on the Aegean Sea... Despite its small face size, this island in western Turkey is home to ports, bays, tourist facilities, lakes and historical values. It is also known for its Underwater National Park, which is the first in its field.

GÃ¶kÃ§eada Underwater National Park, a first in Turkey, is located in the northeast of the island. The area between KalekÃ¶y and Kuzu Harbour, two important tourist spots here, is a hidden natural wonder, 200 meters from the shore!

This sophisticated area, where Mediterranean seals, seagrass meadows, dolphins, algae, sea turtles and even whales are seen, especially in the summer months, is like a treasure... According to the latest statement, 180 different species of underwater plants and animals live in this area of interest. GÃ¶kÃ§eada Underwater National Park, which features breeding, spawning and four seasons habitat for sea creatures, also attracts attention with its caves that promise a visual feast.

The visual feast, where a large number of protected creatures survive safely, is open to discovery within certain limitations. Professional underwater diving can be performed by obtaining permission and meeting certain procedures. In addition, you can swim in the buffer zone entourage YÄ±ldÄ±zkÃ¶y, you can travel by boat. It is also possible to watch the submarine using a snorkel. Non-professional dives can also be done.
</html>

<html>Who can oppose the definition of unique beauties of nature for canyons the water shaped the earth at the deep valleys and retreated for millions of years? While these nature creations eventually turn into ecological richness with the presence of animals and plants, the tasteful landscapes come forward to be discovered. This is one of these exploratory sites in Kastamonu, the world-famous Valla Canyon. Moreover, with its viewing terrace, it offers a wide perspective of beauty that will amaze those who see it. It makes it a fairy tale to watch Valla Canyon, one of the deepest canyons on the planet. 

Reached by car next to the terrace and reached by stairs, Valla Canyon Viewing Terrace in Pinarbasi district of Kastamonu is located at an altitude of 720 meters. 

The terrace, which provides the possibility to see a significant part of the 12 km long canyon with its highest point of 1200 meters, is extremely robust with its steel construction. 

It's high, so you go up with stairs. You almost go up to the hill by climbing over the steps. On the terrace is a wooden cladding, so there is a friendly look in nature instead of an industrial design,. Then there's the discovery of the vast landscape, the adrenaline caused by the height, and your photo shoots begin. 
Have a nice watch. 
</html>

description.en:
Taceddin Sultan Mosque  is located in the Sumer quarter within the borders of Altindag District in Ankara, close to many recommended locations such as Clock Tower, HamamÃ¶nÃ¼ Houses, Mehmet Akif Ersoy House and has a special place among the historical buildings in the region.

The mosque, located adjacent to the Tomb of Tacettin Sultan and started to serve by Sultan AbdÃ¼lhamit in the early 1900s, also includes various items such as fountain and hazre which have survived from much older times to the present day. The mosque and its surroundings are also preserved in general and have survived to the present day.

The interior of the Taceddin Sultan Mosque , which is a small, plain mosque, features woodwork. In addition to its longitudinal rectangular structure, the roof of the mosque is tiled and its single minaret made of stone is striking.

The Tomb of prominent Turkish politician Muhsin YazÄ±cÄ±oÄŸlu, who died in 2009, is also located in the garden of the Tacettin Sultan Mosque and can be visited.

description.en:
<html>We've reached the zero point of time, changing all known human history. This is Belly Hill; The first known temple of humanity...

Belly Hill is the lead in the UNESCO World Heritage List... The place that breaks all known memorizations so far, allowing the rewrite of human history, is the oldest temple complex in the world. 

Until recently, it was known that religions began with the progress of people from the hunter-gatherer period to settled life, and that temples were built with the established life culture. Then, in 1980, a figurine was found. The figurine, which was first taken to a barn as ornaments and then delivered to the Archaeological Museum of ÅanlÄ±urfa, was examined by German Archaeologist Professor Klaus Shmidt in 1995 and understood to be 12,000 years old. Shmidt, who started excavations immediately afterwards, carried out a feverish excavation in the 20-year period until his death in 2014.

Only one per five a of the complex's unity were unearthed in the excavations that are still going on today. Since 1995, the works encountered in the studies have been incredibly old and the kind that sheds light on human history. 

The temple is T shaped, consisting of monumental obelisks and the relief of animal, human and abstract concepts on them, are the oldest historical motifs made entirely handcrafted. Up to 10-12 obelisks, which can reach up to 40 tons each, are designed as a closed complex by circularly. Belly Hill is also the oldest known architectural example.

More than 20 complexes have been recorded as a result of seismic research conducted in Belly Hill, where six venues can be uncovered for 25 years. One of the elements that makes Belly Hill so mysterious is that it is a place that continues to be used until 8,000 years ago and then covered with soil.

Belly Hill, which is the most important tourist destination in Turkey and which guides history, has become the center of attention of hundreds of thousands of local and foreign tourists every year, especially after the promotional work carried out in recent years.
</html>

<html>Wir sind an den Nullpunkt gekommen und haben die gesamte bekannte menschliche Geschichte verÃ¤ndert. Das ist GÃ¶beklitepe; der erste bekannte Tempel der Menschheitâ€¦

GÃ¶beklitepe ist die fÃ¼hrende Rolle in der Liste des UNESCO-Weltkulturerbes.

Bis vor kurzem war bekannt, dass die Religionen mit dem Ãœbergang von der JÃ¤ger-Sammler-Zeit zum besiedelten Leben begannen und die Tempel zusammen mit der besiedelten Lebenskultur gebaut wurden. Dann wurde 1980 eine Figur gefunden. Die Figur, die zuerst als Dekoration fÃ¼r eine Scheune verwendet und dann an das ArchÃ¤ologische Museum von ÅanlÄ±urfa geliefert wurde, wurde vom deutschen ArchÃ¤ologen Professor Doktor Klaus Schmidt untersucht und als 12.000 Jahre alt angesehen. Schmidt, der unmittelbar danach mit den Ausgrabungen begann, fÃ¼hrte in den 20 Jahren bis zu seinem Tod im Jahr 2014 eine intensive Ausgrabung durch.

Bei den heute noch stattfindenden Ausgrabungen konnte nur ein FÃ¼nftel des Komplexes ausgegraben werden. Die Arbeiten, die in den seit 1995 durchgefÃ¼hrten Studien angetroffen wurden, sind unglaublich alt und werfen ein Licht auf die Geschichte der Menschheit.

Die Figuren im Tempel, bestehend aus monumentalen Obelisken in Form von "T" und geprÃ¤gt mit tierischen, menschlichen und abstrakten Konzepten, sind die Ã¤ltesten historischen Motive, die vollstÃ¤ndig von Hand gefertigt wurden. 10-12 Obelisken, von denen jede bis zu 40 Tonnen erreichen kann, sind durch kreisfÃ¶rmige Anordnung als geschlossener Komplex konzipiert. GÃ¶beklitepe ist auch das Ã¤lteste bekannte architektonische Beispiel.

Als Ergebnis seismischer Untersuchungen in GÃ¶beklitepe, wo sechs Jahre lang sechs RÃ¤ume ausgegraben werden konnten, wird festgestellt, dass es mehr als 20 Komplexe gibt. Eines der Elemente, die GÃ¶beklitepe so mysteriÃ¶s machen, ist, dass es bis vor 8000 Jahren weiter verwendet wurde und spÃ¤ter mit Erde bedeckt wurde.

GÃ¶beklitepe, der wichtigste Tourismuspunkt der TÃ¼rkei und richtungsweisend fÃ¼r die Geschichte, ist jedes Jahr zum Mittelpunkt der Aufmerksamkeit von Hunderttausenden einheimischen und auslÃ¤ndischen Touristen geworden, insbesondere nach den WerbemaÃŸnahmen der letzten Jahre. 
</html>

description.en:
<html>There are structures that define the historical identity of cities. Mosques, caravanserais, inns, madrasas, fountains, clock towers are one of them, no doubt. One of the landmarks of the historical city of Ã‡anakkale in the west of Turkey, which lies on the shores of Marmara and Aegean Sea, is the Ã‡anakkale Clock Tower.

The construction date of the Ã‡anakkale Clock Tower in the Central District dates back to 1896. The tower has five floors and greets the city with a total length of 20 meters. It draws attention to its square-shaped plan, which is examined as it is raised from the ground.

At the top, there is a pavilion covered with clocks and bells as well as a dome. There is also a small fountain made of marble on the floor. Its decorations on the third floor, its decorative small columns, some of the places covered with Ã‡anakkale ceramics can be shown among the outstanding details.

Built of cut stone, the Ã‡anakkale Clock Tower is also famous for its openings, balconies and pointed arched doors...In inscription, in which the information about the structure of the Ottoman Sultan II. AbdÃ¼lhamit's tughra is listed, can be seen. The landmark of Ã‡anakkale, which has walking areas in front of it, is also appreciated with its shops around it and its pleasant lighting in the evening hours.
</html>

Die Dekorationen im dritten Stock, dekorative kleine SÃ¤ulen und einige Teile, die mit Ã‡anakkale-Keramik bei den Reparaturen bedeckt sind, gehÃ¶ren zu den herausragenden Details.

Sie kÃ¶nnen die Inschrift mit Informationen zu dem GebÃ¤ude sehen, in dem sich Unterschrift des osmanischen Sultans AbdÃ¼lhamit der II. befindet. Das Wahrzeichen von Ã‡anakkale, vor dem sich FuÃŸgÃ¤ngerzonen befinden, wird auch von den umliegenden GeschÃ¤ften und der angenehmen Beleuchtung der Abendstunden geschÃ¤tzt.

description.en:
<html>Ã‡atalhÃ¶yÃ¼k Neolithic City, which contains remnants of the cultural life of communities that have just moved into settled life, has been among the points that have attracted the attention of explorers for many years. 

Ã‡atalhÃ¶yÃ¼k Ancient City is spread over an area of approximately 14 hectares along the Plateau of South Anatolia. This place contains some of the oldest and perhaps mysterious information in human history. The historic campus of Ã‡atalhÃ¶yÃ¼k Neolithic City, consisting of two separate mounds, east and west, the east part dates back to 7400 BC.

The eastern mound has 18 separate layers of neolithic settlements. In this place, where neolithic people's daily social life and the problems experienced when they settled into life were examined, countless remains were found. The findings, which were found in these archaeological excavations, including reliefs, murals, sculptures and many other artistic elements, shed light on today. 

The western mound of Ã‡atalhÃ¶yÃ¼k Neolithic City is younger than the eastern mound. When you look at the artifacts reached during the excavations, a history journey dating back to 6200 BC is observed. The mound, which includes many cultural works from the Kalcoholicitic period, also called the Copper Stone Age, also reached the villages that have been in existence for more than 2,000 years. These abandoned village structures provide important information about the transition of people from the past to urban life.

Ã‡atalhÃ¶yÃ¼k Neolithic City, which is not returned without seeing those who want to witness thousands of years of history, is one of the active research points of archaeologists. 
</html>

An diesem Ort, an dem das tÃ¤gliche soziale Leben der Jungsteinzeit und die Probleme, die sie bei ihrer Ansiedlung hatten, auftraten, wurden zahlreiche Ruinen gefunden. Die bei diesen archÃ¤ologischen Ausgrabungen erzielten Erkenntnisse, darunter Reliefs, WandgemÃ¤lde, Skulpturen und viele andere kÃ¼nstlerische Elemente, beleuchten die heutige Zeit.

Der westliche HÃ¼gel der neolithischen Stadt Ã‡atalhÃ¶yÃ¼k ist jÃ¼nger als der Ã¶stliche HÃ¼gel. Wenn man die Werke betrachtet, die wÃ¤hrend der Ausgrabungen erreicht wurden, ist eine historische Reise zu sehen, die bis zu 6200 v.Chr. zurÃ¼ckreicht. Der HÃ¼gel, der auch als Kupfersteinzeit bekannt ist, enthÃ¤lt viele kulturelle Werke aus der Zeit der Chalkolithen, und es wurden auch DÃ¶rfer erreicht, die seit mehr als zweitausend Jahren existieren. Diese verlassenen DorfgebÃ¤ude liefern wichtige Informationen Ã¼ber den Ãœbergang frÃ¼herer Menschen zum stÃ¤dtischen Leben.

Die neolithische Stadt Ã‡atalhÃ¶yÃ¼k, die diejenigen, die die Geschichte von Tausenden von Jahren miterleben wollen, unbedingt besuchen, ist einer der aktiven Forschungspunkte der ArchÃ¤ologen.

description.en:
The historical richness in NevÅŸehir competes with many provinces of the world... The city is known to host the Fairy Chimneys, a natural tourism shrine, as well as countless churches built during the Byzantine Empire. 
Among the prominent religious structures in this context, the Place of the AynalÄ± Church, also known as the Church of The Firkatan,is special for itself! 

The church has different characteristics than other churches of its era. It does not carry architecturally standard details, but also stands out with its secret passages and bunkers. It's almost surrounded by measures that have been delicately addressed. There are places has high levels of concealment and escape in a moment of danger. Unlike most churches, there are very few paintings where simple, geometric shapes can be predominantly, and traces of history are in ruins in many respects...It is a different church experience with kitchen, ration-placed sections and serene atmosphere. It is very close to Goreme, so it can be treated as a practical sightseeing point.
description.de:
Der historische Reichtum in NevÅŸehir konkurriert mit vielen Provinzen der Welt. Es ist bekannt, dass in der Stadt zahlreiche Kirchen untergebracht sind, die wÃ¤hrend des Byzantinischen Reiches erbaut wurden, sowie die Spiegelkirche, ein natÃ¼rlicher Tourismus-Tempel.
Der Ort der Spiegelkirche, auch bekannt als FÄ±rkatan-Kirche, ist ein weiteres religiÃ¶ses GebÃ¤ude, das in diesem Zusammenhang auffÃ¤llt!

Die Kirche hat andere Merkmale als andere Kirchen ihrer Zeit. Es enthÃ¤lt keine Standarddetails in Bezug auf die Architektur, macht aber auch mit seinen GeheimgÃ¤ngen und SchutzrÃ¤umen auf sich aufmerksam. Es ist von vorsorglichen Details umgeben. Im Gefahrenfall sind Verstecken und Entkommenwege auf einem hohen Niveau. Im Gegensatz zu den meisten Kirchen gibt es nur sehr wenige GemÃ¤lde mit geometrischen Formen und die WÃ¤nde sind sehr schlicht. Die Spuren der Geschichte sind in vielerlei Hinsicht in TrÃ¼mmernâ€¦ Ein anderes kirchliches Erlebnis mit seiner KÃ¼che, Abschnitten mit LebensmittelgeschÃ¤ften und einer ruhigen AtmosphÃ¤re. Da es sehr nahe an GÃ¶reme liegt, kann es als praktischer Aussichtspunkt angesehen werden.

description.en:
Bursa is one of the cities rich in museums in Turkey. In this context, a different cultural excursion point is located in the city, where the original concepts are included, on the borders of Osmangazi district.


Uluumay Ottoman Folk Clothing and Jewelry Museum, where ethnic clothing and accessories are displayed in a historical madrasa with a history of more than 500 years in Bursa, is one of the most mystical places in the city. In the Ottoman Empire, which ruled on three continents with 20 million kilometers of vast borders from Hungary to Yemen, Morocco to the Caucasus, the clothes and jewelry used since the 1600s are presented as much as possible in a large collection.


In addition to various kinds of clothing specific to different nationalities, there are close to a thousand jewelry such as necklaces, bracelets, rings and earrings produced with different materials. In addition, equestrian teams, various weapons and many different items can also be examined within the museum. Thousands of pieces compiled by Esat Uluumay, who came from a long-established family living in Bursa for hundreds of years, are waiting for visitors at the museum, which is also supported by UNESCO.
description.de:
Bursa ist eine der museenreichen StÃ¤dte der TÃ¼rkei. In diesem Zusammenhang befindet sich innerhalb der Grenzen des Bezirks Osmangazi ein anderer kultureller Aussichtspunkt in der Stadt, an dem sich die ursprÃ¼nglichen Konzepte befinden.


Das Uluumay Museum fÃ¼r Osmanische Volkskleidung- und Schmuck, in dem ethnische Kleidung und Accessoires in einer historischen Medresse mit mehr als 500 Jahren Geschichte in Bursa ausgestellt sind, ist einer der Punkte der Stadt mit einer mystischen AtmosphÃ¤re. Im Osmanischen Reich, das auf drei Kontinenten mit seinen weiten Grenzen von 20 Millionen Kilometern von Ungarn bis Jemen, von Marokko bis zum Kaukasus regierte, werden die seit dem 17. Jahrhundert verwendeten KleidungsstÃ¼cke und SchmuckstÃ¼cke als groÃŸe Sammlung prÃ¤sentiert.


In der Sammlung sind neben verschiedenen Arten von Kleidung, die fÃ¼r verschiedene NationalitÃ¤ten spezifisch sind, fast tausend Juwelen zu sehen, darunter Halsketten, ArmbÃ¤nder, Ringe und Ohrringe, die aus verschiedenen Materialien hergestellt wurden. DarÃ¼ber hinaus kÃ¶nnen im Rahmen des Museums ReiterausrÃ¼stungen, verschiedene Waffen und viele verschiedene GegenstÃ¤nde untersucht werden. Die Werke, bestehend aus Tausenden von StÃ¼cken von Esat Uluumay, der aus einer langjÃ¤hrigen Familie stammt, die seit Hunderten von Jahren in Bursa lebte, warten auf ihre Besucher im von der UNESCO unterstÃ¼tzten Museum.

description.en:
In Trabzon, where green and blue are lined all over the city, famous for its immaculate air and, of course, delicious cuisine, natural beauties do not cease in Trabzon. In addition to the natural richness in this context, there are many parking spaces in the city, which is at the center of investments. There is a service area beyond all these public spaces, which is a source of pride for its location, Trabzon Botanic Park in ortahisar district. 

More than 130 plant species in a total area of 103 thousand square meters are the basis of botanical park. Various animal species such as deer can also be seen in the park. It is a vast product of engineering and landscape that provide a pleasant time for the family in unique beauties.

Trabzon Botanic Park, where more than 2,000 trees of more than 90 species grow, also has 36 kinds of bush. The total number of bush is close to 10,000 and there are more than 11,000 plants in total. There are cultures and rare plants. 

You can visit this ecological treasure area, take pictures on bridges and relax on benches. With plenty of oxygen and fresh air, you can find health and get rid of your stress with the view. 

Landscape is a part of nature. It's a peaceful cross-section taken from a manâ€™s anbient. Trabzon Botanic Park, which is particularly popular on weekends and in the beautiful weather in summer, is one of the city's favorite sightseeing and recreational locations.

description.en:
Those who want to visit the historical sites in Gaziantep encounter a large number of inns. The Customs Inn, which had an important place among these inns, is today converted into a very important museum. The Historical Inn in KaragÃ¶z district was built by Haji Ã–mer Effendi. The Customs Inn, built in 1878, is popularly known as theâ€™ passenger Inn'. On the ground floor there are rooms used as storage rooms and stables. In the upper section, there are regular rooms for passengers. As it was located on the Silk Road at the time, the Customs Inn managed to meet the needs of the passengers for many years to come.

It is possible to capture very clear traces of Ottoman architecture at the inn. The inn, which is evaluated in the category of single-courtyard and two-storey inns, has recently undergone restoration. Customs Inn, which is one of the preferred places for business or tourist trips, is converted into a museum with its restoration completed in the last month of 2011. With this important transformation, the inn begins to serve as both a manufacturing and a sales center.

It is also a place within the customs inn that is unique to the city and keeps its arts alive. Many crafts are kept alive through various workshops in the khan, from tasbih making to glass blowing, from weaving to yemenicism. The inn, which continues as a â€˜living museumâ€™, can be visited between 09:00 and 18:00. The museum is open all days except Monday. The museum, which lives in the Customs Inn, is navigable free of charge. The venue is located exactly within the Uzun Bazaar, which is located in ÅekeroÄŸlu District. You can easily reach the museum by municipal buses and minibuses.

description.en:
The most interesting destination promising intimate hours with natural life in Ä°zmir can be visited 365 days a year. Animal species neighboring each other forms Izmir Natural Habitat which serves as the basis of this pleasant excursion point.

The Natural Habitat of Izmir, which welcomes its visitors with its Kugulu Lake(Lake with Swans), displays species such as kangaroo, porcupine with arrows, capibara, giraffe, zebra, hippopotamus, ostrich and gazelle respectively.
In the place called Peking pond, birds such as pelicans and swans can be seen.

There is also a children's zoo in the Izmir Natural Habitat, where relatively small species such as pygmy goats, chickens, rabbits, turtles are included.

Llama, camels, ala deer, wild goat, red deer, birds of prey, parrots, wolves, lynx, as well as Asian elephants, tigers, Pumas and Lions can be observed in the area.

The park, which has no parking problem and stands out in the sense of getting to know its living ecosystem closely, also has shops selling souvenirs and cafeterias with large capacity. In cafeterias, fast-food foods and soft drinks can be purchased.

The entrance to Izmir Natural Habitat, where there are numerous animal species, begins at 09:00 in the morning. Closing times are different depending on the seasons. It is open every day of the week, students are not charged on school visit days, and in general, admission can be made with modest fees.

The Izmir Wildlife Park in SasalÄ± district is free for children aged 0-6, with disabilities and their companions, veterans and relatives of martyrs.

description.en:
Toy Museum, one of the most important museums in Ankara, attracts not only children but visitors of all ages. In Turkey, a new culture is beginning to emerge regarding the Toy Museum. These museums occur in a long time as a product of personal labours and collections. Sunay AkÄ±n and the names who are particularly interested in this issue have very serious efforts in opening or organizing children's museums. Ankara Toy Museum is regarded as a privileged example in this sense.

Ankara Toy Museum is opened to visitors in 1990 under the leadership of Bekir Onur. Although within the scope of the university, overall supervision is carried out by the Ministry of Culture and Tourism. This place not only functions as a toy museum, but also as a kind of Research Center. Many students from various levels of education in Ankara visit here. It is also possible that when you come here you will encounter groups from certain schools. Ankara Toy Museum contains many domestic and foreign toys. It is possible to find industrial-style items as well as handmade toys in the collection. On the other hand, copies of antique toys in various museums of Turkey are exhibited in this area.

Ankara Toy Museum has basically four separate sections. Traditional toys section has classic toy figures such as top, hoop, kite. The Fabricated Toys Division is itself divided into five separate subdivisions. Subdivisions such as paper, tin and wooden toys can be visited in this area. In the section called Foreign Toys, symbolic examples from different countries are given. Finally, in the section titled Antique Toys, as mentioned above, antique toys found in museums are displayed. Visiting the museum is charged.

description.en:
PalandÃ¶ken Mountain, one of the busiest points of winter tourism in our country, is also an indispensable address for ski enthusiasts. 

PalandÃ¶ken, which is the highest point in the environment with its peak, does not look imposing like any other mountain due to being a chain of mountain. However, many mythos and mythology about Anatolia are mentioned in the name. For example, there are many rumors about the name... The most famous of these comes from the fact that the name 'PaladÃ¶ken', which is used in the sense of 'Machete knocking, unbearing,', has gradually turned into PalandÃ¶ken.

Some steep trails of PalandÃ¶ken Mountain, Turkey's longest ski slope and the most popular ski area, can be dangerous because the winters are extremely harsh locally. 
PalandÃ¶ken is about 4 km away from Erzurum city center and all kinds of needs can be addressed in the location of hotels. The gendarmerie serves 24 hours a day for security. The highest point of Mount PalandÃ¶ken is BÃ¼yÃ¼kejder Hill. It is 2,450 meters high and after this level the ski lift line is followed.

PalandÃ¶ken Mountain is a tectonic mountain in The Eastern Anatolia Region, located in Erzurum with an altitude of 3,125 meters. In the meantime, let's give a special information: 'PalandÃ¶kenensis', a flower unique to PalandÃ¶ken only grows on this mountain and opens only in May.

description.en:
Arkas Museum of Naval History, located in Bornova, Izmir, opened in May 2012. As the name of the museum suggests, Arkas has made a very serious contribution to the financial process of the museum. Ship maquettes, ship antiques, paintings and other collectible pieces on display at the museum were created over an average thirty-year period. Arkas Museum of Naval History has three floors in total. The museum contains 112 ship models and 127 pieces of ship antiquities. The main objective is to show the development experienced in the maritime sector over the years. The oldest of the pieces that make up the collection belongs to the year 1000 BC. The building that houses the museum is also the home where the Arkas family once lived. The house is estimated to have been built in the mid-1800s.

A compass helm cabinet is located on the first floor of the museum, which is open to visitors who have special interest in such themes as maritime and sailing. At the same time, models of Columbian explorer ships, as well as domestic ships such as the BandÄ±rma steamer and the yacht Savanarona, attract attention. On the other hand, apart from the models, many special works produced by important marine painters add a different atmosphere to the museum. A total of 67 tables are located within the center.

Visits to the Arkas Museum of Naval History were set as one day per week in normal circumstances. After the intense interest of the visitors to the museum, the museum management decided to increase the visits to three days a week. It is currently possible to visit the museum on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays. The museum is located very close to Ege University, making young people always interested in it. Visitors can visit the museum with a special guide. To have a preliminary opinion about the museum, you can try a 360-degree virtual tour through the site.

description.en:
YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m Hammam, one of the historical sites of Bursa, is located just west of YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m Bayezid Street. The land on which the hammam was built is known to be sloping. The place, built in the 19th century, has the signature of Yildirim Bayezid. This place was built together with imaret, madrasa and mosque in the first place. The dressing part of the Yildirim Hammam, which is a relatively small bath, is covered with a dome with a diameter of eight meters. One of the ground doors is used on the right side to switch to the warm section. By using the other section, people can go directly into the toilet. The warmness section has a square plan. The diameter of the dome covering this place is four meters.

This place, which is still adjacent to the historic YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m Mosque, belongs to one class of Turkish bath. The Yildirim Hammam has been repaired many times in the historical process. It underwent two major repairs, especially in 1605 and 1671. Today the place is run by a private person. Unfortunately, it is among the places whose value is not quite understood in the final process. The bathhouse remains in disrepair for a long time and is used as a warehouse. Nationalization and re-repair of this place is not on the agenda for now.

The architect of the Yildirim Hammam in the Mudurnu District of Bursa is known as Omar bin Ibrahim. It is one step ahead compared to the baths built in similar periods. The crossing, especially in the crown gate and domes, is greatly admired.
description.de:
Das YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m-Bad, einer der historischen Orte von Bursa, befindet sich im westlichen Teil der YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m Bayezid-StraÃŸe. Es ist bekannt, dass das Land, auf dem das Bad gebaut wurde, geneigt ist. Die Signatur von YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m Bayezid befindet sich an der Stelle, die im 19. Jahrhundert erbaut wurde. Dieser Ort wurde in erster Linie zusammen mit Imaret, Medresse und Moschee gebaut. Der Umkleideteil des YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m-Bades, bei dem es sich um ein relativ kleines Bad handelt, ist mit einer Kuppel von acht Metern Durchmesser bedeckt. Eine der TÃ¼ren rechts dient zum Ãœbergehen in den warmen Raum. Im anderen Abschnitt geht man direkt zur Toilette. Der warme Abschnitt hat einen quadratischen Grundriss. Der Durchmesser der Kuppel, die diesen Ort bedeckt, betrÃ¤gt vier Meter.

Dieser Ort, der immer noch an die historische YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m-Moschee angrenzt, gehÃ¶rt zu der Badeklasse mit einem Bad. YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m-BÃ¤der wurden im historischen Prozess viele Male repariert. Es wurden zwei grÃ¶ÃŸere Reparaturen durchgefÃ¼hrt, insbesondere zwischen 1605 und 1671. Heute wird dieser Ort von einer Privatperson gefÃ¼hrt. Leider gehÃ¶rt es zu den Orten, deren Wert in der letzten Zeit nicht bewertet wurde. Das Badehaus wird lange Zeit vernachlÃ¤ssigt und dient als Lagerhaus. Die Enteignung und der Wiederaufbau dieses Ortes stehen derzeit nicht auf der Tagesordnung.

Der Architekt des YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m-Bades im Bezirk Mudurnu in Bursa ist als Ã–mer bin Ä°brahim bekannt. Es ist den in Ã¤hnlichen ZeitrÃ¤umen gebauten BÃ¤dern einen Schritt voraus. Besonders der Ãœbergang im Kronentor und in den Kuppeln erregt groÃŸe Bewunderung.

description.en:
SÃ¼rmene Ã‡amburnu Natural Park surrounded by forests, is simply the oxygen doping of Trabzon where green meets blue. The highlight of this vast area, which has 51 acres and natural park status since 2011, is the interesting projection between the sea and the forest. These two different elements, adjacent to each other, are also the characteristics of SÃ¼rmene Ã‡amburnu Natural Park.

There are no cultural or historical buildings or ruins in the nature park. The dense forested area, includes rare species, especially scotch pine, willow, maple and oak trees. In addition, various types of bushes and vines are also abundant in the area. It's also a nature park rich in fungi species. 

On the other hand, seeing squirrels in SÃ¼rmene Ã‡amburnu Natural Park is not a big surprise. It can also be noted that relatively large animal species such as roe deer, badgers, coyotes can be seen from time to time. As a bird species, the cormorant is quite common. 

As a promenade area, a picnic can be held in SÃ¼rmene Ã‡amburnu Natural Park, where the public has a lot of covered social areas, especially close to the sea. It's a pleasure here to wander of into the sea and sip  well-steeped tea. You can also have a swim.
description.de:
Der Surmene Ã‡amburnu Naturpark, umgeben von WÃ¤ldern, ist eine Sauerstoffdotierung von Trabzon, wo GrÃ¼n auf Blau aufeinander trifft. Das herausragende Merkmal dieser riesigen Region mit einer FlÃ¤che von 51 Dezaren, die 2011 den Status eines Naturparks erhalten hat, ist ihre interessante Projektion zwischen Meer und Wald. Diese beiden unterschiedlichen Akteure nebeneinander sind auch charakteristisch fÃ¼r den Naturpark SÃ¼rmene Ã‡amburnu.

Es gibt keine kulturellen oder historischen GebÃ¤ude oder Ruinen im Naturpark. Es ist zu sehen, dass BÃ¤ume wie gelbe Kiefer, Weide, Ahorn und Eiche im Waldgebiet konzentriert sind, zu dem auch seltene Arten gehÃ¶ren. DarÃ¼ber hinaus gibt es in der Gegend viele verschiedene Arten von BÃ¼schen und Efeu. Es ist ein Naturpark, der reich an Pilzarten ist.

Auf der anderen Seite ist es keine groÃŸe Ãœberraschung, ein EichhÃ¶rnchen im Naturpark SÃ¼rmene Ã‡amburnu zu sehen. Es kann auch festgestellt werden, dass von Zeit zu Zeit relativ grÃ¶ÃŸere Tierarten wie Rehe, Dachs und Schakal zu sehen sind. Kormoran ist als Vogelart weit verbreitet.

Ein Picknick kann im Naturpark SÃ¼rmene Ã‡amburnu gemacht werden, wo es viele Ã¼berdachte soziale Einrichtungen in der NÃ¤he des Meeres gibt, wo die Ã–ffentlichkeit als Promenadenbereich interessiert ist. Es ist ein weiteres VergnÃ¼gen, das Meer zu besichtigen und gebrÃ¼hten Tee zu trinken. Sie kÃ¶nnen hier auch schwimmen.

description.en:
<html>The construction year of Alaybey Mosque, one of the most important architectural works of Ã‡anakkale, is not known. Despite this, it is estimated that the mosque was built in the 1700s. The mosque, thought to have been built by Colonel Miralay Ahmet Agha, who was known as the commander of the castle at the time, was built in place of AliaÄŸa Mosque, which itself was in ruins. Therefore, it is presumed that the name of the mosque came from here. In fact, the name of one of the neighborhoods on the island is â€œAlaybey Neighborhoodâ€.

The mosque is made up of red cut stones. To enter the space, it is necessary to use five stone steps from the north side. The door in the wooden structure has a flattened arch and double sash. When we look at the minaret, cut stones are still visible in the corners, but the stones here are white, not red. On the other hand, the mosque's balustrades are carved.

The mihrab section of Alaybey Mosque contains interesting baroque style motifs. In the ceiling section, simple workmanship is preferred. In the same way, an ornamental expression is not seen in the pulpit section. Thanks to wooden stairs, the mahfil(gathering place)-the women's section - reserved for women is likely to exit. The women's enclosure stands thanks to six separate wooden columns. In the courtyard there is a small Hazire (a forbidden area surrounded with fences). One of the tombs in this section belongs to Halil Hamit Pasha, who served as Grand Vizier for a period.

The architecture of Alaybey Mosque, one of the historical mosques of Ã‡anakkale, is seen that it has a transverse and rectangular plan. In addition, hipped roof application was preferred in the construction of the building and the last congregation place and outbuildings were added later. The Alaybey Mosque, whose original state was destroyed during the war and built in the same place today, is still open to worship and visit today. It was also announced that the mosque, which was severely damaged recently, will soon undergo extensive repairs again.
</html>
description.de:
Das Baujahr der Alaybey-Moschee, eines der wichtigsten architektonischen Werke von Ã‡anakkale, ist nicht genau bekannt. Trotzdem wird geschÃ¤tzt, dass die Moschee im 18. Jahrhundert erbaut wurde. Die Moschee, die vermutlich von Oberst Miralay Ahmet AÄŸa erbaut wurde, der zu dieser Zeit als Kommandeur der Burg bekannt war, wurde an der Stelle der AliaÄŸa-Moschee errichtet, die selbst in TrÃ¼mmern lag. Daher wird geschÃ¤tzt, dass der Name der Moschee von hier stammt. Sogar der Name eines der Viertel auf der Insel ist "Alaybey Mahallesi".

Es ist zu sehen, dass die Moschee aus rot geschnittenen Steinen besteht. Es ist notwendig, fÃ¼nf Steinstufen von der Nordfassade zu benutzen, um den Raum zu betreten. Die HolztÃ¼r ist abgeflacht und doppelflÃ¼gelig. Wenn wir uns das Minarett ansehen, sind wieder geschnittene Steine â€‹â€‹in den Ecken zu sehen, aber die Steine â€‹â€‹hier sind weiÃŸ, nicht rot. Zum anderen sind die Balustraden der Moschee geschnitzt.

Interessanterweise finden sich im Mihrab-Bereich der Alaybey-Moschee Motive im Barockstil. Im Deckenbereich wird eine einfache Verarbeitung bevorzugt. Ebenso gibt es im Kanzelabschnitt keine Ornamentphrase. Dank der Holztreppe ist es mÃ¶glich, in den fÃ¼r Frauen reservierten Keller zu klettern - Frauenabteilung. Die Frauenloge kann dank sechs HolzsÃ¤ulen stehen bleiben. Im Hof â€‹â€‹befindet sich ein kleiner Friedhof. Eines der GrÃ¤ber in diesem Abschnitt gehÃ¶rt Halil Hamit Pascha, der eine Zeit lang als GroÃŸwesir diente.

Wenn man die Architektur der Alaybey-Moschee betrachtet, einer der historischen Moscheen von Ã‡anakkale, sieht man, dass sie einen quer verlaufenden und rechteckigen Grundriss hat. DarÃ¼ber hinaus wurde beim Bau des Ortes eine Walmdachanwendung bevorzugt, und der letzte Versammlungsort und das letzte NebengebÃ¤ude wurden spÃ¤ter hinzugefÃ¼gt. Die Alaybey-Moschee, deren ursprÃ¼ngliche Form wÃ¤hrend des Krieges zerstÃ¶rt und heute an derselben Stelle errichtet wurde, ist noch heute fÃ¼r Gottesdienste und Besucher geÃ¶ffnet. Es wurde auch angekÃ¼ndigt, dass die Moschee, die kÃ¼rzlich schwer beschÃ¤digt wurde, bald einer umfassenden Reparatur unterzogen wird.
