description.en:
<html>Zinciriye Madrasah, which was built in 1385 by The Last Sultan of Artuklu Melik Necmettin Ä°sa, who reigned in Mardin, was built in 1385, it sheds light on the glory of history; with its secrets and symmetry. This work built by Melik Necmettin Ä°sa, who was imprisoned in his own madrasah after fighting with Timur and his army, is different from other madrasas with both his philosophy and architectural technique...

Zinciriye Madrasah, which covers a rectangular area, is built in two floors; mosque, shrine and various additional venues. The madrasah, which fascinates those who see it, manages to be seen even from far away with its sliced domed structure. Today, the madrassa used as a Quran course has a tomb of Sultan Ä°sa on the masjid side. Built with impeccable symmetry, it is possible to see the philosophy of 'Whatever you plant in this world, you reap it in the hereafter' philosophy under every stone! The pool, which represents the armageddon area, was built to see objects reflected from the sky in astronomy lessons. Natural sound insulation was also provided with the iwan system designed between the classrooms. But the same thing is out of the question for the inside of the madrasah and for the courtyard. These areas have a very different austic to hear the sound of azan without using amplifier. 
</html>
description.de:
<html>Die Zinciriye Medresse wurde im Jahr 1385 vom letzten Artukid Sultan Melik Necmettin Ä°sa erbaut, der in Mardin regierte. Es beleuchtet den Ruhm der Geschichte mit seinen Geheimnissen und seiner Symmetrie. Dieses Werk von Melik Necmettin Isa, der nach KÃ¤mpfen mit Timur und seiner Armee in seiner eigenen Medresse eingesperrt war, unterscheidet sich von anderen Medressen durch seine Philosophie und Architekturtechnik.

Zinciriye Medresse erstreckt sich Ã¼ber einen rechteckigen Bereich und wurde auf zwei Etagen gebaut. Es besteht aus einer Moschee, einem Grab und verschiedenen zusÃ¤tzlichen RÃ¤umen. Die Medresse, die diejenigen fasziniert, die sie sehen, kann mit ihrer in Scheiben geschnittenen Kuppelstruktur auch von weitem gesehen werden. Heute befindet sich in der Medresse, die als Verlauf des Korans verwendet wird, das Grab von Sultan Isa. Es ist mÃ¶glich, die Philosophie von "Was auch immer ein Mensch in dieser Welt sÃ¤t, das wird er im Jenseits ernten" in der Struktur zu sehen, die mit einer perfekten Symmetrie unter jedem Stein eingesetzt wurde! Der Becken, der das Apokalypsefeld darstellt, wurde gebaut, um Objekte zu sehen, die im Astronomieunterricht vom Himmel reflektiert werden. Das iwan-System wurde zwischen den Klassenzimmern mit natÃ¼rlicher SchalldÃ¤mmung versehen. Gleiches gilt jedoch nicht fÃ¼r das Innere der Medresse und des Hofes. Diese Bereiche haben eine andere Art von Akustik, so dass Gebetsrufe ohne Verwendung von Lautsprechern gehÃ¶rt werden kÃ¶nnen.
</html>

description.en:
<html>How about a short trip in time? Imagine that we were in the 9th century bc... In Mesopotamia, our steps are arching the territories of Urartu, which ruled for centuries... And there it is! With its 2,700-year history, it's as if it's challenging time. The capital of the world's first castle, Van Castle. Letâ€™s see about a castle as a capital.

Kingdom of Urartu; Hundreds of years of domination in mesopotamia territory. They usually determine their capital not by parts of land, but with castles. King Sarduri I of urartu, which reigns in and around where the city of Van is today, builds Van Castle from cut stone. The 15-year castle is declared the capital of the country when it is completed. The castle is called 'TuÅŸba', which means 'Very sunny area'. 

Towards the end of the 20th century, many more structures were unearthed with the castle during the excavations initiated by the professors of Istanbul University Faculty of Literature. Ana-KÄ±z Open Air Sanctuary, Sardur (Madir) Burcu, rock tombs of Menua and I. Argis and Sarduri II are just the main ones.

The inspiration of Van Castle, which has witnessed thousands of years of history, in Mesopotamia and the Kenan Region just below it, is seen comfortably with the naked eye even today. </html>
description.de:
<html>Wie wÃ¤re es mit einer kurzen Zeitreise? Stellen Sie sich vor, wir befinden uns im 9. Jahrhundert vor Christusâ€¦ Unsere Schritte bestehen darin, die urartianischen LÃ¤nder zu rÃ¤umen, die jahrhundertelang in Mesopotamien regiertenâ€¦ Und da ist es! Mit seiner Geschichte von 2.700 Jahren scheint die Burg der Zeit zu widersprechen. Die Van Burg ist die erste Burghauptstadt der Weltâ€¦. Wie kann es also eine Hauptstadt von einer Burg sein?

Das Urartu KÃ¶nigreich; Es dauert Hunderte von Jahren in mesopotamischen LÃ¤ndern. Sie bestimmen ihr Kapital normalerweise nicht durch Landfragmente, sondern durch Burgen. KÃ¶nig Sarduri I., der KÃ¶nig der Urartu, der heute in und um die Stadt Van regierte, baute die Van-Burg aus geschnittenem Stein. Die Burg, dessen Bau 15 Jahre dauerte, wird zur Hauptstadt des Landes erklÃ¤rt. Die Burg heiÃŸt "Tusba", was "Es bekommt viel Sonne" bedeutet.

Gegen Ende des 20. Jahrhunderts wurden bei den von den Professoren der FakultÃ¤t fÃ¼r Literatur der UniversitÃ¤t Istanbul initiierten Ausgrabungen neben der Burg viele andere Bauwerke freigelegt. Mutter-Tochter-Open-Air-Denkmal, Sardur (MadÄ±r) -Schild, die FelsengrÃ¤ber von Sarduri dem II., Menua und I. ArgiÅŸti sind nur die wichtigsten.
Die Van Burg, die Tausende von Jahren Geschichte hinter sich hat, ist auch heute noch vom bloÃŸen Auge inspiriert, inspiriert von Mesopotamien und der Kenanischen Region direkt darunter.
</html>

description.en:
When you walk from Ã–lÃ¼deniz to the west, towards Gemile, you are greeted by the remains of a historical monastery. The monastery is located at an altitude of 400 meters above sea level. A monk named Elefterios is known to have made the Afkule by carving rocks in an area of about 10 meters. In fact, according to the legend, because this monk has been locked up here for the rest of his life, suffered a lot and asked for forgiveness, then he region was named after him.


Due to its advantageous location, Afkule has an exquisite sea view. From where the monastery is, the island of Rhodes with the Demon Cape is visible. The nearest place to enter the sea around the monastery is Cold Water Bay. You can go down in half an hour by following the footpaths.


In the past, monasteries were built in such a way that they were located in remote areas. The main purpose here is to protect yourself from potential dangers and not be disturbed by anyone. Located on an extremely steep slope, only certain remains of this interesting structure have survived to this day. Still, it is worth visiting.


If you are coming to KayakÃ¶y via Fethiye, you can turn to the right of the road and reach Afkule. Due to its location, it is only suitable for vehicle transport up to a certain point. Visitors therefore need to take a little nature walk to reach Afkule. To avoid losing your way, you can take advantage of the stone signs here. It is hardly advisable for the elderly or those who have trouble walking to the area. Especially the cliffs near Afkule are dangerous in this sense.


Afkule is popularly known as â€™Ordeal Monastery'. The road left to the right after KayakÃ¶y is named as â€˜Afkule Roadâ€™. If you turn to the left side of this area, you will face the Gemiler AdasÄ± (island of ships). It is very often found with trees on the road you have to walk. The signs on the roads are separated by yellow and red colours. Even if you follow these colors only, you can reach Afkule without getting lost.

description.en:
In Erzurum, the pearl of the east, which smells of history all over it, the fountains takes special place. The city, thousands of years old, is rich in underground water resources, itâ€™s dense population combined with the importance of hygiene and cleanliness, of course, as an Ottoman element, many fountains emerged.
 
The fountains, were used on the basis of both drinking and providing the needs. In addition, the foundation of the people's dignitaries by building fountains has turned into a respectable and appreciated tradition for centuries. In this context, it is obvious that The Paradise Fountain, located in Karakose neighborhood, one of the central locations of the city, is among the highlights. Why the Fountain of Paradise?
 
Itâ€™s been legendary for its water, light and sweet in taste, itâ€™s found a place in travel book. Evliya Ã‡elebi, for example, mentioned that its water is benignant. The name of the fountain is in various written sources as 'Paradise Spring'. The Paradise Fountain, one of the oldest fountains in Erzurum, which was last repaired in 1976, is flowing till now.
 
The Fountain of Paradise is still active as it was the first day after hundreds of years at its location. With its babbling water, without saying young, aged helps to quench the thirst and breathe. It is known that its water is especially irresistible to taste and is preferred by the locals to brew tea.
 
The historic fountain also stands out for its structural details. The Fountain of Paradise, which has a number of original features, after the varies repair, and is among the must-see and taste in Erzurum.
description.de:

Da die Jahrtausend alte Stadt sehr viele unterirdischen Wasserquellen hat und die dicht besiedelte BevÃ¶lkerung sowie die Bedeutung von Hygiene und Sauberkeit als natÃ¼rliches osmanisches Element ist, sind viele Brunnen entstanden.
Die Brunnen dienten sowohl zur Befriedigung der BedÃ¼rfnisse als auch zum Trinken. DarÃ¼ber hinaus ist es eine Tradition, die zu einer angesehenen und geschÃ¤tzten Tradition geworden ist, dass die PersÃ¶nlichkeiten des Volkes einen Brunnen gebaut haben. In diesem Zusammenhang ist es offensichtlich, dass der Cennet Brunnen im Bezirk KarakÃ¶se, einer der zentralen Orte der Stadt, zu den herausragenden Werten zÃ¤hlt. Warum der Cennet-Brunnen?
 
Dass das Wasser leicht und sÃ¼ÃŸ ist, ist zu einer Legende geworden und hat seinen Platz in ReisebÃ¼chern gefunden. Zum Beispiel erwÃ¤hnte Evliya Ã‡elebi, dass ihr Wasser nÃ¼tzlich ist. Der Name des Brunnens steht auch in verschiedenen schriftlichen Ressourcen, die als "Cennet-Quelle" bezeichnet werden. Der Cennet-Brunnen, einer der Ã¤ltesten Brunnen in Erzurum, der 1976 zum letzten Mal repariert wurde, funktioniert noch heute.
 
Der Cennet-Brunnen ist, trotz der hunderten Jahre am seinem Ort, immer noch aktiv. Das rauschende Wasser stillt in jedem Alter, ob jung oder alt, den Durst und hilft zum Erholen. Besonders wird das genieÃŸbare Wasser von den Leuten in Erzurum fÃ¼r den Tee bevorzugt.
 
Der historische Brunnen fÃ¤llt auch durch seine baulichen Details auf. Der Cennet-Brunnen, der eine Reihe einzigartiger Merkmale aufweist, sich aber nach der Reparatur Ã¤ndert, gehÃ¶rt zu den Dingen, die man in Erzurum gesehen und probiert haben muss.

description.en:
Osman Ghazi, the founder of the ancient Ottoman Beylic, was born in SÃ¶ÄŸÃ¼t in 1258, the first phase of the empire that would spread to four continents in the region between Bilecik and Eskisehir. Osman Ghazi, the founder of the Ottoman dynasty, died on August 1, 1326 in SÃ¶ÄŸÃ¼t, which is within the borders of today's Bilecik.


First buried in the Tomb of his father, ErtuÄŸrul Gazi, Osman Gazi's body was moved to the city after the conquest of Bursa on his will. After the 7.5 magnitude earthquake that caused great destruction in Bursa in 1855, the mausoleum underwent extensive repair and was enlarged in 1863 according to its original plan and restored to its present state. The Tomb Of Osman Ghazi Bey, one of the symbols of Bursa, is located close to the Martyrdom Monument in Tophane district. With its spiritual significance, the shrine is a short walk from the city centre, which is a place of intense interest every month of the year.


Osman GHazi Bey Mausoleum is a round-shaped structure with arched windows, octagonal body, pulley and dome parts are striking. Embellishments, also known as Girland, are shown among other items that stand out: the velvet veil on the ark, the mother-of-pearl inlay, Arabic phrases, the crystal chandelier and the plain pencil works on the wall. Also in the shrine, another 17 crates are found, including Prosecutor Bey, son of I.Murad, Alaeddin Bey, son of Osman Bey, and Ibrahim, son of Orhan Ghazi.
description.de:
Osman Gazi, der GrÃ¼nder des alten osmanischen FÃ¼rstentums, wurde 1258 in SÃ¶ÄŸÃ¼t geboren. Der GrÃ¼nder der Osmanischen Dynastie, Osman Gazi, starb am 1. August 1326 in Sogut, das sich innerhalb der Grenzen des heutigen Bilecik befindet.


Die Leiche von Osman Gazi, der zuerst im Grab seines Vaters ErtuÄŸrul Gazi begraben wurde, wurde begraben und nach der Eroberung von Bursa nach seinem Testament in die Stadt gebracht. Nach dem Erdbeben der StÃ¤rke 7,5, das 1855 in Bursa groÃŸe ZerstÃ¶rungen verursachte, wurde sein Grab 1863 in seine heutige Form umgewandelt, nachdem es gemÃ¤ÃŸ seinem ursprÃ¼nglichen Plan vergrÃ¶ÃŸert worden war. Das Osman Gazi Bey Grab, eines der Symbole von Bursa, befindet sich im Bezirk Tophane in der NÃ¤he des MÃ¤rtyrerdenkmals. Das Grab, das aufgrund seiner spirituellen Bedeutung groÃŸe Aufmerksamkeit auf sich zieht, ist nur einen kurzen Spaziergang vom Stadtzentrum entfernt.


GewÃ¶lbte Fenster, achteckiger KÃ¶rper, Rahmenteile und Kuppelteile machen im Osman Gazi Bey Grab, einer runden Struktur, auf sich aufmerksam. Dekoration, auch bekannt als Girland, Samtschleier im Sarkophag, Perlmutt-Intarsien, arabische Phrasen, Kristallleuchter und einfache Stiftverarbeitungen an der Wand gehÃ¶ren zu den herausragenden GegenstÃ¤nden. Es gibt auch 17 Sarkophage im Grab, darunter I. Murads Sohn SavcÄ± Bey, Osman Beys Sohn Alaeddin Bey und Orhan Gazis Sohn Ä°brahim.

description.en:
Ahmet Vefik Pasha Theatre was originally built in 1938 with the idea of a Community House. To date, it has hosted numerous theatre plays.


The community houses, as most people know, were closed at a time in 1952. That's why this place was used as a cinema for a while at that time. By 1957, Ihsan Sabri Ã‡aÄŸlayangil, who was the governor of that time, made attempts to organize this place and turn it into a theatre. Two cinemas named Marmara and Tan are immediately evacuated and necessary arrangements are made. Idil Biret gives a grand piano concert at the opening of this place. Even the most important names in Turkish art history, such as Muammer Karaca and Haldun Dormen, also play small sections of some classic plays specifically for the opening.


According to a decision taken by the General Directorate of State Theatres in 1971, this place is transitioned to established order. With this period, Ahmet Vefik Pasha Theatre continues its journey in a much more active way. A serious effort is made to train new artists and new theatre actors. Special games are played in various villages and towns during the same periods. Schools are introduced to theatre. Applied theatre work enabled the discovery of many new talents in those years. Ahmet Vefik Pasha Theatre, located on AtatÃ¼rk Street in Bursa, has a hall for about 500 people. On the other hand, there is another relatively small section called as Chamber Theatre. This place hosts events of both City theatergoers and private theatergoers.


Ahmet Vefik Pasha was a very important figure in the expansion of theatre and art in Bursa. His struggle on behalf of the theatre dates back to much older years than the foundation of this theatre. He translated and staged the works of many important names, especially Moliere, known throughout the world. In this sense, Bursa is very fond of the theater as a result of these efforts. Popularizing the theater is punished by the dismissal of Ahmet Vefik Pasha, who served as governor at the time, in 1882.
description.de:
Das Ahmet Vefik Pasha Theater wurde ursprÃ¼nglich 1938 mit der Idee eines Gemeindezentrums erbaut. Bis heute wurden zahlreiche TheaterstÃ¼cke aufgefÃ¼hrt.

Wie die meisten Menschen wissen, wurden die VolkshÃ¤user 1952 geschlossen. Aus diesem Grund wurde diese Zeit eine Zeit lang als Kino genutzt. Bis 1957 unternahm der damalige Gouverneur Ihsan Sabri Ã‡aÄŸlayangil Versuche, diesen Ort zu organisieren und sich zu einem Theater zu entwickeln. Zwei Kinos namens Marmara und Tan werden sofort geleert und die notwendigen Vorkehrungen getroffen. Ä°dil Biret gibt zur ErÃ¶ffnung dieses Ortes ein groÃŸes Klavierkonzert. Selbst die wichtigsten Namen der tÃ¼rkischen Kunstgeschichte wie Muammer Karaca und Haldun Dormen spielen kleine Abschnitte aus einigen klassischen StÃ¼cken, speziell fÃ¼r die ErÃ¶ffnung.

Nach einer Entscheidung der Generaldirektion Staatstheater aus dem Jahr 1971 geht dieser Ort zu einer sesshaften Lebensweise Ã¼ber. In dieser Zeit setzt das Ahmet Vefik Pasha Theater seine Reise aktiver fort. Es werden ernsthafte Anstrengungen unternommen, um neue KÃ¼nstler und neue Theaterschauspieler auszubilden. Im gleichen Zeitraum werden in verschiedenen DÃ¶rfern und StÃ¤dten besondere Spiele gespielt. Schulen werden in das Theater eingefÃ¼hrt. Angewandte Theaterstudien ermÃ¶glichen es, in diesen Jahren viele neue Talente zu entdecken. Das Ahmet Vefik Pasha Theater in der AtatÃ¼rk StraÃŸe in Bursa hat eine Halle mit etwa 500 Personen. Auf der anderen Seite gibt es einen relativ kleinen Bereich namens Raumtheater. Dieser Ort beherbergt die Veranstaltungen sowohl von Stadtschauspielern als auch von privaten Theaterschauspielern.

Ahmet Vefik Pasha ist eine sehr wichtige Figur in der Verbreitung von Theater und Kunst in Bursa. Sein Kampf fÃ¼r das Theater geht viel frÃ¼her zurÃ¼ck als die GrÃ¼ndung dieses Theaters. Er Ã¼bersetzt die Werke vieler wichtiger Namen weltweit, insbesondere von Moliere, in unsere Sprache. In diesem Sinne liebt er Bursa als Ergebnis dieser BemÃ¼hungen. Menschen, die das Theater liebten, wurden mit der Entlassung von Ahmet Vefik Pasha bestraft, der 1882 als Gouverneur fungierte.

description.en:
The Ishak Pasha Mosque and Complex located within the borders of InegÃ¶l is a very important and architecturally valuable work that was built by Ishak Pasha himself and reached today.


Ishak Pasha was an important grand vizier during the reign of Sultan Mehmet The Conqueror. The Ishak Pasha Mosque and Complex located in the place known as â€˜Municipal Frontâ€™ was built in 1468. In terms of construction qualities, offers traces of the concept of â€˜Bursa styleâ€™ architecture. It has very serious similarities with the Hamza Bey Mosque, which is already another historical mosque in Bursa.


Both domes are aligned and are of the same size. There are vaulted add-ons integrated with wide arches in the immediate side sections of these. The relatively large domes sit on triangular pulleys. The last congregation area has five small domes in total. It can be observed that these domes are based on masonry feet.


The main walls of the mosque are covered with rubble stones and lined bricks. The historical site is within InegÃ¶l Bazaar as a location. Visitors can witness a large building community consisting of a madrasa and a mausoleum outside the mosque. The complex largely reflects 15th century Ottoman architecture. According to the records of the foundations, in the first period of the complex, there are also inns, barns and lodges. Today, there are only mosque, shrine and madrasa. Even this is enough for the mosque to be visited extensively.


Today, an inscription on the door on the north side of the mosque draws attention; but this is not an inscription of construction but of repair. According to the information here, the complex underwent extensive repair in 1877. At the same time according to the information written here again repair is performed by II.Abdulhamid. Ishak Pasha Mosque has a â€˜tâ€™ plan as a structure.
description.de:
Die Ishak Pasha Moschee und der Komplex, die sich innerhalb der Grenzen von Inegol befinden, sind ein sehr wichtiges und architektonisch wertvolles Werk, das von Ä°shak Pasha erbaut wurde und bis heute reicht.

Ä°shak Pasha war ein wichtiger GroÃŸwesir wÃ¤hrend der Regierungszeit des osmanischen Sultans Fatih Sultan Mehmet. Die Ishak-Pasha-Moschee und der Ishak-Pasha-Komplex, der sich an der als â€Gemeindevorderseiteâ€œ bekannten Stelle befindet, wurden 1468 erbaut. Es bietet Spuren des architektonischen Konzepts "Bursa-Stil" in Bezug auf seine BauqualitÃ¤ten. Es enthÃ¤lt bereits sehr Ã„hnlichkeiten mit der Hamza Bey Moschee, einer weiteren historischen Moschee in Bursa.

Die beiden Kuppeln sind ebenfalls ausgerichtet und gleich groÃŸ. Es gibt gewÃ¶lbtes Anbau, der auf der rechten Seite mit breiten BÃ¶gen integriert sind. Die relativ groÃŸen Kuppeln sitzen auf dreieckigen Riemenscheiben. Das letzte Gemeindegebiet hat insgesamt fÃ¼nf kleine Kuppeln. Es ist zu beobachten, dass diese Kuppeln auf Mauerwerksbeinen basieren.

Die Hauptmauern der Moschee sind aus TrÃ¼mmern und Reihenziegeln gebaut. Der historische Ort befindet sich im Ä°negÃ¶l-Bazaar als Standort. Besucher kÃ¶nnen eine groÃŸe Gemeinschaft von Medressen und GrÃ¤bern auÃŸerhalb der Moschee beobachten. Der Komplex spiegelt weitgehend die osmanische Architektur des 15. Jahrhunderts wider. Wiederum gibt es laut den Aufzeichnungen der Stiftung auch GasthÃ¤user, StÃ¤lle und Derwischzelle in der Anlage. Bis heute konnten nur die Moschee und die Medresse mit dem Grab erreichen. Auch das reicht aus, um die Moschee intensiv zu besuchen.

Heute macht eine Inschrift an der TÃ¼r an der Nordfassade der Moschee auf sich aufmerksam; Dies ist jedoch keine Konstruktion, sondern eine Reparaturbeschriftung. Nach den hier vorliegenden Informationen wurde der Komplex 1877 grÃ¼ndlich repariert. Gleichzeitig wird nach den hier angegebenen Informationen die Reparatur vom II. Abdulhamit durchgefÃ¼hrt. Die Ä°shak-Pasha-Moschee hat einen T-Plan als GebÃ¤ude.

description.en:
<html>Van, which has carried thousands of years of historical heritage as one of the transit routes between Central Asia and Anatolia, is located in the east of Turkey. The Muradiye district of the city, surrounded by historical structures and natural beauties on four sides, is one of the highlights of tourism. In this context, atayurt's place between the sightseeing and tourism points in the district is undoubtedly special. 

Atayurt, which has the opportunity to know Central Asian culture very closely to the truth of the traces of the past; An activity area that appeals to everyone from 7 to 70, maintains values and transfers them to future generations.

The tourist area around which the flag of 16 major Turkish states in history hangs, close to Lake Van and is intertwined with nature.
Based on a total area of 50 acres, atayurt is based on traditional activities around 8 pastures (large Hakan tent in Central Asian culture) established with traditional understanding. 
Atayurt, which can be defined as an 'Experience' and 'Training' center, provides its visitors with activity opportunities in a variety of subjects. 

In addition to the equestrian courses given by Kyrgyz Turks dressed in local clothes, trainings based on their own concepts, such as archery, handcraft, felt making, local food, Turkish culture, are offered. 
At the same time, traditional treats and tastes of historical origin can be enjoyed in tents. 
Atayurt, one of van's favorite experiences and entertainment points, also attracts attention with itâ€™s low costs. 



</html>
description.de:
<html>Van, der als eine der Transitrouten zwischen Zentralasien und Anatolien ein jahrtausendealtes historisches Erbe besitzt, liegt im Osten der TÃ¼rkei. Das Stadtviertel Muradiye ist von historischen GebÃ¤uden und NaturschÃ¶nheiten auf allen vier Seiten umgeben und einer der touristisch bedeutendsten Orte. In diesem Zusammenhang ist die Lage von Atayurt zwischen den touristischen Orten im Bezirk zweifellos eine andere.

Vielversprechend ist die Gelegenheit, die Kultur Zentralasiens kennenzulernen, die Spuren der Vergangenheit sehr nahe am realen Atayurt ist ein AktivitÃ¤tsbereich, der alle zwischen 7 und 70 Jahren anspricht, Werte schÃ¼tzt und als Ãœbergabepunkt fÃ¼r die nÃ¤chsten Generationen dient.
Das touristische Gebiet mit den Flaggen von 16 groÃŸen tÃ¼rkischen Staaten in der Geschichte liegt in der NÃ¤he des Van-Sees und ist mit der Natur verflochten.

Traditionelle AktivitÃ¤ten werden rund um Atayurt durchgefÃ¼hrt, das auf einer GesamtflÃ¤che von 50 Dekaden errichtet wurde. Rund 8 Viertel (das groÃŸe Hakan-Zelt in der zentralasiatischen Kultur) wurden mit traditionellem VerstÃ¤ndnis errichtet.
Atayurt, das als "Erlebnis" - und "Bildungs" -Zentrum definiert werden kann, bietet seinen Besuchern AktivitÃ¤ten zu verschiedenen Themen.

ZusÃ¤tzlich zu den Reitkursen der kirgisischen TÃ¼rken in lokaler Kleidung werden Schulungen angeboten, die auf einzigartigen Konzepten wie BogenschieÃŸen, Kunsthandwerk, Filzen, lokalem Essen und tÃ¼rkischer Kultur basieren.
Gleichzeitig kÃ¶nnen traditionelle Leckereien und Aromen historischen Ursprungs in Zelten verkostet werden.

Die bescheidenen Preise in Atayurt, einem der beliebtesten Erlebnis- und Unterhaltungspunkte von Van, ziehen ebenfalls die Aufmerksamkeit auf sich.

 

</html>

description.en:
<html>Built as a complex but hosting its visitors as a museum today, The Ata Foundation Museum is one of the valuable architectural works that has survived from the 13th century to the present day.

Keluk bin Abdullah is the architect of the building, built by Protector Ata Fahreddin Ali, one of the vizier of the Anatolian Seljuk State, in 1277. This structure, which has been facing centuries with its robust structure, remains almost the first day's grandeur. One of the oldest Seljuk architectural examples of Konya, the complex is connected to the General Directorate of Foundations in the early 2000s. After several years-long restoration work, the lodge part of the complex opens to the visitors in 2006 as the Master Ata Foundation Museum.

Today, the complex, which is used as a museum, consists of a mosque, mausoleum, lodge (hankah) and double baths. Built as a religious structure in the style of classical Seljuk architecture, the building also bears traces of Anatolian civilizations. Fahrettin Ali, who built the complex, his wife and children are in the eternal resting at the shrine of this structure.

This complex-museum, where Anatolia's hospitality and synthesize of Turkish culture of Seljuks, comes out of the 13th century history scene and embraces today's explorers so to speak. 
</html>
description.de:
<html>Das Sahip Ata Stiftungsmuseum, das als Komplex erbaut wurde und heute Besucher als Museum akzeptiert, ist eines der wertvollen architektonischen Werke, die vom 13. Jahrhundert bis zur Gegenwart erhalten geblieben sind.

Der Architekt des GebÃ¤udes, das 1277 von den seldschukischen Staatswesiren Sahib Ata Fahreddin Ali erbaut wurde, ist Keluk bin Abdullah. Diese Struktur, die mit ihrer soliden Struktur die Gegenwart mit den geringsten SchÃ¤den durch herausfordernde Jahrhunderte erreicht hat, bewahrt ihre Pracht wie fast am ersten Tag. Der Komplex, eines der Ã¤ltesten seldschukischen Architekturbeispiele in Konya, wurde Anfang der 2000er Jahre mit der Generaldirektion Stiftungen verbunden. Nach mehrjÃ¤hrigen Restaurierungsarbeiten wurde der Derwischbereich des Komplexes 2006 als Sahip Ata Stiftungsmuseum der Ã–ffentlichkeit zugÃ¤nglich gemacht.

Der Komplex, der heute als Museum genutzt wird, besteht aus einer Moschee, einem Grab, einer Hankah und DoppelbÃ¤dern. Das GebÃ¤ude, das im klassischen Stil der seldschukischen Architektur als religiÃ¶ses GebÃ¤ude erbaut wurde, weist auch Spuren anatolischer Zivilisationen auf. Nach dem Bau des Komplexes ruhen Fahrettin Ali, seine Frau und seine Kinder ewig im Grab dieses GebÃ¤udes.

Dieses Komplex-Museum, in dem die Gastfreundschaft Anatoliens und die tÃ¼rkische Kultur der Seldschuken zusammengefasst sind, geht von der Geschichtsszene des 13. Jahrhunderts aus und umfasst die heutigen Entdecker.
</html>

description.en:
Oltu Russian Church in the east of the city is known to have been built after the Ottoman-Russian War. Although there are no inscriptions on it, the church, which is estimated to have been built between 1885 and 1890, attracts all the attention with its appearance.
 
The church, which is thought to have been built by the Russians after the Ottoman-Russian War; It is 35x15 meters in size. The dome of the church, which has a rectangular structure, was created in kiborion style. The lower curved construction of the fronts on the north and south side has added a marginal style to the structure. The church entrance door also wants to welcome guests with its ornate embroidery, round arch and architecture that is carried out in a manner befitting the entrance. At the same time, this structure has made the cross plan more prominent because it has been raised on the apses.
 
Oltu Russian Church, which is thought to have been completed in a period of about 40 years during the Bolshevik Revolution, is a magnificent architectural monument that can stand until today. The official said it will start working on the church. By 2020, they plan to contribute to tourism by restoring the church and turning it into a library in order to be functional without changing the texture of its internal structure.
description.de:

Die Kirche, die nach dem Osmanisch-Russischen Krieg von den Russen erbaut worden sein soll, ist in der GrÃ¶ÃŸe von 35x15 Meter. Die Kuppel der Kirche, die eine rechteckige Struktur hat, wurde im Kiborion-Stil geschaffen. Die untere geschwungene Konstruktion der Fassaden an der Nord- und SÃ¼dseite verlieh dem GebÃ¤ude einen marginalen Stil. Die EingangstÃ¼r der Kirche bewillkommt ihre GÃ¤ste mit ihren kunstvollen Gravuren, dem Rundbogen und ihrer Ã¼berragenden Architektur. Gleichzeitig machte diese Struktur den Plan des Kreuzes bemerkbarer, weil er auf der Apsis angehoben wurde.
 
Die russische Kirche von Oltu, von der angenommen wird, dass sie wÃ¤hrend der bolschewistischen Revolution in etwa 40 Jahren fertiggestellt wurde, ist ein groÃŸartiges architektonisches Werk, das bis heute erhalten geblieben ist. Die ZustÃ¤ndigen haben berichtet, dass sie eine Bearbeitung zur Kirche machen werden.Sie geben an, dass sie einen Beitrag zum Tourismus leisten wollen, indem sie die Kirche bis 2020 restaurieren und in eine Bibliothek verwandeln werden, ohne die Struktur ihrer internen Struktur zu berÃ¼hren.

description.en:
It is estimated that it was built in 1179, although there wasnâ€™t any knowledge about the  construction of the tomb belonging to St. Emir Sheikh, who lived during the Abbasid period and had an important place in history.

Although clear information about the sheikh who contributed to the spirituality of Erzurum has not been reached to present day, the stories told from ear to ear are famous. Emir Sheikh, who lived during the Abbasid period, is said to have come to Erzurum for the task of being a spiritual guide.St. Emir Sheikh, who came to Erzurum from Kars on the orders of his own sheikh, died here and his tomb is built here to bring up the people like himself. 

Despite all the attacks carried out in Erzurum over the centuries, St. Emir Sheikh tomb, which managed to maintain his presence, unfortunately does not have an inscription of the tomb that has reached today. According to the inscriptions of Ketencizade Rustu, it is known that the tomb was built in 1179 in the time of SaltukoÄŸlu Sultan Mehmet Kizilarslan.

In order to go to the tomb of The Emir Sheikh, you must go down a five-digit staircase through a door that opens through the masjid. The dome-shaped tomb contains three empty pals. The dome of the tomb made of cut stone has two arches.

description.en:
<html>The ancient city of Limyra, located within the borders of Antalya's Finike district, is located 5.5 kilometers away from the Finike-ElmalÄ± turn on the Kumluca-Finike land road. The ancient theatre building on the left side of the ancient city and the Xatabura Mausoleum a little further away are shown among the most popular structures of the ancient city of Limyra.

To see hillside houses, Acropolis church, Perikle Heronu (Monument), rock tombs, ramparts and many more, you must climb to the top of the ancient city of Limyra. The foundation date of the ancient city of Limyra dates back to the 5th century BC, when the stream flowing right in the middle of the colonnaded street created an exquisite image. Limyra was used as the capital at that time in order to establish the Lycian League against the Persians of the Lycian Pericles. The eternal fire of freedom of Lycia, which became symbolic in the ancient world, was also lit in this Limyra.

The ancient city of Limyra, whose name is also mentioned in the likik inscriptions as Zemuri, has been excavated since 1970. Most of the finds from different periods are exhibited in Antalya Museum. In addition to the Acropolis and inner castle on the northern slope of the ancient city, the fortifications and cisterns are definitely worth seeing. Especially the Limyros stream and the early Byzantine fortification to the west of it also attract attention.

Limyra, which is one of the most ancient cities in the Lycian region with rock tombs, has more than 400 rock tombs. The monumental tomb built in 4 years after Islam is another important building built by Gaius Caesar, the spiritual son of Emperor Augustus. Let us also remind you that you have the opportunity to swim on the famous colonnaded street of the ancient city of Limyra.
</html>
description.de:
Die antike Stadt Limyra, die sich innerhalb der Grenzen des Stadtteils Finike in Antalya befindet, liegt 5,5 Kilometer von Finike-ElmalÄ± entfernt und biegt auf die Autobahn Kumluca-Finike ab. Das antike TheatergebÃ¤ude auf der linken Seite der antiken Stadt und das etwas weiter entfernte Grab des Xatabura-Denkmals gehÃ¶ren zu den beliebtesten GebÃ¤uden der antiken Stadt Limyra.


Um HÃ¤user an den Klippen, eine Akropolis-Kirche, Perikle Heron (Denkmal), FelsengrÃ¤ber, Stadtmauern und vieles mehr zu sehen, muss man auf die Spitze der antiken Stadt Limyra klettern. Das GrÃ¼ndungsdatum der antiken Stadt Limyra, in der der Fluss aus der Mitte der SÃ¤ulenstraÃŸe eine exquisite Aussicht bietet, stammt aus dem 5. Jahrhundert vor Christus. Limyra wurde zu dieser Zeit als Hauptstadt genutzt, um die Lykische Liga der Lykischen Perikles gegen die Perser zu grÃ¼nden. Das endlose Freiheitsfeuer von Lykien, das in der Antike zu einem symbolischen Staat wurde, wurde ebenfalls in dieser Limyra verbrannt.


In der antiken Stadt Limyra, deren Name in den lykischen Inschriften auch als Zemuri erwÃ¤hnt wird, werden seit 1970 Ausgrabungen fortgesetzt. Die meisten Funde aus verschiedenen Epochen sind im Antalya Museum ausgestellt. Neben der Akropolis und der inneren Burg am Nordhang der antiken Stadt sind die Mauern und Zisternen auf jeden Fall sehenswert. Besonders der Limyros-Strom und die aus der frÃ¼hbyzantinischen Zeit stammende Mauer im Westen ziehen ebenfalls die Aufmerksamkeit auf sich.


Limyra, eine der antiken StÃ¤dte mit den meisten FelsengrÃ¤bern in der Region Lykien, hat mehr als 400 FelsengrÃ¤ber. Das monumentale Grab, das 4 Jahre nach dem Islam in der antiken Stadt errichtet wurde, in der es viele DenkmÃ¤ler gibt, ist ein weiteres wichtiges Bauwerk, das vom geistigen Sohn von Kaiser Augustus, Gaius Caesar, erbaut wurde. Wir mÃ¶chten Sie auch daran erinnern, dass Sie in der berÃ¼hmten SÃ¤ulenstraÃŸe der antiken Stadt Limyra schwimmen kÃ¶nnen.

description.en:
Haho Church (Stone Mosque), built in Erzurum, the historical city in eastern Turkey, with Georgian domination close to a thousand years ago, has reached the present day very well and is one of the city's standout touristics structures. 

As we approach the historic structure with an extremely elegant architecture, the taste and air of the surrounding green tissue is spectacular. In a nutshell, there is a clean air and nature enjoyment that can be get by sitting on nearby benches. The church feels as soon as it sees its historical atmosphere. The construction date of the building, which promises a very rich experience visually, dates back to the early years of the 11th century. 

 Itâ€™s known to have been built by 3.Davit the famous Georgian King of the time. Centuries after Ottoman domination, it is recorded that it was converted into a mosque in the 19th century. It is estimated that the decreasing Christian population is effective in converting the structure into a mosque. 

It's very interesting with the interior of the building. There are characteristic details and many reliefs. It's not overlooked that lion and bull like figures are delicately processed. The frescoes on Jesus Christ and the Virgin Mary, which are the source of the touristic interest, can also be seen indoors. 

Located about 1.5 hours away from Erzurum city center, the building can be reached by private vehicles as well as by public transport.

Jahrhundert nach Jahrhunderten nach der osmanischen Herrschaft in eine Moschee umgewandelt wurde. Es ist davon auszugehen, dass die vermindernde christliche BevÃ¶lkerung ein Grund dafÃ¼r war, dass das GebÃ¤ude in eine Moschee verwandelt wurde.

Das GebÃ¤ude ist sehr interessant mit seinem Inneren. Es gibt charakteristische Details und viele Reliefs. Es ist nicht zu Ã¼bersehen, dass Figuren wie LÃ¶we und Stier mit Sorgfalt behandelt werden. Im Inneren sind auch Fresken zum Thema Jesus und Jungfrau Maria zu sehen.

Das GebÃ¤ude befindet sich ca. 1,5 Stunden vom Stadtzentrum von Erzurum entfernt und ist sowohl mit Ã¶ffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln als auch mit privaten Fahrzeugen erreichbar.

description.en:
Ã‡inili Mosque, located in Konak, one of the touristic districts of Izmir, is one of the city's landmarks. Offering a stunning visual identity, the mosque manages to impress visitors as soon as they see it.

It is not very old as an interesting detail, but it is the sophisticated elegance that suggests it is an Ottoman work. With all its details, it stands out with its architectural understanding that it constitutes the basis of Islamic architecture.

The elegant architecture of the mosque is crowned by the large number of people who want to take pictures in front of it, especially during the busy months of tourist numbers.

Some days, there are staggering queues that remind you of the surroundings of Istanbul's iconic mosques.

The mosque, named after its blue tiles, was completed in 1996. It is recorded that the construction work, which lasted approximately 8 years, was finally completed. It is open to worship and visit every day of the week.

Its dome, colorful interior and spacious courtyard are among the highlights. The Izmir Bay, which lies in front of the mosque in the Zafertepe neighborhood, is the basis for the building's interest in a kind of landscape.

description.en:
<html>The khan in Antalya is estimated to have been built in 1219 BC. All of the walls of the khan, which has a rectangular design, are cut stone.

The upper part of the khan is made up of rubble stone and all the remaining parts are made up of cut stone. Two corners of the khan, which is included in the class of four iwans khans, were completely demolished. In addition, certain parts of the curbs were damaged. There is a small altar on both sides of the niche. Thick cut stones can be seen in the inner courtyard section. Also at this point, the presence of pointed arch porches draws attention.

Although the marble inscription of Evdir Khan has reached today, three lines of it are missing. Despite these shortcomings, It has been determined that it was built by I.Izzeddin Keykavus. Many characteristic features seen in Seljuk caravanserais in terms of architecture are based on this structure. In fact, the khan has a special place in terms of being the first place where this architectural style was represented in Anatolia. The adoption of four main gardens and an open courtyard in general form the foundations of this style.

The decorations on the crown door and their use of marble immediately stand out. In this area, which is completely decorated, different geometric motifs were preferred. In the ribbon area above the arch are circles and slices of baklava that meet with knot motifs. In the muqarnas, oyster patterns also come to the fore. Evdir Khan, which managed to make a difference both with its plan and crown door decorations, has unfortunately not seen the value it deserves and has been left without a modicum of care in recent years.

Between Antalya city center and Evdir Han, there is a distance of 18 kms. The khan is located near YeÅŸilbayÄ±r village on Korkuteli. There are no visiting restrictions for Evdir Khan. Therefore, you can visit the historic khan by visiting the area seven days a week. Entrance to the khan is free of charge.
</html>

Evdir Han, der es geschafft hat, mit seinem Plan und der Dekoration der KronentÃ¼ren einen Unterschied zu machen, hat leider nicht den Wert gesehen, den er verdient, und wurde in den letzten Jahren vernachlÃ¤ssigt.

description.en:
<html>Bigali, one of the most visitor-attracting villages of Ã‡anakkale, is especially prominent with being the headquarters of AtatÃ¼rk during the war. The village contains memories of the Ã‡anakkale war from head to toe. In this village, Ziyabey Martyrology and Ali Riza Effendi Martyrology as great as Anafarta Martyrology is of particular interest. This martyrdom was created with the initiatives and contributions of Ibrahim KÃ¶ÅŸdere, who served as deputy of Ã‡anakkale in 2005.

This great martyrdom is instrumental in commemorating 749 martyrs in total. Because the body of the commander of the 21st Infantry Regiment, Ziya Bey, who was killed in the Gallipoli campaign, is located here. At the same time, Lieutenant Colonel Halit Bey of the 1st Division Cavalry was buried here. Mustafa Kemal AtatÃ¼rk often mentions these people in his memoirs. Both names were martyred at Asma Creek on 11 August. It is also very close to the area used as an arsenal at the time.

The location of the Great Anafarta martyrdom is towards the exit of the village. Today, there are only six martyrs who can be identified in this martyrdom. The Great Anafarta martyrdom also has a fountain and a social facility outside the museum and Masjid. This place is sometimes referred as the â€˜Martyrdom of Khalid and Reza'. Ottoman Turkish stands out in the inscription of martyrdom which reaches today. It is known that the rankle who lay in martyrdom fought in the Ariburnu campaign. In the process, they engage in an intense struggle to reclaim a hill, and unfortunately the city falls. For this reason, the name of that hill remains Halil Riza Hill.

A Turkish slab is found on the grave of Halit Bey. An explanatory text was preferred on this plate, which was included in 2007. Unfortunately, the plaque does some damage to the tombstone.
</html>
description.de:
BigalÄ±, eines der meistbesuchten DÃ¶rfer von Ã‡anakkale, ist das Hauptquartier von AtatÃ¼rk wÃ¤hrend der Kriegszeit. Das Dorf enthÃ¤lt Erinnerungen an den Ã‡anakkale-Krieg von oben bis unten. In diesem Dorf zieht der GroÃŸe Anafarta-Friedhof ebenso groÃŸe Aufmerksamkeit auf sich wie das Ziyabey-Martyrium und das Ali RÄ±za Efendi-Martyrium. Dieses Martyrium wurde mit den Initiativen und BeitrÃ¤gen von Ä°brahim KÃ¶ÅŸdere geschaffen, der 2005 als Stellvertreter von Ã‡anakkale fungierte.

Dieses groÃŸe Martyrium ist ein Mittel, um insgesamt 749 MÃ¤rtyrern zu gedenken. Weil die Leiche des Kommandanten des 21. Infanterieregiments, Ziya Bey, der im Ã‡anakkale-Krieg den MÃ¤rtyrertod erlitten hat, hier ist. Zur gleichen Zeit wurde auch der Oberstleutnant der 1. Division, Halit Bey, hier begraben. Mustafa Kemal AtatÃ¼rk erwÃ¤hnt diese Menschen hÃ¤ufig in seinen Memoiren. Beide Namen wurden am 11. August in Asma Dere gemartert. Dieser Ort liegt auch ganz in der NÃ¤he des Gebiets, das zu dieser Zeit als Arsenal genutzt wurde.

Der GroÃŸe Anafarta-Friedhof befindet sich in Richtung des Dorfausgangs. Heute gibt es nur sechs MÃ¤rtyrer, deren IdentitÃ¤t in diesem Martyrium identifiziert werden kann. Auf dem GroÃŸen Anafarta-Friedhof gibt es auch einen Brunnen und eine soziale Einrichtung auÃŸerhalb des Museums und der Masjid. Dieser Ort wird manchmal als "Halit und RÄ±za Martyrium" bezeichnet. Das osmanische TÃ¼rkisch macht auf die Inschrift des bis heute erhaltenen Martyriums aufmerksam. Es ist bekannt, dass die im Martyrium liegenden Reihen in der ArÄ±burnu-Schlacht gekÃ¤mpft haben. In diesem Prozess begannen sie einen intensiven Kampf, um einen HÃ¼gel zurÃ¼ckzuerobern, und leider werden sie MÃ¤rtyrer. Aus diesem Grund bleibt der Name dieses HÃ¼gels Halil RÄ±za HÃ¼gel

Auf Halit Beys Grab befindet sich eine tÃ¼rkische Platte. Auf dieser Tafel, die 2007 aufgenommen wurde, wird ein erlÃ¤uternder Text bevorzugt. Leider ist zu sehen, dass die Platte den Grabstein ein wenig beschÃ¤digt hat.

description.en:
NarmanlÄ± Mosque is located in yakutiye district of Erzurum in eastern Turkey. It is one of the most important heritage of the city with its cultural and historical texture. 

NarmanlÄ± Mosque, which was built in 1738 by NarmanlÄ± Haci Yusuf Efendi, who was known as magnate of his period, stands out as one of the successful examples of stonework.

NarmanlÄ± Mosque; rises paralel to the triangle of the Grand Mosque, the madrasah with double minarets and Erzurum Castle. According to a rumor, in the evening, haji Yusuf, who walks with a front and back on the road illuminated by his slave with a lantern, he bumbed to a mound on the ground and fells to the ground. His slave, who returned to him, says, "Agha, the light in the back will not help anyone, everyone should take its light itself." HacÄ± Yusuf impresses from the saying very much, gives the part of his belongings to the poor people, he freed his slave and he had built a mosque it said that the mosque is NarmanlÄ± Mosque.

NarmanlÄ± Mosque, which has five domes and a final congregation place at the front, stands out for its largeness. In this respect, it stands out among the mosques in the whole region.
description.de:
NarmanlÄ± Moschee befindet sich im Yakutiye-Viertel der Stadt Erzurum, die im Osten der TÃ¼rkei liegt. Es ist eines der wichtigsten Erbe der Stadt mit seiner kulturellen und historischen Struktur.

Die NarmanlÄ±-Moschee, die 1738 von NarmanlÄ± HacÄ± Yusuf Efendi, einer der bekanntesten PersÃ¶nlichkeiten seiner Zeit, erbaut wurde, gilt als eines der erfolgreichsten Beispiele fÃ¼r Steinmetzarbeiten.

NarmanlÄ±-Moschee erhebt sich parallel zum Dreieck der Ulu-Moschee von Doppelminarett-Medrese und der Erzurum-Burg. Einem GerÃ¼cht zufolge stolpert HacÄ± Yusuf, der mit seinem Sklaven auf der von seinem Sklaven beleuchteten StraÃŸe geht, Ã¼ber in einen Buckel und fÃ¤llt auf den Boden Sein Sklave dreht sich darauf um sagt: â¹‚Mein Herr, das Licht hinter dir wird niemandem nÃ¼tzen, jeder muss sein Licht selbst tragen". HacÄ± Yusuf, der von diesem Wort beeindruckt war, verteilt einen Teil seines Eigentums an die Armen, befreit seinen Sklaven und baut eine Moschee. Diese Moschee soll die NarmanlÄ±-Moschee sein.

Die NarmanlÄ±-Moschee mit ihren fÃ¼nf Kuppeln und der letzten Gemeindensaal fÃ¤llt durch ihre GrÃ¶ÃŸe auf. Mit diesem Aspekt kommt die Moschee unter den anderen Moscheen in der gesamten Region hervor.

description.en:
<html>Ayn Zeliha Lake, one of the visual symbols that  gives ÅanlÄ±urfa its real value, is located between BalÄ±klÄ±gÃ¶l and Urfa Castle in the center of the city. Ayn Zeliha Lake, which is also the subject of narrations located close to Halil-ur Rahman Lake, contributes to the aesthetics of the city and is of spiritual importance. 

The narration is like this: When King Nemrut throws Abraham into the fire, suddenly an event occurs. Zeliha, the king's daughter, says that she accepted his religion and believed in him. King Nemrut, famous for his cruelty, sets his daughter on fire, and the place where Zeliha died turns into a small lake. As a result, Ayn Zeliha means 'Zeliha's tears' in Arabic, and the name of the lake comes from here. 

Lake Ayn Zeliha has a small area of 150 square meters. It is very lively with its green waters, fish, small fountains and short boat tours arranged on it. 

Cool and serene... There are tea gardens for drinking tea around. In the months when the weather is nice, it is possible to have a pleasant time in and around the lake, which has become a center of attraction. 

</html>
description.de:
<html>Der Ayn Zeliha See, eines der visuellen Symbole fÃ¼r ÅanlÄ±urfa. ÅanlÄ±urfa, befindet sich im Zentrum der Stadt zwischen BalÄ±klÄ±gÃ¶l und der Burg Urfa. Der Ayn Zeliha See, der ein Thema von Geschichten ist, die sich in der NÃ¤he des Halil-ur Rahman Sees befinden, trÃ¤gt sowohl zur Ã„sthetik der Stadt bei als auch zur spirituellen Bedeutung.

Die ErzÃ¤hlung ist wie folgend; Als KÃ¶nig Nemrut Abraham den II. ins Feuer warf, trat ein plÃ¶tzliches Ereignis ein. Zeliha, die Tochter des KÃ¶nigs, sagte, dass er Abrahams Religion akzeptierte und an ihn glaubte.
Daraufhin wirft KÃ¶nig Nemrut, berÃ¼hmt fÃ¼r seine Grausamkeit, seine Tochter ins Feuer und der Ort, an dem Zeliha starb, verwandelt sich in einen kleinen See. Infolgedessen bedeutet Ayn Zeliha auf Arabisch "TrÃ¤ne von Zeliha", der Name des Sees stammt daher.

Der Ayn Zeliha See hat eine kleine FlÃ¤che von 150 Quadratmetern. Es ist ziemlich aktiv mit seinem grÃ¼nen Wasser, Fisch, kleinen Springbrunnen und kurzen Bootstouren.

Cool und ruhig ... Es gibt TeegÃ¤rten. Es ist mÃ¶glich, eine angenehme Zeit im und um den See zu verbringen, der in Monaten bei schÃ¶nem Wetter zu einem Anziehungspunkt wird.

</html>

description.en:
<html>Jews have a 2,400-year history in Antioch. However, despite the recent decline in numbers, their religious temple sits together for worship during ceremonies or holidays in the Jewish Sinagog.

The Jewish Sinagog, which means the temple of Jews, is located on Kurtulus Street in Antioch. The synagogue is thought to have been made in 1700 . It is common thought that the synagogue has survived to this day as a charity built for relatives or acquaintances who died from members of the congregation living in Hatay in those years. It has a smaller structure than mosques and churches in Hatay.

There are seven Torahs in the Jewish Havrai, which has a manuscript prepared on 500-year-old gazelle skin brought from Nakip Mosque, a synagogue. These religious artifacts are among the must-see. 
</html>
description.de:
<html>In Antakya haben Juden eine 2400-jÃ¤hrige Geschichte. Obwohl ihre Zahl in letzter Zeit erheblich zurÃ¼ckgegangen ist, versammeln sich ihre religiÃ¶sen Tempel zur Anbetung in der jÃ¼dischen Synagoge wÃ¤hrend Zeremonien oder Feiertagen.

Die jÃ¼dische Synagoge, d.h. der Tempel der Juden, befindet sich in der KurtuluÅŸ StraÃŸe in Antakya. Die Synagoge soll um 1700 erbaut worden sein. Man glaubt, dass diese Synagoge bis heute als WohltÃ¤tigkeitsorganisation fÃ¼r Verwandte oder Bekannte, die in diesen Jahren in Hatay gestorben sind, und als Gemeindemitgliedern in Hatay lebten, Ã¼berlebt hat.Es hat eine kleinere Struktur im Vergleich zu den Moscheen und Kirchen in Hatay.

Es gibt sieben Manuskripte auf der 500 Jahre alten Gazellenhaut, die aus der Nakip-Moschee, die frÃ¼her eine Synagoge war, in die jÃ¼dische Synagoge gebracht wurden. Diese religiÃ¶sen Werke gehÃ¶ren zu den Orten, das gesehen werden muss.
</html>

description.en:
<html>KÄ±rkpÄ±nar Field of Contest is located in the town of SarayiÃ§i, which is connected to Edirne city center. July and June of each year to coincide with the beginning of the historical KÄ±rkpÄ±nar Oil Wrestling Tournament is organized here. KÄ±rkpÄ±nar Field of Contest stands out as one of the city's landmarks due to the oil wrestling that has become traditional.

There are various narrations about the origin of KÄ±rkpÄ±nar Field of Contest, the sine qua non of Edirne, which is a world famous place when oil wrestling is mentioned. The most well-known of these is that during the founding years of the Ottoman Empire, Orhan Gazi's son Suleyman Pasha explored the region called â€˜KÄ±rklarâ€™ which was the territory of the Byzantine Empire with his pioneer troops, where he defeated the soldiers and captured the fortresses, and then wrestled between them.

In this story, which dates back to the 14th century, it is mentioned that the brothers Ali and Selim wrestled with each other, but they lost their lives in the end. Even in the place where these brothers are buried, the springs flow. This spring called as 'KÄ±rkpÄ±nar' for the memory of the valiant wrestling tradition emerges.In time, it begins to be referred to as KÄ±rkpÄ±nar.

KÄ±rkpÄ±nar Field of Contest, which hosts traditional sports competitions in the month of HÄ±drellez and is the first place that comes to mind when it comes to Oil Wrestling, welcomes thousands of local and foreign visitors every year. Er Square, which hosts exciting oil wrestling matches, carries on a tradition that has been going on for centuries.
</html>
description.de:
Der KÄ±rkpÄ±nar Er-Platz befindet sich in der Stadt SarayiÃ§i im Stadtzentrum von Edirne. Hier findet jedes Jahr das historische KÄ±rkpÄ±nar Oil Wrestling-Turnier statt, das mit Ende Juni und Anfang Juli zusammenfÃ¤llt. Der KÄ±rkpÄ±nar Er Platz macht aufgrund des traditionellen Ã–lwrestlings als einer der Wahrzeichen der Stadt auf sich aufmerksam.

Es gibt verschiedene GerÃ¼chte Ã¼ber die Entstehung des KÄ±rkpÄ±nar Er-Platzes, der ein Muss fÃ¼r Edirne ist, einen weltberÃ¼hmten Ort, wenn es um Ã–lwrestling geht. Das bekannteste davon ist, dass Orhan Gazis Sohn SÃ¼leyman Pascha wÃ¤hrend der GrÃ¼ndungsjahre des Osmanischen Reiches mit den Pioniertruppen die Region 'KÄ±rklar', das Land des Byzantinischen Reiches, erkundete, die Soldaten besiegte und die Festungen eroberte und dann zwischen ihnen rang. In dieser Geschichte aus dem 14. Jahrhundert wird erwÃ¤hnt, dass die BrÃ¼der Ali und Selim miteinander rangen, aber es gab kein Ergebnis und sie verloren schlieÃŸlich ihr Leben. Es wird sogar gesagt, dass Quellen an dem Ort flossen, an dem diese BrÃ¼der begraben wurden. In diesem FrÃ¼hling namens "KÄ±rpÄ±nar" entsteht die Tradition des Wrestlings um die Erinnerung an die Tapferen. Mit der Zeit wurde es als KÄ±rkpÄ±nar bekannt.

Der KÄ±rkpÄ±nar Er-Platz, auf dem traditionelle SportwettkÃ¤mpfe in HÄ±drellez stattfinden und der erste Ort ist, der bei der ErwÃ¤hnung des Ã–lwrestlings in den Sinn kommt, beherbergt jedes Jahr Tausende von einheimischen und auslÃ¤ndischen Besuchern. Der private Platz, auf dem spannende Ã–lwrestling-KÃ¤mpfe stattfinden, hat ebenfalls eine jahrhundertealte Tradition.

description.en:
The Bet Israel Synagogue is located in KarataÅŸ district in Izmir. This historic synagogue, located on MithatpaÅŸa Street, opened for worship in 1907. Initiatives of II.Abdulhamid who is the sultan of that period  are instrumental in opening this place of worship. II. AbdÃ¼lhamit wrote an edict to the Grand Vizier Kamil Pasha, who was the governor of Izmir in those years, and ordered that a suitable place to be built for Jews to worship. The Bet Israel Synagogue is regarded as the largest structure in Izmir in the special of Jewish places of worship. In the 1950s, Gizbar Avraam Rubi restored this place and was instrumental in restoring it to its present state.The 100 year of the synagogue was recently marked by many glorious events. The Bet Israel Synagogue currently continues to serve actively.

The Bet Israel Synagogue, which is easy to reach because it is located in the center of the city, fills the eye, especially with its architectural features. Donations would be instrumental in the construction of the synagogue, which is considered the most impressive Jewish place of worship in the city. Especially at that time, the leading figures of the congregation made large donations. The Bet Israel Synagogue, built on a 920-square-foot plot, costs 1,200 golds. When the synagogue is opened for worship, it is not finished yet. However, it is used in this way for a long time. All synagogues in Izmir have an architectural style unique to the region. These are all high-walled and include a courtyard. In the center of the hall, there are four columns supporting the ceiling.

During the construction process of the Bet Israel Synagogue, special artists are brought from Italy. This place is immediately separated from other structures in certain aspects of architecture. The wooden decorations in the synagogue add quite a unique catch to the place. On the other hand, it is observed that the Bet Israel Synagogue was influenced by the ornamentation forms in the rich Greek houses.

description.en:
<html>The mansions, consisting of 400 cultural property reflecting Kastamonu's example of civil architecture, challenge time with at least one century of age.

Kastamonu Mansions, which constitute the registered civil architecture structure of the Western Black Sea, consist of structures in Tosya, TaÅŸkÃ¶prÃ¼ and Inebolu districts. With the ages of more than 100 years, mansions, each of which looks like big sycamores that challenge time, also provide integrity in the architecture of the city.

Designed in accordance with the geographical location of the region, the mansions are the most admired civilian architectures of the Black Sea. Decoration and design, which are discussed with a different architectural understanding on the front line of each of the mansions, especially in the center of the city, are also an indicator of Kastamonu cultural richness.

Kastamonu Mansions, which emerged as a result of the city's unique beauty and well-established cultural accumulation, which dates back to the Hittites and is the subject of Homer's Iliad Saga, are structures that constitute the identity of the city and show respect for its past community.

One of the important differences in the mansions is that it distinguishes themselves from cities famous for its other mansions. It succeeds with the construction of two-storey structures not deaf, but as the floor of face to face life and where daily life begins. 
</html>
description.de:
<html>Die HÃ¤user, bestehend aus 400 KulturgÃ¼tern, die die zivile Architektur von Kastamonu widerspiegeln, fordern die Zeit mit einem Alter von mindestens einem Jahrhundert heraus.

Die Kastamonu-HÃ¤user, die die eingetragene zivile Architektur des westlichen Schwarzen Meeres bilden, bestehen aus Strukturen in den Distrikten Tosya, TaÅŸkÃ¶prÃ¼ und Ä°nebolu. HÃ¤user, die wie groÃŸe Platanen aussehen, von denen jede mit ihrem Alter von Ã¼ber 100 Jahren der Zeit trotzt, sorgen auch fÃ¼r IntegritÃ¤t in der Architektur der Stadt.
Die HÃ¤user, die entsprechend der geografischen Lage der Region entworfen wurden, sind die am meisten bewunderte zivile Architektur des Schwarzen Meeres. Die Dekoration und das Design, die mit einem anderen architektonischen VerstÃ¤ndnis behandelt werden, insbesondere an der Fassade der einzelnen HÃ¤user im Stadtzentrum, sind ein Indikator fÃ¼r den kulturellen Reichtum von Kastamonu.

Die Kastamonu-HÃ¤user, die das Ergebnis der einzigartigen SchÃ¶nheit der Stadt und der tief verwurzelten kulturellen AnhÃ¤ufung der Stadt sind, die auf die Hethiter zurÃ¼ckgeht und Gegenstand des Ilias-Epos von Homer ist, sind eine Gruppe von Strukturen, die die IdentitÃ¤t der Stadt bilden und Respekt fÃ¼r ihre Vergangenheit zeigen.

Einer der wichtigsten Unterschiede in den HÃ¤usern ist, dass sie sich von anderen berÃ¼hmten StÃ¤dten unterscheiden. Dies wird erreicht, indem das Erdgeschoss von zweistÃ¶ckigen GebÃ¤uden nicht ausgestossen ist, sondern als Stockwerk errichtet wird, das sich dem Leben Ã¶ffnet und in dem das tÃ¤gliche Leben beginnt.
</html>

description.en:
Eymir Lake, which is one of the most important natural beauties of Ankara, is small compared to other lakes in the region. The rowing team of the University trains regularly on the lake located in Metu. Thanks to its unique fauna, the region manages to offer a unique appearance and freezes in the winter months. This is seen as a very special experience for visitors. The average depth in the lake is around 3.80 meters. The total length of the lake is determined to be 4 kilometers. Although Lake Eymir is a small lake, it is home to different animal species. When you come here, you may encounter some interesting bird species such as greenhead duck and wild goose  around the lake.

Lake Eymir, an ideal lake for water sports, especially rowing, sometimes hosts some special tournaments. On the other hand, various courses on rowing are organized in this area for outsiders. The fact that it is intertwined with Metu creates an important advantage in this sense. The area of the lake remains far from green until the 1930s. Kemal KurdaÅŸ, who was rector of Metu after the middle of the last century, makes arrangements in and around the lake. Some volunteers, other than himself, have a very important role in the creation of green spaces here.

Lake Eymir is a natural beauty that is open for everyone to visit and use, even though it is within the borders of Metu. Of course, if you want to come here in your private car, you must provide the Lake Access Card. If you do not remove this card, you can walk to the lake in person, not in your private car. There is an average of 20 minutes' walk between where you left your car and the lake. In addition, cycling is a popular option at the point of transportation to the lake. There are quite nice breakfast places and restaurants by the lake.

description.en:
Ahi Åerafettin Mausoleum, located in the Aslanhane quarter within the borders of Ankara, takes its name from the mosque located directly opposite. According to the information quoted in written sources, the mausoleum was built in 1350. In the southern section of the tomb, there is an inscription reaching to this day. In this inscription written in Arabic, the date of the construction of the tomb is inscribed. Cut stone and brick structures are used in Ahi Åerafettin Mausoleum. The upper side of the dome section is covered with a wooden roof. After the Republic, this place can be repaired properly. Umut Ä°nci, the architect, undertakes this repair. This restoration is concluded under the control of the General Directorate of Self Foundations. In the ark belonging to Ahi Sharafettin, the artistically striking details stand out. In later years, this specially carved ark is removed to the Ethnographic Museum located in the center.

When you come to Ahi Åerafettin Mausoleum, you will encounter seven graves in total. Among these, of course, the most interesting one is the Tomb of Ahi Sharafettin, who gave the tomb its name. Besides himself, there are also names like his son Ahi Sharafettin Mehmed and his daughter Devlet Hatun. The remaining chests are reserved for the descendants of Ahi Sharafettin. The Tomb of Ahi Åerafettin has an octagonal plan as of the structure. The lower part of the tomb is square. A pointed cone covers the structure.

In the tomb, transitions are provided with niches other than corner triangles. The craftsmanship in these transitions is admirable. Some of the chests have plaster relief ornaments. In addition, two pieces of arks are given blue-colored tile coatings. Marble materials are preferred in arks belonging to the Devlet and AyÅŸe Hatun. The tomb of Ahi Åerafettin contains various stones. Today, only the skirt of the ark belonging to Ahi Åerafettin is found. This chest is made of walnut wood, it adds a special aesthetic.

description.en:
<html>SanlÄ±urfa is not only tasting lahmacun, kebab, raw meatballs, liver, baklava but also visiting the old inns, caravanserais, mosques, museums are another in the city, which promises a cultural adventure. At this point, one of the highlights of the tourists is the exotic Customs Inn, which is close to BalÄ±klÄ±gÃ¶l. 

It was built five centuries ago during the reign of Sultan SÃ¼leyman the Magnificent of the Ottoman Sultan. It's active as it could be today, just like centuries ago. The inn, which was restored in 2001, is particularly attracted those who want to relax and have tea and have a pleasant time. The two-storey historic building is also home to many authentic shops. There are many commercialities where the same work has been done for three, four generations. Some other traditional crafts are showcased. 

Rosary shops stand out on the first floor of the monumental customs inn. On some days there is a moving stream of trade in the inn, where rosary collectors come in, the rosary in question you can find more than your expectation in this inn has a courtyard is ideal for sitting and drinking tea. It promises a serene atmosphere between the greens. It's worth noting that interest is increasing a lot, especially on weekends. 

</html>

description.en:
<html>Ruler Mahmut Mosque, which salutes Mardin in all its glory on the journey towards the savur gate, is perhaps the most beautiful of the architectural examples of the 14th century.

'City of History', 'Cradle of Civilizations', 'Eagle's Nest' or 'Stone City' and dating back to 4500 BC, Mardin is also seen as a complex of religions. 

Ruler Mahmut Mosque has come to this day in an exemplary form. It is the only place left in all its glory from the Artukians who ruled in Mardin from the 11th century to the 14th century. The building was built by The Ruler of Artuklu, Ruler Salih, between 1312 and 1362. Because of the belief that Ruler Salih's tomb was found in the mosque with square planned and shrine, the building takes this name.

The simple cylindrical form minaret of Ruler Mahmut Mosque is one of the classic Artuk architectural examples. Hand-embroidered decorations at the entrance gate called portals are virtually intact. The entire structure, which says in inscription, it dates back to the 14th century, is stone.'

Ruler Mahmut Mosque, which has undergone small-scale restorations many times in accordance  with its original, has been a mystical atmosphere in Mardin city and is one of the rare places with a different atmosphere.
</html>
description.de:
<html>Die Melik-Mahmut-Moschee, die Mardin auf dem Weg zum Savur-Tor in seiner ganzen Pracht begrÃ¼ÃŸt, ist vielleicht das schÃ¶nste architektonische Beispiel des 14. Jahrhunderts.

Es ist zu sehen, dass Mardin in der Vergangenheit auch ein Religionskomplex war, der aus dem Jahr 4500 v. Chr. "Stadt der Geschichte", "Basis der Zivilisationen", "Adlernest" oder "Steinstadt" genannt wurde.

Die Melik Mahmut Moschee ist bis heute in vorbildlicher Form entstanden. Vom 11. bis zum 14. Jahrhundert war Artuklu, das in Mardin regierte, der einzige Ort, der mit all seiner Pracht erhalten blieb. Das GebÃ¤ude wurde zwischen 1312 und 1362 vom Artuklu-Herrscher Melik Salih erbaut. Das GebÃ¤ude erhÃ¤lt diesen Namen aufgrund der Annahme, dass sich das Grab von Melik Salih in einem geplanten Platz und einer Grabmoschee befindet.

Das einfache zylindrische Minarett der Melik-Mahmut-Moschee ist eines der klassischen Beispiele der Artuklu-Architektur. Die handgeschnitzten Ornamente an der EingangstÃ¼r, Portal genannt, sind fast intakt. Das gesamte GebÃ¤ude, das in der Werkinschrift auf dem Portal aus dem 14. Jahrhundert stammt, besteht aus Stein.

Die mystische AtmosphÃ¤re der Stadt Mardin ist in die Melik-Mahmut-Moschee Ã¼bergegangen, die bis jetzt viele Male restauriert wurde, indem sie ihrem Original treu geblieben ist. Sie ist einer der seltenen Orte mit einer anderen AtmosphÃ¤re.

</html>

description.en:
Green areas such as Botanik Park, SeÄŸmenler Park or AtatÃ¼rk Garden are always in the foreground in Ankara, the capital of Turkey. Although not as popular as these important parks of the city, Zafer Park is shown as one of the places where the people of Ankara show great interest on weekends. Zafer Park is often engraved with the opening ruins, which are home to great enthusiasm. Haluk Levent performs at the opening of Zafer Park as will be remembered. Zafer Park, which covers a total area of 60 thousand square meters, houses walking paths within children's play areas and bicycle paths. In addition, the security building stands out for people to spend a comfortable time here. One of the most popular places in the park is the biological pond. This mini pond occupies an area of 385 square meters.

Zafer Park, located in Ankara's Ã‡ankaya District, offers many opportunities for sports lovers. In this context, you can use tennis, volleyball, basketball and football fields. On the other hand, you can use the jogging path especially in the morning hours. Another important feature of Zafer Park is that some municipal-oriented events take place here. The park is actively used for concerts, dance performances or similar events.

Zafer Park, which brings the local people together with green in a large area in the heart of the city, is referred as â€œAugust 30 Zafer Parkâ€ in some sources. The Metropolitan Municipality makes very important contributions in the construction and regulation of the park, which is located close to Asti. Zafer Park, which has become the centre of many cultural and sporting events since its opening day, has free internet service. A very special tree species, especially the Parrots of Pakistan is of great interest in the place. The park currently has four main entrance gates in total.

description.en:
The Tophane Clock Tower, which is among the symbolic buildings in Bursa, is located in the heart of the city. In 1905, the tower with a height of 33 meters, which was completed in the Ottoman Sultan II.Abdulhamid's time, is one of the important sightseeing and recreation areas of the city.


The top of the six-storey structure, which can be entered through the door on the south side, is reached by an 89-step staircase. Like many other clock towers of its time, the tower, which is built of cut stone and has balconies on two floors, is notable for its pointed arched windows and niches.


The building, which has historical clocks with quadrants around it, served for fire surveillance after its construction. As the construction around it was scarce, the surrounding area was closed in parallel with the development in Bursa and the panoramic view function was eliminated. The tower, whose clocks do not work today, is a monumental historic building. Due to its location in a region with a large number of historical and cultural structures, it is one of the most frequented points of tourists coming to the city.
description.de:
Der Tophane Uhrenturm befindet sich inmitten der symbolischen GebÃ¤ude in Bursa im Herzen der Stadt. Der 33 Meter hohe Turm, der 1905 zur Zeit des osmanischen Sultans Abdulhamid dem II. fertiggestellt wurde, ist eines der wichtigsten SehenswÃ¼rdigkeiten und Erholungsgebiete der Stadt.


Die Spitze des sechsstÃ¶ckigen GebÃ¤udes, das durch die TÃ¼r an der SÃ¼dseite betreten werden kann, ist Ã¼ber eine 89-stufige Treppe erreichbar. Der Turm, der wie viele andere UhrentÃ¼rme seiner Zeit aus geschnittenem Stein gebaut wurde und einen Balkon auf zwei Etagen hat, macht mit seinen spitzen Bogenfenstern und Nischen auf sich aufmerksam.


Das GebÃ¤ude, das auf allen Seiten historische Uhren hat, diente nach seinem Bau der BrandÃ¼berwachung. Da der Bau um ihn herum verringert wurde, wurde seine Umgebung parallel zur Entwicklung in Bursa in den folgenden Jahren geschlossen und die Panoramablickfunktion ging ebenfalls verloren. Der Turm, dessen Uhren heute nicht funktionieren, ist eine historische GebÃ¤ude mit einem monumentalen Merkmal. Aufgrund seiner Lage in einer Region mit vielen historischen und kulturellen Strukturen gehÃ¶rt es zu den hÃ¤ufigen Zielen von Touristen, die in die Stadt kommen.

description.en:
Abdal Mehmet Mosque, one of the places of worship visited by visitors to Bursa, is located at the intersection of Abdal Street and Tahal Street. Abdal Mehmet is one of the most well-known Sufis of the II.Murat period. BasÃ§Ä± Ibrahim dedicates this historic mosque to Abdal Mehmet at that time.


The mosque is rectangular in plan. Just above this plan, there are two oval domes. There is also a mausoleum and fountain in the immediate side of Abdal Mehmet mosque. The first major repair of the mosque took place in 1955. This repair is organized by Bursa Antiquities lovers institution. The historical mosque, inherited from the 15th century, is surrounded by stone walls. The main entrance section of the mosque is on the north side.


The last congregation site is covered by three small domes. It is regarded as one of the largest among the local masjids in Bursa. The last communion of this place differs from other mosques in the city. The front of the section, which has three pointed arches, is covered with iron profiles. Two gates can be used to pass through this area to the actual place of worship. Between these two doors, there is a large altar. When the mihrab is closely examined, various ornamental details draw attention.  


Although a lot of information is transmitted in written sources, there is no inscription of the mosque that has survived to the present day. This naturally brings about some controversy about the period when the mosque was built. It is said in some sources that the mosque was built directly during the reign of Fatih Sultan Mehmet the Conqueror.


The interior of the mosque measures 8 times 15 meters. Lead coatings are prominent in the main domes. The pulleys of these domes are octagonal in shape. A total of three rows of windows illuminate the mosque. The cover sections of these windows are made of oak wood.
description.de:
Die Abdal-Mehmet-Moschee, eine der von Bursa hÃ¤ufig besuchten KultstÃ¤tten, befindet sich an der Kreuzung der Abdal-StraÃŸe und der Tahal-StraÃŸe. Abdal Mehmet, der den Namen der Moschee gab, Abdal Mehmet, der der Moschee ihren Namen gab, ist einer der bekanntesten Sufis der II. Murat-Zeit. BaÅŸÃ§Ä± Ä°brahim widmete diese historische Moschee zu dieser Zeit zu Abdal Mehmet.

Es ist zu sehen, dass die Moschee einen rechteckigen Grundriss hat. Direkt Ã¼ber diesem Plan befinden sich zwei ovale Kuppeln. Es gibt auch ein Mausoleum und einen Brunnen direkt neben der Abdal-Mehmet-Moschee. Die erste grÃ¶ÃŸere Reparatur der Moschee findet 1955 statt. Diese Reparatur wird von der Bursa Antiksachen Enthusiasten Gemeinschaft organisiert. Die historische Moschee, die vom 15. Jahrhundert bis heute geerbt wurde, ist von Steinmauern umgeben. Der Haupteingang der Moschee befindet sich auf der Nordseite.

Der letzte Versammlungsort ist mit drei kleinen Kuppeln bedeckt. Es gilt als eines der grÃ¶ÃŸten Masjids in Bursa. Der letzte Versammlungsort dieses Ortes unterscheidet sich von anderen Moscheen in der Stadt. Die Vorderseite des Abschnitts mit drei SpitzbÃ¶gen ist mit Eisenprofilen bedeckt. Zwei TÃ¼ren kÃ¶nnen verwendet werden, um echte Anbetung aus diesem Bereich zu ersetzen. Zwischen diesen beiden TÃ¼ren befindet sich ein groÃŸer Altar. Bei genauer Betrachtung des Mihrab fallen verschiedene Verzierungsdetails auf.

Trotz der Tatsache, dass viele Informationen in schriftlichen Quellen Ã¼bertragen werden, hat die Moschee keine Inschrift, die bis heute reicht. Diese Situation bringt natÃ¼rlich einige Diskussionen Ã¼ber die Zeit mit sich, als die Moschee gebaut wurde. Es wird gesagt, dass in einigen Quellen die Moschee direkt wÃ¤hrend der Fatih-Zeit gebaut wurde.

Das Innere der Moschee hat Abmessungen von 8 mal 15 Metern. In den Hauptkuppeln sind Bleibeschichtungen erkennbar. Die Riemenscheiben dieser Kuppeln haben die Form eines Achtecks. Es ist zu sehen, dass insgesamt drei Fensterreihen die Moschee beleuchten. Die Abdeckteile dieser Fenster bestehen aus Eichenholz.

description.en:
BostanlÄ± is considered among the most elite regions of Izmir. This is a point that makes a difference, especially economically and socially. You can catch this difference from the first moment you step into BostanlÄ±. BostanlÄ±, a district of Karsiyaka district, has recently been experiencing a great development momentum. Investments in the region also increase in parallel. BostanlÄ± is a neighborhood located right on the beach, can be considered as the most important advantage of this place. People from many parts of Izmir can flock to the beach here. Transportation to BostanlÄ± is possible by tram, ferry and bus. Ferries departing from Konak are generally the primary choice for transportation. One of the first places that comes to mind when it is called BostanlÄ± is the sunset observation terrace.

BostanlÄ± Sunset Observation Terrace, yet very recently created. Unliket the grey places of stubbornness, the terrace give emphasis to particularly happy social places. This special observation terrace in BostanlÄ± is created under the leadership of Izmir Metropolitan Municipality. The area is also called BostanlÄ± footbridge. The idea that the people of Izmir should be more intertwined with the coast is based on the idea. The terrace, which starts from the top of a hill area and extends to the sea, consists of a wooden platform. In a short time, this place manages to be a sort of meeting and resting place for everyone. Both picnic tables and chess tables add significant value here.

Special vegetative landscaping works on pedestrian paths attract attention. On the same path, decorative lighting is performed on the other hand. The spring bridge, built just above the stream, completely changes the face of the region. Moreover, it is also possible to ski immediately from the bottom side.

The footbridge built on the creek rises with a soft profile between the two collars; it is also possible to make kayak access from underneath. The cruise terrace, which soon managed to become one of the landmarks of BostanlÄ±, is shown as one of the most beautiful places to watch the sun set in Izmir.

description.en:
Erciyes mountain and Cappadocia in all its glory from a panoramic angle, with trees decorated with landscap and evil eye beads is a wonderful spot where you can take pictures of the magnificent memory 'Under that Tree'.

In Cappadocia, one of the important tourism centers famous for its Fairy Chimneys of Turkey, evil eye trees (trees decorated with evil glands and wish glands) have increased in recent years... However, if you want to experience this in the original and first business that does this job, the point you need to go is the business called 'Under that Tree'... A place where local and foreign tourists are frequented in a short time with its unique views during your trip attracts attention with its panoramic views and flavors. Guests who come to the business who visited Cappadocia before leaving and can enjoy the dizzying view of the city with the 'selfie point' feature, do not leave without taking pictures under the trees adorned with evil eye beads. 

Sipping Turkish coffee with its beautiful views in this business located in UÃ§hisar region has become a traditional choice. Open from 08:00 a.m to 06:00 p.m , you can take a lot of amazing photos to add to your album.
